Stormchaser Roleplaying
ðŸ§Š The Icebox / jedahn-gameplay
Kyle [Arcadian] 15/06/2020 22:45
The Kitakaze Maru sways gently in the sea breeze as the ship's sails catch the wind, carrying the rickety junk north-west towards the distant shores on Hong province. The captain, a stoic man with a clean shaken head by the name of Ezume, perches steadfast by the rudder, steering the ship true on its course. It's a six day journey and those aboard the Kitakaze Maru have already been at sea for almost four days.
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/06/2020 05:06
Takumi stands at the front of the ship, his blue cloak billowing out, as he enjoys the sensation of the air against his face and hair. He watches in wonder as the sea ripples and flows as the boat cuts across the water. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/06/2020 05:27
Ryuzuko is on the deck, leaning against the railing while methodically tuning his shamisen, humming a tune from his childhood, as he listens to the sound of the waves. (edited)
Mike 16/06/2020 05:33
Sadao emerges from the tiny cabin in the midst of the junk, stretching his arms as he basks in the sunlight. "Thank you, Ezume, for letting me borrow those quarters. It's been a while since my last sailing trip." He gives a half-bow to him, out of appreciation, with a smile. He approaches the railing as well, feeling more in tune with the waves that disagreed with his stomach when they first set out. He watches the sea churn, quietly listening to Ryuzuko's tuning. "You play as well?"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/06/2020 05:45
"Yup..." Ryuzuko responds "Been playing since I was a hatchling." still picking at the strings. (edited)
TheOrsini 16/06/2020 05:50
In the looming shade from below the decks, Koide lays in one of the crew hammocks strung between supports on the boat. She naps quietly, her Katana tied to the ropes as she swings. 'Bad luck to have a woman on board' that's what those swine had said. Four days of it. She lazily looks down the hallway see other hammocks just swaying aimlessly with their owners away on deck. The ship was fine. With her or without her. Koide never carried for sea travel, probably the salt in the air. Two more days she thought. A sigh stole at her breath and she finally let it go. She wanted be back on the ground.
Mike 16/06/2020 06:02
"Ha, me too. When I was little, my mom wouldn't let me set foot out the door without completing some form of cultural lesson. And I loved to go out, so..." He strides over to his satchel, and retrieves his shamisen, an intricate thing that looked more like an antique; a gift he had only recently received. "I chose to study this." He glanced over to the door below decks, thinking of Koide, the more enigmatic of this new group, remaining quiet in the shade. "Let's have a duet," he said, hoping the Dragonborn would catch on. Maybe she'd hear and be cheered up. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 16/06/2020 06:55
Viraj stands along the starboard rail, rocking with the rhythm of waves and listens to the small talk of the others. He rests his maulaxe across his broad shoulders and peers off, steely-eyed, towards the east. The tall Rajani thinks on the stories his grandfather told him of their crossing, when they had to flee for their lives from the Sarameian invaders. His hand grips the handle of the weapon and gives it a firm twist. One day, Bapa... I will return and reclaim what they stole from us. He turns back towards his new companions and gives them a wry smile. "I need to stretch my legs. I've been on this boat for too long." He gives a glance to the captain. "Don't worry none about me." And without any hesitation, the druid takes a running leap, propelling himself off the railing and dives into the water. A moment passes without any sign of Viraj. Then approaching from behind and catching up easily to track along side the boat, a dolphin appears. It breaks the surface with its dorsal fin - tipped with a streak of orange, quite unusual for such creatures. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/06/2020 07:55
Takumi, while staring out into the open sea, hears the sound of music... I know that tune looking around for it's source, he sees a man leap off the side of the boat. Now that looks like fun or failure running over to the side, he looks for the man in the water. As he searches for the jumper, he begins to worry... he looks to the captain with sad eyes, and returns to looking for the lost soul. Did I see color on that dolphin, or was it a trick of the light? Knowing about tricks of the light, from using them in the show, I watch for the dolphin to reappear while still looking for the man overboard... (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/06/2020 08:01
"Sur-" Ryuzuko tries to say to Sadao, just before he sees a man leap off the boat, an odd dolphin appearing immediately after. "Well, you don't see that every day." Turning back to Sadao, "Sure, what did you have in mind?" he asks the (insert race name). (edited)
Mike 16/06/2020 08:16
Sadao's head turns at the splash, only to see a dolphin dipping in and out of the water. Assuming that's all it was, he resumes tuning his instrument. Watching the dolphin's movements, he feels inspired, recalling a seafarer's song he learned while still a novice. "Follow my lead." He begins strumming energetically, allowing Ryuzuko to pick up on the recognizable song as they play to the dolphin's leaps.
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/06/2020 08:27
When he sees the dolphin leap out of the water again, Takumi is sure he saw something strange... did that dolphin just wink at me?? It takes a moment to process, but after seeing the reactions of others on the boat that must have seen the man jump, Takumi shakes off the surprise and makes his way towards the familiar tunes.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/06/2020 08:46
It takes Ryuzuko a bit to catch on with Sadao's tune, but once he finds it, they play the minyo (folk song) along together.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/06/2020 20:12
The distant rumble of thunder disturbs the twanging of the music, but when those aboard the Kitakaze Maru look to the heavens they are clear, blue and cloudless, but for the enormous silver moon that takes up most of the western sky.
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/06/2020 21:34
Takumi makes his way over to the musicians, ready to add his own flavor to the music, when the thunder catches his attention. Was that me? He looks over towards the source of the rumbling, and sees nothing but clear skies and open seas. "uhh... That wasn't me" Takumi says to the musicians, a little perplexed. He goes looking for Koide. (edited)
Mike 16/06/2020 22:02
Sadao stops playing, and looks to Takumi, then to the sky. "Peal of thunder on a cloudless day..." He relaxes, putting aside his shamisen. "Either that's an omen, or someone doesn't like our playing, eh?" He gives Ryuzuko a shrug and chuckles.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/06/2020 22:14
"Hopefully we have not angered Raijin in some way, that would not bode well for our voyage. However he could just be angry at some other poor soul in that direction" Ryuzuko says back with a laugh. He then walks over to his backpack, putting his instrument back on the rack then grabs his odachi, as well as a whetstone and some oil from a pouch. Sitting back down where he was, he begins to clean the massive sword. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/06/2020 22:24
A droning shockwave peals out from across the sea to the north, rocking the boat to and fro as powerful waves hit the starboard bow. Another thunderous rumble echoes in the distance and far away a column of black light can be seen spanning the distance between the sea and a rapidly growing cyclone of dark clouds that spirals above.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 16/06/2020 23:30
Not prepared for the sudden onslaught of waves, the dolphin is almost pushed into the side of the boat. It lags behind a moment before catching back up. Circling around the boat and popping out of the water it eyes a clearer path back on board. Finding a spot, it dives down to launch itself up and back over the railing...
TheOrsini 16/06/2020 23:38
The rocking of the boat shakes Koide out of her relaxed stupor and she quickly loosens the slip knot on the kantana sheath and rushes up to the deck. Halfway up the stairs she encounters Takumi, and he beckons up to the ominous spectacle. (edited)
Mike 16/06/2020 23:47
"Omen it is, then!" Sadao braces himself against the railing for more waves, his eyes scanning the horizon for the column of black light, trying to see what the source of it was. If it's a spirit, I've got to do what I can to calm it.
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/06/2020 23:53
"Lady Koide, I mean Koide," Takumi recovers, having been told multiple that he doesn't have to call her lady. He continues on, knowing that he's done something similar in the past "The thunder isn't me I swear. If it's someone like me, they definitely have more skill than I." He continues following as he grips his staff tightly in his fists. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/06/2020 01:52
As the boat rocks from the waves Ryuzuko says "I do not envy those who anger a kami." as he holds a tighter grip on his sword, so as to not lose it in the shaking, as he sharpens the blade. Storms never fazed him much, the dark column of light and the cyclone however, had his attention. But he just kept an eye on it, as he continued hia work, having faith that the captain and the ship's crew could handle whatever came their way.
TheOrsini 17/06/2020 02:32
"Relax, Takumi." Koide tries to relax. Its a very disconcerting sight. "How long?" she asks looking to Ryuzuko and raises her hand to indicate the geyser of dark light. The dragonborn's demeanor seemed to show some of that discipline she had become accustomed to on their travels. He would be able to give clear answers.
Dandiil {Takumi} 17/06/2020 04:25
"That is beautiful," eyeing the storm with interest, "but looks like it could be a problem." Takumi looks around at the boat, to the musicians and to Kiote then turns back to the musical pair. "the crew looks a bit hurried, you guys seem as calm as..." He uses his staff to keep his balance as another wave strikes the side of the ship. "Sorry I'm interrupting again, go on." Takumi watches the storm, respectfully admiring it's power... It really is amazing he thinks to himself as he stands quietly so that the... more seasoned... could compare notes. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/06/2020 06:22
Ryuzuko looks at Koide, then looks at the storm, then looks at Koide, "No idea, ask the captain." (edited)
TheOrsini 17/06/2020 06:55
That wasn't the answer she was looking for. She gave a nod and glanced back to the captain at the till. She didn't want to hear his prattling, but she would have to get answers. She paced past sailors awestruck by the display. "Captain Ezume," she gives the semi-formal bow, enough to show him the honor of his station in relation to herself. "...do you know what this is?" she asks indicating the brewing storm in front of them.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/06/2020 07:06
... As the dolphin begins to clear the railing, the animal form begins to melt away and reveal Viraj. However, changing form in midflight makes for an awkward landing. He finds himself briefly tangled in some of the rigging. He grunts in frustration as the scrambles back to his feet, smoothing back his greying hair. "Humph... That was barely worth it. What's the cause of all these waves?!" He looks to the swirling clouds overhead. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/06/2020 07:07
The captain glances past Koide into the distance and slowly shakes his head. "Whatever it is, it's not natural," he tells her quietly as he wrests control of his ship from the waves, holding course heading west, away from the strange light in the sky. "We'll make for Dandong. Shouldn't be much more than a day more at sea."
Mike 17/06/2020 07:18
Sadao leans out further over the railing, staring intently at the storm. He had taken his eyes off of the orange-crested dolphin, only for it to launch out and onto the boat, now taking on Viraj's likeness. He flinches back slightly at the splash, but quickly recognizes him. He points to the pillar of shadow. "That is! It came out of nowhere." He felt hamstrungâ€”the sea was not his natural element, as it was to someone who could become a dolphin. He turns to Ezume. "Captain! Is there anything you need us to do?" Surely there was something, but he hardly knew much about boats in particular.
TheOrsini 17/06/2020 07:57
She really didn't like being interrupted, but Sadao meant well - although they were paying for passage. Maybe this was one of those common courtesies she didn't understand. That will be fine. Thank you, Captain." she thought a moment longer, drawing upon her estranged social grace, "and as Sadao has offered, they are more than able to help if needed." She'd offer that courtesy if her life depended upon it. Otherwise, let the men do it. She again half-bowed in deference and left the Captain to his work.
Cel 17/06/2020 16:27
Having been staring absentmindedly at the newly forming storm, Aralynn turns to face the others. ''The storm is not too big of a problem yet, let us not succumb to fear or panic while we can still do something about it. If there is anything we can do to help we should all offer our full capabilities to the captain'' Leaning on the railing, she returns her gaze to the sea, offering a silent prayer for the safety of the ship and its passengers, while also keeping an eye on how close the storm is getting.
Kyle [Arcadian] 18/06/2020 06:46
Captain Ezume glances back over his shoulder at the strange lights in the sky and slowly shakes his head in response to Sadao and Koide's offer. "Whatever it is, the wind is carrying us from it." The Kitakaze Maru only has a small crew of a three men, and they are busying themselves shaking out the sails to catch the evening breeze. "That's no storm, and I don't care to learn the answer either." (edited)
TheOrsini 18/06/2020 09:51
Koide had suspected that it wasn't a natural storm. She had never seen anything like it before, but she had hoped for a simple answer. Curiosity gripped at her. What if it was important?
Dandiil {Takumi} 18/06/2020 18:53
Takumi realizes that he left his bag at the Bow of the ship. He walks over and collects his heavy pack, and returns with a damp bag. "So... we just wait?" (edited)
Mike 18/06/2020 19:00
"It's probably safest, so yeah." Sadao takes up his shamisen, putting it with the rest of his things, next to the cabin. He continues to watch the storm as best as he can from this distance as they turn away from it, a troubled look crossing his face. It probably is for the best. Whatever that is...I don't think I'm ready for it.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/06/2020 20:13
Viraj's face hardens as he takes note of the pilar of dark light shooting up in the distances. "Does not look natural," he comments back to Sadao, just stating the obvious. Through a metal loop on his pack, he stows his maulaxe and approaches the captain. "I know my way around a ship, if it would help us get there any faster," he says ready to offer a hand. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 18/06/2020 20:17
Viraj hears a distant bestial roar, like that of an enormous monster, carried in on the wind from far away to the north-east.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/06/2020 20:37
The druid snaps his neck toward the direction of the roar. "Something large is out there... and it does not sound pleasant."
Mike 18/06/2020 22:17
"I hope it doesn't come towards land." Sadao tightens his grip on the railing. "We should tell someone about this when we get to Dandong." When, not if. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 18/06/2020 23:36
it does not sound pleasant... What's that supposed to mean? Takumi looks out to the storm, having not heard the roar, or attributing it to the peal of thunder... "That storm is pretty large.. How is a storm supposed to sound, besides angry?" The curious humor is evident in his voice ...
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/06/2020 23:49
Viraj turns to Takumi and smirks. "This was not the storm that I heard. Some large beast... perhaps a reptile." He glances back toward the dark column of light then back to the captain to see if he will be taken up on his offer to help the crew. (edited)
TheOrsini 19/06/2020 08:38
That was an odd claim. She was sure what he was talking about. "What kind of reptile?" Koide asked. It would be formidable to cause what she was seeing from astern. Something legendary.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 19/06/2020 09:26
"Definitely one bigger than a dragon, if Viraj heard a roar way out here. I have not heard stories of their kind creating such a display either." Ryuzuko answers to Koide as he does the finishing touches on his blade, before putting it back on the rack. He then takes the backpack inside the cabin of the ship, before coming back out and sitting down in the same spot he was in a minute ago. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 19/06/2020 19:33
"I'd like to see a dragon" the half-elf says more to himself, Trying not to interject on the conversation... But curious, he asks "What kind of monster can be larger than a dragon?" (edited)
TheOrsini 20/06/2020 06:12
"Something worse." Kiode says staring at the storm. Her voice is distant, as if in thought.
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/06/2020 07:19
The storm slowly recedes into the distance as the Kitakaze Maru picks up speed heading west. Captain Ezume gives Viraj an ambivalent nod, but the other sailors welcome the additional pair of hands. Eventually, the waves calm and the black pillar of light fades from view. The next day, the coast finally shows itself. A thin strip of land on the horizon signifying the approaching end of six days at sea. By midday, the buildings of Dandong can be made out, and some time in the early afternoon the shop scrapes up against one of the many jetties on the docks. The air is pleasantly cool and full of the smells of fresh fish and the chattering of locals in the Honmin tongue. Some of the crew hop onto the boardwalk and begin tying the ship up. (edited)
Mike 20/06/2020 07:58
"Thanks again, Captain Ezume. Fair winds on your next charter." Sadao breathed in the fresh port town air as he disembarked, taking in the sights and sounds. The last time he'd been in Hong, he was only a small child, unappreciative of the littler things that distinguished it from his home nation of Je'dahn. The architecture, the people and the way they made even tight quarters feel homely and spacious. "We should find a jiuguan, get the lay of the land, plan out a route to that village... Tonghua, I think it was?" He looked around to the rest of the party. "Come to think of it, does anyone else speak Honmin?" (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 20/06/2020 08:25
"Not I" answers Ryuzuko as he disembarks as well, all his gear hoisted on his back "I have not interacted with too many Honmin, let alone know their speech."
Dandiil {Takumi} 20/06/2020 08:39
Takumi dons his glittering blue garb when he sees the approach. "A good performance can transcend language. We can find someone that speaks as we do... Or at least someone who understands... And with your gifts of music, and my flair... It might work" gods... I really hope so he thinks to himself, hopeful.... (edited)
TheOrsini 20/06/2020 10:00
"I have confidence in you, Takumi." Kiode reassures him, but her words come off spoken flatly, distracted by her survey of the port. Since Sadeo had done the niceties with the Captain, she wouldn't be saddled with it at least. "Sadao is right, though. We should be able to find someone to speak for us if we need. A lucky beggar would settle for few coins."
Cel 20/06/2020 20:14
"And a few coins I'm willing to part with" Aralynn takes a few gold coins out of her coin pouch and flips them in the air before catching them and returning them to their original location. "Or more, if that's what it takes to achieve our goal." She looks around the docks before returning her gaze to the group.
Mike 20/06/2020 21:28
"You won't have to go to such lengths. My family has history here in Hong, so I know the tongues. I was thinking I could make myself useful to the group as a translator, since I knew we'd be coming here." Sadao steps off the docks, and looks for a local. Getting their attention, he asks them in Honmin, "Do you know where the nearest jiuguan(tavern/inn) is?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/06/2020 21:46
It doesn't take long for Sadao to get some directions to a pair of nearby drinking establishments on the docks. The Nisi Chunu at the northern end of quay and the Shuishou Xiyue on the south side.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/06/2020 04:01
Viraj continues to assist the crew on their way towards the docks. Finding a few loose boards on the deck he retrieves some tools from the pack. As he  is sanding down an edge so that the warped lumber can fit back in its place, the former shipwright gazes off to the strange land which they approach.  Once the boat is secured, Viraj retrieves his belongings and gives the crew a quick goodbye. "I hope your return is less exciting," he says to the captain.  In response to Sadao's questions shakes his head. "This is my first time away from Je'dahn," he says hoisting his pack onto his back. "I wonder if they have had any instances here of that dark column shooting up to the sky,." he says nodding back towards the northeast.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/06/2020 18:48
After Sadao finishes talking to one of the passersby, Ryuzuko asks him "I take it you found some information for us?" Bewildered at the unknown speech the two had. (edited)
Mike 21/06/2020 19:23
Sadao smiles, and points behind him with his thumb down the docks. "There's a couple of places we can stay. Follow me." He starts to lead the way towards the Shuishou Xiyue.
Dandiil {Takumi} 21/06/2020 22:25
Using his staff to assist with walking, Takumi takes in his surroundings as they make their way towards the tavern, subconsciously noting alleys and other possible escapes. "This is a nice little town, not as much activity as I'm used to, and it's spread out a little more, but nice."
TheOrsini 22/06/2020 01:53
While they walk, Koide draws nearer to Viraj. "What you suggest is good, but it might be wise to avoid fearing the locals. Be discreet about the column for now." She looks around as they pass pack animals and workers going about their day. She didn't know the druid as well as the others, so she wasn't sure how discreet he naturally was. If his jumping into the ocean was any notion, he would probably need coaching on the more delicate parts of their trade. Monster hunters were paid to get rid of problems; not cause others by sharing information that commoners could not understand. "Keep your eyes open for a local wizard or druid. They might be able to get us answers about the column." She tries smiling at Viraj, but is unsure of the effect.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/06/2020 06:45
The captain and crew bid their passengers farewell and, bags in hand, Sadao leads the way south towards the Shuishou Xiyue. The gentle twanging of a pipa echoes from inside the building, which is of traditional Hong design. Inside, it is calm. A few patrons sit at tables enjoying an afternoon drink.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 22/06/2020 08:21
Ryuzuko heads over to the bar, motioning to the bartender. "Do you understand Je'dahn? If you do, what do you recommend for a dragonborn's first drink in Honmin?" he asks the man inquisitively. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 22/06/2020 22:51
Seeing the lizard guy trying to order a drink, Takumi calls out to Ryuzuko "I'll have a hot leaf juice and a..." Realizing his mistake, he bows low and franticallly apologizes... He tries to order a tea and water from the bar, and returns to the table. Takumi sets his bag at a table, and sits with his head down... Oh gods, I hope I didn't offend him, and I really hope he doesn't eat me (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/06/2020 02:28
Ryuzuko waves the back of his hand towards Takumi "I'll see what they have."
Mike 23/06/2020 04:05
Sadao joins them at the bar, looking over the posted menus himself. Mouthing the characters as he quickly translates them, he recognizes the name shuilian cha, Lily Pad tea. In the mood for its sweet, nostalgic taste, he makes ready to order 4 cups worth, once the server was done with Ryuzuko and Takumi. He beckons to Koide, Viraj, and Aralynn. "You'll like this," he starts enthusiastically, but seeing Koide's serious face reminds him of the business they're to tend to, leaving him a little red in the face. "It'll be good to have, while we go over our route." (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 23/06/2020 05:02
Takumi causes a female shape to form on his cup of water, having it move and flow, as if dancing to the music. shape water He sits there silent, habitually concentrating on his creations performance as he looks around the small establishment, noting the eyes that were on him. Hmmm... This town could be profitable... As the pipa player hits one note off tune, the lady falls back into the wooden cup. Takumi awaits the rest of the party to determine the best course of action.
TheOrsini 23/06/2020 05:18
"Thank ... you, Sadeo. This is... fine." Her words shift several times as she tries to express gratitude. The thought of some tea after being stuck on that ship for several days brings genuine appreciation for the gesture. She could drink saké like any of the men and drown away one of the bad nights, but tea was a secreted pleasure. Her demeanor relaxes and the worry over what they may be facing evaporates away for a few minutes. Koide indulged her imagination - taking a sip, noting the sweetness and flavor, closing her hardened eyes to savor it. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/06/2020 06:48
Viraj glances down to Koide and gives a nod to her suggestion. Her uneasy smile catches him off guard though and just shrugs it off as he's unsure how to interpret it - pleasant, patronizing, flirty. The large man continues along near the front allowing Sadao to lead the way, but to allow his bulk to cut a path for the group to easily pass through the crowd. He takes a seat with the others and waits for the drinks. Out of habit, he bangs a fist against the table and chairs a few times to test their craftsmanship. When Sadao arrives with the tea he looks a bit disappointed, hoping for something a bit stronger after the long journey across the gulf, but it accepts it graciously. "Thank you," he says after taking a sip. His nerves calm and finally settles back into his seat. "Anyone know how long until we get to that haunted village?" he keeps his voice low to keep the other patrons from overhearing.
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/06/2020 08:24
The bartender is a small man with short-cut, dark hair. When Ryuzuko approaches he is busying himself behind the bar keeping things tidy. "Aaah, DoragonbÅn," the barkeep replies to the silver-scaled paladin in accented Je'dahnian. "Not often we see your kind around here. You try huangjiu, yes?" The server at the table is a slight, young girl in a simple dress who smiles sweetly to Sadao before hurrying away to arrange the tea.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/06/2020 08:54
"As long as it's not gonna kill me, sure." Ryuzuko says jokingly. "Also, do you have anything that resembles "hot leaf juice"? My friend over there asked." He points his thumb, with a clenched fist, behind him towards the depressed looking half-elf. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/06/2020 13:00
The barkeep chuckles softly. "Yes, of course. Jin will take care of it." He nods to the serving girl who Sadao spoke with before pouring Ryuzuko a cup of a pale yellow beverage.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/06/2020 17:55
Ryuzuko leaves four copper pieces on the bar table "Thanks for the drink" he says before heading back over to the group. When he gets there, he pats Takumi on the back "The server girl is coming with your tea" he says before sitting down in a spare chair, taking a gulp of his huangjiu. (edited)
Cel 24/06/2020 00:10
After thoroughly looking over the building from her seat, Aralynn looks over the group. "Indulge in the local culture while you can. We might not be at the so called 'haunted village' yet, but we should keep our guards up, something doesn't feel right to me."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 24/06/2020 02:44
"What gives you that impression?" Ryuzuko asks with slight confusion. "Everything seems pretty normal to me, as far as I can tell, having never been to Hong" (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 24/06/2020 06:11
"I thought it was my inexperience with small towns, but I think the lady is correct." He looks around a moment before continuing... "I can't put my finger on it, but something feels ... Off around here"
Mike 24/06/2020 06:50
"I don't know what you two mean. I'm with Ryuzuko, nothing's seemed out of place, and I've been to Hong before." Sadao takes a larger sip of his tea, savoring it.
TheOrsini 24/06/2020 07:08
Coming out of her relaxed state, Koide hears her companions, and takes a glance around looking for a sense of the people around her.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 24/06/2020 14:39
Viraj offers his own insight. "I know what you mean, but I thought it was just part of being in a new land."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 25/06/2020 23:03
"Seems like our next course of action is to find a map, or at least directions, to our destination." Ryuzuko says, finishing up his huangjiu the sweet smell and taste reminding him of sake from Je'dahn. "Ahh... This huangjiu is a lot like *sake, good to know something here is familiar to me." He thsn stands up, mug in hand, and heads to the bar, "Thanks for the drink ojiisan, it's very much like Je'dahn sake." He then heads back to the table with the rest, but instead of sitting, he starts to strech. The stretches help to ease the slowness of his body from being on a cramped ship for four days. "If this unease you guys are feeling has any bearing, we should keep a watch out for anything suspicious. Also... we should stay in groups of three if we have to split, this land is unknown to us all." (edited)
Mike 26/06/2020 20:42
"Well, I suppose it is better safe than sorry." Sadao looks out the window, at the mostly empty street outside. Only now did it begin to set in that it was rather quiet for the day. He looks to the barkeep. "Honorable sir, are more people spending time indoors? I remember seeing more faces than this in a Hong port town. Besides that, have you heard of a village called Tonghua? We seek to travel there. It seems strange things are afoot."
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/06/2020 20:49
The bartender gives Sadao a puzzled look. "Whatever do you mean? Dandong has always been a small town. There's no trouble here."
Dandiil {Takumi} 26/06/2020 22:21
"He means in Tonghua, my friend here wasn't implying that there is trouble in your lovely town." Trying to calm the defensive reaction of the barkeep. "My apologies, but is my tea ready yet?"
Mike 26/06/2020 22:23
"Uh, no trouble, I'm sure. I certainly hope not!" He laughs awkwardly. "I was just wondering. Not much chatter on the streets, and all." He doesn't force the issue, thinking there probably wasn't anything to it.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/06/2020 22:26
Takumi's reassurances seen to assuage those of the barkeep. Jin is already on her way and gladly pours Takumi his cup of tea. She glances furtively at the window now and again.
Dandiil {Takumi} 26/06/2020 23:03
"thanks for the tea." Takumi hands Jin a few coppers. Not noticing the look on her face he wonders if she might know the way. "Do you by chance know the way to the village of Tonghua?" Actually I wonder if she can even understand me. (edited)
TheOrsini 26/06/2020 23:58
Koide brings herself to the here and now, snapping out of the zen state. Her party has discussed much, but they're is definitely something off. She rises. As she passes Takumi, she says calmly. "I know the way to Tonghua." She continues her pace up to the barkeeper, "Apologies, but you told my friend there is no trouble here. If there is no trouble, then why is the town not at ease, or peace in your voice. If it is a monster that puts you ill-at-ease, that is my profession." Her eyes had been looking down in supplication, but they rise to meet his with a fierce intensity of purpose. "And if not, my compatriots are proven adventurers of their own merit. We can bring peace here if there is need," she pauses for effect, " ...and coin." She is calm enough that she does not portray anger or hostility to him, but loud enough that her companions can hear in the empty tavern. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/06/2020 10:57
Jin smiles and nods friendlily to Takumi, before walking away. The barman, on the other hand, looks at Koide in confusion. "There are no monsters here. Why would you think the town is ill at ease? Look at all my happy customers!" He gestures across the common room. The wide array of empty chairs and tables is occupied only sporadically by locals who watch the group of newcomers with suspicion. "Please, let them drink in peace."
TheOrsini 27/06/2020 11:12
"Very well." Koide smiles. They had been given two tries to ask for help. Whatever the wrongness was, she no longer cared. She takes the tea cup in her hand and finishes it and sets it on the counter. She walks back to the table. "Enjoy your tea, and take your time. There may be little of it in the days ahead. I'm gonna buy a map for us so we can put this town behind us. You can find me when you're ready at what passes for the western gate." She picks up her kit and chest of equipment, hoists it over her shoulder, and begins to head for the door. Koide smiles at Ryuzuko, and jokingly says, "Stay out of trouble." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/06/2020 11:58
As Koide walks through the streets of Dandong, her feeling that something is not quite right slowly grows. The market is closed, but many of the stalls remain abandoned on the square. Honmin graffiti has been scrawled in red paint across a number of buildings and left.
TheOrsini 27/06/2020 13:19
The silent echoes of what might have been a market at one time, makes Koide reconsider the bartenders words. He had seem accepting of smaller numbers, and with the apparent lack of trade, there probably meant there wasn't a substantial population. She considered. 'Where is everyone?' Koide decided to make a small side trip down one of the residential streets just to see how many homes were abandoned.
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/06/2020 13:33
The houses look neat and in order at first glance, but in many cases the tell-tale signs of absence are there. Unlocked doors. Uncleared gardens. Daily maintenance gone undone. These homes have not been empty long, but many may be now.
TheOrsini 27/06/2020 13:49
With all the missing people, her training reverts to its more baser nature, 'undead'. She sets her storage box on the porch of one of the abandoned homes, and then sits cross leggeded leaning against it in the shade. He grasps her medallion and opens her awareness beyond her eyes and ears. Minutes pass, the quiet street does not phase her. There... to the south... mere specks in the distance on the edge of her reach. "Strange." she says aloud to no one.
TheOrsini 27/06/2020 14:11
Stumped by her searches, she recovers her belongings and heads to towards the town center. 'Maybe a scribe would have a map. Owning a map really wasn't her kind of thing, but it would help her troop at least.' The one questions keep agging at her 'Why is everyone so calm about this?'
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/06/2020 18:25
As Koide leaves with a smile, Ryuzuko smirks back "I'm not the one that gets us into trouble" he thinks to himself. "Well, if she is going to do that, how about the rest of us ask some other locals about what has happening here?" He says to the rest of the group, as he too leaves the establishment. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/06/2020 06:20
Takumi watches as the sole connection to the group walks off... And he has an idea as Ryuzoku makes his suggestion... "I trust Koide's instincts. As I said before, a good performance can transcend language, and maybe lift the spirits of this town. That distraction may be a way to get some information that we require." He looks to Sadao and ryuzoku, as Takumi finishes his statement. "We play," pointing to Ryu, Sadao, and himself "on the main street, maybe even make some coin, and someone could gather info from the crowd." this statement 'almost' seems like a question. "Who speaks the local language?" he was unsure about his proposition, but Takumi tries to appear confident about his suggestion, but seeing his current companions, he nearly falters. Gods I hope I was not being too direct (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 28/06/2020 06:44
"That could work Takumi, better than aimlessly talking to anyone we walk past. Let's bring the information to us!" Ryuzuko laughs, as he smacks Takumi on the back. "At the very least we can make some friends here doing it. The center of the town should be good, any objections?"
Mike 28/06/2020 07:35
"That's a great idea!" Sadao perks right up, having felt a little unsure himself about the state of this town, and whether there was anything that they could, or should do to better it. "Hah, I speak it of course, Takumi!" He gets out his shamisen while the others produce their instruments, and spends about 10 minutes tuning it. Seemingly an inordinate amount of time for an instrument with only a few strings, he is really taking the time to attune his senses to the flow of magic in the world. Perhaps spirits are at work, or mortal mages. Won't know unless I check. (edited)
07:40
"...There. That should do it!" Sadao smiles. "I'll just have to do the translating myself, like before. Let's get to the town square." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/06/2020 10:44
Koide heads for the town centre. The afternoon sky is overcast and she sees a number of townsfolk going about their day, but again the girl notices that it doesnâ€™t seem busy enough for a town of this size. As Koide walks the streets, she sees that many shops arenâ€™t open, and when she glances inside they seem empty and derelict. In the heart of Dandong, bunched in amongst the shops, taverns and other buildings is what looks like it was once a grand town hall. However, the building is unexpectedly broken and dilapidated. Nevertheless, one of the nearby shops does appear to stock books and other paper goods. Perhaps here she can find a map?
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/06/2020 10:53
Meanwhile, down by the docks the locals watch Sadao with consternation as the man tunes his shamisen. However, they do not interfere. The walk into the heart of town takes some time and the sensation that something about Dandong isn't quite right grows the deeper they go. The streets are quiet and what townsfolk they do see appear sombre. Sadao's eye is especially caught by the unusual dark red graffiti that has been smeared across the walls of many buildings. (edited)
10:57
Eventually, the rest of Koide's hunting party arrive at the town square, where Sadao has proposed they perform. While there isn't much of a crowd to form an audience, they do spot Koide across the square as she browses the shop signs.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 28/06/2020 15:10
Viraj shrugs finishes his tea and follows behind the Ryuzuko and the rest. Better to be doing something than just sitting around. "Maybe you all were right about things not being right. It's quiet and the few we see seem to just be going through the motions." As the group passes the through the streets, he points to some of the grafiti and asks of Sadao, "Do you know what that says?" (edited)
Mike 28/06/2020 15:17
Sadao swallows, looking around at the walls. "Some grim messages left as graffiti," he makes mention, as they walk through the streets. But, as he sees the occasional person, noting their downcast looks, he gathers his resolve. "We're doing the right thing for this place, by doing this. I'm sure of it." He helps the others get set up, and waves to Koide. He remembers that she likely hadn't heard their performance on the boat, what with the mystical storm and all. Looking over at her, he starts to blush, and feels inspired to play a love song. Figuring that none of the group would understand his Honmin singing anyway, he is doubly encouraged. "Once more, I'll need you to follow my lead. You might not know this song, but it's slow, and easy to pick up on," he advises Ryuzuko in Je'dahnian, before turning, and gradually beginning his strumming, giving them plenty of time to catch up and get the feel of the song, before he starts to sing Honmin lyrics. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 28/06/2020 15:36
Viraj glances around unsure at first what to do while the Sadao and the rest prepare. With the townsfolk paying little attention to someone casting a spell in the, he prepares for his own ritual. "I will see if any of the people are sick with some poison," he announces. Pulling a red maple leaf from a pouch at his hip, the druid begins the incantations in the language known only to druids. With each round of the chant, his senses become more and more focused on any nearby toxins or afflictions. Once completed, he stands and finds a nearby group of townsfolk. He approaches just close enough to allow his heightened senses to detect anything. (edited)
Mike 28/06/2020 15:39
Sadao lowers his head and begins singing. Unfortunately, or perhaps, fortunately, he looks back up at just the wrong time, meeting Koide's gaze for a moment, and feels thrown off. He begins making mistakes where he otherwise wouldn't, but at least remembers the lyrics... but mostly in Je'dahnian. Fly me to the moon Let me play among the stars Let me see what spring is like With you in my arms In other words, hold my hand In other words, darling, kiss me Fill my heart with song And let me sing for ever more You are all I long for All I worship and adore In other words, please be true In other words, I love you Fill my heart with song Let me sing for ever more You are all I long for All I worship and adore In other words, please be true In other words, in other words I love you. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/06/2020 17:57
Walking through the streets with the others, though lagging behind.. due to the burden he carries, he begins extravagantly waving his arms, advertising a delightful show. In a confidence that the rest of the party barely sees from Takumi, he says as he walks the streets, "Ladies and Gentlemen, Mothers and Father's, Sons and Daughters, children young and old. We are here to perform fantastical music and feats of magic that you may hold in your hearts forever. Bring a friend, bring a loved one, bring yourselves, and come, come, enjoy the show." Arriving at the square, Takumi makes his way over to the water trough. He sets his bag down. He then checks his component pouch to make sure the items within are still usable. Delighted by his findings, he prepares his show. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/06/2020 18:09
As Sadao begins the music, Takumi uses his practice from the tavern on a much grander scale. He creates a colorful pole that sits upon the water, and brings forth a woman about 2 foot tall from the trough. Holding his hands above her, as though she were a marionette with invisible strings, she moves around the pole, dancing to the music with seemingly effortless grace. This is a light crowd he thinks to himself I hope more will arrive. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 28/06/2020 19:03
Ryuzuko plays along with Takumi and Sadao, matching the sounds of his shamisen to complement their performances.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 28/06/2020 19:12
Finding nothing except for a bit of alcohol or the common ailment, Viraj leaves the performers to their business and joins Koide near the storefront. "Have you found anything useful?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/06/2020 21:21
Sadao's ballad is something of a flop, but Takumi's tricks draw a few onlookers who gather around to watch the routine.
TheOrsini 28/06/2020 22:33

Kyle [Arcadian] 28/06/2020 22:36
When Koide and Viraj look across the square at the town hall, it appears entirely normal and undamaged.
TheOrsini 28/06/2020 22:42

Dandiil {Takumi} 28/06/2020 22:48
After the first performance, Takumi sees the small crowd gathering, he turns to Sadao, "How about playing something that Ryuzoku can follow, that last song was an odd one."
Mike 28/06/2020 22:51
Sadao, finishing up his song, only now realizes just how much he had been singing in Je'dahnian out of habit. Not sure whether to be glad or disappointed Koide didn't appear to be paying attention, he is nonetheless thoroughly embarrassed, with Takumi and Ryuzuko right there next to him. "Hah, I don't know where my head was at. Sorry." He glances back at Koide and Viraj before focusing back on Takumi and Ryu.
Cel 28/06/2020 23:17
Having been sitting off to the side during the performance, Aralynn looks at the small crowd, her previous unease only being amplified at how empty the town is. "It seems it will take more to attract a larger crowd in a place like this, might I add my Guidance to the mix?" Moving closer to the group, she channels her prayer towards aiding the currently lacking performance of her allies, hoping this might help them gather any information to ease her doubts about this town.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 29/06/2020 04:05

He chalks up her false assumption as one of not being familiar with he town and was misremembering one of the many other dilapidated buildings. "Something isn't quite right around here and some answers would be good. I wasn't able to detect any substance that could be affecting them... Lead the way." (edited)
TheOrsini 29/06/2020 14:27
Koide leads Viraj on. They walk up the eight wide steps leading to a covered, railed landing in front of town hall's red lacquered doors. She places her hand on door handle, but hesitates before pulling on the door. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 29/06/2020 21:21
Inside the broad double doors is a spacious entrance hall with a shiny tiled floor and a high ceiling. In the centre of the room is a large oval desk with an elegantly dressed woman sat behind it. Stairs run around the back of the room to a balcony on the first floor and three doors at ground level lead to other parts of the building.
Dandiil {Takumi} 29/06/2020 22:23
Takumi prepares himself for a much grander 2nd show. Feeling a hand upon his back, as he sets an empty wooden bowl on the ground between himself and Sadao, he glances up and sees the eladrin smiling. He returns the smile and feels a bit more confident about his next performance. "Thanks miss." I should have put that out earlier. He thinks to himself. Probably would have made a little coin. Awaiting Sadao's next song, he does a few parlor tricks using his dextrous fingers and the occasional Gust of air. Nothing too extravagant, just enough to keep the crowd interested During his mini show, Takumi sees Koide and the dolphin guy heading towards a damaged... no... Wait, the building doesn't appear to be in disrepair at all... "Strange... I could've sworn..." Shaking it off, he finishes up his little trick, dropping the copper coins he was using landing in the bowl to provide a hint. "Sadao, Ryu, are you ready for one more? Something lively and exciting If you can." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 29/06/2020 22:48
"Sounds good to me." Ryuzuko says before starting up an upbeat melody for Sadao and Takumi to follow.
Mike 29/06/2020 22:55
Sadao nods and follows along with the melody, hoping to raise more of the people's spirits.
Dandiil {Takumi} 30/06/2020 03:09
The musical choice was a good one, and as the music begins, Takumi raises his water dancer again, and she moves to the beat with a ribbon of water. Takumi performs the same dance, and using his quarterstaff (in place of the ribbon) juggles an illusory ball throughout the dance. At the crescendo, blue sparks flash around his water dancer, she vanishes in a splash that rises to form a thin sheet of water. Takumi points his finger and mutters something under his breath. The veil freezes and falls with a crash. Satisfied with the performance he bows gracefully and makes his way into the crowd. Asking a question with just one word..."Tonghua?" (edited)
TheOrsini 30/06/2020 10:49
"Hello." Koide bows from the atrium of the building, "I ask your humble apologies, but we are travelers from afar and wish to speak to the magistrate, if it pleases you." She remembered some of the supplication, and then realizes that they may not understand her anyway. "I hope you speak some Je'dahnain."
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2020 11:36
Just over a dozen townsfolk have now gathered to watch Takumi's fanciful magic tricks. They clap politely and smile when he bows and a few toss some copper pieces into the bowl. However, most look at the magician with confusion when he mentions Tonghua. "Nà TÅnghuà ne?" Asks one man. (edited)
11:38
Meanwhile, inside the town hall, the woman behind the desk also inclines her head towards Koide and Viraj with a graceful smile. "I'm sorry, who? There is no magistrate here." She replies in Je'dahnian.
TheOrsini 30/06/2020 11:44
"I again apologize. I am unfamiliar with your country, perhaps mayor or councilor, or governor. Someone who runs the city." Koide tries to get the right title. She was relieved that language wouldn't be a barrier. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2020 14:39
The woman hesitates as though confused. "No... no, we've never had a mayor or governor. Would you like to see the Magister?"
Dandiil {Takumi} 30/06/2020 14:40

Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2020 14:42
The man turns and points back through the ground, westwards. "TÅnghuà jiùshì zhèyàng."
Cel 30/06/2020 20:31
Still curious about the general lack of activity in the town, and deciding to leave Takumi to try and talk to the locals, Aralynn quickly glances around the area, her eyes briefly turning to an inky black color as she does.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 30/06/2020 22:02
Viraj furrows his brow. "Yes, the person in charge please," he replies to the woman behind the desk.
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2020 22:08

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 30/06/2020 22:17
Viraj starts toward the stairs but stops near the desk. "Were you expecting someone else? You seem like you are a bit nervous about something."
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2020 22:33

TheOrsini 30/06/2020 23:20
"He would be fine, thanks." Koide was getting confused. If she understood her language, it should not have been much distinction between magister and magistrate. (edited)
Mike 30/06/2020 23:42
Sadao is quick to clear up the confusion between Takumi and the Honmin speakers, explaining, "Yes, he was wondering which way to get there," in Honmin. "Has anyone from Tonghua come here?" He asks the crowd, before they disperse.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/07/2020 05:09
"So, some sort of sorcerer is in charge of the town...?" Viraj says to Koide halfway up the stairs, concern clearly showing in his voice. "That could explain a few things." (edited)
TheOrsini 01/07/2020 06:35
Koide draws her breath, thinking on options. People are missing. This could be dangerous. She lowers her words to a near whisper that only Viraj can hear. "If problems happen, our priority is to run, not fight. Any sorcerer able to exert this kind of control and fear upon a town is too dangerous to be fighting in a straight fight on their terms."
06:36
They reach the top of the stairwell.
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/07/2020 06:50
The long corridor to the left is lit by low candlelight. Koide and Viraj pass open doors to other offices, but most are completely empty. The only occupants are the occasional scribe putting quill to parchment here and there. The door that they have been directed to opens into what looks like some kind of library. Outside, most people shrug and walk away, but one man approaches Sadao. "Once a month farmers from Tonghue come to sell their wares," he confirms.
Mike 01/07/2020 06:58
"Have they come this month? When they do come, has there been anything unusual about them of late?"
TheOrsini 01/07/2020 07:00
Koide is tempted take her katana and cut a precise stroke into one of the doorway frames just to get a response from these people. She talks herself out of it. It would be a frivolous risk to my weapon. She was on edge from the strangeness. Her mind craved answers that just weren't forthcoming.
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/07/2020 13:47
The man on the town square shakes his head. "Stay for a week, maybe you'll see them." Inside the town hall, the library is eerily silent. Only a little light shines in through the high set windows and the stacks extend away from the door into shadows.
TheOrsini 01/07/2020 14:03
Koide glances around the room looking for the mysterious ruler of the city. Seeing no one she decides to speak at whisper to Viraj, "If you have a way to see magics, now would be a good time." The silence is deafening to her. "Lord Magister. My Lord ... we are here seeking an audience." She fights the urge to draw her Katana again, but she does set the chest down off her shoulder.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/07/2020 15:11
Viraj shakes his head. "I don't like this," he says in a low voice. His human eyes squint to try to make out anything within the room. "Bah! Can't see much in here." The man snaps his fingers. "Farbaghey" A flame springs to life in the palm of his hand. He holds it out before him to illuminate the room. (edited)
TheOrsini 01/07/2020 15:17
The sudden light triggers Koide's reflexes as she begins to react to the burst of flame. Her draw reveals an inch of steel from the sheath, as she moves into a lowered crouch turned to face Viraj. She stops herself from the full draw and relaxes the intensity from her stance. "Sorry... it's this place." She apologizes with a heavy breath of relief as the blade retracts back into the sheath. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 01/07/2020 20:09
As the honmin man leaves the square, Ryuzuko asks Sadao, "What did that man say to you?"
Mike 01/07/2020 20:19
"That people from Tonghua come here to trade once a month. They're supposed to come again in about a week." He shrugs. "I'm not really planning on staying here that long, and I doubt the rest of you are either. Maybe we'll see them on the road there."
Dandiil {Takumi} 01/07/2020 20:24
After gathering his things and entertaining a few children that hung around, he walks back over, hearing the end of the conversation. "So what did you find out about what's going on around here? Isn't that why we came here? to gather information about the local events?" Takumi may have misinterpreted things that was said during the meeting, but he is pretty sure that's what they were trying to do... He looks around as the man walks away, apparently he was the last to go.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 01/07/2020 20:25
"We should find Koide and Viraj then, wherever they wandered off to." Ryuzuko says, while searching for their comrades amongst the dispersing crowd.
20:26
He then chuckles at Takumi's comment, "No, my friend, we were looking for information about why this town seems off, and how to get to Tonghua, save the actual direction, which we have."
Mike 01/07/2020 20:53
"Yeah. I think I saw them head over this way..." Sadao starts across the square, looking for where they went.
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/07/2020 21:42
Viraj's light reveals that many tomes and sheafs of parchment have have been scattered on the floor, the trail leading deeper in to the library. The whispering crinkle of paper on paper, echoes in the distance. Something is moving - hiding maybe. Most would never notice, but the druid and the witcher both possess exceptionally sharp senses.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/07/2020 22:04
"Come out!" Viraj shouts without stepping forward. His annoyance over the situation is quickly rising. Something ripples under the skin of his large forearms, but he takes his own breath to steady himself and the the disturbance underneath subsides. "I hear you back there hiding!" He looks around at the piles of parchment. "I'd hate to see some of these important paper get burnt up!" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/07/2020 22:32
Viraj hears only distant muttering, but nobody shows themselves.
Dandiil {Takumi} 02/07/2020 03:06
Takumi follows Ryu and Sadao for a moment until they start to pass the "city hall" and points to the strange building. "I'm pretty sure Koide went in there, the dolphin guy went in with her. I didn't see where Aralynn went though..."
TheOrsini 02/07/2020 03:15
Koide thought to herself, 'Damnit, I wish Takumi was here.' She takes a careful step forward. "Magister?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/07/2020 07:11
Silence reigns in the library, but for the whistle of wind through a window near the ceiling. Then there is a thump, like a book falling to the floor.
TheOrsini 02/07/2020 07:34
Her skirts rustle nervously, as she pensively decides upon the next course of action. She would like to make a grandiose speech of how she's given the magister more than enough opportunities to reveal themselves, but it would just be justifying why she would be willing to kill him to the rest of her party. 'I'll cross that bridge once I come to it.' It didn't matter for now. Koide quietly begins to make a stead pace forward trying to avoid the creaking of the floor boards, her frustration surmounting concern for this potential villain. She draws the blade free of its scabbard. As she brings it into the comfort of her two handed grip, the scabbard catches against a stack of books with her momentum, cascading the pile to the floor, many of the books thumping as they slap against the hardwood planks. Koide curses to herself as she motions for Viraj to stay put - unsure of how quiet he could be. 'Not that he could be any worse.' she chided. She glances back at him to make sure they remain in sight, but sees Viraj coming onward anyway. (edited)
Mike 02/07/2020 07:40
Sadao eyes the building curiously. Beckoning Aralynn over, he heads inside, with the three of them. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/07/2020 09:40
Koide rounds the end of a stack and finds a brown-robed man squatting near the wall in a circle of open tomes and unraveled scrolls. Dark patches of blood and mutilation mar his ruined ears and he stares up at the girl with wild eyes. "No! You can hear it too!" He cries in Honmin in a strangely slurred voice. The man weaves a rapid incantation with his fingers and his leaps speak a word that Koide never hears, as the room falls into silence. There's a moment of shock that causes Koide to hesitate. The silence is so profound that it's like a sound that she was never even aware of is abruptly gone. The man in the circle of books points up and away behind her, over her shoulder. (edited)
TheOrsini 02/07/2020 10:57
Koide's mind races looking for options, the magister had struck her deaf. Her paranoia and stress seem to dump into her arms, coiled like a viper from hours of confused searching. She draws her blade up to strike, but the man before her wasnâ€™t taking advantage of her moment of confusion and weakness. In fact, his fear wasnâ€™t directed at her at all, he was transfixed behind her. Her eyes darted to his ears. 'His ears, why?' There seemed to be some obsession over the noise. â€™This wasnâ€™t aggression.â€™ Years of reading truth from the unspoken words in courts and alleys dispelled that theory. She starts to lower her high stance, but his frantic pointing and fearful gaze draws her gaze behind her... (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/07/2020 12:11
High above the stacks, dim light trickles into the room from small windows close to the ceiling. One is directly behind Koide, at the far end of the aisle she stands in, amidst the break between one set of stacks and the next. Grey clouds are visible outside, shrouding the sky over the town's rooftops. Standing in front of this morose backdrop, an oversized, grey-skinned head sways atop an enormous snake-like neck. Eyeless and noseless, its only feature is a gaping maw lined with pointed teeth.
12:13
Downstairs, the rest of Koide's companions enter the building. The woman at the desk in the lobby looks at them with a curious smile. "Hello, can I help you?" She asks in Honmin.
TheOrsini 02/07/2020 12:21
The sight of the creature is fear inducing, she mutters in amazement, "Watashi o fakku." but the words are silent.
Cel 02/07/2020 15:25
Stepping inside the entrance hall with her companions, Aralynn makes her way to the woman at the desk, taking the time to take in the room around her, and noting how its emptiness reflects that of the town they are in. She bows as she reaches the desk. ''Hello, I apologize for our intrusion, but have you seen 2 humans enter here recently?'' (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 02/07/2020 15:43
Viraj shakes his head at Koide's unsaid instructions. Instead he pushes ahead holding his flame aloft and pulls his weapon from his back. Reaching the end of the row, he struck with disgust seeing the man on the floor with blood coming from his ears. However, when, who he assumes to be, the magister begins their incantation and all sound is suddenly gone, Viraj's instinct of a potential attack kicks in. That small ripple earlier now comes to a full boil. Vines push out from his skin wrapping themselves around the druid's limbs and torso all the way up his neck. With this quick transformation complete, he raises his maulaxe preparing to strike the sorcerer, but notices Koide has stayed her weapon for some reason. He turns to see what has drawn her attention. He takes a step back in shock of the horrifying visage, but soon recovers his nerve. He looks to Koide in confusion: How did we not see that outside?! (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/07/2020 22:57

TheOrsini 03/07/2020 08:32

She pats his near arm as a motivator, sheathing her katana and starts to quickly move toward the library entrance to recover her chest.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/07/2020 08:34

TheOrsini 03/07/2020 08:59
Koide begins to pick up her storage chest at the doorway, but hears Ryuzuko's laugh down the hall. She looks into the hall, only her head showing against the frame. "Ryu! Hurry up and be quiet. We got problems. Bring the others." Excited by her luck she leaves the chest and tucks back into the library. She leans around the corner looking to Viraj and the earless magister. Her hand motions holding up one finger to the panicking caster, and she mouths as clearly as possible, 'One moment.' Hoping they understood her, she leans back around the stack to stare at the open door - waiting for her friends to make it inside. (edited)

Cel 03/07/2020 13:18

TheOrsini 03/07/2020 15:48

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 03/07/2020 15:58
As the rest begin to gather, Viraj looks out the window again then back towards the frightened man cowering against the wall with his ears a mess. He takes a step forward until finding the edge of the silence. He looks up to the window again and finds the creature no longer visable. Standing there a moment to think, he decides to start with the easiest possible solution - plugging his ears with a finger. Of course, not so easy.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/07/2020 18:19
As Ryuzuko draws closer to Koide and Viraj, he is instantly hit with silence. The sounds of his armor, weapons, and equipment shifting around as he moved, that he had grown accustomed to, simply ceased. He tries to say something, but nothing comes out, he doesn't even hear it internally. Knowing something is off, he looks up to the windows that Koide pointed, the outside view engulfed by the monstrosity. "Nani?! That is definitely a problem!" he says to himself. (edited)
Mike 03/07/2020 19:04
Sadao steps into the library, as Ryu, Aralynn and Takumi do so as well. When he gets close to those gathered around, he kicks over a fallen book, only to be surprised not to hear its thud. Looking around, he realizes it is a magical effect of some kind. Then, following Ryu's gaze, he sees the cause of the unrest as well. "A spirit was watching us the whole time?!" He says, silently. He looks at the earless man with some shock, but slowly begins to understand his plight. He looks to the others, and gestures to himself, then to it. "I - should - talk - to - it." He mimes the Je'dahnian syllables as he mouths them in the silence. In his training, the first step was always to try to extend to the spirit an olive branch. But from there, he thought with concern, there's no way to know how things will go. (edited)
Mike 03/07/2020 19:28
As he starts to leave the bubble of silence to get a better look at the creature, he slows down, holding his head. It was getting... harder to remember what it even looked like, and soon enough, what he was planning on doing in the first place. He reenters the field, and tries to come up with another solution. Looking around the library, he gathers up itemsâ€”a quill and some ink. When he has enough, he leaves what he found in the center of the circle, then takes up the quill and begins writing. He quickly scrawls a message in Honmin on some paper, before showing it to the earless man. "We are here to help. How long has that been here/What is it doing here?" It is worth noting that despite it being rushed, his penmanship is impeccable. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 03/07/2020 21:23
Continuing to work through ruling out the easiest solutions first, Viraj retrieves a candle from a nearby scone. He pinches a bit of the warm wax between his fingers to form two small. Using his magic to produce a flame again he warms the wax so that it will be more malleable and fitting to his ear canal. With the wax in place he walks to the edge of the silence and tests the earplugs.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/07/2020 21:58

Dandiil {Takumi} 04/07/2020 04:36

TheOrsini 04/07/2020 04:41

"Monster," the words sound strained from her lips, but they come out. She places her hand around his shoulder and says, "Come, I will show you." Desperation grips her, and she pulls him along a hurried pace finally breaching back into the cone of silence. 'It had felt like an hour,' she thought to herself. Koide lets go a deep breath and spins Takumi around and calmly directs his head to the creature in the window and abrupt lets go, so that she does not hurt him if panics and tries to struggle away and partially at the renewed memories of its grotesque form. Dandiil {Takumi} 04/07/2020 04:53

He finally looks away from the disturbing creature, and looks at Koide and begins asking questions at a quick pace, the sounds never reaching past his thoughts. 10:30

Mike 06/07/2020 06:53
Sadao thinks for a moment. Looking at the grim message the magister wrote back, his eyes travel downwards to the scores of books they were squatted over. Gods, of course! Learning more about this creature is easiest in a library! He begins checking the books scattered around him, and notices that there was art of the creature on one of Koide's books. With a questioning motion for her approval, he'll take the book and begin checking it for relevant information. He silently points to the book, then to the page she tore out, hoping to read it too.
Kyle [Arcadian] 06/07/2020 07:13
The book is lying on the ground besides the magister and one has been left open on a page that could be an artist's impression of what can be seen through the window. However, whoever drew it had clearly never actually seen one... or maybe they couldn't remember it. A few paragraphs of text besides the illustration describe the creature. Common wisdom holds that false hydras come from the ground. They spontaneously originate as undifferentiated masses of flesh. Potatoes that sprout from no seed. Supposedly, they germinate in response to lies, and that each falsehood causes a false hydra to swell larger. The false hydra enters a town through a humble enough method. Fattened on worms, it has been growing upwards these last few days (weeks? years?), but has only now broken through the soil. It emerges in a basement, from behind the jars of fruit preserve. Or pushes its face up through a broken cobblestone. And then it begins to sing. While it sings, it is ignored. It just creates gaps in your attention and then slips through them. It is subtler than invisibility, and more reliable. But of course, none of this is noticed. While it sings, the hydra exists in our blind spot. The lair of a false hydra always lies underneath the city it chooses to feed on. The hydra burrows underground sprouting its head like a plant typically under buildings or in their lower floors. It frequently moves creating large cavernous areas prone to collapse. It only surfaces if the city can no longer feed it, and only long enough to move to its next target. (edited)
Mike 06/07/2020 08:29
Sadao reads intensively, his concern visibly growing. He hands the page back to Koide. Closing the book, he checks for the author's name, making a note of it. He takes the quill, and writes a paraphrased version of the article's information, with an addition: The element of surprise may be our greatest ally here. It has considerable size, but it's used to being ignored. Another problemâ€”it's probably intending to leave soon, and tracking it will be tricky once it does. We may be able to figure something out. Any ideas?
TheOrsini 06/07/2020 08:41
Koide reads over Sadao's shoulder as he writes. With the population of the town so diminished, it was logical that the creature should be leaving soon. It had almost exhausted its food. Part of her wanted the simplest solution, Just leave. She wasn't being paid for this creature, but her Master's words echoed in her head. She thought on it. Fighting it wasn't really an option, at least not with swords. She thought on it, there were no warships in the harbor so the cannon was out, but.. black powder. Koide thought more. It might work. She picked up her quill and another piece of parchment and began to write. If we could lure the creature into an area of town that we stashed black powder nearby, the explosion could possibly kill the creature. She considered, * It would be costly in the city, but worth it if it destroyed the monster.* She looked to the magister and wrote. Ask the magister if they have a store of the powder, fireworks even. She lifts the page up and shows it to Sadao. (edited)
Mike 06/07/2020 08:46
Sadao nods, then quickly gets to work on another page, showing it to the magister. Where do you store your black powder? All of it. Fireworks, anything explosive, we'll need it. (edited)

There is a massvive aberration called a *false hydra* that lives under the town, it has been eating them for a while. Use the powder to help kill the monster, to save the town from it. He let everyone read it, before folding it up and slotting it into one of the grooves in his gauntlet. (edited)

Mike 07/07/2020 21:42

Thinking and acting quickly, he pens a message to himself in case he forgets. Dandong is under siege from a false hydra. THAT is what the graffiti means. It has eaten most of the people already. You cannot remember it while it sings, but it is true. Koide has the pamphlet for more info. Get explosives, rig the underground to blow. It is an aberration, we must destroy it. Only the magister knows the truth. He then tries to hand the quill around to others so they can write their own messages, but realizes there is scarcely time. Kyle [Arcadian] 07/07/2020 21:47
If ears could see, the air around the group would shimmer as the spell fades and sound returns to the library. The magister slumps back against the wall from the exertion, even as the memory of the false hydra's head blurs in the minds of Koide's band of monster hunters. They don't have long before the memory fades, running off the surface of their thoughts like water from a lotus leaf.
Mike 07/07/2020 22:01
Sadao starts to speak to the magister in the newly audible space. "Sir! We-" He then remembers his condition, looking at his ears. Instead, he pulls from his pouch a reed, colored like copper. Holding it to his mouth, he whispers into it: "Spirits of the wind, buoyant and free. Carry my message, I beseech you." Then, he whistles with the reed, as his words are carried imperceptibly to the magister's bloodied ear-holes. Sir, we'll return soon with ordnance. We will need your help again to remember everything. Continue to hide for now.
Kyle [Arcadian] 07/07/2020 22:55
The magister nods, but seems too exhausted to do much more. "Remember. It is watching you," he utters in a hoarse whisper. The man's tonality is eerily distorted by his inability to hear his own voice.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/07/2020 23:24

"Hopefully we can remember enough to deal with this monstrosity." he thinks to himself as his memory of the creature fades away like dew on a hot summer's day. (edited)
