Would you be so kind as to carry it for me?" The request sounds sincere, and half-elf offers the ornate quarterstaff to her. "Thank you for relieving me of this burden." He also pulls his mirror out of one of his interior pockets, glancing around the cavern.
TheOrsini 16/11/2020 06:42

Kyle [Arcadian] 17/11/2020 20:46
The tunnel winds on beneath the town, aberrant noises echoing up from the depths. Unintelligible whispers, insectoid chittering and a strange rattling hiss bewitch the senses and make it seem as though danger lurks around every turn. In fact, the descent seems to be nothing but one big turn, spiralling downwards until it finally comes to a dead end blocked by a pile of fresh rubble. As the questing band approach the slump of earth and stone, those attuned to the darkness can make out a bunch of the same fleshy tendrils that had controlled the magister, sprouting up through the ground like some kind of obscene plant. The ends flail wildly in all directions as though seeking something.
Mike 17/11/2020 22:31
As they continue into the tunnel, which slowly began to sound of an alien hellscape, Sadao is both unsettled, and somewhat intrigued. He speaks, not too loudly, to both ease the tension, and pose a theory. "These tendrils... the way they're growing out of the walls. That article we found about the hydra mentioned it starts life more as a plant. It grows underground, feeding on lies, until it gets big enough to try and hunt living things. It's like it's... reverting to that original form, somehow." Though perhaps impossible to understand for mortals like themselves, Sadao can't help but try to make sense of the strange being. It wasn't unlike his favorite childhood activity of exploring the woods around his family home, in a twisted way. Spending all day and sometimes night out there, still close to home, but able to observe and understand the behaviors of many different animals, and eventually natural spirits. But neither was anything like this. Idly rubbing the backs of his hands, though they hadn't been burnt, he comes to a stop short of the dead end. "Viraj?" Sadao asks blankly, looking at the tendrils. The name hangs in the air, making his thoughts obviousâ€”these things needed burning.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/11/2020 20:10
Viraj eagerly steps up to the wriggling weeds catching the simple request. A flame grows in his hand to set them afire. He raises his hand above his head to cast the light on the pile. Contemplating the rocks, he turns back to the others. "It will be better to do this from a distance. Who knows what kind of response we will get for the monster."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/11/2020 20:15
"Agreed." Ryuz says, backing up to a safer distance, shield ready to block any incoming debris.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 19/11/2020 16:55

The flames strike true and causes one of the tendrils to give an ear-piercing wail before going limp. Those remaining tendrils hiss and begin to wrap upon one another, pointing in the druid's direction. The ends of the tendrils peel open in three segments, revealing edges lined with teeth. "Damn! I think that just made it mad!" Viraj calls to the group behind him. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 20/11/2020 01:38
Takumi sees the reaction of the plant and runs through what they've seen in his head. "Vines with teeth... So Drying it out didn't work, slashing at it did something noticeable, the fire just kind of pissed it off... I'm going to try giving it a little cold." His hand rears back and a knife of ice appears as he slings it toward the vines. With sure aim, the ice knife pierces one of the "heads" and pins it to the rock behind it. The knife explodes, taking the head along with it, in a spray of chilled blood that covers the rest of the vines. They definitely react to the cold, shrinking away from the sensation. Takumi drops his pack and draws his dagger, trying to stay near Koide in case some assistance is needed. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/11/2020 22:15
The fanged tentacles rear in the direction of their attackers like a swarm of vipers, lunging forth to bite at the interlopers. Koide, on the other hand, suffers a nasty bite. The vicious teeth dig deep, drawing blood from the girl.
TheOrsini 21/11/2020 16:27

Kyle [Arcadian] 23/11/2020 20:09

Cel 24/11/2020 16:14

Mike 24/11/2020 21:23

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 24/11/2020 21:38

Takumi noting the more severe reaction to the cold but seeing the melee getting too close creates a pale blue beam that slides towards the tendrils. He saw his staff drop to the ground, he moves up and retrieves it in one hand only to drop back and get into position. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 25/11/2020 01:18

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/11/2020 02:59
Two of the tendrils hiss and bear their teeth. They lash out towards the druid. Viraj easily sidesteps them both and before the last has a chance to retract, thwack, he lops off the head with a quick upward arcing chop of his axe. He kicks the wiggling appendage aside as the last of its life departs. "Haha... Keep at it! We'll bring this thing down yet!" he encourages the group. (edited)
TheOrsini 25/11/2020 03:46
Koide spins as vines strike at her, like wind she flows past the verdant tendrils, but the flare of pain in her twirl causes her to miss her counterstroke. She remains silent trying to bear the pain, but no fresh wounds grace her form. Battle allowed for no delay, such a pause would be her death. The power flowed into her veins from the fight.
TheOrsini 25/11/2020 10:10
And then the power she felt vanished... and the pain gripped her once more, faltering in stride nearly toppling over. She catches herself in the dance with a painful slide. She manages to keep eyes on the vines, but can't maintain her guard. (edited)
Cel 25/11/2020 20:17
Continuing the momentum of her previously successful strike, Aralynn continues her prayers with renewed enthusiasm, causing the radiant flames to wrap around the base of the creature, damaging it further.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 25/11/2020 21:52
Realizing his shield his not benefiting him much here and the creature can not penetrate his armor, Ryuz drops it and sheaths his wakizashi. He then pulls out his odachi from its scabbard, holding it to his side. He lowers his stance, holds the sword back behind him before shooting his back foot forward, slicing the air. Trying not to hit is friend in the process, Ryuz misses completely as the nimble little tentacles dodge his blade. "Misjudged that one..." he says as he snarls at the creature. (edited)
Mike 26/11/2020 06:02
Seeing that the spirits were unable to hamper the creature, Sadao raises his bow and lets another arrow loose at a wriggling tendril. Though they were hard targets, his training proved him capable, as the arrow pierces its mark.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 26/11/2020 06:27
Viraj continues to hack through the tendrils as he did in his younger years when he cleared the forests surrounding Higashiko. He swings across horizontally through the creature's vine-like heads and quickly flips the axe head around to cut back through. A satisfying ker-chunck can be heard as he makes contact each time with the tough hide. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 26/11/2020 13:48
'These vines sure are relentless, and definitely more trouble than they are worth.' Takumi almost says this out loud, but actually holds his tongue... for once. He is continuing alternating between air and cold against this cluster of annoyance, not wanting to waste his strength on the pitifully persistent and painful plant. The familiar ball of air appears in his hand and streaks toward the vines, striking the vine's bulbous portion with the condensed blast of air. Constantly seeing Lady Koide freeze in pain, and her attempt to conceal it, has the half-elf bothered. He's seen her fight through so many different types of injuries, what is so different this time? "Hey guys, I know I'm not versed like you in these kinds of monsters, but what if we just tried walking away?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/11/2020 20:22
The tendrils swirl about their attackers as Viraj and Ryuzuko advance to tangle with them. The druid is able to fend off the worst of it, but one finds an unprotected region in the paladin's armour, delivering a deep bite that draws a stream of blood from within. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/11/2020 21:08

TheOrsini 27/11/2020 02:16

Cel 27/11/2020 13:01
Shifting to get a better angle, Aralynn considers Takumi's advice as she prepares another attack, opting to leave the decision up to those currently in danger of the creature. Thrusting her hands forward, she releases another attack.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/11/2020 22:21
Takumi's advice goes unheard as the dragonborn continues the fight in the mass of flesh. Feeling the blood poor down his arm, Ryuzuko grabs a healing potion from his belt, pops the cork with one finger, and downs it. The magical properties closing his wounds to stop the bleeding. He then tightly grips onto the hilt of his odachi again, bringing it high in the air. Sadao's lamp spirit floats around one of the untouched tentacles guiding Ryuz to strike it. His right foot steps back, putting his legs in a low stance, as he takes a deep breath, closing his eyes to concentrate. The odachi's blade shines in what little light illuminates the tunnel as Ryuz angles it in the air. His eyes open swiftly as he lifts his right foot up, shooting it forward with a loud shout, as he brings the blade down at a diagonal, cutting clean through one of the tentacles and slashing some of another. "Much better..." he whispers to himself as he goes back to a defensive stance, ready to deflect any incoming blows.
Mike 27/11/2020 23:25

Without really thinking about it, or trying to provide a good argument to himself or Takumi why, he just keeps fighting. Exhaling with a curse, he edges closer to aid the attacking group, placing a hand on the bÅ slung across his back while he looks for an opportune entrance. (edited)

Stone explodes in every direction, sending the druid flying onto his back and showering everyone else with shrapnel.

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 02/12/2020 02:09

Mike 02/12/2020 02:15
Finally faced with the aberration once more, Sadao realizes the time is right. Reaching for a gilded scroll that prominently sticks out from his pack, he withdraws it, and opens it just a few inches, as it mystically brought ancient knowledge from his clan to his eyes. ç£ As he read the character, "Beast." aloud, the rest of the parable came to mind. The trickster kitsune that evadedâ€”and nimbly struck downâ€”a cruel warlord. He points a finger at the nearby Ryu, as a fox-like apparition appears floating beside him, simultaneously mimicking and guiding his movements as he engages the hydra.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 02/12/2020 02:23

Dandiil {Takumi} 02/12/2020 02:44
When the creature came through the floor, Takumi instinctively jumped back knocking aside some of the flying rocks with his staff. He glances over to see that Lady Koide may not need his assistance after all. 'maybe this time it will work... It has to.' It's one of the few skills that he and Hestia shared, but he never could quite get it to work. The last time he tried to channel the focused burst of air through the diamond, it cracked the diamond. That was 50 gold of his hard earned money gone to waste. He looks at the new diamond he pulled from his component pouch, and mutters the single word "SandÄ" and pours his inner energy into the diamond. He closes his eyes in hope, but opens them just as quickly to see the pool of yellow energy in his palm. The excitement and glee that appears on his face is gone almost as quickly when Takumi realizes, he doesn't know what to do with it. Looking at his hand, he isn't exactly sure how to proceed, then he recalls his youth. Pinching the diamond, He tosses the glowing ball of 'energy' overhanded at the creature, like he used to do when throwing rocks at Lady Remiraz's clay jugs while lifting pies from old man Dimitr. The glowing yellow energy strikes the creature on the neck, and the strange sensation of something akin to thunder without sound is felt against the half-elfs chest and he knows that the power that he funneled into it was a success. The air around him lifts him slightly, and he floats away from the creature, getting a few more feet of distance away from those teeth where the half elf drops his pack to the ground. He pockets his diamond for easier access the next time he uses this strange new power. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/12/2020 08:18
The hydra throws back its head and begins to wail. A hideous droning noise that drives to the heart of one's head and drowns out all else. It makes the skin crawl and conjures images of a man's greatest fear. The wail only lasts a few moments, but it feels like an eternity, only ending abruptly when the aberration clamps its enormous jaws down on Ryuzuko's armoured torso. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 02/12/2020 09:55

Mike 02/12/2020 15:07

His hands clench around the scroll, and he nearly fumbles as he puts it away to keep from damaging it. While momentary, the image leaves him shaken.
TheOrsini 03/12/2020 06:43
There is a shriek from a dark cave, and then the background seems to soften, and Koide finds herself shivering with a torn kimono. "NO." she yells with her voice from back then. There is blood sprayed everywhere and the horned beast towers over her and smiles. It cocks its head to the side and bares its teeth and in its huge grip it holds her unconscious brother. Red blood tinged strings like a macabre marionette dangle from his clothes. In its deep graggling demon voice, the hairy beast says, "I am waiting." Its glowing blue eyes are all she sees as it begins to disappear - fading into the shadows. She can't find her katana anywhere and she raises her fist instead and incants the elder speech. "Igni!" A burst of flame lashes out at the Oni, but instead of the demon's cries she hears the guttural pain of a different creature, and the vision seems to unveil revealing the monstrosities fleshy head. Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/12/2020 23:04
Reeling from the jaws of the hydra, Ryuzuko holds his odachi high in the air, pulling it back slightly. "Inazuma no kamigami. Teki o taose!" he shouts out with a roar that fills the cavern as his blade glows an ominous blue hue, with small streaks of lightning crackling around it. However, houghts of failure and sorrow fill his mind, "What if we fail... What if I fail... What if we cannot defeat this monster and it slowly rots another village just like this one." Ryuzuko's arms freeze for a second, his face one of fear, his sword still hanging in the air as it glows. Just then, the kitsune, called by Sadao, catches his gaze as it tries to guide his hands to strike true, as the word Beast repeats through his mind. "NO!" he bellows out "I... no WE, will slay this blight, here and now!" the sound of the decree erupts through the cave. His hands re-adjust, gripping his blade tighter, before he sends it crashing down with the crack of lightning. The sword cuts a massive gash in the aberration, blood spewing forth, covering Ryuzuko in a dark red tint. He quickly moves his odachi aside, takes a large breath, and exhales a bone chilling gust of ice towards the creature's faceless mass. The blast hits it's mark however, it does not seem to faze it much. "Strike now, while it is weakened!" he calls to his companions with a snarl. The blue glow and crackling dissipate from his odachi as he takes a defensive stance yet again, frost flowing from his mouth. (edited)
Mike 04/12/2020 02:26
Sadao, still disturbed by what he saw, doesn't join the offensive. A primal instinct of fear kept him from approaching his allies near the creature to heal them, and he didn't trust his shaky hand with a bow. Instead, he remains on his guard where he is, ready to duck or roll away if threatened.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 04/12/2020 05:59
The hydra's piercing wail gives way to a lone gull squawking overheard on the rocky shores south of Higashiko. A Rajani man wanders upon some wreckage that has washed ashore. He recognizes broken pieces of the figurehead, a maiden surrounded by snowy clouds, marking this as the remains of the fishing ship Yukigumo. He pushes through the debris with his axe, looking for any signs of the crew, but there are no hint of life - or death. He picks up a small chunk of debris and flings it out into the water, staring past the ripples where it landed. Out of the corner of his eye, he catches a flutter of something further down the shore. His keen eyes catch the flapping of some torn cloth in the sea breeze. He slowly approaches, but his steps soon waver as he begins to recognize the familiar dress of the unmoving figure. "Hanikoâ€¦," his dry throat manages to utter - as the last of his hope fades awayâ€¦ Enraged by the vision that the creature placed in his mind, Viraj swings with all his strength, but tear-filled eyes blind him and his misses widely. He then just punches out in frustration. However, the barbs protruding from his fist just skitter across its thick hide. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 04/12/2020 06:36
Takumi screams with wild abandon at the images running through his mind.  His father is gone, Hestia is gone, his hands mangled by the beast before him.  Did that thing kill the people he loved? He can't seem to remember... When did they die?  How did they die?  The fog in his memory clouds his vision.  He doesn't see his companions fighting the creature before him.  He knows that this snake must die. The air around him grows cold as he releases his desperation outward.  The half-elf doesn't see his friends.  Snow begins lightly falling over him, he uses that energy and sends it towards the swaying head before him.  Ryu appears his sword cutting deep into the creature. The spray of blood and the frosted air... Takumi remembers where he is, he sees those around him fighting, but the power is ready to be unleashed.  He quickly changes the orientation of his power trying to hit as few of his companions as possible, knowing at least one of them will be caught up in the incoming storm.  He can't get it away from Ryu, the hardened snow pelting the head of the beast, catches the dragonborn as well. "My apologies, Ryu!!" Takumi shouts to the new acquaintance.  Hoping that the large fellow won't hold this against him. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/12/2020 11:02
The false hydra thrashes and struggles and tosses its neck as the warriors surrounding the monster hack and slash and conjure. Ryuzuko's mighty blow finally draws a gush of thick, black ooze from the creature's flesh and, with its blood shed, the hydra goes wild. A blood-curdling howl erupts from the thrown-back head and all around the hideous aberration the ground begins to shake and undulate. Moments later rocks are thrown in all directions as the monster finally frees its foul bloated body from within. Sitting crumpled in the middle of what is now a crater below where the battle has been taking place, the bizarre, grey sack of guts is obviously scorched and wounded from the earlier explosion.
TheOrsini 05/12/2020 09:38
Already planning to strike the head off its base with her katana, Koide use both hands and prepares to make a heavy strike. While her companions distracted the creature, she prepared the dance in her head, when beast knocked about sections of rock and stone. Its huge flailing form shoving her to the cavern floor. It hurt, but the pain of the burns remain abated, so she rapid shifted her body weight to swing up to her feet. But before she can recenter, she lands in a pile of the loose debris and is unable to find purchase. It slides from under feet sending her sailing back to the rocky floor. The impact fills Koide's sight with a red tinge as a sharp wave of pain envelops her body. Her vision clears after a moment, before she realizes that the abominations fleshy trunk seems to twist from her flailing motion as it if had undead eyes in its grotesque head. It rears back and wads of flesh peel away from it as teeth emerge to snap down on her neck. She manages to interpose the blade in the split second before the strike, which probably saved herself the painless death. 'No, she would go down screaming.' And then the scream in her throat broke, the chewing motion of the teeth, its release from lifting her a foot into the air and the fall to the ground, she didn't feel. There was blackness, a lack of pain, it was almost relaxing. The others see Koide's near-lifeless body, broken and bleeding, and the creature's maw puzzling out a new addition tangled in its teeth. The katana finally gives free of the pressure of the interweaving teeth, clattering to the ground, but her pendent from around her neck seems to frustrate the creature. (edited)
Cel 05/12/2020 18:28
Seeing Koide at the mercy of the creature, Aralynn comes to the realization that she has to approach the false hydra, putting herself in further danger. Her years of training kicking in, she pushes aside her fears and rushes forwards, praying all the while that both she and Koide will survive the next few seconds. As soon as she reaches her target, she tries her best to ignore the creature as she momentarily bathes Koide's injuries in a warm healing light. Sighing in relief after the fact, dread fills her as she looks up at the hydra's maw but a few feet away. "Not again!" She yells, gathering whatever scraps of courage she has left, and the very next moment she disappears in a blast of ice and cold, which fills the air around the false hydra, creating an oppressing sense of cold and despair. "Its over, just lay down and die already!" She yells at the creature, having reappeared 30 feet away at her original location.

The massive blade rests behind him, ready to strike.
22:43
  • Ryuzuko takes one final breath before his eyes shoot open, glaring into the aberrationâ€™s eyeless, grotesque face and the wound inflicted by Takumi. "Inazuma no kamigami. Teki o taose!!" he shouts, with an almost draconic voice, a final time, his arms, legs, and torso moving in unison, as his odachi glowing ever brighter, lightning coursing through the steel blade. Too tired to move out of the way, it crushes Ryuzuko underneath it. â€Is...it dead?â€ he yells from below the corpse, his sword still wedged into the dead aberrationâ€™s skull.

Dandiil {Takumi} 06/12/2020 23:41
Takumi, still reeling from the thoughts of loss, isn't ready for the onslaught of rocks, but is able to dodge and bat away some of the smaller ones. The screech from the beast disorients him even further, allowing one of the larger rocks, seemingly a boulder to the half-elf, hits him square in the chest, knocking him on his back. The wind knocked from his lungs, he can't even call out when he sees Lady Koide on the ground, the jaws of the creature hiding her head from him. 'oh no, it's actually happening, this can't be happening' He watches helplessly as Aralynn runs to her side, and a moment later, Lady Koide's breathing seems to have stabilized. The half-elf is still struggling to breath as he sees Ryu who seems to be flying as his blade enters the neck of the beast, only to fall under the weight of the severed head. Takumi is finally able to stand, the adrenaline and pain keeping him alert. The beast doesn't seem to be moving, when Viraj moves to help the dragonborn to his feet. Takumi, still a little breathless, mutters "FuyÅsuru" and the head lifts a little from the ground to help Ryu escape his trap. The axe of Viraj strikes the head without reaction from the beast, and Takumi knows it's finally over. A wave of relief comes over him and he drops to his knees, exhausted and sore... (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 06/12/2020 23:47
"Thank you, Viraj and Takumi. Definitely do not want to be under that anymore." a glint of pulsing, oozing, flesh catches Ryuz's eye in the crater. "We might want to deal with that. Viraj, care to ooblige?" he says to the druid before walking towards the crater. He opens up both of his oil flasks from a pouch, pops the corks, and begins to spread oil all over the bulbous mass. He fires off a small bolt of lightning at one end, pointing to the other for Viraj to light the other. (edited)
TheOrsini 07/12/2020 02:20
Koide's leg stirs slowly and full of pain. That was her reality, her head aches from the combat and adrenaline fading. Her eyes are open but without the distraction of the creature looming over her, her mind runs the past few moments of her life over and over in her head. The bite. The fall. The blackness. She is not dead, and she can move, but Koide doesn't want to. She hears the end of the battle around her even with the blood drums thudding in her ears and the ringing. She coughs a residium of blood blowing free of her airway as she turns her head towards the others. She starts to say something to the others, but she already knows. She had tried to call out for help earlier when she had regained consciousness, and gotten nothing. She had felt the blood piling up in the back of her throat and considered just letting it drown her in her sorrow, but, no, she had life. The sensei had warned of despair... but the lecture felt hollow in this time and place. So she just lay there breathing, coughing, and sobbing quietly. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/12/2020 02:32
As the hydra's mass of gooey flesh burns, the sounds of battle fading from his mind, Ryuzuko turns to see his friend, Koide, sobbing. He walks over, handing her his last healing potion, "This should dull the pain at least, my friend," he says with a hand on her shoulder. "If you require help up, or out of this place, I'm here to aid or provide an arm to lean on, whatever you require." he speaks sorrowfully, but with a modicum of hope in it. (edited)
TheOrsini 07/12/2020 02:34
She looks at the potion with glassy dead eyes, the tears streaming down the side of her face, but she doesn't move to take it from him. Her expression doesn't change. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/12/2020 02:40
He puts the potion in her hand, closing it over. "Take it when you are ready." then Ryuz goes back to insure the mass of flesh is destroyed.
TheOrsini 07/12/2020 02:40
She longs to thank the dragonborn, but her mouth quivers afraid to confirm her fear.
Dandiil {Takumi} 07/12/2020 02:48
Takumi looks up at Ryu's approach, still fearful of the snowball aftermath, and sees him stop at Koide. When Ryu walks away, The half elf brings himself to stand up and walk over to his friend. Seeing her like this is devastating. 'if someone as strong as she is can break like this...' He gets down and speaks quietly to her... "Stand up Lady Koide... You are one of the strongest people that I know. Overcoming impossible obstacles without complaint is something that I've seen you do on many occasions." He puts his quarterstaff in front of her. "Here, lean on the staff and get moving under your own power... It's what you do. The monster is dead. The people are saved. So smile and rise, and as you say... 'You need to be ready to fight again.' Come on." Takumi stands up... "Let's get out of this dark place" (edited)
TheOrsini 07/12/2020 03:19
Koide tries for a deeper breath, and coughs dust and blood, she turns to her side. 'He's right.' She thought. 'Takumi had grown a lot over his time with her. He wasn't that clever urchin any more.' The thought crept a moment of non-misery, not enough to bring a smile to her face, but the faint ray of light peaked through the clouds momentarily. She spit a little of the iron flavor from her mouth, and drinks the potion. It has a sugary sweet taste that covers up the bitter ingredient she knew where probably in it. She looks a Takumi, and gives a half smile. Koide notices the healing and tries to speak anyway, 'I'll be fine.', but only ragged scrapings of air come out. She exhales in frustration and another tear rolls. Her mouth curling into a frown. All of the energy she had used to build her spirits dies in the light of reality, and she lets herself outstretched hand drop to the ground, the uncorked bottle rolling away, and her head rests on the ground in the growing pile of blood from the creature. She had to think, but the misery choked out all the thoughts. (edited)
TheOrsini 07/12/2020 08:24
She watches the dancing flame spirit as it throws small gouts of healing flame toward her companions that come near. Koide could feel her body mending and the strength returning, but it was her spirit that was broken. She would never speak again; never be able to tell someone she loved them, never banter wits with a fool, never cast her magic again. 'Why is there all this fear and doubt?' She gingerly draws her hand to her neck and feels for the torn flesh, but it is solid and whole, just some smearing of blood from the old wounds. And then she remembered, the necklace. She looks about for it. There is a renewed urgency. In the shadows of the cave, there is the red glow of eyes. 'Was it there or just touching her mind?' It had that connection with her. The Oni could shape her thoughts without that pendant. She flipped on to her all fours and began crawling past Takumi and toward the mouth. It had gotten the pendant before, she remembered. Where was it?!! She frantically tries to motion around her neck to everyone and points toward the hydras limp form. (edited)
Mike 07/12/2020 09:25
Sadao flinches as the hydra lurches forward once more, only to hear Ryu's yell and the sound of flesh being pierced... the hydra's. As it collapses, he lets out a triumphant shout. "Great job, Ryu!" He triesâ€”unsuccessfully, but it was the thought that counted, surelyâ€”to lift the head off of his dragonborn friend, until it is lifted with an updraft from Takumi's direction. The abomination is felled, and we made it happen. And we lived! His father and ancestors would surely be proud. His smile disappears when he remembers Koide's wound. Though her breathing had evened out just before the hydra fell, that had been a lot of blood. He takes a couple of steps back towards her prone form, thinking to reassure her, only to hear her wretched coughing, and... sobbing. He doesn't come closer. The others were doing fine looking after her. Ryu gave her a healing potion, while Viraj warmed them with healing flames. Seeing Takumi kneel to speak to her, he feels a lump in his stomach. It truly started to dawn on himâ€”he didn't know how long Takumi had traveled with her before he joined up with them. Doesn't matter. Longer than with me. He felt an immense regret, coupled with embarrassment. He had been tenfold the presumptuous fool he'd thought of himself, singing her that love song earlier. And then he pushed, and kept pushing for her and the others to finish the hydra here and now, while knowing he'd be relying on them to do the direct fighting. Brought her right to the thing that stole her voice away. Meanwhile, there was hardly a scratch on him. Idiot. He nods, at no one in particular, as the hydra's remains burn, and sits away from the group, looking down in contemplation. He only looks over when Koide seemed to stir, miming something about the hydra, and her throat. He looks away, not out of neglect, but sheer guilt. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 07/12/2020 09:32
The bulbous, amorphous, grey mass of the false hydra's strange body lies throbbing unpleasantly at the bottom of the crater. Sparks from Ryu's magical discharge wrack the fleshy lump, igniting the oil that the dragonborn has doused the monster with and filling the dark tunnel with shadows cast by the dancing flames. A keening hiss, like the piping of a kettle, fills the air as the aberration is slowly consumed by cleansing fire.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 07/12/2020 16:35
Viraj howls in delight as Ryuzuko fells the monster, but then quickly rushes to his aid when the head falls atop the exhausted paladin. "Let's go, now... What's the point of getting so strong if cant lift half a monster's head off of you..?" He jests while pulling the dragonborn to his feet.
"We might want to deal with that. Viraj, care to oblige?" he says to the druid before walking towards the crater. He opens up both of his oil flasks from a pouch, pops the corks, and begins to spread oil all over the bulbous mass. He fires off a small bolt of lightning at one end, pointing to the crater.
The druid gives a nod and begins to pummel the remains of the creature with his own fire bolts. Satisfied with the results, he joins the group. "Can we all manage the climb back out?" (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/12/2020 21:20
Ryuzuko, satisfied that the gray mass is destroyed, walks back over to Koide, pulling his healer's kit out to tend to her wounds. He tries to help her, but his hands are far to large for the delicate wound, still wearing his gauntlets. Frustrated, he hands the kit to Aralynn, "Hopefully you can do better, cleric." he says as he goes to pick his shield off the ground. "I'm good to go Viraj, I'll be hanging in back to help anyone who struggles." he says to the druid. (edited)
Cel 07/12/2020 22:25
Having mostly stayed still since the fight ended, staring at the destroyed creature, Aralynn snaps out of her trance as her name is mentioned. "I've healed worse, this should be no different." Kneeling next to Koide, she places the healers kit on the ground and takes a minute to carefully bandage and clean the wound. "Lets hope we don't meet any more monsters before this heals." She then stands up and returns the kit to Ryuzuko.
TheOrsini 08/12/2020 01:25
Koide struggles from Ryu's healing but between the dragonborn and the elf, they bandage a few of her wounds and clean some of the blood off of her. She tries to make them understand by indicating her neck and putting an object around it. She snaps her finger at Takumi, hoping to remind him of the necklace she is always wearing, once she makes the motions, she then points urgently at the hydra's neck stalk and then her teeth. The entire time she see out of the corner of her eye the red eyes in shadow and a growing disembodied smile. She regretted not tell him of its importance all these years. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 08/12/2020 01:58
Takumi grabs his pack, and walks back over to the area where she is being tended. Not quite understanding the hand motions that she is trying to convey, "Yes ma'am, they are obviously trying as hard as they can to heal you. You want a tooth... Uh, Ryu. I think she's saying she wants a tooth... I'm not exactly suited, and I don't have the tools for that kind of work." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/12/2020 06:31
"Hm?" the ronin turns to Takumi, then to Koide as she is pointing at her chest. "Oh... your pendent is gone, Koide?" then looks to the hydra's lifeless head, "It got snagged when it bit you." he reasons that to be the case. Ryuzuko walks over to the hydra and begins to dig through it's maw, searching for her pendent. After a through search, he finds it under it's mass of tentacles that formed its tongue. "Found it" The dragonborn takes his water flask out and poors some on the pendent, washing it off of the black oozing blood. He walks back over to the wounded and distressed Koide, draping the pendent over her head. "Here you go, Koide." (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 08/12/2020 06:38
Viraj walks over to the head and eyes the gaping maw of the severed head, ready to oblige with the request of a trophy. Rubbing his hands together, he takes up his weapon again this time flipping it around to the blunt end. As he draws it back in an attempt to crush the creature's jaw, he pauses overhearing Ryuzuko. He lets the dragonborn do his investigation. "Hmm. Okay...," the man waits for Ryuzuko to return the necklace to Koide. "I'll take a prize for myself!" He brings the hammer down on the head. (edited)
TheOrsini 08/12/2020 06:59
Koide's reddened eyes show fatigue, but she bows in gratitude, taking the necklace from Ryu. She puts the ward on, and the eyes and teeth vanish, but an echoing laugh diminishes in the back of her mind. 'So it is looking...' The only way for it to react so quickly revealed its intent. But she would be safe for now. They would need to move on soon, but the group already had that in mind. It didn't cloud out all the negative thoughts, but they were much more manageable.
Dandiil {Takumi} 08/12/2020 08:24
"ohhh, the necklace..." Takumi realizes in embarrassment how he would forget about such a thing... "I don't think I've ever seen you not wearing it." His face reddens even further as he notices the condition of Lady Koide's clothing. The half elf averts his eyes quickly and goes digging into his pack, coming up with one of his blue costume tunics. He holds it behind him, trying hard not to look in that direction. "Um... Here"
TheOrsini 08/12/2020 08:31
Koide slips the tunic over her clothes. It is loose but it helps gain some modesty back for the trip to the surface. Satisified, she smirks at Takumi, and sighs. She taps him on the shoulder, and when they make eye contact again, she gives a weak smile and a nod of appreciation. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/12/2020 10:23
The unpleasant hiss of boiling fat continues to keen through the tunnel and the air is laden with the foul scent of burning flesh. (edited)
TheOrsini 08/12/2020 10:45
With the smell growing, Koide stumbles over to her katana lying on the ground. Seeing no cloth to clean it from etching, she flicks as much of the blood free of the blade and begins walking for the exit with it cradle in her arms. She looks back to the others and leans her head to the side, as if to say 'Let's go.' Not waiting for a response she begins the walk up the dark tunnel. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/12/2020 10:50
Ryuzuko did not mind the smell as much as the others. He was used to the smell of the dead and dying while purging undead filled cemeteries and catacombs. But he realized that the others would start to gag and suffocate soon. He gives up his search of the area, following behind Koide, ready to aid her if need be. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 08/12/2020 11:10
Takumi collects his staff, having already considered that Koide would refuse to use it. As he leaves the tunnel, he thinks of taking one last look at the creature, but chooses to avoid anymore coughing. It seems like days since he's had any sleep, but knows it couldn't have been much longer than normal. Fresh air would be nice too. He follows the group up the tunnel, wondering whether he should have taken this trip. The thoughts that were implanted in his mind by the... By the... By what? The thoughts of losing his father and dearest friend are still fresh in his mind. He sees Lady Koide up ahead wearing one of his shirts, the scars visible on the neck. When did that happen? Something is messing with his head. Could it be illusion? When did she get those? Why am I climbing up a tunnel? What is going on? 'I'll ask when we stop.' He looks up again and sees the familiar stride of Koide in pain, but hiding it. 'I must have missed a fight... But why do I feel drained?' Takumi's mind kept returning to the thoughts of the death of his family as he makes his way up the tunnel. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/12/2020 11:58
As the bloodied and beaten, but victorious, band of warriors approach the surface, a wave of psychic energy floods up from behind them. A howling telepathic scream echoes through each person's mind, reminiscent of the hydra's wailing moan that left them clutching at their heads in the midst of battle. However, this time the 'sound' feels somehow weakened and pained, rather than loaded with rage and fury. Slowly, the psychic emanation dies away, until there is nothing left, and in its wake a scrambled jumble of suppressed memories wells up inside each and every one of Koide's band of monster hunters. Memories that the false hydra's song has smoothed over and convinced not to exist. Memories of the receptionist at the town hall and Dandong's dilapidated buildings. Memories of the barman of the Shuishou Xiyue and the captain of the Kitakaze Maru. Memories of Tanpo, their faithful valet who lugged Koide's chest around after her wherever she went.
Mike 08/12/2020 20:06
Before he follows the others out, Sadao lingers in the underground chamber. Drawing his bÅ, he looks over the weapon. He remembers when he'd chosen it amongst other, more lethal options, back when he began his training. At that time, he believed that adhering to his role as a peacekeeper meant that he had no need of edged weapons. But now, after surviving this encounter, he had learned: there are some things that do need to be hurt, or even killed, for the sake of others. After all, an aberration couldn't peacefully coexist with mortals. He raises the staff and pauses for a moment, before planting it in the ground, overlooking the still-burning corpse. Offering a short prayer of farewell, he turns to leave. Now I need a blade.
TheOrsini 09/12/2020 09:32
Koide's memories of now the dead members of her party and those that were before her but lost in memory strike the numbness of an exhausted, emotionally drained, near-broken woman. She sighs almost apathetically. She then remembered Sensei Tsuneuji's words in the reeds of sugar cane fields, "What does not break us, only makes us stronger. For we may bend if we choose. Only you can decide to be broken, child." While not exact, the lesson was important one. Given rest and enough time, she would rise above even this. 'Rest,' she thought, with an almost joyful smile creeping on her face... 'and tea.' She would have laughed had her vocal chords allowed it, but she didn't care. 'Tanpo would approve.' (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 09/12/2020 21:30
Takumi quickly covers his ears when the wail hits him, but with no results. The mournful cry seems to echo within his skull. Lost memories of his other companions fill his mind along with fight after fight with this creature, 'the false hydra.' Memories of Tanpo, the young man that followed Lady Koide around like a lost puppy, constantly trying to find ways to help. He even offered to carry Takumi's bag on several occasions in the past. Tanpo was a good guy... And was especially adept at making tea... Tanpo always made the best tea. As the surface approaches, Takumi can only think about one... No, two things... 'Fresh air, and a bed.' He knows, now, why he felt so exhausted, "Today was a long day" he says out loud to noone in particular. A sense of relief comes with the waft of air coming down the tunnel, momentarily replacing the smell of burning flesh.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/12/2020 22:54
Viraj grabs the largest tooth that's still in one piece that he managed to knock loose. He gives the carcass one more kick for good measure before turning to follow the group out. Hearing the wail, the druid immediately turns around to expect the monster to be bearing down on them. However, the flood of memories eases Viraj's worries. He remembers wanting to say something to that receptionist in the magister's hall. Tanpo... Shaking his head in regret, he silently curses himself. He was always a bit too hard on the valet, with his teasing about when he's going to pick up a sword and join the fight. But he couldn't fault the servant for his faithfulness to his mistress and his desire to help. "Yes it was," Viraj replies to Takumi. "And one that we all can see the end of is a good one." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/12/2020 12:09
After several minutes of clambering back up towards the surface through the maze of tunnels that the hydra has burrowed out beneath Dandong, the glistening silver of moonlight falling through the holes in the roof of the town hall can finally be made out in the distance. Light at the end of tunnel in the truest sense of the word. The night air is cold, but fresh in burning lungs. Now, for the first time, the six companions see the town truly free of the veil of the hydra's song. Damaged and wounded, but alive.
TheOrsini 11/12/2020 05:34
Reaching the open air, Koide finally notices a torn clothesline with discarded clothes near one of the unlit homes. She pulls a shirt off the ground, shaking the dust and debris from it, and cleans her blade of the hydra's remaining blood. She eyes it in the moonlight and then slides it into her sheathe, letting the shirt blow away in a gust of wind. She could feel the chill on her skin, almost like a cold burning, but it was nice, aside from the icy touches where her clothes no longer gave her coverage. She adjusts Takumi's tunic to give her some better windbreaking. Koide probably would have said something inspirational, in the normal circumstances, but that wasn't on her mind. No, she had taken the time to think about the situation, about mistakes in the battle, and she had made the realization that she may need to be replaced on this writ, or at the very least aided with it while she recovered. 'Hmm, maybe I should write Lyrel.' she considered.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 11/12/2020 08:53
As the party emerges from the tunnel burrowed by the hydra, the full extent of the destruction is shown to them. Windows shattered, carts overturned, tables and chairs thrown about in all directions, puddles and streaks of dried blood found everywhere. Some buildings feature large round holes in them, others almost completely destroyed. "This...this town will never be the same." Ryuz says sorrowfully. "We may have put an end to it's terror, but many, many lives were lost before we could." He looks towards the beaten and battered Koide, "Let's find a place to lodge for awhile, maybe there is an inn, and an innkeeper, still intact here". Ryuz begins to wade through the rubble, moving debris to the side to clear a path.
TheOrsini 11/12/2020 09:03
Ryuzuko was reading her mind. She almost started to retort about how it would at least have the chance to rebuild, but he wasn't saying the effort was a waste, and she didn't have the words to express such an ideal. Koide pushes aside a destroyed cart wheel, and set her path behind the dragonborn's scaly wagging tail.
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/12/2020 21:21
The Jinjiang inn is near the centre of Dandong and clearly marked by the sign that hangs from only one of its two hinges, creaking softly as it sways in the night time wind. The interior is dilapidated, like many of the other nearby buildings, but will suffice for shelter.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 11/12/2020 23:13
Viraj doesn't wait for anyone else. He marches into the rundown inn and immediately busies himself with the task of making a fire. Finding pieces of wood from what appears to be from one of the dining room tables and some chairs, he breaks down the larger pieces with his handaxe and stacks them neatly in the hearth. He then shaves down one small boards into ribbons for kindling and retrieves the steel and flint from his pack. With a few deft strokes sparks fly from the steel and the tinder is aflame. A few moments later a cozy fire is blazing. The process seems to have brought some calm to Viraj. The man lets out a breath to release some of the stress from the night's events. "Good to practice," he says as he rubs his hands over the fireplace. "You never know when you'll be without... other methods." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 11/12/2020 23:30
Being from the far southern reaches of Je'dahn, Ryuzuko enjoys the cold breeze of the night air. He finds a sturdy enough chair and plants it outside the inn with a small table, peering out to the remains of Dandong as his allies rest for the night. He begins to take off the larger parts of his armor, leaving just his undercloth, leaning his pack against the outside wall. His kabuto shines in the moonlit night, what parts are not covered in black blood. "I need to get this cleaned," he thinks to himself as he takes his odachi, throws the sling around his back, and proceeds to leave the porch of the inn in search of a bucket and clean water. "I'll be back, going to look for water to clean my armor with." he yells back inside the inn to his companions. (edited)
TheOrsini 12/12/2020 05:42
Koide knew she needed a bath too, there was blood and ichor from the creature still clinging to her hair and neck, not to mention her own contributions smeared over her body. It would risk disease if she put it off, so despite her fatigue, she follows along with the dragonborn without disarming herself. It was curious for her to see Ryuz go to such ease. 'There could be bandits taking advantage of the town.' While they weren't likely a threat to him, it might be something she could justify taking out her frustrations upon.
Mike 12/12/2020 06:12
Sadao follows the group to the inn, but lingers around the doorway. He doesn't feel ready to keep still quite yet. He looks among them for a few minutes, before speaking up. "I should go tell the townspeople hiding outside the town the threat is over... and maybe make sure there aren't any stragglers stumbling around in a haze. If anyone feels like coming along, that's uh, fine by me." He starts to leave, and do exactly that.
Dandiil {Takumi} 12/12/2020 06:25
Takumi walks into the inn, and out of habit, goes to looking around. He makes his way to the kitchen, finding a pretty well stocked pantry. Using some of the drinking water, he cleans off a dusty countertop and places some of the fresher foods on the counter. His hunger is currently overpowering his exhaustion so he continues on, snacking as he works. He knows that he isn't much of a cook, but the foods that are before him are similar to the foods that he gets at home. He slices the salted meat into strips and drops it into a cast iron pot that he just wiped out. What few vegetables and tubers he finds also get diced and tossed into the pot. Using some of the drinking water, he covers the ingredients and walks it out to Viraj, "Found some food, threw it together for a stew. I'm going to fill a bath or two while it's cooking." The half elf hangs the pot in the hearth to cook. The smell makes it obvious that Takumi didn't add any additional seasonings to the mix. Finding a couple of usable buckets among the destroyed ones, Takumi walks out into the chill night air to the well and begins filling them, walking them to the bath tubs. Luckily, the bath room doesn't have any major damage. After enough trips to fill one of the large tubs, his arms begin to feel like jello, but he forces himself to fill the second tub. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/12/2020 16:53
Viraj gives the stew a sniff and doesn't seem to mind the lack of flavoring. "That'll do, he replies to Takumi indicating the half-elf's effort for a meal. "Let me know if you need that bath heated up." He continues to sit by the warmth of the fire and gives the stewpot an occasional stir. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/12/2020 07:02
After a short while, Ryuzuko reaches the market square, where a large fountain is located. He notices Koide following close behind him, "Mind helping me find a bucket for some water to clean our gear?" With the aide of the, now mute, Koide, they turn over a cart which had been flipped over, most likely during the mass mind control of the townsfolk hours earlier, finding an undamaged bucket underneath. "Ok, let's get some water, then head back to the inn, Koide." he says towards the small girl before he fills the bucket full of water and walks back towards the inn they are holed up in for the night. (edited)
TheOrsini 17/12/2020 07:15
Despite the urge to talk while they searched for a bucket, Koide got the feeling that the dragonborn didn't really need her. They found the bucket together in the market square, but besides getting water and getting back to the inn, it seemed very uneventful. The quiet of the town; the lack of the creature's mesmerizing song in the back of her mind. And now the silence of her voice, its left her frustrated. If it weren't for the crunch of the road and the Ryuz's sparse comments, she could have easily believed she had become deaf as well. She vainly cast one her signs in frustration. At its fully strength, Aard could shoved the broken down cart debris, but it was just another moment off silence as well. Koide was sure that the dragonborn didn't even notice her motions behind him. She thought on this as she followed after the water bearer and back to the inn. Sleep was calling but she needed to attend to herself before answering. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/12/2020 15:39
As Sadao approaches the edge of town, he can see many of the townsfolk starting to cautiously wander back in amongst the buildings. Something has clearly given them reason to believe that it might be safe to return.
Mike 17/12/2020 19:17
Sadao joins the people, and begins helping where he canâ€”ensuring they have access to food and water, clearing out areas for those now without homes to take shelter in, and the like. Working into the night, he is exhausted by the time he leaves to sleep in the inn, but in a pleasant, satisfied way.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/12/2020 19:41
Ryuz returns to the inn with Koide, bucket in tow. He sets it down by his gear before searching for some torn rags laying around. Once he finds a few, he begins work cleaning the blood off his weapons and armor. This takes a little over an hour, before he is satisfied that it will not rust. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 17/12/2020 20:11
Takumi just finished filling the second bath as the pair returns. He dishes himself a plate of stew. He turns to Viraj, allowing his meal to cool. He hands him a piece of bread. "I will take you up on your offer to heat the baths, I filled two tubs." The half elf smiles and calls out for the rest of the group to hear. "Stew's done, come and get it!" He spoons the bowl, blowing a little cool air over it and puts the spoon into his mouth, followed by a bite of bread. "It's not the worst I've made" After a meal and warm bath, Takumi finds a bed. His dreams are frightening, but not overwhelming. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/12/2020 22:33
"If we can procure a cart in the morning, I can provide the needed pack animal for it." Ryuz says to the group, having come in to eat, his cleaned gear now leaning against around the doorway of the inn. "We also should try and find the closest this town has to leadership that is left. So we may inform them of the many things we have found about the destruction of this area." "That was well needed, thank Takumi," the dragonborn says to the small half-elf before heading back outside to move the chair he was using inside the inn just by the entrance, where he posts up for the night. (edited)
TheOrsini 17/12/2020 23:25
Koide is frustrated by not being able to participate in the planning, so she enjoys her stew in silence. She motions when Takumi's gaze passes to her, by raising her bowl and smiling with a nod to say that its good before finishing the bowl. She motions about using one of the baths, the grit and blood in her hair and clothes.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 19/12/2020 00:58
"Water should be nice and hot for you when you're ready." Viraj announces as he emerges from the hallway leading to the washrooms. He grabs a bowl of the stew and takes a place near the fire to enjoy the meal.
TheOrsini 20/12/2020 03:18
Koide takes Viraj's words as an invitation. She sets her empty bowl to the side, and gives a slight bow to the druid. She leaves them to their conversations and relaxation in order to try to bathe in privacy. She closes the door behind her when she enters the room with the steaming tubs. She discards the soiled clothes, looking at one of the large towels in a stack laid out on the shelf. Koide lifts one of the smaller wash rags and gingerly tests the water. It is almost too hot for her. There are moments where the heat seems to ignite the burning sensation across her body, but she resists the urge and slips into the water. The heat burns at her, and even another tear is forced from her eye involuntarily, but she slowly draws the wash cloth across her skin with the soap attempting to clean off the creature's Yuck. She peels a blood glued fragment of the abomination's skin off her leg. Despite the pain, the discarded flesh makes her scrub furiously at the spot. In the span of ten minutes, the water is so befouled that it doesn't aide in cleaning. She stands from the mire, and using a ladle from the other tub she spoons fresh clean water atop her in a shower to remove the remaining residue. Soon she is enveloping herself in the towel, enjoying its warm clean embrace. She eyes Takumi's tunic laying in the pile on the floor, but the fatigue eats at her resolve. She could clean it in the morning. She waves to the group in passing as she heads for one of the unoccupied rooms. It is only a formality of her head hitting the rough flax pillow before sleep overtakes her. (edited)
Mike 20/12/2020 08:14
As Sadao returns, he sees Ryu in his chair, keeping watch. "The villagers are returning to normal. Whatever haze the hydra had them in is dispelled, I'm glad to say." He gives the dragonborn a weary smile, and passes him by with a friendly pat on his way inside. He finds the stew and eats in relative silence, before picking a rundown room to call his own for the night. Before he finally beds down, he sits on the bed, legs crossed, and pulls out the gilded Huiya Scroll. Opening it to reveal a seemingly blank inside, he places it on the bed, and finds the quill and ink he and the others had used earlier that day, in the library. He thinks of the magister as he does so, and his last words; ones of gratitude, if he hadn't been mistaken. Setting all of these things in front of him on the bed, he closes his eyes and exhales, running through the rest of the day's events in his mind. The hydra's will to hide itself from sight. The words of the departed. These things left a great impact on him. Though his father was not here to tell him so, he would undoubtedly consider slaying the hydra a feat worthy of record in the scroll... to say nothing of the toll it had taken. Opening his eyes, he takes up the quill and begins to write: the tale of the false hydra, the phantom pain it had wrought upon the town of Dandong, and the bravery of his friends as they put an end to the aberration which threatened the mortal realm so. Having finally added his own entry to the numerous others that resided within the scroll, Sadao watches as the words fade away, absorbed into the parchment for the benefit of his ancestors and generations yet untold. He'd made one major accomplishment, but there was still the matter of his mother. All at once, he feels incredibly tired. He puts the materials and scroll away carefully, before falling into a deep sleep.
Cel 20/12/2020 21:58
Staying mostly silent up to this point, Aralynn takes more time to look over and tend to her wounds, especially making sure the teeth marks on her shoulder don't get infected, no longer having the danger of the Hydra limiting her work. Finding a seat with the group, or at least close enough to hear their future plans, she goes over the events of the day in her mind, unable to shake the terror and paranoia brought to her by the monstrosity, no matter how confident her allies seem that it has been destroyed. This slowly brought her into a trance, mindlessly cleaning the same wound before the pain in her shoulder brings her back to reality in time to see that she was alone. "If this creature is still alive after all of our efforts, how can we hope to stop it like this, was my training not enough?" Amulet in hand, Aralynn spends the night in feverish prayer, seeking further strength for the challenges to come.
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/12/2020 22:55
The next morning, the band of heroes awake to find that a small crowd of the returned townsfolk has gathered outside the Jinjiang inn. They appear to be waiting for something or someone. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/12/2020 05:27
At the coming of dawn, Ryuzuko, who has been resting by the entrance to the inn, senses the presence of many people nearby. He takes a look out the half broken window and sees the townsfolk gathering outside. "I should wake Sadao." he says aloud himself as he gets up from the chair, stretching his arms and cracking his neck on his way to where the bard is sleeping. When he gets to Sadao's room, Ryuz nudges the man with his scaly fist. "Hey, Sadao, we have company outside, we're in need of your tongue." he says to him before going to wake the others. (edited)
Mike 21/12/2020 07:51
Sadao groggily awakens from his deep sleep, letting out a yawn as he stretches out. "Hmnh? Oh, I see. Maybe they need more help. I'll be right down!" The rest has done wonders for his outlook, as he perks up considerably compared to the prior evening. He gives his clothes a quick sniff. With them having passed some olfactory exam of his own design, he gets dressed quickly, and heads to the entrance. Waiting a couple more minutes for the others to arrive, he then steps outside to meet the crowd. "ZÇŽoshang hÇŽo," he says in Honmin, shielding his eyes from the light of the newly uncovered sun. "What's the matter?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/12/2020 15:47
A hush falls over the gathered crowd as Sadao steps out of the building and for the first several moments there is silence but for the whistling of the wind. Those that remain of the people of Dandong stare at the bard with scared faces and wide eyes, until one man steps forward. "What now?" He asks tiredly. "You saved us!" Another shouts. "What do we do?" A woman calls, desperation plain in her voice.
Mike 21/12/2020 20:16
Sadao furrows his brow, realizing what would be necessary to truly finish the job of saving the town. He finds a discarded crate and pushes it over, using it to stand on. As before, he creates a minor illusion of his own voice to address the crowd. Before he speaks, he invites the spirit of an eloquent ancestor into himself, asking to give him its guidance. "Everyone. We've done what we can for you all by purging the aberrant spirit from this town. But there's more that we can't do for you. I see a healthy people remaining here, stronger than any specter that hides in the back of your mind. You can rebuild Dandong under your own power. Look to each other, not us! Stand together!" (edited)
TheOrsini 22/12/2020 13:46
Koide awakens with the numbing pain pushed aside. Her blankets and sheets are bound about her to preserve the warmth. While her skin no longer bears the scarring of the burns, there is a gash of gnarled flesh around her throat. It might not even be seen to someone not looking, but she knows it is there as she runs her fingers over it, finally resting her hand on the necklace. She closes her eyes to think on it. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 22/12/2020 23:10
Ryuzuko comes back down, leaning against the threshold of the doorway. After a time, unable to understand the Honmin tongue, his grabs he shamisen from his pack, sitting down against the wall. He begins to tune the stringed instrument, playing a few notes here and there as Sadao converses with the crowd. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/12/2020 23:50
Sadao's words seem to strike to the heart of the townsfolk's hopes and fears. The people of Dandong love their town, but, looking around, they see only wreck and ruin in the wake of what they have been put through as a community. Neverthless, the bard's motivation is uplifting, inspiring those present to band together and forge a better future. Soon, some of the more assertive survivors begin to take charge, dividing up responsibilities and assigning tasks. Over the course of the morning, it is decided that those who remain must consolidate their living spaces, so that they can more efficiently gather and use what resources can be salvaged from the ruins. The town hall, for many a gruesome reminder of a past forgotten, is eschewed in favour of the north-western district, close to both the docks and some of the more usable plots of farmland. From here, the townsfolk will seek to build anew.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 22/12/2020 23:57
Viraj stirs from his spot in front of the fireplace where he laid his bedroll. He soaks up what warmth he can from the dying embers before slowly getting to his feet. It's mornings like this that remind him that he's nearing fifty. After packing up his gear, he steps out to see the crowd gathered and Sadao explaining things to them. "I will see if I can do more for their farms," he says quietly from behind the bard. He cinches the straps tight on his pack and steps through the crowd. He gives awkward nods, accepting what he assumes to be the gratitude of some of the town's folk. As he begins down the road, he calls back to Sadao, "It will take some time. Expect me back later in the afternoon." The daylight brings to full view the effects the creature had on this town. With their slaying of the false hydra, the ruined state of many of the buildings is no longer hidden. These people didnâ€™t even have a chance â€“ didnâ€™t even know - to fleeâ€¦ like Dada did when his conquerors came. He continues on through the town in quiet reflection. A short time later he finds himself in the farmlands on Dandongâ€™s outskirts. As expected, being the early spring, there is not much growing in the fields. However, the creatureâ€™s influence appears to have been felt out here. Most of the fields seem to be untouched for at least a cycle. He wonders how many of the farmers they managed to free and hopes they will be able to return to provide for their town. Though still feeling the aches from their battle, Viraj feels some new well of power within himself. A feeling which Natsuko had been there to help guide him through as he learned the ways of the druid over the past few years. He recalls one of his Jeâ€™dahnese mentorâ€™s adages: â€œOur flames will destroy, but the ashes bring regrowth.â€ He kneels down, placing his palms in the dirt. With the new font of energy, he urges the plants within the area to grow. (edited)
Cel 23/12/2020 04:38
Stirred by the sound of the crowd outside, Aralynn suddenly snaps out of her feverish prayer. Taking a few moments to gather her thoughts she joins the party, leaning against the wall of the tavern as she watches the bard inspire the crowd, to what seems like a success. Turning to the allies that remain near her, she asks, making sure the crowd is out of earshot, "So we are to leave them to suffer the same fate? No amount of crop growth will protect them from the return of such a creature. If we can be sure whatever likely still plagues this town stays here, we can evacuate the townsfolk and some of them might live." She speaks in a tired but frantic voice, not having shared the comfort the group gained from the death of the monstrosity.
TheOrsini 23/12/2020 05:09
Koide wraps the sheets about her form as she ventures through the common room. She ducks quickly into an ajoining bedroom and notices the dried caking of gore across the walls. There is a rupture in the floorboards from an obvious visit from the creature. Images and memories crowd into her mind, but she pushes them aside. She begins rifling through cupboards and dressers for a rough fitting set of clothes, albeit in the Honmin style. Satisfied with the demanded modesty, she abandons the sheet atop the dresser and returns to the common room. (edited)
Mike 23/12/2020 14:58
Sadao smiles as he sees the people abuzz with more constructive thoughts toward their future. Beacon. I'm doing my best, father... mother. He waves to Viraj as he leaves. Knowing what he did about natural rituals, he knows it will take some time, but the effect would be worth the effort. As he hops down from his soapbox, he narrowly catches wind of Aralynn's conspiratorial whisper. He had to think: Had she always been like this? She had been the one member of the group he'd spent the least time with, and now, with these strange gaps in his memory, it was difficult to remember, which saddened him. He approaches her non-threateningly, trying to remember his lessons in courtly behavior. "Aralynn, I'm sure there's no traces of a threat of that kind remaining. Would you like to join me for a walk around and check, if it'll ease your mind?"
Cel 23/12/2020 17:32
Sadao's words comfort Aralynn momentarily, but she quickly returns to her previous state as the words are repeated and warped in her mind over time. "I appreciate the offer, but considering this creature's influence over minds, it would be very easy for it to cover up its tracks." Glancing beyond the crowd, she continues "I suggest we stick together as much as possible, I will trust the groups decision for our future plan but lets not take unnecessary risks."
Dandiil {Takumi} 23/12/2020 18:14
Takumi sits on the edge of his bed, not wanting to be around people right now. He enjoyed his mornings alone, it allowed him to think and evaluate the events of the days before. He isn't alone anymore, that much is obvious. He sits in silence, listening as the crowd makes their arguments and then their preparations. Why does he feel stronger today? He should be exhausted. Is the adrenaline of the evening conflict still flowing through him? Is it knowing that he has people around him that he can actually count on or are they using him for their own agendas? No... that's not the kind of people that Lady Koide travels with... But then again, he hadn't met any of these folks until they got on the boat. They seemed to fight well together. 'What did I accomplish in that fight? I opened the wound that Ryu was able to finish the monster off, I also hit the dragonborn with a blast of cold... not my best moment. I can do better. I have to do better, Lady Koide almost died.' Takumi's mind continues going over all that the group has been through. The friend they lost, the new camaraderie that's been gained. The effectiveness of the team in combat isn't his specialty... but it seemed to work out, so it can't be that bad. As the crowd starts to disperse, Takumi rises and starts to search the rest of the empty inn, while actively avoiding the rest of the group for another hour or so... 'maybe there's something here that can aid us in the future.' (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/12/2020 18:33
Overhearing Sadao and Aralynn talking, Ryuzuko sets his shamisen to the side as he stands up. The tall dragonborn walks over to the elven girl, laying a hand on her shoulder. "The creature is dead, Aralynn, Viraj and I burned it's disgusting mass to a crisp. We have also regained our memories of this place, both the people and it's destruction. You need not worry about it anymore, go get some of Takumi's leftover stew, sit down, and relax," he says to the girl as heads back inside to see about heating the leftovers up some.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/12/2020 19:22
Ryuzuko see Koide enter the common room, having found new clothes and looking weary. He walks over to her, getting her attention with a slight wave. Laying his hand on her shoulder, he sends bits of divine energy through her. His hands then clap together as he prays for her body's restoration, "There, that should ease the pain and mend some of your scars." He places his scaly hand back on her shoulder, "Try not to push yourself for a while longer, ok?" he finishes with before handing her a bowl of stew, heading off to get his own.
TheOrsini 23/12/2020 22:55
Koide feels a cool chill from the dragonborn's touch, despite his rough scaly claws. She was unsure what his healing could do, but it did something. She raised a hand to her face over one of the burn scars. 'Smooth' That was something at least. She'd have to do something about her hair though. Before she could dive into introspection, Ryuzuko thrust a bowl toward her, and she quickly obliged. She nods in appreciation before walking over to one of the tables to sit and eat. There she would plan what must be done for the day. In the silence of her own mind, thought crept, trying to slash at her resolve. Doubt, misery, pain, failure... they clawed at her like a feral Shyrike. She wanted to hit something with her sword.... 'my sword' She abruptly got up from the table hastily, splashing droplets of the soup. She makes her way to the bathing area.
TheOrsini 24/12/2020 08:19
Its not long before she finds the sword in the same way she had discarded it during her bout of fatigue. And she takes another rag into the cold water, to begin cleaning the saya of debris, she notices the key she hastily tied to the sageo last night. After securing the blade around her abdomen, she tries to heft the tub of dirty wash water she had left, but only manages it about half way before there is a loud crash to the floor. Koide's grip lost due to her struggle from the pain. The tub of soiled water on its side dumped into floor. It soaked the firepit for warming the water and the pile of clothes on the floor. She would be cursing aloud or crying in frustration if she could manage the noise. It was not being able to vent that was so aggravating. 'And Ryuz magic didn't fix it.' She couldn't hold her companion responsible for her mistake. A lesser person might; even now she had the urge to do so, but she would not stoop to faulting him for trying. She had hoped that the sensation she had felt was her body being fully restored though. Koide returns to the common room defeated by the damn water tub... carrying Takumi's soaked tunic as the sign of her failure. She glances around the room, but doesn't see her friend anywhere. 'So much for him magicking it away.' she thought. She ducks back inside the room to grab a bucket. 'Guess, I'll have to do this by hand like a common midwife.' The list of things to be done in the back of her mind grew quickly. It would be difficult adjusting to this new situation. (edited)
TheOrsini 26/12/2020 08:39
Within the quarter hour, Koide had managed to fetch a bucket of clean water and scrub the blood and gore from Takami's tunic. She rebinds a clothesline at the rear of the inn, and lets hang there to dry. She passes through the common room, to spot Takumi perhaps. But without his smiling face, she sighs and moves on to other business. Noticing Ryuz checking his blade edge in one of the seats, she approaches him and tries to add a little weight to her steps as to not surprise him. She reaches to her katana and unties the string with the key attached and holds it up to the dragonborn to get his attention. She lifts her right eyebrow in a question.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/12/2020 22:15
Ryuzuko looks up at the determined girl, some life coming back into her eyes, "Is that the key you got off the magister?" He pauses, hand on his chin in thought "It's going to be difficult to find its use, with the magister dead and all..." He looks to Sadao, "Care to interpret for us on our little search?" asking the man, who was the only member of the group to understand both Je'dahn and Honmin. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 26/12/2020 22:52

More than likely his home since he kept it so close." Takumi continues forward to stand next to Koide, facing the others. "Probably a door or large chest. Definitely something that he warranted needing protecting." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/12/2020 23:02

The sooner the better." he says as he walks outside the inn, leaning against the outside wall while he waits for his companions to finish their preparations.
TheOrsini 27/12/2020 05:32
