The last was a mime of someone being hanged, but she didn't have a better option. She then mimes to Ryuz about struming instrument-speaking-inside-and then a motion of a crashing wave rushing towards them trying to ask if Sadao was coming with them. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 27/12/2020 05:43
Takumi collects his pack from his room, meeting the others outside. Understanding that Koide is conveying the location of his shirt, "oh yeah, thank you." he goes to collect his performance tunic from the line. Using a little magic he dries the still wet shirt and folds it up into his pack. Returning to the front of the tavern, he looks at the town with renewed sorrow for the people that have been through an unimaginable plight. His problems seem small in comparison to what these people have dealt with. How many of them lost loved ones over the last... Year? Husbands, wives, sons, daughters, children... 'I can't imagine what they must be feeling' Having lost a companion, and when the memories returned, the pain that affected the half-elf. The pain of losing family and the sudden flood of that knowledge must be exponentially worse. He returns to the task at hand, making sure that his tools are readily available for the coming searches. "Ok, let's go."
Mike 27/12/2020 06:04
Sadao gives up trying to convince the high-strung elf woman, but doesn't overlook Ryu's request for help. "Sure thing. I'll come with." He turns back to Aralynn and adds, "Just take some time and... relax. As a favor to me, okay?" With a reassuring smile and parting wave, he runs off to get his things from his room, soon joining the assembled group just as they're about to set out. "I'm ready to go, too."
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/12/2020 13:20
The abandoned town hall is an eery reminder of the horrors that the party witnessed the day before. At the back of the library is an open door that leads into an office that presumably belonged the magister. The walls are lined with books and a large writing desk stands in the middle of the room.
TheOrsini 27/12/2020 15:47
Koide begins searching for something the key would fit within the library office. She points to the walls and desk for the others to look about, trying to lead a concerted effort to find the key's lost lover.
Dandiil {Takumi} 27/12/2020 16:35
Takumi searches the floor, lifting rugs, under desks... As he searches, he constantly looks over at the holes around the office. The reminder of what happened to these people keeps his mind off of the search and on the devastation that has been brought to this town. He wants to find the lock as much as anyone, but the distractions are many and overwhelming.
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/12/2020 22:51
Mostly, the room is filled with books. Books on geography. Books on heraldry. Books on history and religion and magic - most of all, magic. A heavy robe hangs on a stand behind the open door, with a ring of iron keys and a coin pouch in its pockets. Everywhere one searches, small fragments of parchment can be found tucked into drawers or between the pages of books with messages like "HELP", "IT'S WATCHING YOU" and "IT'S EATING US". The little brass key fits a hidden compartment that Koide finds in the magister's desk, which contains ten platinum Honmin yuan, a single sheet of parchment with a frame-like watermark of gold lint and a coin-shaped token made of black glass that has been carved with a seven fingered hand. (edited)
TheOrsini 28/12/2020 07:51
This is not what Koide was expecting. She could have probably gain knowledge of other fell beasts from the library's collection. Should she have the time, but some sort of sigil on glass token did not seem of import. It might be worth something. The platinum was interesting though. Perhaps it could be compensation for her party's services, although her dragonborn friend might not see it that way. She pulls the coins out of the compartment and loudly flops them on the desk to draw her friend attention while she recovers the other two items and places them on freed areas of the desk.
Mike 28/12/2020 08:43
Sadao looks over at the sound of the objects hitting the desk. He approaches without making eye contact with her, and begins studying the items. "Hmm..." After a few moments, he gives the group a disappointed look. "Not much for me to go on, really. This token is weird, but I've got no idea what it means. Although..." He holds a hand to his mouth, considering what he's about to share. "My family has certain methods of contacting the spirits of the departed. If we could recover the magister's remains, I think I could question his spirit, if you believe it's worth it." At the glances he receives from the others at the word 'think,' he adds, "I've uh, never actually done it before. Only learned the broader strokes." He scratches the back of his head. (edited)
TheOrsini 28/12/2020 22:32
Koide waves her hand to draw Sadao's attention and then shrugs. She looks pensive for a moment as she thinks further.'It may be pursuit for wild gachÅ for all I know.... although it was important enough to lock away where only he could access it.' She points to the Sadao, and then imitates the magister throwing fireballs, and points down below, and talking. Nodding yes. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/12/2020 23:52
The sound of coins breaks Takumi from his dazing search. Coming to the conclusion that he won't find anything, he makes his way towards the origin of the clink of metal on wood... Without the muffled comfort of leather cloth. He joins the others in the room and sees the platinum on the desk. He sees Lady Koide nodding her head 'yes' to Sadao. A little perplexed and not catching the importance of the interaction, he bluntly asks Ryuz"so, what's the next step? Did she find out where he lives?"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 29/12/2020 22:36

Ryuzuko says to the half-elf with a hand on his chin. "If we do go back down, I would like to get back to inn and retrieve my own gear, just in case it ends up not being a pleasant descent. Maybe someone around here might know what those objects are?" He heads back to the entrance of the build, having not found much else himself, or rather, not understanding the language of the region and therefore would not be of much more help.
Mike 30/12/2020 03:47
"I'll hold onto them, then. Maybe ask around if we can't find the magister." Sadao puts the black token in his pack, then examines the watermarked parchment before carefully folding it up and putting it away as well. "Let me know when you're ready to head below, then."
Cel 30/12/2020 04:11
Deciding that no matter how dangerous their investigation may be, safety would likely still be found in numbers. Seeing Ryuzuko exit the building as she arrives, she hesitates before approaching. "Has their investigation uncovered anything significant yet? Returning to a scene such as this is reckless, but I suppose it may be worth the risk if it can aid us in our future battles." She looks at the building and starts making for the entrance, before deciding that staying here, even with Ryuzuko, would likely be safer. "You left before them, has something happened?"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 30/12/2020 04:36
Seeing the small elf approach "Ah, Aralynn, decided to join us? Yeah, we found a black coin-shaped piece of glass, no one knows what it is exactly, as well as a piece of paper in his desk." he pauses in thought. "You might not want to go, but our next course of action is to go back down that tunnel," he points to the nearby hole they had climbed down to finally kill the false hydra, "And find the magister's body so Sadao can use a spell on it to help us figure out the use of those items."
TheOrsini 30/12/2020 04:56
Koide says nothing, but begins to scrounge bits of material together: sealed ink wells, quills, parchment, a scroll case. She eyes around for a bag like some of the message runners use, but sadly no such luck. Since no one seems to care, she adds the coin to her purse. And then stands next to Sadao, ready to reenter the belly of the beast. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 30/12/2020 06:09
Viraj, still kneeling upon the earth, takes a handful of the dirt and rubs it between his hands. Spirits of these plants and this earth, I ask and give thanks for a great crop. May you heal and provide for them, and the cycle never stop. The man rises and takes a great step forward. Again his goes to a knee and gathers a handful, offering his prayer as the dirt falls back to the ground. Spirits of these plants and this earth, I ask and give thanks for a great crop. May you heal and provide for them, and the cycle never stop. His path through the fields spiral out from the point of origin as the druid continues this process throughout the day until the suns are just above the horizon. Once complete, he rises one last time and slowly rotates his head about his shoulders, working out the stiffness of the day's toils. The man's form then melts away. A great elk, its antlers variegated with streaks of orange, gallops off toward the coast to catch what rays are left of the sun. (edited)
Mike 30/12/2020 23:15
While he waits just outside of the office, Sadao withdraws the parchment, turning it over in his hands and toying with it. As Koide approaches to wait for Ryu's return, he pauses for a moment, before relaxing. He glances back into the room, noting Takumi was busy, and Aralynn had gone with Ryu, leaving them alone, relatively speaking. Go ahead and say it. He inhales, and speaks not too loudly. "Koide, I... just wanted to say I'm sorry. About what happened to you. If I hadn't been so insistent on seeking out the hydra and gone about it a different way, or hadn't kept my distance from it, you'd still have your voice. I share the responsibility." He bows deeply before her. (edited)
TheOrsini 30/12/2020 23:20
Koide places her hand against Sadao's bowing face, and raise it to meet her eyes. She shakes her head no. She smiles at him and actually looks as if she cares for a moment. She moves the hand from under his chin to his shoulder, and give it a pat, like brushing dust off the shirt. Koide straightens and walks away in solace.
Dandiil {Takumi} 31/12/2020 00:43
Takumi wanders around the office and starts picking up some of the little things, finding a decorative writing set and some bamboo strips, and putting them into his bag. 'These will be good for pa. He could use some decorations for his office.' Satisfied with his haul, he makes his way outside to the rest of the group. "so we're going back down the tunnel for the magister's body?" Takumi seems a little bit worried with this proposition. "I'm not sure I want to see that again. Would it be OK, if I just wandered around town, maybe help the residents out a little?" (edited)
Mike 01/01/2021 21:56
"Great idea. Ah, but you'd want to be able to understand them, right? Hold still for a moment." Sadao outstretches his hand to Takumi and speaks in ancient Je'dahnian, causing a mystical energy to flow from him to the sorcerer. After a few seconds, he pulls back. "Now you won't need me around to translate. For a little while, at least." he says in Honmin, to prove his point to the now understanding Takumi.
TheOrsini 02/01/2021 15:07
As Takumi and Ryuz go about their business, Koide decides to sit and wait... As the minutes drag on, and she idles there with Sadao, she pulls a left behind quill and one of the unstoppered ink wells over to one of the remaining stacks of paper that she or Takumi didn't raid. She thinks, and begins writing in rough hand. Does a reed blame the wind when it is blown over? Or perhaps the duckling when it becomes the fox's dinner? No, it is nature. Monsters may be unknown to us, but they follow their own nature. It is the harmony of the universe. It is the balance of all things. Sometimes we must give to be able to take. No, Sadao. This is not your doing, or indeed my own. I may have slipped at the critical moment, but I was spared death, and it came at its cost. I can overcome this with enough effort. Though I may never flirt, or laugh, or use some of my powers again. I will adapt. I thought for a while about ending it, but it would be a slight upon the sacrifice and a slight to the people that lost their lives here. I know I come off as callous, and the clergy may think I am a lost soul, but I am no monster. I know my place in this world. And although I do it for pay, and my methods may be questionable. I do it for them in a askew sort of way. She didn't like writing about herself in such a way, but the first outlet to speak in hours. She needed Sadao to stop worrying. She didn't hold an perceived inaction against him, maybe the elf, but not him. She didn't want to be a hero or some sort of damned martyr. She hands the paper to Sadao after blowing on the ink. (edited)
Mike 03/01/2021 06:53
Sadao reads the note, his eyes becoming glassy as they scan the page. I'm glad." is all he can say for the moment as he blinks back the tears, and puts the paper away. After a few quiet moments, which felt like an hour, he attempts to lighten the mood, shifting to a slightly more jovial tone. "Well, if you're going to be writing more often, there is one way I could help. No offense, but your penmanship could use some work." He smiles and adds with a laugh. "'A quill is stronger still, than a hundred men of war,' my teacher used to say. If you care to learn, I could help you practice, every now and then." (edited)
TheOrsini 03/01/2021 07:01
Koide smiles and bows with respect, bring her hands up into a prayer pose. She nods yes to his offer.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/01/2021 07:32
Moments later, Ryuzuko comes back from getting his gear back. "Everyone who is coming with ready?." he says as he enters the building. Noticing Koide finishing her bow to Sadao "That's fairly unusual of you Koide... But I guess you do have to find new ways to communicate." he places a hand on her shoulder. "Now let's go relocate this corpse. And hopefully it will be as simple as that." Sadao informs him of what happened while he was gone. He then looks to Aralynn, who had followed him to the inn and back, but at a moderate distance. "Don't feel like you need to come with us, Aralynn. Help Takumi here with the villagers, I'm sure they could use your help." he proposes to the elf as he prepares to journey back down the tunnel.
Mike 03/01/2021 07:45
Sadao returns the bow and looks to Ryuzuko. "Alright, let's go." He waves to Aralynn before they begin their descent.
TheOrsini 03/01/2021 07:55
Koide looks back to the remain paper, considering how much she may need in the coming days. 'Maybe after getting the chest.' She thinks. She checks her katana blade in the light, before resheathing it and catches up with the others as they head down the earthen hole.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/01/2021 23:25
The underground venture is short-lived. The tunnel comes to an abrupt halt not long after entering it, when the band of warriors is confronted with an enormous slump of earth. It looks like the warren-like network has begun to grow unstable since the the hydra's death. (edited)
Mike 04/01/2021 06:54
"Tch." Sadao clicks his tongue in disappointment as they come across the dead end in the ground. "The hydra's constant tunneling was the only thing supporting the earth here. I hadn't thought of that." He gives the dirt wall a few experimental probes before backing off with a sigh, his hands now dirtied. Turning back to look at the other two and seeing not even so much as a shovel among them, he shakes his head. "I hate to say it, but I'm not sure there's much we can do. It'd probably take a whole team of people days to dig through to where we left him, and that's provided they don't get lost trying to find it. Plus without supports, you'd be trapped underground... Guess this was a waste of time. Sorry."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 04/01/2021 09:05
Ryuz puts a hand on the man's shoulder, "It's not your fault, none of us considered the tunnels to be so fully collapsed." He kicks a few rocks before heading back up. "There has to be someone important enough left in this town that knows something, right? Let's go to the surface and ask around... Well, you can ask around, Sadao." He lets out a hardy laugh, knowing Sadao is the only one who can converse with the majority of the Honmin people.
TheOrsini 04/01/2021 13:48
Koide makes a gesture of carrying her chest, an enclosed box, and then a bursting wave. Trying to ask about going to the firework warehouse.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 04/01/2021 17:55

TheOrsini 04/01/2021 18:32
Koide nods, 'yes.'
Mike 04/01/2021 18:36

Dandiil {Takumi} 04/01/2021 18:50
Takumi wanders around the town, entertaining the children, providing water for the workers. He continues through town, helping the kids laugh, getting an idea where the empty buildings are... for possible investigation. After about half an hour, The half-elf stops in front of the clothing shop that he saw earlier and takes a step inside. "Would you like to look around?" He asks Aralynn. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/01/2021 20:59
Those who gathered outside the Jinjiang inn have left for the edge of town, where they are beginning to organise what they will need to survive as community so reduced in size. However, it seems that intelligence and insight are counter-productive when it comes to surviving a false hydra, for few Dandong's more learned inhabitants remain. The most knowledgeable amongst the survivors appear to be those who have taken charge - a tall, powerfully built man with a thick black beard by the name of Han Zheng and a slight, but severe woman named Xue Fu.
TheOrsini 05/01/2021 20:48
When Koide's trio reaches the warehouse, they seem the ceilings and walls torn apart, a fresh door way ripped into the side of the build. She finds the chest where she had cast it aside. She looks it over and nods with her satisfaction. She drags it over near a ledge table. And pulls out a slip of paper. She writes quickly, barely legible, 'I'm gonna need someone with sending. There is someone that should be nearby to help us, while I am recovering. An old companion, skilled. Sadao, would you know the magic? I may have to ask Takumi or the holy woman otherwise. Else I will need to send a raven to the last town he might have stayed.' She hands the note to her companion so he can read it.
Mike 05/01/2021 21:05
Sadao makes a mental note to speak with the two apparent leaders later on about the magister. Looking at the note, Sadao thinks for a moment, and looks through the objects they found in the magister's office. Besides the token and spellbook he'd identified, he finds the parchment he'd been unsure about earlier. Giving it a closer look, he recognizes it as a scroll of telescription. He unfurls it and hands it to her, with an explanation. "You can use this just like you would a spell of sending. If you tear off a bit and write your message, the person you want to send it to will receive it."
TheOrsini 05/01/2021 21:09
Koide is a bit confused by the explanation, but refuses to overlook her fortune. She scribbles a little more on her note after motioning it back from Sadao. 'Do I think a name or an image to send it?'
Mike 05/01/2021 21:21
Sadao smiles a bit. "Both, or neither. All you have to do is know who you want to speak to, and the scroll will take care of the rest." It wasn't often he got to talk like a sage, so he savored the moment.
TheOrsini 05/01/2021 21:36
Koide tears a piece of the page free. She thinks for a moment, picturing Lyrel, his elven features, his smile, that knowing look, feeling his embrace in bed, his sword forms.... in between the seconds, She feels like that hollow pit in her is silently whole. She blushes from some of the thoughts, and with a smile, she begins to write on the magic paper. 'Lyrel, I need you, on the road to Tonghua by way of Dandong. Please.' She didn't know how to end it, A moment of heated memories was not love, nor portrayed her intent. She had gotten a note of admiration before, and she didn't want this to sound like that, so she finished. 'Bring your kit.' She had written more than she had set to, not wanting to waste the precious paper in case it was needed later, but it was done now. She looked at the ink, already dried. Must be part of the magic. she thinks. It vanishes into the ether as she lifts it in the air. That was done at least. Koide stands from the desk, offering the scroll back to Sadao before picking up her chest. She thinks of Tanpo, and she quiet begins to follow the others out of the warehouse, a tear fighting to leave her eye. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 06/01/2021 09:51
Takumi walks around the shop collecting an assortment of local clothing, he quickly finds something that would fit Aralynn and actually look good on her. He can guess each member of the party's taste by what he has seen them wear... but he doesn't like it. He continues trying to convince the elf to change her garb. "If we go into another village affected as this one was... We aren't exactly going to be inconspicuous. The clothes will at least help us blend in." He continues collecting clothes for the rest of the party, making sure to pick things a little large for assurance that they would at least be wearable. He's no tailor, but style is something that he knows. He makes sure to get some new duds for everyone, even finding a tunic that might fit over Ryu's armor... 'that must have been made for a pretty big guy' Aralynn steps out of the changing room and even in commoner's clothes... "You look stunning" The half-elf finds one of those single wheeled hand-carts that you push, he's not sure what they're called, and folds the commoner's clothes neatly into it, separating the stacks by person. He then repeats the process, to find some higher end clothes in case they wish to pass as merchants or wealthy travelers. He doesn't find anything for the dragonborn in this category. "Ok, to Shoes" he says to Aralynn. she just seems to go along with whatever he wants to do... "You know what, nevermind, there were plenty of shoes at the inn. If there's anything you want to do, just let me know." Takumi and Aralynn start heading back to the inn, after an hour or so in the clothing shop. He nearly spills the cart several times during the return, so Aralynn carried some of the more expensive clothing. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 06/01/2021 21:10
Lyrel was enjoying a light snack of nuts and dried fruit with baiju while reading through a tome of lore about magical practices of the Ardathian Empire prior to its collapse when a strange flame appears within his line of sight. With quick glance about, he quickly reaches into the flames and removes a bit of parchment from within. As he read the hasty script, he somehow knew that it had come from his old acquaintance, Koide. 'Lyrel, I need you, on the road to Tonghua by way of Dandong. Please. Bring you kit.' The first section felt strangely like a plea of passion, but the last sentence told him all he needed to know. As soon as he finished reading the words, he holds the dry parchment to a nearby candle and allows the words to burn away. He crushes the ashes into a powder before blowing them into the air. He flips the tome closed with a sigh; the Ardathians would have to wait for another day. The nuts and fruit he sweeps into his palm and deposits them back into a small pouch, which he quickly slips into a pouch on his belt. This was a long journey and he would need sustenance. He tips back the cup of baiju and lets the liquid warm his throat and belly, the heat would keep his feet going for a spell. He grabs a beautifully crafted curved blade from its resting place against his chair and slips the exquisitely tooled, leather baldric from which it hung over his head. Lastly he throws his backpack over his shoulders and flips a coin to the owner of the establishment on his way out the door. He had a long journey ahead and he would prefer that Koide would not need to wait for him. 'I need you.' It had been sometime since he has last seen Koide, but he could still picture lithe form and her fierce eyes. 'Please.' Something about those words haunted Lyrel. It felt... off from the Koide he knew. 'Keep your wits about you, fool. No more baiju until this is done.' (edited)
Mike 06/01/2021 22:50
Sadao leaves the warehouse, and looks for the town's new leadership, spying a group of men returning just now. "I'll go see if the people in charge knew anything about the magister. TheOrsini 07/01/2021 02:29
As Sadao and the dragonborn begin to shuffle through the crowd at the edge of town, Koide decides to leave. The people talking back and forth reminder her too much of what is lost, she decides for quiet and solace. She heads back to the inn where they stayed the night and places the chest down in her room. She thinks of nature and the outdoors, and thinks of a few alchemical treatments for her hair, and a few extra potions would not go amiss. Soon, the warrioress is in the wilds in the surround of town, search for ingredients, and reconnecting to the natural world. It is a meditative like calm that comes from being away from the chaos of the city. Soon she is stuffing alchemical reagents into the satchel she borrowed from an abandoned market stall on her way out of town. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/01/2021 01:10
Sadao finds Zheng directing the efforts in the fields on the northern edge of town. Most of the men seem to be coming in for lunch after a morning of assessing what is left for them to farm. By now the bard is a minor celebrity amongst the survivors and Zheng quickly notices him approaching. "Sadao-zÅ«njià," the tall, dark-haired man greets Sadao with a bow. "What can I do for you?"
Mike 08/01/2021 20:08
Sadao returns the bow, with a smile. "Han-xiÄnshÄ“ng. We've been investigating the departed magister of this town, trying to figure out how all of this started in the first place. I was wondering if you knew much about him, or perhaps recognized this token? It belonged to him." He shows him the seven-fingered icon.
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/01/2021 23:38
"The magister?" Zheng asks in confusion and surprise. He takes the token and rolls it between his fingers, holding the obsidian disc up to the light to inspect it. "No, I can't say that I do know what this is. The magister was always the most learned and wisest among us. His loss pains us truly, like so many others." Zheng glances about to check who is nearby, before asking quietly. "Surely you don't think that he was somehow involved in our plight?"
Mike 09/01/2021 01:35
"Oh, no." Sadao says, assuaging the man's fears. "No, he was a victim in all of this, like the rest of you." Though he's putting up a calm outward appearance, a small part of Sadao's mind begins to wonder. He was the most learned man in town... and seemed to know enough about the hydra to deafen himself to ignore its song. And it was also true that they didn't have all the facts. But on the other hand, the man had been practically scared out of his wits when they first met him. And he'd never forget the way he died. Besides that, he didn't want to sully the townspeople's warm memory of him without some serious evidence. "It's just that his past is shrouded in mystery. Do you think that Xue Fu, the women's leader, would know anything about him, or a symbol like this? Or could it be I'm chasing shadows?" he adds with a guilty chuckle. In the end, if they couldn't make anything of the curios he left behind, whatever secrets the magister had had, malevolent or otherwise, would die with him.
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/01/2021 13:55
Zheng reaches back with a large calloused hand to rub the nape of his neck. "His name was Qian Wu and he came to Dandong just over thirty cycles ago, when Thanglong fell to the Ming. A lot of things were changing back then. Magister Qian came as an advisor to the new mayor. I've heard tell that he learned his craft at the great academy of Dongjing, but truth be told we never spoke in person. Xue-daren might know more, but if that item was personal to Qian-laoshi, then it may be that nobody here has ever seen it before. He was a quiet, private man."
Mike 11/01/2021 20:12

We're waiting on a new arrival. In the meantime, our shaman, Viraj, will see after your crops with a ritualâ€”you might've noticed him already. If I miss the chance to talk to you before we go, I just wanted to say you and the others have done great work so far. At this rate, I believe you'll have a beautiful town once more before you know it." (edited)

Kyle [Arcadian] 12/01/2021 14:36

Mike 12/01/2021 18:47

Kyle [Arcadian] 13/01/2021 06:55
Fu puts down the spoon that she is holding and leans closer to the bard, speaking quickly and quietly. "What do you mean, 'strange behaviour'? What are you suggesting?"
Mike 13/01/2021 08:05
Sadao shrinks back. A dull pain echoes through the scars on the backs of his hands, and it's all he can do to keep from touching them. "N-Nothing!" For a scant few moments, he feels the urge to escape the conversation, as the Honmin woman's visage and tone began to resemble that of his mother's... "Sadao! If I have told you once, I've told you too many times! You cannot play outside until you finish your studies." The normally serene face of Mi-ha Huiya twisted with anger as she saw the little boy trying to slip away from their estate, on another one of his 'expeditions.' "But mother! Father said it was alriâ€”ow!" Sadao's excuses are cut off as she grabbed him by the arm, just a little harder than necessary, and pulled him to the library. "That is his folly. I shan't let it infect you. Now sit, and practice your Honmin script again. You've been getting sloppy with all this time off." He quietly obeys, receiving a hit across the back of the hand with a small crop whenever he made a mistake, as usual. An older Sadao returns to the present. Blinking his eyes, he remembers that this is a wholly different person. What he felt before had to have been the lasting effects of the hydra's magic. But he wouldn't let that torment him, as it did Aralynn. "Xue-nÇšshì. An aberration of incredible size and strength was in control of this town not days ago, you're well aware. As it stands, there's no evidence that the magister is to blame for its appearance, and I hope that's not the case. But if you've seen what I've seen, you'd want to ensure we know where that thing came from, so this never happens again! If you know anything else about him, then please tell me!" His voice gradually increases from a whisper, until he's nearly speaking the last two sentences aloud.
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/01/2021 11:14
Fu sighs and shakes her head. "Qian-laoshi was a man of great wisdom and dignity. Sadly, I know little more of his life before coming to Dandong than Zheng-daren, but if anyone could have understood what was happening to our beloved town, it would have been him."
Mike 13/01/2021 15:42
"Very well. Then I'm sorry to have taken up your time." With another bow, Sadao makes a swift exit. Out of places to go, he returns to Jianjing Inn.
Dandiil {Takumi} 13/01/2021 18:58

It was one of my concerns when we arrived here, before we learned the real reason for the people's disposition." The half-elf provides Sadao with two changes of brand new clothes.
Mike 14/01/2021 21:27

Maybe we'll have cause to visit there at some point." With a slight shrug, he goes to find something to eat, and let the rest of the day pass.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 14/01/2021 22:25
Lyrel steps out into the crisp, cool grey morning and felt thankful for the warmth of the baiju he'd just consumed. He glances about briefly, checking over his shoulder before cupping his hands around his mouth and emitting a strange "whoooooo" sound, like one might hear from an owl in the stillness of the night. There is a brief moment as onlookers glance warily at the strange, armed elven man among the hustle and bustle of Dalian before the sounds of flapping wings can be heard. Lyrel turns and raises his forearm up, parallel to the ground as a tawny-feathered owl flutters down to land and clutch on his forearm. The owl looks inquisitively at Lyrel cocking his head this way and that. Even more inquisitive onlookers stop and gawk at the strange sight as they realize the owl has numerous runic designs across its wings and chest... and a glowing blue rune upon its forehead. 'Longwei, my oldest friend, we are taking a journey. A long one, I will need your eyes and ears to watch the road ahead. We ride for Dangong to meet an old friend. I trust you to keep me safe.' His thoughts cross the barrier of speech to the familiar.
22:26
The owl hoots and bobs its head in the strange way of owls before spreading its wings in anticipation and takes flight as Lyrel raises his arm up high. He quickly finds an inconspicuous side street where he could work his magic in peace. A beautiful bound, leather spellbook is removed from a large pouch on his right hip and placed with care upon a wooden stoop. He confers with the ritual instructions and begins spending the next 10 minutes sculpting an illusionary creature from the recesses of his imaginative mind. He steps back from his work with a satisfied smirk as the creature regards him with its blue, glowing eyes and dips its shadowy antlered head in difference. Lyrel rubs the illusions nose before gracefully leaping into the saddle upon it's back. He then uses the specially designed flat spot near the horn to strap his spellbook with the affixed leather straps so he could continually refresh this phantom steed while he rode. He takes the reins in hand and with a gentle prodding of heels to ribs, guides the stag-like steed into streets beyond and towards Koide...
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/01/2021 04:42
With the sun well behind Unus, the elk gallops back towards the town. The animal approaches along the main thoroughfare, and, once at the edge of the city proper, it slows to a trot. Then to a walk, which becomes less graceful as the form of beast begins to morph into that of the Rajani man. As he heads directly for the Jianjing Inn, Viraj gives awkward waves and nods to those townsfolks he passes along the way and makes a mental note to have Sadao run him through a few basic phrases so that he can manage while they're on this side of The Maw. "Takumi, you got that stew of yours going yet?" the druid says as he enters the inn, massaging his blistered hands from working his magic in the fields for the day. (edited)
TheOrsini 15/01/2021 06:27
Despite the linger chill of winter, Koide enjoys the wilding in this early spring day. The sun finally peaked through the clouds as she traced the game trails and backwater area near the town. It was a risk, to be out on her own, but the hunter's prowess, made it a calculated risk. She avoided any of the signs for wolf or bear, and when she search her primal connection to the earth, she did not sense the taint of undead in the lands beyond, save for the few that had appeared to the south during her meditation the day prior... before all this... madness. She did feel a bit better with the dragonborn's healing , but she fought the urge to practice her kata and sword forms. She instead focused on the hollows and hideaways for the illusive herbs and alchemical components. She was surprised to find a usable amount of Inar's Blessing. The pale pink blooms were rare to be so developed this early in the year, but they could be used for their healing properties. The Saidar Moss was thick, but most clumps had germinated its spores, and begun to brown. Koide thought how it was strange that such a unusual plant would go through its life cycle in less than a month, only to go dormant until the fall. Its alchemical properties diminished quickly after it had gone to seed. She only found enough to make a tincture that could help regrow her hair. She search on into the afternoon gathering as much as she could, but headed back before temperature began to drop, and the fog that would be coming would begin to pour in. Besides, they might lock her out of the town if she didn't get to the gates before nightfall. It would be hard to tell based on the chaos in the village.
Mike 17/01/2021 01:27
Towards the end of the day, Sadao assembles a small collection of ingredientsâ€”some charcoal, found in an abandoned domicile. Herbs, graciously donated from Koide's stockpile while harvesting from the village outskirts. And now, incense, which he had just found in the confines of Dandong's temple. Though it had fallen into disrepair due to the hydra's reign, the place was no less solemn, and he found the quiet rather pleasant as he prepared a ritual with the ingredients, placing them each in a wide brass brazier. Using the tinderbox from his gear, he sets the mixture alight, then reads a passage from the Huiya Scroll, the words appearing as he unfurls it. The flames turn from fierce red, to a calming golden glow. He then clasps his hands in prayer. "Honored ancestors. Having written my name alongside yours in our legends, I now beseech you. If I have done so in proper accordance, please send me a spirit to be my guide, as each Peacekeeper before me has had upon rising to meet their fate." Ending this prayer in ancient Je'dahnian, he opens his eyes moments later, just in time to see a tanuki burst forth from the golden flame. With a squeal, it puts out the remaining flame on its tail, which leaves a gold tuft of fur on the tip, contrasting with its brown and black hair. It then sits, quite aloof, before the surprised Sadao. "Ahem. You called for me, and so I appear. Nice to meet you, treat me with care, and all that." A rather blasé-sounding voice echoes through his head, emanating from the creature. With a smile, Sadao embraces the tanuki, causing it to fidget uncomfortably in his arms. "Hey, let's take things one step at a time, shall we?" Some time later, Sadao enters the inn that evening, with the new arrival on his shoulder. "Two bowls of stew for us! One for me, and a smaller one for Kinoh here." (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 18/01/2021 17:54
Over the cold days of waiting, Takumi continues to cook soups and stews for his companions. After their first day at the inn, he found himself designated as the party's cook... maybe it was self-imposed... The food that he made wasn't exactly the top of the line, best food in the worldâ€¦ 'but what if I could do that kind of cooking for them?' Takumi decided to go out to help with the cooking and distribution of food for the townsfolk in order to get a better understanding of what cooking is all about. Even with the language barrier, he has begun learning quite a bit about chopping and cutting techniques. The second day, Takumi didn't learn as much, as he was on the distribution line more than the kitchen. The third day was quite the revelationâ€¦ he began to understand the use of seasonings in food to help accent and even hide the tastes within the meals. The half-elf was happy with his decision to begin learning the nuances of being a real cook. He will be more creative and experimental in his style as he continues to pursue this craft. (edited)
Mike 19/01/2021 01:12
The next day, Sadao awakens late. After he finds breakfast, he notices Ryu, hard at work reforging his weaponry and armor. After watching him at his craft for a little while, he approaches. "Hey, I was wondering if you could do me a favor. I need a new weapon for close combatâ€”a sword would really do the trick."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 19/01/2021 01:36
Ryuzuko looks up towards the bard, setting his tools aside. "I did notice you came back without your bÅ... What kind of blade were you looking for and why do you believe it will serve you better?" The dragonborn asks as he straightens his back, crossing his arms as he does so. "A staff is a fine tool for both combat and travel, swords, not so much." being a master of arms, Ryuz knows the finer uses of any weapon and is searching for the intentions the human has for one.
Mike 19/01/2021 03:21
Sadao thinks back on his past experience with the staff, feeling a tinge of regret at having left it behind as the dragonborn shares his martial wisdom. "True, but I've been spent most of my life outdoors as much as I could help it. I've found different ways to replace its utility, when it comes to getting around. But there's more to my decision than that..." He scratches his head, glancing around the vicinity to see if Koide or anyone else was around or listening before responding. "It's about the perception that my choice of weapon can bring. I was brought up to be a peacekeeper, and I clung to that ideal as closely as I could throughout my training. I only avoided blades because I didn't think it was right to spill another's blood and still call yourself a guardian of the peace. But given, er, recent events, I'm seriously reconsidering for the first time. Maybe it seems childish, but it feels like I'm not very serious of a threat when I primarily wield a bÅ. Even Takumi uses his magic more often than his own; and my tantÅ I've only used for paring fruit and nuts..." "To be honest, I don't know much about two-handed blades outside of katana, which I've received some training with. I thought I'd start there, if you'd recommend it. What I really need is something not too hefty, though." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 19/01/2021 05:55
The dragonborn thinks for a minute before turning around and grabbing his wakizashi, still in it's scabbard and showing it to Sadao. "A wakizashi should suffice then. It's not as long as a katana, but longer than your tanto." he hands the man his sword, letting him test it's weight and feel for a minute.
TheOrsini 19/01/2021 09:42
Koide takes her daily blessings, more to appease Ryuz than the hope that it actually repairs her voice. She is less than pleased when Viraj joins the rotation, but it feels better anyway so she doesn't protest, even if she could. She spends the days of fog and dreary winter's chill in isolation as she can, first securing an alchemy kit out some of the destroyed labs left abandoned in the town. She only waves politely to townsfolk as they speak at her in words she doesn't understand. They aren't hostile, so she ignores them as best as she can. She spends a few hours working on drying out and storing the chromatic mud she pulled from a riverbank, as well as the other ingredient she is presented. When her prediction of the weather is correct on the second day, she makes the mistake of planning on how to greet Lyrel. She spires into a depression for the first part of the day. The silent woman manages to recover after the midday meal, and finds herself setting up a make shift lab with her alchemy tools in the attempt to make a bomb. She requisitions some of the materials from the fireworks storehouse: the nitrates, and components for saltpeter. Finalizing the components with her alchemical treatment, she wraps the explosive in cloth and pulp forming a basic form as it dries, and coats the form in lead to give it a hardened shell, attaching the fuse at the end. Two days of work to complete a bomb. She hoped it would work.
Mike 19/01/2021 23:44
Sadao holds the wakizashi aloft, and tests its weight with a few swings. "This is good. But perhaps we could do better. A blade like this, but lengthened somewhat, with the same weight on the right places would be perfect. Can you do it, Ryu-sensei?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 20/01/2021 06:11
Viraj rises early the next day, hoping to gather more herbs in the fields. However, the half-day long ritual he performed the previous day seems to have taken its toll on the older druid and his tired eyes are unable to find any useful plants for his potions. On the way back to the inn, he makes a quick stop at the smith to see about his shield. Again, he finds disappointment. The craftsman holds up the splintered mess of wood and broken metal bands. "WÇ’ wúfÇŽ jiÄ›jué zhège wèntí" he says shaking his head and giving an apologetic look. Viraj doesn't understand the words, but manages their understanding. It was too much to hope for after that blow the dragonborn delivered. He nods and continues back to their lodging. "Well, I had a fruitless morning." He begins setting up his equipment to process some of the healing herbs Koide managed to find. He listens as Sadao and Ryuzuko discuss the matters of crafting the bard a new sword. "Think you could make me a new shield? You do owe me after all." He gives the dragonborn a wry grin as he breaks up one of the red leaves of the Healer's Boon and places it in his mortar. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/01/2021 01:59

TheOrsini 21/01/2021 08:23
Another day... another magical healing. 'Maybe it was helping.' Koide thought to herself as she walked down the road outside of the Inn. The pain seemed to come less and less, and she slept slightly more comfortably. She had proved her professional skill to herself in the previous days, today she would test her mind some. She foresaw another day of solace, and soon she found herself back in the quiet mausoleum that was the magister's library. Before the sun peaked high through the broken window panes, she was pouring over spines looking for books that might interest her, if she could understand them.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/01/2021 22:54
"Eh... I'm not too particular on the details. Just needs to get the job done." Viraj replies to the dragonborn, then continues his own work of brewing a potion for the remainder of the day. The next two days are filled with much of the same for the druid. Though gathering herbs proves to be more successful. The next morning he tries his search near the coast and manages to locate a few clumps of golden-brown seaweed known as Mermaid Braid beginning to sprout from the shallow tide pools. The third day his search takes him to the fields on the southern side of town where he locates a stalk with a handful of red and gold Dragontongue Petal. "Spicy!" he notes when he cuts a sliver to chew on. The warmth gives comfort to Viraj. (edited)
Mike 22/01/2021 20:10
While Ryu works, he occasionally notices Kinoh lounging about the smithy he's repurposed. The raccoon dog returns his gaze with a lethargic, yet sharp, look.
TheOrsini 23/01/2021 12:41
Koide finds a few books that pique her interest including a dictionary to help with translation. She focuses her study through a book of alchemy call The Way of the Golden Elixir. Referencing the dictionary for some of the notes that were scrawled in the native tongue. She studied on into the evening lighting candles to continue her study into the deeping hour when her stomach began to complain. She nabbed a snack before bed that evening from the slowly draining pantry. Koide slept well into the morning making up for her lost rest. Another cold day with bad weather. They would not be leaving this day either. She had brought her books back to the inn with her that night, so she spent some of the morning in the common room reading Kojiki. While some of the myths interested her, for the sensei had always said there is some truth to any tale, it did not steal her attention for long, and she was back reading in the alchemy treatise. Another long night of reading. Tomorrow, if the weather didn't break, it would be sword training... maybe (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/01/2021 21:49
Two more days pass and Dandong remains trapped beneath a haze of perpetual fog, still and silent, but for the cawing of the crows. Ryuzuko continues his work in the smithy, pounding away at hot steel on the anvil as he forges a new blade for Sadao. Meanwhile, Takumi continues to help out in Xue Fu's kitchen, preparing communal meals for the town's survivors. Viraj scours the wilds for useful herbs and steeps potions from the healer's boon that Koide found by the river, while she herself is ensconced in the books that she scavenged from the magister's library. It's nearing dusk on the fifth day since the Kitakaze Maru arrived in Dandong, when a spectral steed ridden by a tall, pale Elf trots into town from the north...
Dandiil {Takumi} 25/01/2021 11:04
Takumi returns late from assisting the townsfolk with their meal preparations. There seemed to be more people this day requesting a meal. Maybe it was due to the horrid weather, but this was a day of learning for the Half-elf street magician. He learned how to use spices and herbs to flavor a meal. Takumi is a little hasted when he realizes he doesn't have enough time to have a stew ready at dusk. The half-elf opts to make a noodle stir-fry with the vegetables and quick meats he has on hand. He doesn't realize it yet, but he used a little too much seasoning, especially the ones that cause a bit of fire in the throat. When the meal is served, Takumi is proud of his accomplishment. As each member of the party comes in for their plate, he awaits a reaction. The flavor is excellent, save for the pepper induced heat that is leaving the mouth yearning for something to cool the burn. "What do you think?" he asks the normally stoic Ryuzuko as the paladin prepares for his second bite. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 26/01/2021 22:25
It is a strange sight in the hazy fog as a tawny owl silently flaps into the center of town and perches itself atop a pitched roof. What was even stranger was when a single, glowing blue eye splits open in the middle of the owl's brow as the bird begins to look about in that strange way owls were want to do... Almost as quickly as the owl appeared, the took flight once more and disappears into the fog once more. Shortly after a large antlered stag colored in deep blacks and ashy whites with a huge, wispy wrack and brightly glowing pools of blue eyes silently trots into the town with a pale elf, wrapped heavily in a thick, warm cloak and his head wrapped tightly with a likewise thick scarf to fight out the frigid fog that swirled around the dark rider. The appearance of the mount and its rider were strange enough, but the lack of sound accompanying it pushed some of the nearby townsfolk, already on edge from their terrible encounter with the mind-wracking powers of the false hydra, into a near panic as they stumbled away from the odd elf. The elf looks about at the dilapidated state of the town and the grafiti splashed here and there with concern. He quickly dismounts the stag and with a snap of his fingers the beast disappears into a swirl of dark smoke. He approaches one of the braver townsfolk with a respectful bow, speaking in their native tongue. "Can you tell me what has happened here? I am seeking a woman from Je'dahn. A woman named Koide. Do you know where I could find her?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/01/2021 22:31

TheOrsini 28/01/2021 05:05
Koide takes another spoonful of Takumi's latest variation. 'Her friend could *actually cook.'* She turns the page in her text. Rereading about this story about the Kotoamatsukami. She pauses thinking of Lyrael, she had been tempted to send another message to check on him, unsure if something had befallen him or perhaps he had bypassed Dandong entirely in the fog. Blankly staring at the page she idly runs her finger along the blank spacings on the page. She takes a brief inhale, thinking. 'Maybe this would be fine.' Time resting had put her better spirits despite the weather, and she had proven capable even without the use of voice. And she had learned more about her companions in the time at the inn than the boat ride here. 'Fighting together had the tendency for bringing people together.' Koide had wondered where Aralynn had disappeared to, she despised the woman from when she first met her, but now Koide found herself even more worried about the bitch trying to tread around with Lyrael. 'Why was she being so possessive?' He had not been her only lover over the years, but this one was different... at least to Koide. She hoped he felt the same. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 28/01/2021 05:18
Viraj holds a vial over over a small flame coming from his other hand, swirling the concoction within as it to comes just to the right consistency. The druid flicks his hand, extinguishing the fire used to brew his elixir. Setting the healing potion in a small rack to cool, he rises with his meal that Takumi prepared and walks to the window. He slurps the noodles as he watches the town wind down for the night, though the fog doesn't allow for much of a view. "Mmm. Pretty good, Takumi! You've come a long way... Could use a bit more heat. "We expecting anyone?" he asks, wiping the broth from his chin as the person stops in front of the inn. (edited)
TheOrsini 28/01/2021 05:20

Mike 28/01/2021 07:26

"So much for my wise spirit mentor. You're a little glutton!" He "says" through their uncanny telepathic connection. Just friends... right? While the bard began to fret, Kinoh finds an opening. She darts underneath his arm and thrusts her face into his bowl, partially spilling the contents while she laps up the broth, noodles, and meat and vegetables alike. She cuts her eyes at him as she feasts. "There's your first lesson, my young pupil. Never let your guard down!" comes her nonverbal response. He lets out a frustrated sigh. While he's cleaning up the mess with a towel, the stranger's presence is made known. He eyes the owl and stranger with curiosity. (edited)

TheOrsini 30/01/2021 09:57

Mike 30/01/2021 15:50

Dandiil {Takumi} 30/01/2021 18:33

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 03/02/2021 22:13

His face is red as he compliments Takumi's cooking with a slight wince. TheOrsini 04/02/2021 01:48

They solidified and shaped the earth, which was then like floating oil on the primeval ocean. Using a spear, Sarutahiko, the Allfather, churned the ocean, thus forming islands of Je'dahn. However, a fifth God named Yomi emerged from the shadows, vowing to slay a thousand mortals each day, to which Suijin replied that he would every day beget fifteen hundred more to thwart this. The Kotoamatsukami came together and dragged Yomi into the Obsidian Maw, where all five were rent apart in the depths and destroyed." (edited)

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 09/02/2021 21:05

I ordered them to send word to the nearest garrison and capital city, but... I think perhaps the word from an ambassador such as my father may carry more weight."
Dandiil {Takumi} 09/02/2021 21:13
Takumi nods in recalling the earlier conversation "That's what you were talking about earlier. The Kaiju and the village... I'm sorry, I've been a little bored hanging around town. If I wasn't cooking I'd probably be scavenging a bit more." He trails off a little, thinking of the state of the town and Lady Koide as well. "But with the state of things here, I don't know..."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 09/02/2021 21:56

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/02/2021 22:04

TheOrsini 10/02/2021 23:03

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 10/02/2021 23:09

TheOrsini 11/02/2021 12:18
Koide slides her stack of papers pulling a different paper from the bottom, it is creased in letter form and a broken wax seal has left its red residue despite being removed. He slides to it to Lyrel and it reads: Honoured Master of the Raven Watch, My name is Jiang Kokwan and I write to you to beseech your aid. I am the Shizhang of the small village of Tonghua in southern Hong province and our home has been beset by a terrible evil. The monster appears without warning and feeds upon my people without fear or restraint. Those bitten by the foul creature languish and die from the unholy wounds that it leaves upon them. Steel does not harm it. It cannot be slain by common folk. I beg of you; help us. We do not have much, but what we do, we will gladly give for our salvation. Jiang Kokwan Shizhang of Tonghua She had not shared the letter specifically with the others, but had given some of the description to her party on the boat travel to Dandong. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 14/02/2021 15:46

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 14/02/2021 22:06

Kyle [Arcadian] 20/02/2021 22:31
Lyrel joins Koide's group of companions for the night at the Jinjiang inn and when morning comes Ryuzuko returns to the forge to finish his work on Sadao's new blade. Takumi spends most of the day practicing his cooking. However, as the afternoon draws in, he grows restless and heads out into the ruins of the town in search of anything worth salvaging. Kyle [Arcadian] 21/02/2021 01:28

Mike 21/02/2021 04:18
Feeling refreshed from his night in the woods, Sadao awakens very late in the morning, yawning. After dusting off some stray blades of grass, he clasps his hands in a gesture of prayer. "I call upon you to fulfill our pact." he says in Je'dahnian. At his words, a small gust of wind carrying leaves issues forth, heralding Kinoh's arrival. She lets out her own wide yawn, revealing sharp teeth. "Hmph. You were rude when last we spoke. I'm not talking to you." He rolls his eyes and sets to work on clearing his small campsite while the tanuki lounges. "Hm. I do wonder where raggedy-girl got to though..." Ignoring her telepathic pondering, he wipes his brow once he's finished cleaning. It was already past noon, so he has brunch on the spot, finding some berries for Kinoh. "Alright, let's go," he says, grabbing his pack. "Ryu is probably done forging that sword for me." The tanuki wrinkles her snout. "I know I said I wasn't talking to you, but as your guide, I'd be remiss not to tell you when you reek. Ought to fix that first." Sadao sniffs his underarm, only to find the canine was right. After a wash in a nearby stream, the pair reenters Dandong as the afternoon dragged on. It's only a few minutes walking through the ruined districts of town before they hear some commotion nearby. Sadao rushes over. "Nín hÇŽo," he says to the perturbed elder fuming at Takumi. "What seems to be the issue?"

"I don't think this guy is happy to see me in his home, but Apparently you're looking through the houses too, did you find anything? Can you ask this guy if this is his, and if so, how much does he want for it?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/02/2021 16:53
"This knife-ear is looting peoples' homes," the old man explains to Sadao in Honmin, his anger clear from the venom in his words. "He should have some respect for the dead and for this community, after all it has been through. What has been left will eventually be salvaged and used to start anew."
Mike 21/02/2021 17:29
Sadao appears dismayed. "Takkun..." He thinks back to the clothes Takumi had presented them; he didn't even consider it then, but those had likely been looted too. Still, he wanted to give the sorcerer the benefit of the doubt. He'd always seemed more eccentric than malicious. "He's definitely not going to let you buy it off him, he thinks you're stealing it. And regardless, he's right, this stuff still belongs to the town's survivors first." He approaches Takumi, and tries to take the messenger bag from him to present to the old man. "Here." He looks to Takumi. "I can't really apologize on your behalf, though. It'd mean more coming from you." He places a hand on the half-elf's shoulder, who feels a familiar current run out of the bard and into him, as tongues takes effect. "Go on," he says, with an expectant look.
Dandiil {Takumi} 21/02/2021 17:34
Takumi looks confused... "Apologize for what? I've stolen nothing, there isn't anything worth stealing. Is this your house? What are you doing here then? What are you going to do with the bag?"
TheOrsini 21/02/2021 17:50
Koide was torn between a catharsis of having Lyrel here and not being able to say all the things left unsaid since they had last held a few quiet moments. 'And now I can't say shit.' She was silently agitated as she lead the elven warrior to the magister's library as he had so - she shivered, pushing the thought down - He had asked, and she wasn't gonna tell him 'no' on something this simple even if she could. There was a final numbing twinge from the burns. It was dull. 'Almost gone,' she evaluates as they walk. She could practice her sword forms again soon, and be back to her full potential. 'Aside from the magics,' she corrected. 'That was gonna be a problem.' Since her vow of silence, she had began to gleem a new understanding of the people around her. She had finally realized that Sadao might have been a bit sweet on her. The whole apologizing thing. That might have been guilt, but his demeanor when he met Lyrel. Slightly dour glances when they passed since. 'Had he been blushing when she had came into the hall wrapped in that towel?' She had been too preoccupied to notice. Her foot catches on a wayward stone, her mind running through this new aspect of reality and her body pitches forward, but Lyrel is there to catch her in the moment. Koide fought the urge to swoon. 'This was so unbecoming.' She smiles as the most hilarious thought came to her mind. (edited)
Mike 21/02/2021 17:57

"Come on, Takkun, it doesn't matter whether it's his house or not. You get that, right? Just say you're sorry for now and leave it be." (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 21/02/2021 18:12
Takumi looks down at his feet then looks up at Sadao. "I'm telling you that I have nothing to apologize for. There is no better way to get to know someone than by their possessions. And if the lives of those people are gone, their memories have to live on in some way. Take the house next door, or was it two houses back. They were a couple, modest lifestyle for these parts, and they were fishers. They were also very well organized and committed to each other. See, there is nothing but memories here. I will not apologize for getting to know the people that were lost. If this is this man's house, which it might be, because of the age of some of the things in here, like that bag. It hasn't been used in around 10 years, you can tell by the buckles nearly rusting together. It is well worn, but well taken care of. Is that how you injured your knees? Running messages? I apologize for entering your home without permission. I really would like to buy that bag, if you'll sell it. To keep the memory of this town, and for my disgraceful actions" Takumi bows low to the elder gentleman.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/02/2021 00:34
The old man accepts the messenger bag from Sadao, but stares at Takumi with hard eyes. "You talk of the lives of the people of this town as though they were worth nothing. Mike 22/02/2021 01:20
With a sigh, Sadao bows to him and heads for the door, gesturing for Takumi to follow. He did what he could to ease the situation, certainly, but there was little he could do in the face of morals like Takumi's. But it still stung. When they get outside, he leads the half-elf a few dozen paces away, to an alley. When they get there, he turns back to look at him. "I'm sorry, Takkun, but your logic, I just... don't get it. I mean, looting and stealing are one and the same, and they're both wrong. That's no way to honor someone's memory... and I hate to say it, but I don't think you really believe it either." He pauses, looking away as he remembered the magister's dying moments, and the items they'd found in his quarters. Xue Fu's wordsâ€”about their snoopingâ€”echo in his mind. He shakes his head. That was different. Refocused, he speaks up once more. "Did you take those clothes without anyone's permission too? And please... tell the truth."
Dandiil {Takumi} 22/02/2021 01:30

It wasn't about honor, that's true... I guess it was what if noone does remember them, like before...? Yes, my intention was to go looting, as you put it, ... I call it scavenging... but I didn't." With the start of his sobering talk, she dismissed the internal joke about starting a harem. After regaining her composure, she listened and walked, not having her paper or satchel with her. Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/02/2021 05:48
Sadao walks in on Ryuz polishing the blade against a sharpening stone. "Almost..." he replies, deeply concentrated on the finishing of the bard's ko-katana. The dragonborn moves the sword from the larger stone, placing it on a piece of cloth. He carefully takes a pinch of extremely small stones, placing them on the middle line of the blade. His hand skillfully slides them up and down the sword, slowly revealing the sharp change from the hard steel of the back of the blade, and the softer, yet razor sharp edge. "There, done..." he declares, raising the finished blade into the air, letting the light shine and reflect off of it. Ryuzuko, satisfied with his work, gives it a few more strokes of a cloth to clean it before placing it in it's scabbard. The ronin kneels on the ground in front of Sadao, holding the finished ko-katana in the palms of his hands, presenting it to the man. "Your ko-katana is completed, Sadao the bard."
TheOrsini 01/03/2021 12:23
With the trip to the library a success for Lyrel, Koide had thought about her magics on the way back to the inn. They were another part of her lost. She wasn't cut off from the power. Her ability to gaze through wolf's eyes still answered her ritual. She had briefly tried several invocations last night, when she had finally gotten some of her wits about her. Only the one worked. She felt up to practicing sword forms again, but she didn't surrender to the whim. Her legs no longer caught from the pain of unseen scars when she walked. In fairness, she probably could match any of her cohorts blade-to-blade in a match, but that missing magical factor was going to be something to overcome. Koide had hoped that the village would have had a skilled magical healer. Someone to fix this. If one had lived in Dandong, he had surely been consumed by the false hydra. 'Why was she rehashing all this? It is folly.' She chided herself at dinner. Magic had grown to be a sore subject for her. When her companions had brought up magic during the meal, she had silently found ways to busy herself and make her way out of the
12:23
conversation. No one argued with the mute woman anyway. This day felt like a waste for her, but she just took it in stride. Lyrel tried to comfort her, but she wasn't having it. She read on her alchemy book when the time allowed itself in the privacy of her room. And as she settled in for the night, she rebuffed the attentions of her companions at the door - clinging to isolation for the night. Her final thoughts before falling asleep were troubling dour, 'Tomorrow... if the fog cleared, we can finally be on their way....' the thought refused to end there, with a pang of bitterness of her personal loss lingering'to help the next group of hapless idiots who can't save themselves.' The thought stung inside her head, like a cobra's withering bite. Altruism nagged at her soul, 'Fine... at least the village and its people survived.' She took brief solace as she drifted to sleep. (edited)
Mike 01/03/2021 16:06
Sadao kneels to accept the blade with both hands, head bowed. He draws the blade to inspect it, turning it over in the natural light. Seeing it was good, he resheathes it and bows a final time before the dragonborn. "Thank you for hearing out this selfish request of mine," he says, using traditional Je'dahnian phrasing. In contrast to the austere words, as his head lifts back up, he's practically beaming. Sadao rises to his feet and leaves the smithy. Once outside and in an area free from debris or refuse, he performs a kata with the blade, familiarizing himself with it in short order. As he goes through the motions, he feels a slight exhilaration in them. Is this how it feels for her? He wonders through the practice. Eventually, he settles down for what would likely be their last overnight stay in Dandong, at least for some time.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/03/2021 22:14
Viraj has busied himself again throughout the day with preparing another potion of healing. When Koide returns from the library, he waves her over. "I found these when when looking for other herbs."
