TheOrsini 01/03/2021 22:29
Koide had remembered accepting them from Viraj, but her head was preoccupied so the fruits sat in her pack waiting to be processed the following morning when she awoke.
Dandiil {Takumi} 01/03/2021 23:27
Takumi finds his way to the kitchen of the inn, not really paying attention to those present. He isn't moving with the same energy that he normally has and begins preparing the evening meal. 'What is happening to me?' he continues sicing tomatoes and a green stalky vegetable that he hasn't identified yet. 'I should have come back with a bag full of cool stuff... Why didn't I?' "Shit, forgot to start the noodles." The half-elf quickly mixes the batter for the noodles and starts kneading the doughy mixture. He continues doing so whole thinking. 'I know that I should feel bad for these people and I continue to feel their loss. They lost a lot of people, but that means there is a lot of unclaimed valuables throughout the town. Sadao is right, but there is plenty of stuff to go around.' Takumi decides to try something different with the noodle batter and cuts out some larger squares from the flattened dough. 'I've been having trouble talking my way out of things lately... Language is only part of it, maybe there's something else going on.' The cook piles some vegetables onto the squares and folds the dough over creating a pocket of mixed vegetables within the doughy squares. He bakes the squares and begins the meat sauce preparations.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 02/03/2021 00:44
Lyrel slips a few of the more important looking books into his pack. He attempts some small talk with Koide, but finds that her inability to reply without scribing everything quickly frustrates her and so they both fall into silence for the remainder of the time spent in the library. He wishes to catch up and find out everything that she had done since their last time together. He can only imagine her suffering, the lack of connection with not only people but the magic she once possessed at her disposal. He knew magic, it was a part of him and the utter loss of self felt as if it would tear him apart. The fact that she had not yet gone on a rampage showed her restraint.
00:46
The next day he gave Koide the space she seemed to request. He would spend most of the day reading some of the new books he gathered and getting to know his new companions. In spite of being in his books he would occasionally glance up whenever someone entered the room or spoke.
Kyle [Arcadian] 05/03/2021 17:22
The next dawn is met with the weak rays of a distant sun, slowly burning off the fog and cloud that has blanketed Dandong like a shroud for the last few days. Gulls caw overhead and the smell of brine hangs on the air, born by a salty breeze from the north-east. The weather is turning. If Koide's not mistaken, they'll see blue skies by mid-morning. Time to be on their way.
Mike 06/03/2021 17:21
Sadao stretches in the scant morning light, readying himself for travel. After having breakfast, he busies himself just outside of the inn, checking and double checking the contents of his pack to ensure he was ready to go, while Kinoh wanders off to amuse herself in Dandong one last time. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 07/03/2021 23:14
Takumi finishes cooking up breakfast and begins packing away some foodstuffs (cheese, dried meat, bread, nuts, and vegetables) that won't go bad too quickly. He also packs up some essential cooking utensils, the smallest cutting block that he can find, a small pot, a frying pan, a chopping knife, spatula, and ladle. Finding that the cast iron collection is too heavy, he trades the pot and skillet for a single skillet with deep sides. He also decided to leave the cutting block behind. He gathers up the rest of his gear and brings his stuff to the common area before sitting down to eat. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/03/2021 03:18
Ryuzuko has been up for a bit longer than the others, methodically sharpening his odachi on the porch. The dragonborn gives a nod to Sadao as moves around outside the inn. After he has finished honing the blade, he puts it away in its sheath and rests it against the wall next to his pack. He then walks down off the porch before sitting on the ground, legs folded underneath him with his hands on the top of his thighs. The ronin begins to meditate with his eyes closed for quite awhile, taking in the sounds of Dandong. He hears the clangs of Takumi in the kitchen as well as Sadao as he is busy gathering his things together. After almost ten minutes, he opens his arms wide, clapping his scaly hands together twice, keeping his palms together afterwards. The dragonborn bows his torso down, hands still meeting. "ShÅkan..." as the words leave his lips the ground before him begins to become charged with visible static. The grass stands on end and the small stones start to shake as the air charges with some holy power. A few moments later, a bolt of lightning, seemingly from nowhere, crashes into the ground, a front the ronin. With a flash, anyone in sight would be momentarily blinded by the streak of light. As it dissipates, a massive black horse, already harnessed, appears where it struck. Thin streaks of lightning arc about the muscled body of the steed as it moves about, adjusting to the ground beneath it. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/03/2021 03:41
Ryuzuko stands from his bow, grabbing the reins of the beast before stroking its mane. "Vinxa ihk confnir, Tsuruki. Si mi persvek rigluin di dout dastudr ekess assist udoka persvek hesi ossalur." the dragonborn says in draconic with hisses and hard consonants. Tsuruki looks towards the Ronin, almost as if it were speaking to him, "It would be my pleasure, Shochraos. Anything you ask of me, I shall do it to the best of my ability" the steed beats its hooves against the ground, small sparks arcing across the dirt as it does. Ryuzuko then goes to gather his pack and odachi before securing them on the massive creature. He turns to Sadao "All right, we have our horse, now we need a cart to her to pull." he says to the man as he finishes securing his gear. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/03/2021 18:06
Viraj wakes the the next morning and, as the routine has been for the last few days, he begins his day looking for more reagents for his potions. With the lands surrounding the town showing the effects of the creature, The nearby the grassy fields seem to have given up all that they can as his efforts prove to be fruitless in this endeavor. Perhaps further out. But the druid picks up on the changing winds and the sounds of the birds in the nearby bay and decides to call it quits of the day. Things seem to be finally taking a turn for the better. Though empty-handed he wears a smile on his way back to the inn. Finding the dragonborn tending to his new mount, Viraj gives Ryuzuko a nod. "You find yourself a new friend too?" he asks referring the little raccoon-like creature that has been following Sadao recently. (edited)
TheOrsini 09/03/2021 19:47
Koide readied her packs after breakfast. She saw the signs in the sky, and let the others know that the fog would lift today. She scribbled a message to Sadao, who had proven invaluable when dealing with the local folk. 'Sadao-san, could you please look to securing us a cart or wagon for our journey. Let me know if you require coin.' She bowed in silence and smiled upon her rise.
Mike 09/03/2021 21:26
"Yeah," replies Sadao, turning to regard Viraj as he rises to get something to eat. "Her name's Kinoh. She's a spirit given flesh, here to guide me." Remembering who he was talking to, he leaves off there with a knowing smile, as the druid could surely understand the significance. He pauses, then looks around for the tanuki, finally realizing she wandered off while he was packing. "Ugh. Sometimes I wonder if I'm supposed to be guiding her, though." Sadao sits peacefully for a while, finishing off the rice that partially composed his breakfast, while he quietly observes Ryu's meditation. When a bolt of lightning comes crashing down at the dragonborn's call, he flinches, shielding his eyes. He relaxes as he sees that it has summoned a steed, and is glad he finished his food first, as he would've undoubtedly spilled it everywhere. "Heh. Talk about spirits given flesh. Kinoh didn't show up like that, that's for sure." At Ryu and Koide's prompts, he kicks to his feet from where he was sitting, and shakes his clothes clean. "Got it." Taking just his sword and scroll for now, he begins searching through town. Since he figures Han Zheng would be in charge of that sort of thing, he starts in that direction, keeping his eyes peeled, and contacting Kinoh through telepathy when he senses her in range as well. "Hey, don't just go walking off without saying anything. Anyway, have you seen any carts around?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/03/2021 11:08
"Why not one of the abandoned market carts on the square?" Kinoh remarks, her tone making it sound as though it's the most obvious thing in the world.
Mike 10/03/2021 19:02
Sadao blinks, then presses a hand to his head with a grimace. "That's... something we could do, yeah. So long as they're abandoned. Wouldn't want the townsfolk getting the wrong idea... like with Takkun." He looks around the square for one suitable for their needs.
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/03/2021 21:01
There isn't a cart to be found with out some kind of wear or damage. However, enough remain that something serviceable can be cobbled together by cannibalising two or three. (edited)
Mike 11/03/2021 20:00
Sadao calls over the rest of the party, identifying the leftover carts in the square. He joins them in putting together a usable cart.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 11/03/2021 20:03
Lyrel approaches and offer his help in getting the cart in working order. â€I do not have the exceptional skills to do much here, but I will help in any way I can.â€ His Jeâ€™dahnese was heavily accented in his elven and Honmin dialect, but especially for Sadao there were no issues understanding him. â€Sadao-san. I am told that you have the Magisterâ€™s spellbook? Would you be adverse to allowing me to examine it sometime to see if I might be able to copy some of these spells into my own?â€ (edited)
Mike 11/03/2021 21:29
Shaking his hands and original Je'dahnian clothes free of the dirt clinging to the cart, Sadao doesn't notice Lyrel's approach until he begins to speak. All at once, the bard's mannerisms become just a bit more tense than they were minutes ago. "Oh, Tylnier-san. Hey." When the elf makes his request, Sadao seems at first hesitant to answer. He smiles and kneels to dig through his pack, but several things were racing through his head at once: I watched the magister die. Is it right to just hand this off to someone I barely know? He does seem to know what he's talking about... and Koide seems to trust him. Ugh. Maybe too much. They're... pretty close, huh. His thoughts tinged with an ugly streak of jealousy, his hands brush his ko-katana. The bard is struck with inspiration. He looks back to Lyrel. "Yeah, of course Lyrel-sanâ€”if you're alright with my calling you by your first name. But hey, I've got an idea to make this more interesting." He stops digging through his bag (partially an act, the spellbook certainly wasn't hard to find) and rises to his feet. "We've only recently met, so I don't know your fighting style at all yet. It might be easier for us to study these spells and their applications if we work together, yeah? Why don't we start with a due-er, sparring session once we're on the road? Around midday?" With another boyish smile on his face, albeit one a bit more forced, he extends his hand to Lyrel to shake. "After that, we'll at least have an understanding of each other. And you can copy whatever spells you want. However things go, no hard feelings, yeah?"
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 11/03/2021 22:14
Lyrel bows slightly. â€Yes, of course, you may call me Lyrel.â€ He listens intently to the rest and rubs his wrist absently while doing so, completely oblivious to any additional connotations hidden within Sadaoâ€™s words. â€A sparring session would be an excellent way to get to know one another! I have yet to see how you fight, but I can think of no better way to bond with someone than to cross blades with them.â€ He grins widely. â€You honor me with this request, Sadao-San! I would gladly study the spells with you as well. I do not wish to sound covetous with my request. I did not know you were a follow practitioner.â€
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 11/03/2021 22:15
Not one to pass up an opportunity to get his hands a little dirty, Viraj grabs his bag from inside the inn and proceeds to the square to assist with the salvaging of a cart. The former shipwright pulls out his tools and begins cobbling pieces together from the various. After getting a few sideboards hammered back into place, he moves then moves to the wheels. The absence of the noise from the hammering allows him to overhear the discussion of the spellbook between the two men. He stifles a laugh as he detects within Sadoa's challenge what appears to be a grudge against the newcomer. "Before y'all start poking each other, think you two could give me a hand and hold this up while it get this last wheel back on? I figure between the two of you it's something y'all can manage." (edited)
TheOrsini 12/03/2021 01:25
Koide notices the repaired cart as the trio bring it by the inn. She smiles at Sadao. 'He had done an excellent job.' But the warrior noticed the tools that Viraj placed in the back of the cart. Obviously he had been forced to do some repair work. She still found it surprising how well these two groups had formed a team with just a little adversity. Lyrel was with the pair. He probably managed to finally retrieve that spellbook she'd told him of the day prior. 'Still putting things off to the last second.' She was sort of grateful he hadn't changed that much since they last were together. 'Lyrel always came through for her though.' That brought another smile to her face. Something about the injury had changed her. She was enjoying what she had. 'Maybe losing something precious had finally gave her clarity in what was important?' She lifted the bundle of her gear into the back of the cart, placing them next to the growing pile of items. She had considered disassembling the alchemy lab and placing it in the chest wrapped in clothing, but she had been happy to have it available when she was there, and didn't want to strip it from the town's meager reserves. She had needs, but that lab was not one of them. Besides it would be too easy to damage on the trip. She headed back inside the inn to retrieve the chest and the rest of her effects.
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/03/2021 22:57
Once Tsuruki is hitched up to the cart, the band of warriors head out west, waving a last goodbye to a few of the townsfolk who come out to see them off as they go. It's fair day and while it certainly isn't warm, the weather is relatively mild, compared to what they've had to deal with for the last week. The morning leg of travel will be roughly four hours before they break for lunch, but the land is at least flat and the road well trodden enough to cause the cart no trouble.
Dandiil {Takumi} 14/03/2021 08:17
Taking to the road is easier for Takumi, now that his gear is sitting on the cart. He continues on in silence for the first hour or so before approaching Sadao. "I have a few problems..." The half-elf appears genuinely distressed, but his voice is more than a whisper but not quite his normal boisterous speech. "I know that my actions in town caused you a bit of trouble, but they trouble me even more. I'm starting to think that the battles have dulled me a little more than should be normal. First thing... I don't usually get caught when I'm scavenging lost buildings. And number two... I had feelings for these people... Sure they've been through some tawagoto, but the things aren't the important part to people that have been through that stuff. Finally... I can always talk or manipulate my way out of anything. I've always had the silver tongue, but it appears that's gone... Do you think it has something to do with the mental scrambling of that creature?" (edited)
Mike 14/03/2021 16:17
"Well, uh..." Sadao was loathe to admit it, but he was having a difficult time remembering just how good Takumi's gift of gab was before they encountered the hydra. Either way, he felt that the sorcerer's actions absolutely weren't doing him any favors. And his casual talk of manipulation caused him to raise an eyebrow, but perhaps that was the hydra's fault as well, skewing his mental priorities? "Y-Yeah, what it was doing to our heads might've had something to do with it. But... how do I say this? It's not just about getting caught or talking your way out of it, it's about the reason you're doing it in the first place, too. Like... if you really have feelings for them, you'd figure they need every bit of material goods they can get to dig themselves out of this. And besides that, some of them might really be attached to the items left, because that's all they have left of their old lives." There's a pregnant pause as Sadao looks away, thinking over how best to phrase things to him without it coming off as a lecture. He then begins gesticulating as he begins an example. "Say, for instance, you lost something dear to you, but were charmed to forget its existence. By the time the charm wears off, it turns out someone else made off with it. You'd still feel really strongly about it! I think those feelings should be respected, if you care for someone."
Dandiil {Takumi} 16/03/2021 20:31
Takumi's thoughts go a thousand different directions at once, 'should any of that matter?' The half-elf decides to take a different route. "So... If we confront some bandits or something... We leave them their stuff after we destroy them? That doesn't make sense, even if they were only doing it to feed their family. The family is going to miss those things, should we care? We come across an overturned carriage, the driver died in the accident... you think we should just leave whatever is within behind? The gone are gone, their unclaimed stuff shouldn't just sit there. My problem is, why was I unwilling to take it? I didn't care about these people, I did 'feel' for them from the beginning. They also have helped me to help the group..." His voice trails for a moment... "Thank you Sadao, I think I understand what you mean. I won't let that happen to me again." A smile appears on Takumi's face for the first time since the incident with the old man.
Mike 17/03/2021 02:50
"Heh, glad to help." Sadao scratches the back of his head with hesitant laughter. It seemed like he was getting through to him, so he considered it a success. But then again, whether or not Takumi did have any further plans of mischief, it wasn't Sadao's focus at the moment. Because the time was just about right... "Oi, Ryu-kun! Don't you think it's time to give Tsuruki a break? We could have some lunch and stretch our legs." He catches Lyrel's eye and nods. "Have some time to practice, too, yeah?"
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 17/03/2021 14:10
Lyrel looks over to Sadao from where he was taking a drink feom his waterskin and grins. â€Yes, I would enjoy some practice! It will be good to stretch my muscles after so many days on the road and to warm the blood. This cold makes for miserable travel.â€ He stands and takes a moment to loosen his shoulders and joints as he draws out a beautiful, two-handed blade of exquisite beauty. The blade is clearly very old and topped with a clear, if slightly rough-cut blue gemstone. â€Your lead.â€ He nods.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/03/2021 14:18

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/03/2021 15:58
With the stop for a midday meal, Viraj takes some time to inspect the cart. Satisfied that it appears to be holding up well, he finds a spot under a tree to eat his ration and watch the sparring session that's about to commence. "You two are determined, huh?" he says after tearing off a bit of dried meat with his teeth. "Well, don't hold back. I'll heal up any wounds if you manage to deal any out," he adds with a chuckle, thinking that outcome unlikely. (edited)
Mike 17/03/2021 16:35
Sadao nods, walking over to the other side of the clearing, and drawing his own blade, short in length, but remarkable in its newness and light weight. Although his aims have been less than noble thus far, he makes a mental note to favor the blunt edge, heeding Viraj's offer. All is quiet for a few moments, as he watches the elf's movements. But his eyes dart away on occasion to check if 'she' is watching. "Okay... go!"
Mike 17/03/2021 16:53
As soon as he calls his warning, Sadao begins the melee far more aggressively than he would normally, closing the gap as quickly as possible and making a rather reckless series of swings at Lyrel.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 17/03/2021 17:19
Lyrel taps his ancient runeblade to his forehead as the hitherto simple runes near the base of blade suddenly blaze with a deep blue color. In much the manner Lyrel expected, Sadao threw himself headlong into the match. He dodges easily around the shorter blade and follows up with rapid strike with the blunt back of the blade to Sadaoâ€™s shoulder. The blow was painful and would likely bruise, but nothing dangerous. â€Too quick. You should always take a moment to watch your opponent and learn their ways.â€
Mike 17/03/2021 19:54
Sadao staggers backwards at the jab to his shoulder, letting out a grunt. Too pained to think up a retort, he settles for following the elf's advice; watching his movements as he returned to a neutral stance. He pauses, looking for a more opportune moment. He feints left, before sweeping forward with a blunt strike once he thinks Lyrel's guard is focused the wrong direction.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 17/03/2021 20:33
Lyrel shifts his stance slightly in response to Sadaoâ€™s own adjustment. Thinking the young man would potentially move into a bit more defensive posture, Lyrel moves to feint towards the right just as Sadao also feints his own movement and the two warriors suddenly find themselves coming directly at each other with blades already arcing towards one another. Both weapons impact with a heavy thud as metal met flesh, but whereas Sadaoâ€™s edge collided with Lyrelâ€™s bicep, DÅngfÄ“ng slammed into the side of Sadaoâ€™s head just as he ducked low. What would have been a lesser blow sent him staggeringâ€¦ Lyrel immediately disengages with a concerned look.â€Sadao-san! Are you alright?â€
Mike 17/03/2021 21:25
Not realizing his mistake, Sadao lands the hit. Yes! he thinks, just as something hits his temple from the side. He backs away a couple steps, the world spinning around him, before falling backwards, unable to stand. His consciousness returns just a few moments later, with a killer headache. Is this what a hangover is like? he wonders absentmindedly, sprawled out on the grass, before remembering why he was there. ...Crap. He pulls himself up to a seated position, rubbing his head. "Uh, yeah. I'm okay. You're uh... you're pretty good." He winces, less from the pain, but more from embarrassment, as he looks back towards the other members of the party. Kinoh is making a repetitive wheezing sort of noise, and rolling around in the grass, much to his chagrin. "Amazing fainting technique! That's why I admire you Sadao! You should offer to be raggedy-girl's practice dummy!"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/03/2021 21:49
Viraj jumps to his feet as Sadao staggers back from the strike. "Ha HA!! Looks like you got your bell rung pretty good there!" he says approaching the combatants with a piece of of the jerked meat sticking out from the corner of his mouth. "Alcoal foiee." The fiery spirit appears and surrounds Sadao to ease the physical wounds, however the druid knows that the Sadao will have to tend to his own hurt pride after that sound defeat. "That was quick work. You're pretty deadly with that blade," he says , impressed with Lyrel's skill. He moves the healing flames over the bladesinger when it appears that they can do no more for Sadao. (edited)
TheOrsini 17/03/2021 22:26
Koide watches silently, but even during the duel she found herself keeping a firm eye on Sadao. She had seen Lyrel's technique many times, and knew he would outmatch the bard in straight fight. What she had not expected is for Sadao to give him a straight fight. 'What was his game here,' she brought herself to question. Strangely she had a defensive urge to challenge Lyrel to a spar, but she suppressed it. She looks knowingly to her fellow Watchman, but let's it go.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 17/03/2021 23:06
Lyrel sheathes his blade and walks over, offering his hand to Sadao. â€You honor me with your kind words, Sadao-San. Let me help you.â€ If allowed he will help pull the young human to his feet. â€I can teach you if ever you find yourself interested in advanced sword fighting techniques. It is my favorite thing. The weight of a sword in your hand, the whistle of a blade slicing through the air. Some paint, others write, some sing.â€ He gives Sadao a knowing smile. â€Me? I write poetry with my weapons.â€ He nods to Koide as he catches her eye. â€Now, let us eat!â€ He gratefully accepts the refreshing energy from Viraj. â€This is a very handy skill you know! That is something I have never been good atâ€¦ healing. There is balance in this as in all things. My hands kill, they cannot heal the wounds DÅngfÄ“ng leaves behind. Much to my sadness at times.â€
Mike 17/03/2021 23:22
The combined heat from his flushed cheeks and the healing flame makes Sadao's head swim, though in a much more pleasant manner than several seconds ago. He rises to his feet, knocking the dirt from his clothes. He still felt that nagging bit of jealousy, but at the moment, it was suppressed by a greater amount of newfound respect for Lyrel. It was now (painfully) clear that he wasn't all talk. He wondered just how much easier the battle against the hydra would've gone with him there. "Oh, yeah. Here." The bard walks over to his pack and withdraws the spellbook instantly, with no fumbling around. He hands it to the victor. "After a display of might and magic like that, I'd be a fool not to entrust you with it." He folds his hands behind his head as the pain subsided. "Like I said, I'd be interested in studying it with you... though, to be honest, my magic surfaces in different ways. I don't know if I can actually use some of the techniques the magister wrote in there." He laughs, with a genuine smile. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 18/03/2021 20:39

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/03/2021 04:41
Ryuzuko watches intently on the duel, noting both Sadao, and most importantly, Lyrel's, footwork and Kenjutsu. TheOrsini 21/03/2021 05:38
As the group begins to pack up for the trip north and west, Koide locks eyes with Lyrel. The hunter draws two fingers together to her eyes, salutes with the hand coming down to her knee, and then a thrust of the hand outward towards the continuing road - finishing the sign to Lyrel, letting him know that she will scout ahead. It was one of the few niceties of having another of the Watch here; she could use their signals with having to say 'or write' anything. She pulls her bow out of the back of the wagon, placing the staff between her feet and bending the arching branch as she draws the bow string up from the ground and seats it. Koide slowly lets the tension take hold, making certain that the string is set in place. Satisfied, she lets the bow settle to the crook of her arm as she retrieves and fastens the belt quiver around her midsection, adjusting it for the clearance of her katana's suba. She nods to the dragonborn and her sorcerous cohort as she paces ahead, opening her senses to the surround. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/03/2021 10:10
As Koide scouts ahead of the party, she spots a riderless grey horse grazing on a field near the road. It's saddled and laden with bags, but there's no rider in sight.
TheOrsini 21/03/2021 12:23
She notices the horse in the field, but perhaps the paranoia from the creature in town or the encounters with bandits along the road in the past have her wary. She slinks along a couple of the hedge rows and slowly circles the horse as the party closes down the road. 'It appears clear.' Koide decides for herself. Quietly she slings the bow over her shoulder to let her hands free. Slowly, she approaches the animal, letting it see her hands, smell her presence, and making calm motions. If she had been able to speak she would have tried talking softly, but instead didn't risk any of her ragged twinges from her ruined vocal chords. As she gets near, she visually inspects the gear laden upon the horse in more detail. And finally rests her hand against the neck of the animal in a soft caress.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 21/03/2021 17:22
Lyrel nods as he takes a look around the area while Koide goes off scouting.
TheOrsini 21/03/2021 18:41
With the animal at rest, she looks the saddle and its contents over. It reminded her of some of the tools of her own trade. Koide notices several what she assumes as potion bottles, and she pulls one from the bag to glance at it through the sunlight. She watches for distilled ingredients in the liquid trying to determine their content.
TheOrsini 21/03/2021 19:24
'Alchemical silver?' Koide found it odd that such a tailored kit would be strikingly similar to one for the Watch. She immediately had the urge to find the horse's rider. He could be fallen nearby, needing help. Or if the horse's fatigue could be any indication, passed out from exhaustion. Koide looks to the ground, but decides that she can come back to follow the path. She tries to lead the horse back to the group on the road. It had been too long since she had checked in, and she could use the extra eyes on this. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/03/2021 19:42
As Koide approach with the tired horse in tow, Viraj takes a moment to commune with the spirits of nature and attune himself to speak with with the beast. He moves toward the pair, pulling up a tuft of the newly green grass that has appeared through the early spring. He offers the sweet blades of green as a treat for the horse and slowly steps in front of the animal. The druid begins to speak in the language that was taught to him by his mentor, Natsuko. "Easy there, friend. Looks like you have been working hard. Where's your master?" (edited)
Mike 21/03/2021 19:58
Sadao raises an eyebrow at the signal Koide gives Lyrel, not understanding. As she readies her bow, then hurries ahead, he catches wise to its significance. She's going to scout ahead. He ingrains the gesture in his memory. As she leaves, he remains with the cart for a while, watching their surroundings carefully, until she returns with the horse. He eyes the animal with interest as Viraj performs a ritual, before speaking to it in an ancient-sounding tongue. He stands by with rapt attention to watch this; he had a love for nature himself, but it clearly paled in comparison to Viraj's knowledge and abilities. Kinoh observes the proceedings from the rear of the cart, comfortable where she is.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/03/2021 20:56
The horse tosses its head in surprise when the human before it speaks in words that the beast can understand. "No, no," it begins, shaking its head in distress, "don't bring back the darkness."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/03/2021 15:16
"Darkness," Viraj repeats in Je'dahnian. He strokes the side of the animal's neck. "Did your rider turn into this darkness? Have you been running from them?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/03/2021 15:20
The horses shakes its head again, but slowly begins to calm in response to Viraj's touch. "Mistress was taken by the darkness."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/03/2021 15:27
Viraj's face hardens at this news. "How long ago...? How many times has the sun crossed the sky since she was taken?" he adds trying to find a way for the beast to understand the concept of time. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/03/2021 22:39
"...more than legs on horse," the beast manages, with difficulty.
Dandiil {Takumi} 24/03/2021 00:58
Takumi watches with awe... 'That is amazing' "Is Viraj actually talking to that horse? I wonder if I can learn to do that... He's like a Horse Whisperer or something. Can you imagine what it would be like to talk to animals? Training them would be a cinch. I wonder if he'll help me train a wolf or something." Takumi's eyes light up a little at the prospect of having an awesomely smart pet.
TheOrsini 24/03/2021 01:27
Koide listened to Takumi. She pursed her lips in frustration hearing her friend, showing his true age. Rearing a wolf pup was the only way to truly train them in the way he described. Sure you could enslave the animal with magic, but that wasn't a companion. You could possibly break a wolf with time, but it could always go feral at inopportune moment. 'He'd be better off with a dog.' she thinks to herself, but she feigns support placing her hand on his shoulder and giving a half-hearted smile. An old staple for herself. 'Maybe she could learn sign language.' Of course, then someone else would need to as well, and they didn't have time for that. She looked at Viraj communing with the horse, wondering what they were saying. 'Why would the magic allow the druid to speak with an effectively dumb animal, but she was struck silent. There had to be some form of mental magic that would make this easier. It was hard to imagine that the horse's tongue clicks, whistles, and neighs from the creature to form words and language. Sure, they were smart enough to understand the tones and inflections of words from a rider, and they communicate emotion well enough. Koide had always assumed that a horse neighing in fear just passed the emotion on to other horses. She lets her thoughts come back to Takumi. With her sorcerous companion looking at her, she tries to communicate with her hands. She pulls out her small coin purse in her off-hand and points to the ground showing 4 fingers like legs with her hand and shifting it to a wolf's silent howl. She then mimed paying coin with her purse, and pointed around. Suggesting that he buy a tamed wolf instead. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 24/03/2021 02:47
"yeah, that's true. Sure, I could buy one ..." he stops for a moment, feeling at his throat... "Shhhhuuure" another look of excitement crosses his face as he starts making other sounds while touching his miniature adam's apple. "Shhhh... ssssss... Tuht.... aaaah" he shakes his head a little then continues by pursing his lips together and popping them apart making a "Bah" sound, and continues to do so for a few moments sounding out each letter, replacing clicks and whistles in a few spots. "I think you may be able to speak... kind of, and it'll give your voice a chance to return... maybe, with a little practice, you can talk again!!! I'm sure vowel sounds and 'mmm' and 'nnn' are gonna be the first things you get back, too since they don't put too much strain on your throat..." Takumi's bright face looks back down at the ground, "I may be wrong, but please try... Start with 'T' or 'D' and 'K' and 'S'... How about you try to say Sake... please, Lady Koide?" The half-elf looks up expectantly in the hopes that he is right about her injury.
TheOrsini 24/03/2021 02:50
Koide let's a slow shallow sigh, but lets her lips grow into a more genuine smile and nods in agreement. 'What could it hurt?' She tries to say the word. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 24/03/2021 05:31
Viraj gives the beast another reassuring pat. "Rest easy now, friend. My friends here have been summoned to this land to look into this problem. Thank you, umm... What should we call you?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/03/2021 21:37
''Mistress calls me Tanpo," the horse brays, now more happily. The beast trots over towards Koide and nuzzles affectionately at her ear.
TheOrsini 24/03/2021 22:32
Koide welcomes the distraction and returns the animals affection, certain that the creature was uneased by talking to a person, most likely for the first time.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/03/2021 02:07
Viraj mouths the name without sound trying to place where he knows it. "Hah!" he shouts in recognition when the horse goes back to Koide. "It seems the creature's effects still linger," he say to the huntress with a grin. "I believe this here is your missing Tanpo." "More reason to be at ease," he says to Tanpo. "We have dealt with the darkness that stole her from you." (edited)
TheOrsini 25/03/2021 02:15
'Tanpo?' This horse was her porter? There had been a man with them. Horses didn't drink tea or sharpen swords. 'Who the hell had the man been? Fucking hydra.' All these thoughts rushed through her head, but they were drawn out with the joy of new memories of her horse Tanpo, and the dangers they had faced together. She hugs the horses neck gently with the growing joy. 'Maybe it would remember her too.' She desired to speak to her horse, desperately and then realized, like Lyrel, she needed to let him know about her voice. She points to Viraj and then mocks talking and then to her throat and the horse, asking for him to tell the horse. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/03/2021 03:13
"Of course," Viraj gives a nod of understanding to Koide. "Your brave mistress here was hurt in the fight against the creature that made the darkness come," the druid begins. "And she cannot speak until we find someone who can heal her and give her voice back." The man rubs his own throat in sympathy then takes a drink from his water skin.
Dandiil {Takumi} 25/03/2021 04:02
Koide's voice did make the sounds... Kind of, though it came out as a drawn out 'sss' with a harsh 'keh' sound, it was definitely a start... Takumi smiles at the accomplishment, happy for Lady Koide's success. When Viraj mentions the horse's name, Takumi's recollection returned en force.... "Ohh, Tanpo!!" He wasn't as excited to see the horse as Koide was... something else is wrong... "My memory is still a bit fuzzy, Who was the other guy then? The one that used to help with the bags..."
TheOrsini 25/03/2021 04:04
Koide nods and pats the horse on the neck. She relaxes for a minute while the druid continues his conversation with Tanpo. 'Well that explained why the kit was so familiar. It's mine.' She thinks back to the man that accompanied them, trying to remember a name, but she comes up with a blank. 'The creature was gonna live on menacing the past for a good long while.' (edited)
Mike 25/03/2021 05:41
Sadao perks up when he hears the name. "Tanpo?" He hops down from the cart and approaches the horse, outstretching his palm carefully to give his mane a rub. "Ha, my memories're way too messed up if I got him and a person confused. Sorry we forgot about you, boy." After happily petting Tanpo, he steps back, leaving him to Koide. The bard then crosses his arms and closes his eyes in thought. "...Was there another guy? I'm just not sure." Scratching his head with a shrug, he gives up the effort. "Hopefully, he made it out okay, too."
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/03/2021 10:07
The horse stamps its hooves in disagreement. "No. Mistress spoke. Mistress was taken." It sniffs at Koide in confusion.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/03/2021 16:32
"Oh... I'm sorry," Viraj says to Tanpo, scratching his head in his own confusion. "The creature we fought messed up our minds some, so I must be thinking of someone else. What did others call your mistress?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/03/2021 22:55
"What others?" The horse asks with a puzzled tilt of its head. "Mistress works alone."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/03/2021 23:53
"Any other creatures like me - humans." Viraj gives a sigh remembering that communicating with animals had a different set of challenges.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/03/2021 23:56
The horse shakes its head again and chews on a nearby tuft of grass.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 26/03/2021 00:38
Viraj let's the ability to talk with the horse wane. He strokes the animal along it's back as it eats. "Well... If this is your Tanpo he seems not to remeber you either," he says to Koide. "He said he lost his mistress to some darkness more than a few days ago." (edited)
TheOrsini 26/03/2021 02:34
It was starting to make more sense. Koide didn't remember having a horse on the boat ride to Dandong.
TheOrsini 27/03/2021 02:40
She pets the animal once more with less love but more comforting friendliness, and let's out an exasperated sigh. She steps away from the animal, walks over to Sadao. Her emotions had been all over the place since the monster in the caves. If the creature could implant false memories... 'Maybe there was no boat? Or these people could be strangers... or...' No. There were enough parts that fit in her memory well enough. She remembered Lyrel, and Takumi was one of her closest companions. 'So maybe the horse was just named Tanpo. In such a case...' Koide left the druid and the horse speaking on the road with the others. She retuned to where she had found the horse, and decided to look for tracks - of horse or man or else. She could try to get to the bottom of this confusion in her own way. Going with what years of training and instinct pushed her to follow. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/03/2021 03:35
Ryuz sits off to the side, equally confused as the rest of his companions.
TheOrsini 27/03/2021 07:03
Koide eliminates her own tracks and the grazing footprints the wandering horse, finally noticing the source of the horse's journey. It might be too far to be off on her own without her magics, so she quickly heads back to the group making a mental note of the trail. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 27/03/2021 07:08
Takumi takes note of the group and sees that Koide may be eager to go off on her own. When she returns, his youthful exuberance is evident... Yet again. "Did you find something? You kind of seemed excited about something... Maybe it was just me, but you seem like you wanna go somewhere."
Mike 27/03/2021 07:16
As Viraj explains the horse's contrasting thoughts in greater detail and Koide steps back from it, seemingly lost in thought, Sadao reconsiders. No, we came here on a boat, we couldn't have had a horse... What am I thinking? Sadao couldn't help feeling like the hydra was getting the last laugh from whatever realm its soul was in now. As Koide breezes by him with purposeful steps, he tries to think of something reassuring to say, only to come up with nothing. Instead he can only smile awkwardly for the moment, before cursing under his breath once she's out of earshot. Great insight. When she returns, seeming ready to do something, the bard has an epiphany. "Oh..." He brings two fingers to his eyes, brings his palm down to his knee, then thrusts outward toward the western direction she came from. Scouting that way. "Right?"
TheOrsini 27/03/2021 07:26
Koide gives him a smile and a knowing nod. Sadao's interest and observation caught her a bit by surprise, and made her reconsider what she was going to ask. She points to Sadao and then to Takumi knowing of her traveling companion's expertise. She points to her weapon, and taps her palm against it as if demonstrating it was attached, and then motions to leave any packs by miming taking off a backpack. 'This should be quick and quiet. They needed to travel light.' She looks to the both of the and lowers her hand to the ground and raises a finger to her lips as if to shh someone. She looks questioning waiting for a reply from the two of them. (edited)
Mike 27/03/2021 07:41
Sadao nods, and leaves his pack aside. He now has only the essentials: his sword, bow, quiver, and scroll. Just one more thing. He pinches his fingers to his lips and gives a short, sharp whistle. Kinoh glances over, realizing it was for her, and hops down from the cart, lazily trotting over. "Time to earn your keep." "Certainly. You need a chaperone, after all..." replies the canine, baring her fangs with a yawn. Set to go, he begins westward once Takumi is ready as well, tanuki in tow. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 27/03/2021 09:12
Takumi leaves his staff with his pack and cart, packing the crossbow instead for this little expedition. He moves on to Sadao and Koide. "Ok, I'm ready' He follows Lady Koide and Sadao... Not exactly sure what he's going out there for, only that Lady Koide wants some assistance.
TheOrsini 27/03/2021 09:38
Koide looks to the others at the cart and just gives a nod to Lyrel, as she leads the three of them to return across into the field as the huntress begins to follow the troubled horse's hoofprints. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 29/03/2021 23:21
The hoofprints roam in circles across roughly an acre of land going back several days. The horse fed, walked and slept. It isn't until Koide comes across tracks that are several days old that she finds a trail that came from the west. (edited)
TheOrsini 30/03/2021 01:39
Koide points at the eastward set of tracks. Trying to emphasis their importance to the others.
Mike 30/03/2021 02:46
Sadao focuses on the tracks Koide pointed out. "Okay, maybe this'll lead us to his real mistress." He gestures for Kinoh to get out in front as he begins to follow the tracks. As he walks, he can't help but wonder at the odds. A lone woman about Hong territory. Could it be Mother? He recalls the equipment they found on Tanpo's saddle and sighs, realizing that couldn't be the case. The chances of a Hong-Je'dahnian noblewoman turning to undead hunting in her spare time were slim indeed. But whoever this was had to be a person of interest, and regardless, she was undoubtedly in danger. He presses on, quickening his pace.
Dandiil {Takumi} 30/03/2021 05:14
Takumi considers Koide's gestures and Sadao's words... "Isn't that the way we came from? I mean not directly, but in general. Doesn't that lead back to the coast, and Dandong? Lady Koide, If you want to check it out further and faster, I can help you ride the wind for a bit... I mean, if that's what you want to do, but we can take the ground route or we could go back if your questions were answered... It's safe to say that it's not your Tanpo..."
Mike 30/03/2021 06:46
"Er, not those tracks Takkun, those ones over there. Leading west." Sadao points out for the sorcerer as he hears his confusion. He throws Koide a look, like he's stifling a laugh, and jokes. "I take it between the two of you, you were more the navigator before I joined up?"
Dandiil {Takumi} 30/03/2021 07:10
Takumi feigns a defensive posture, and walks around the area making gestures toward the sky and surroundings "All these trees look the same... I can't tell where anything is without the tower or castle or actual proper landmarks.... But I won't get lost in any village, town, or city. That much I can promise." The half-elf finishes his posturing and looks to Koide. "If you'd like to ride the sky, the offer is still open."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 30/03/2021 17:51
Lyrel spent sometime looking over the horseâ€™s accoutrements while Viraj spoke with the beast. He indicates the gold-tipped rods with an off-handed gesture. â€These are sunrods, alchemical devices that allow you a period of light when you strike the gold tip upon a hard surface.â€ He listens intently to the talk about porters and Tanpos among the jumble of other oddities that the others speak about with a frown. â€™This monster must have really wreaked havoc upon their minds. It is any wonder that they even recall themselves or even me for that matter.â€™ He glances at Koide. â€I will join you in following the tracks.â€ He checks that his blade is secure in its sheath as he follows behind , exceptionally silent. (edited)
TheOrsini 31/03/2021 01:35
Koide smiles at her friend's words. 'He wasn't 'likely' to get lost.' She had yet to ever become lost - part of the magic in her training. Her sense of direction was unerring, as far as she knew. She had never been comfortable with flying. The ground had its benefits. And she wouldn't be able track from such a height. She shakes her head at her Takumi's offer, patting him on the shoulder. Her eyes pass to Sadao with a smile and then to Lyrel. She wave them onward. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 31/03/2021 04:32
Takumi nods at the decline, "ok, I'm going to fly up and take a look around. I've never done this before, but I figured it out after the powder barrels" Takumi has another look of excitement on his face as he takes a Jay feather from his pouch. "I have to push the wind up beneath myself, to lift myself off the ground, and then I can fly like a bird!" He takes the feather and brushes it across his chest as he utters "Sora ni tsureteitte" The air begins to whip wildly around him, lifting him off the ground. He laughs ecstatically as he feels the exhilaration of the wind through his cloak. After the initial excitement, he returns to the business at hand. He rises into the air cresting the treetops and looks in the direction of the sea, then to where Ryu and Viraj waited patiently, and finally he turns to the west, seeking signs of civilization. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/04/2021 08:25
From his vantage point up high, Takumi can see that the landscape is littered with isolated farms at regular intervals, but there are no major settlements in any direction as far as the eye can see.
Dandiil {Takumi} 01/04/2021 09:37
Takumi drops back to Koide and sets his feet on the ground for a moment to relay the information. "There isn't much out there, just some houses and fields that look like lines. Flying is so much fun, you should try it next time, I can kinda see Ryu back there. I don't see any towns or villages. Do you want me to go back and let them know what's going on?" When Koide responds, Takumi will take back to the sky.
TheOrsini 01/04/2021 13:20
Koide waves him on. As he ascends into the sky again, she looks to Lyrel and the last person she had flown with. She gives him a half bemused smirk and then shakes her head. Takumi was write this would probably lead on for a good while, and they might as well not lose too much time on the road, but she was worried about her group being spread to thin. Banditry would not be unlikely for the area soon, especially with the new released peoples of Dandong deciding if they would continue on in the town. She tries to show Sadao a few of the ways to look for the tracks, not as any formal training but at least to ensure he was mildly familiar with the subject.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/04/2021 10:05
The horse's trail meanders on west across fields for several miles. It never returns to the road, but does run roughly parallel to it.
Dandiil {Takumi} 04/04/2021 01:42
Takumi flies back and forth between the parties, gleefully laughing and enjoying the wind against his face. "Ryuz, Viraj!! They're this way. Come on, it's not far from the road." He keeps flying, renewing the effect as needed, so they can follow his constant motion throughout the day.
TheOrsini 04/04/2021 01:51
They follow the horse's trail westward for the rest of the day. Before dusk, Koide looks for a place that her and her companions can make camp for the night.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 04/04/2021 04:36
As Koide and the others go ranging off after the trail of the horse, Viraj takes another moment to cast his spell to speak with the horse again. He turns to Tanpo and hoists himself up into the saddle. "Okay, Tanpo... looks like we're going to try to track down your mistress," Giving the horse a nudge with his heels, he urges the animal slowly along to follow behind the scouting party. "We'll just hang back here in case the darkness comes again and my friends up there will keep it from you." The druid gives the horse a reassuring pat on the neck as they trot through the field.
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/04/2021 14:06
Tanpo neighs affectionately and canters off after the rest of the party. Along with Ryu's steed and the cart, Koide guides her companions in retracing Tanpo's steps for another four hours, until the rising moon begins to occlude the sun, bringing dusk to southern Hong. Venturing ahead once more, the Je'dahnian witcher goes in search of an appropriate place to make camp for the night. (edited)
TheOrsini 08/04/2021 02:04
The hunter finds an unusually secluded glade in a copse of woods that forms a part of one of the strips of trees running between the outer edges of two farms. The branches of the larch trees weave a thick cocoon, hiding the clearing from view. She directs her companions into the copse to set up camp. 'One way in, and out.' she thinks to herself, 'that should make the watches easier.'
Mike 08/04/2021 15:52
Sadao slips into the copse, holding onto a higher branch and swinging his lower body through a gap, twisting as he does so. The act (and perfectly secluded nature of the location) evoked especially strong memories of finding secret natural hideaways as a child, bringing a smile to his face. "Nice find." He says to Koide, as he helps to set up camp.
Dandiil {Takumi} 09/04/2021 04:20
Takumi flies back to Ryuz and Viraj for the last time. Dropping to the ground for a moment. "Lady Koide found a great camping spot. Underneath the trees. It's pretty well hidden, but I'll help you spot it... Keep an eye on me, I'll wave from directly above the little hideaway." He flies back up, heading toward the copse, turns to look at Ryuz and Viraj. Hands waving in the air as he sinks to the ground
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/04/2021 04:23
Viraj follows Takumi's guidance into the glade. He hops from Tanpo to avoid the branches as the trees push in on them and leads the horse on foot the rest of the way to the campsite. "This'll do nicely," he says after securing the reins to one of the trees across for where they entered. The large Rajani man then takes a moment to work out some of the soreness of the day's ride before making some preparations to camp for the evening.
TheOrsini 09/04/2021 04:33
Koide takes the time to use the copse to set up a lean to shelter out with her rope. She avoid cutting the rope and instead just winds the rope with the multiple knots before weaving branches and piling on leaves along the slope. 'Was it necessary?' She thought for a good minute. 'No,' she mused, but it was good to stay in practice. And it kept her too busy to give in to worry about practicing with her sword.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 09/04/2021 04:42
As Ryuz enters the copse, various branches and twigs crack and break, just from his sheer size and weight of his equipment. He looks to the group and shrugs. "Not much I could do, small glade, big dragonborn." Turning back to the opening he created, various parts of the brush smashed aside and dangling, "At least we won't have to worry about making more noise as we leave." The clattering ronin chooses a soft spot of moss, planting his pack next to a tree. Tsuruki lays down beside it, neighing in a way as if she laughing at her master before she gets a glare from him and stops. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 09/04/2021 15:31
Takumi steps into the glade after everyone arrives and collects his bag from the cart. "Well, this will be the last of the noodles." He says as he pulls out some dried pork and vegetables. He sets his pan on the fire and commences to make a simple meal. He continues talking as if someone was listening. "All that flying around was a little exhausting, I don't think I'll be doing an all-day flight again. It was so much fun, though. The wind through my hair, the sun on my back. Looking below to see the world through the eyes of a bird. It was most exhilarating." He finishes up the food, leaving it in his pan to allow the crew to get their own bowl. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 09/04/2021 22:22
As the small group gets comfortable in their camping site, Lyrel walks up to the main entryway into their clearing as he examines the overall size. After a moment he begins to speak some arcane words as he reaches down to the large blue gem upon the pommel of his blade. He seems to be pinch the top of the gem and draw a silvery substance, much like spider silk, from the gem. He stretches the thread out and seems to attach it a branch a few feet to one side of the opening. He spends a moment walking around a 20â€™ cube, attaching the â€˜threadâ€™ to four points before closing the connection and watching with a smile as the thread disappears. â€We will now have an alarm should anyone other than one of us enter this area. You will all hear the sound of bells. It will be loud enough to wake you. Should you hear that sound, know that someone has infiltrated our camp. You all my come and go as you please though. This will last for 8 hours, but I will renew it just before the end of my watch to ensure we have covered the entire night.â€ He takes a seat near Takumi as he begins to prepare their meal. â€That was exceptional, watching your form today in the air. I hope to one day learn such magics myself.â€ He smiles before nodding to the pan. â€What is to be our fare for this evening?â€
TheOrsini 10/04/2021 05:18
Koide lays an appreciative hand on Lyrel's shoulder. Make a sign of thanks to the hunter. And then goes over to drag a fallen log toward the fire pit to sit upon. It looks like there is room for another on the large bench.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 10/04/2021 05:35
Viraj finishes burrying the last of his four torches at the edges of the clearing before wandering off into the trees. The others can hear a series of thwaks as the druid finds a suitable tree to turn into firewood. He soon returns and deposits and armful of small logs in the center of their campsite and begins to build the fire for Takumi to prepare the evening's meal on. With a few words in druidic the fire springs to life, giving off numerous crackles and pops as the wood begins to burn. "That's a shame," Viraj replies to their cook on the topic of this being the last night of decent food. "I've got a handful of rations that should hopefully be enough to get us to the next stop. If it comes to it, I know a way to get us by on a handful of berries." (edited)
TheOrsini 10/04/2021 05:39
Trying to comfort Viraj's concern, Koide points across the clearing to her lean to and the unstrung bow leaving against it. She then mocks drawing a bow and letting an arrow fly and then carrying something heavy on her back, finishing with a shrug. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 10/04/2021 05:48
Viraj nods at the ranger. "Yes. The land can provide us some provisions as well. I'm sure we will be able to make do until the next town." While waiting for the meal to cook, the man lies back with his hands under his head looking up to the stars and moon overhead. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 11/04/2021 03:40
Takumi chuckles while preparing the meal. "Yes, there have been times that I was without food. I am so used to scavenging a weeks worth for me and pops, I didn't think to grab extra for the party." He lifts his bag from the ground beside him... "I have enough eggs for tomorrow's breakfast..." He looks in as a substance leaks from the seams... "Or not" he distastefully says as he reaches in and pulls a broken eggshell from the bottom. "I guess it's nuts and berries from now on... I'm out."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 16/04/2021 18:55
Viraj slowly scrapes himself from the ground - the day long ride of being jostled on horseback being something the older Rajani man hasn't been accustom to, and wanders over to retrieve his meal from Takumi. "You have spoiled us these past few days with your cooking," he says taking his bowl and then finding a seat near Ryuzuko. As he slurps his noodles, he gives the dragonborn a nudge with his elbow. "How about you help me work out some of this soreness from the long ride after we finish up with our meal here..?" (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 17/04/2021 17:43
"What did you have in mind?" Ryuzuko asks of the druid as he finishes his own bowl. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 20/04/2021 01:28
"Just a little friendly test of strength," Viraj replies. "Arm wrestling." With no table nearby, the large Rajani opts to get down on the ground on his stomach and plants his elbow in the dirt.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 20/04/2021 17:32
"Sure, why the heck not. But you're going to regret it". Ryuzuko get down on on the ground with Viraj. Elbow bent upwards, the dragonborn strongly grips the man's hand. "On the count of sab... Ichi...Ni...San!" As he yells out san, the two begin thier battle of strength. Thier muscles tense and contort as they both try to bring the other's arm down. For awhile it seems they are evenly matched until Viraj starts pushing Ryuzuko's arm closer to the floor. It inches closer and closer, grunts and snarls fill the copse as they both struggle to win. It looks as if Viraj is going to win just before Ryuzuko lets out an almost draconic roar, pushing back on Viraj and gaining back ground. Viraj struggles more, trying to gain back his momentum but finds himself losing it. The struggle makes it's way back to where it, holding there for a second longer before a crashing slam can be heard throughout the camp as thier arms smash into the ground. As the flown up dirt settles, it reveals the soft shine of Ryuzuko's scaly arm, pinning Viraj's down into ther forest floor. The dragonborn stares the man down before letting out a hearty laugh, standing up, helping his rival up with him "That, was a most enjoyable bout. You almost had me Viraj, but almost was not enough." He lets out another laugh before slamming his hand into the man's, gripping it tight with his immense strength.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 20/04/2021 18:46
Viraj hops up to his feet with assistance for Ryuzuko. With a wide smile, he replies, "Hah! I may be getting on in my years but I still have it in me to give you a good run." He runs a hand through his salt and pepper hair, though upon doing so he feels the strain the match put on his arm and begins to work it in a circle. "One for you." With a hammered first, he strikes the dragonborn's shoulder in congratulations.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/04/2021 16:46
It seems that Koide's choice of campsite is as safe as it is sheltered. By the time that the first rays of sunlight blossom from around the edge of the vast, silver disc of the moon, bringing dawn to Hong province, all three night watches have passed entirely undisturbed. Viraj and Sadao rise to take the last watch In those small, grey hours of the morning and a couple of hours later their companions too wake to break their fast. An hour later they are on the road, making for Tonghua once more.
Mike 23/04/2021 08:01
Having enjoyed a bentoâ€”among his remaining rationsâ€”and after warming himself by the fire, Sadao beds down early for the night. Waking up early, he spends his time on watch with Viraj with quill and paper in hand, attempting to sketch what appears to be the portrait of a woman, albeit a crude one; the bard is lacking in both proper supplies and artistic talent beyond calligraphy. As they continue on the trail, Sadao keeps a watchful eye on their surroundings, having Kinoh do the same.
TheOrsini 23/04/2021 08:16
Koide awakens from her slumber shortly after dawn. Her watch was quiet and she used to think on their situation. The city had tested them; some more than others, but they had managed. For her part, she was feeling better. Koide had already pulled her kit from underneath the shelter as she worked on bringing down her leanto, untying the knots that lashed the frame. As her companions readied themselves after breakfast, she strung her bow. She offered her hand to Tanpo, nuzzling the horse if it is receptive.
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/04/2021 12:49
Tanpo nuzzles Koide's hand affectionately and allows himself to be saddled and made ready for travel. Heading west, the band of trees soon gives way to more fields and Koide picks up her horse's two-day-old trail with ease, rapidly guiding her companions cross-country as they retrace Tanpo's steps. The tracks meander back and forth, but overall lead ever further west across the sweeping tracts of farmland in the general direction of Tonghua. Come midday, they are still following the trail when a farmer working the land calls out from across the fields in Honmin. "What're you fools doing out here? There's a road over yonder, isn't there? Use it!"
Mike 23/04/2021 15:14
Sadao's head jerks in the direction of the farmer's call. "A farmer. This could be good, maybe he saw something." He waves back at the man, turning back momentarily to the group. "Oh, and just now he was scolding us for not using the road. I'll explain." He turns back to the farmer and calls back. "Good day! We're actually out here looking for someone, sir." He approaches, coming close enough so they won't have to yell to be heard. "Have you seen this horse before? Or its owner, we believe she's a woman? Anyone going to or coming from Tonghua at all, besides us?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/04/2021 00:05
The farmer eyes Sadao suspiciously as the bard approaches, but the peasant's misgivings quickly give way to a yellowed smile when the travellers' purpose is explained. "Aye, now y'mention it. Saw that beast come trotting through just a couple o' days ago. No rider t'be seen. Ran off before I could catch it though. Not seen a lot of folks coming east lately."
Mike 24/04/2021 21:37
Sadao strokes his scant facial hair in thought. "I see. If you haven't noticed anything else of note, I won't keep you from your work any longer. Thank you, kind sir." He bows, and turns to leave, but pauses, as Lyrel seems to have something to say as well. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 26/04/2021 22:28
As they encounter to old farmer, Lyrel stick behind with Sadao as he speaks. Before the duo departs, Lyrel addresses the farmer. â€Do you feel as if there are less people than usual traveling east? We are looking into strange occurrences in the area and anything you could provide would be of great aid.â€
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/04/2021 22:31
The farmer narrows his eyes at Lyrel suspiciously. "'ain't that what I just said? We don't need no 'strange occurances' 'round these parts. Just good, honest folks."
TheOrsini 27/04/2021 10:57
Koide shakes her head quietly. Watching Sadao and Lyrel compete in another game. It was amusing, but she hoped it wouldn't get one of them hurt one day. Tired of the conversation, she continues on the trail ignore any glares from the farmer. 'If we could find the horses' rider - she had stopped trying to call him Tanpo, as it still invoked a sense of loss for her porter -that would make this detour worth while.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 28/04/2021 14:06
Lyrel shrugs to the old farmer. â€Whether you â€˜needâ€™ them or not, they are here, old man. You should be thankful there those like us who are willing to stand between you and the darkness that lurks at the edge of your little world here.â€ He gestures to the tiny village. â€Farewell, I wish you good fortune on your crops.â€ He turns away towards Koide and follows behind without another word, invwardly berating the simple minded fools that seem to pervade this world. â€™They do not understand or appreciate just how dangerous the world is outside their bubble.â€™ His thoughts drift back to the destruction that he had witnessed on his journey to Dandong.
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/04/2021 14:23
The ornery old farmer spits in the dirt and mutters something to himself as Lyrel departs.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 28/04/2021 14:53
Lyrel glances back and shakes his head as he comes up next to Koide. â€They never change, do they?â€
TheOrsini 28/04/2021 15:01
She replies with a smirk. 'Nope.'
Mike 28/04/2021 15:09
Sadao looks between the cursing farmer and the departing Lyrel sheepishly. "Right." He sighs. The people, especially the commoners living close-knit lives here in Hong, did have these sorts of problems with outsiders, it was always abundantly clear. It always seemed like there'd be no changing that. But would he have to learn to change their traditional ways of thinking, if he was to be a peacekeeper? Do I even have the right to tell them how to live, after all these generations? The scroll feels heavier on his side than usual. He shakes his head. Whatever. Just gotta keep people alive and working together. He jogs to catch up to the group as they get moving again. "I've got a bad feeling. Let's hurry on to Tonghua."
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/04/2021 16:20
After a brief break for lunch, Koide continues to guide her companions in retracing her horse's path west, until, by the middle of the afternoon, the long day of walking starts to catch up with them.
TheOrsini 29/04/2021 03:17
The soreness and ache grows from their first full day of travel after staying in Dandong. Koide realizes too late, 'I should have kept practicing the sword, getting my stamina back.' She recognizes the fatigue growing in the horse as well, but missing it from the dragonborn's wearing form. She begins to look for a place to rest the night before the group starts to suffer from ill effects of exhaustion. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 29/04/2021 20:41
As dusk approaches, Koide and Sadao find a secluded spot in the heart of a broad hedgerow between two fields. On one side of the grassy clearing is a stone slab stood upright with its bottom embedded in the earth. The slab has been engraved with an ornate mural of a number of figures and several Honmin characters. The stone looks weathered and old and brambles are growing around its edges.
Dandiil {Takumi} 29/04/2021 21:12
Takumi walks over to where the group seems to be gathering. "I've not had to take a night watch yet, and I kinda want to be useful... especially since I don't have anything to practice cooking with. So if you guys want to fit me into a guard duty thing, I'll do my very best. What are you guys looking at?"
Mike 29/04/2021 22:20
"It's a shrine to Lu Shen, God of the Smooth Path." Sadao explains. "I've got a feeling we'll be all the safer, resting here in the middle of a journey." He clasps his hands and offers a brief prayer for safe travels.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 30/04/2021 22:36
"Smooth Path, huh?" Viraj pipes up as he is about his business of planting his torches around the campsite. "Maybe a little smoother if we get back to the road? Seemed like Tanpo's trail was getting a little wild today." (edited)
Mike 30/04/2021 22:45
Sadao unclasps his hands and opens his eyes. "Y'know... now that you mention it, it is a little odd that a shrine like this would be so out of the way, isn't it? And nobody's taking any care of it." he muses, before sighing and dropping to his knees and starting to clean the shrine up. "People shouldn't let this happen. No wonder the land seems so out of balance."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 30/04/2021 22:55

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 30/04/2021 23:00

Kyle [Arcadian] 01/05/2021 13:39

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/05/2021 17:49

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 01/05/2021 19:57

I am going to cast a simple ritual to detect any magical auras. There is something different about this shrine.â€ He quickly retrieves his spellbook and begins to follow the instructions of the complicated ritual...
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/05/2021 23:02

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 01/05/2021 23:28
â€I wouldnâ€™t approach the hedge. I am detecting very strong Conjuration magics coming from the hedge behind the stone, which is also emitting faint transmutation magics. Something is strange here...â€ Lyrel tries to think if he has ever heard of such a phenomenon before in his studies of magic. (edited)
Mike 02/05/2021 04:05
"If you don't want to help, you could just say so... wait, magic?" Sadao says, glancing over his shoulder as he finishes clearing the brambles from a corner of the shrine. "Whoa. This is a hedgeway, isn't it? They're like portals to other realms." He looks on in thought for a moment. "If Tanpo and his mistress have been through here, we ought to follow suit. Maybe whatever's happening in Tonghua is related to an outside realm too."
TheOrsini 02/05/2021 04:14
The words are dull in Koide's ears, she sits quietly in meditation, eyes closed, pushing her mind free of distraction. She sits with her feet under her near the fire, her sheathed katana resting in her lap. She breathes in... and out... unlabored but deliberate. For a moment she imagines jerking up with a start, willing her body up and freeing her legs to kick off. She thrusts her feet forward to push off into a backflip, landing lightly, her blade no free of the scabbard and falling to the ground below. Koide smiles at the fantasy. 'Definitely worth trying one day.' She shoves the fancy from her mind and tries to resume her concentration. Her mind continues to wonder though, first to Takumi and Sadao, and finally to Lyrel. Each man a different kind of distraction becoming harder to dismiss from her focus, but she manages it and the void envelops her in its calm silence. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 02/05/2021 04:21
"I think you have it right, Sadao." Viraj approaches the others near the shrine. "My druid mentor told me of places like this. Where our world connects to others. Fey creatures can sneak into our through here. And Tanpo there said his mistress was lost on the other side. Now this is coming from a horse, mind you, so that could mean somewhere on the other side in our world here... or maybe she got lost in there," he jerks his thumb at the stone. "We probably need to be careful and keep an extra watchful eye tonight. You may have cleared the way for things to pass. Natsuko warned me that it's not all fairies and sprites on the other side." (edited)
Mike 02/05/2021 04:38

If we run into somethingâ€”or really, if something runs into usâ€”I'll endeavor to see if it can be reasoned with." He walks over and takes a seat against the glowing rock. "I did start this, so it's only fair I take first watch. We can decide which path to follow in the morning."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 02/05/2021 21:35
â€An honorable choice, Sadao. I can take the watch in the deepest dark of the night. I mean no offense to Tanpo and his mistress, but what do we have to gain by going into this place? If you think it might be connected perhaps we can try, but places like this tend to connect in all manner of strange worlds. TheOrsini 04/05/2021 16:49
The void stirs. Someone draws near. A voice garbled from the outside. Koide hears, "You two are the same in some way." Her eyes flick open, and she asks, "Who are the same?" forgetting for a moment about her voice, and a scratchy mumbling groan on incoherence escapes. She shakes her head in frustration, any calm evaporating. She moves her hands furiously, 'Who are you talking about?'
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 04/05/2021 17:00

TheOrsini 05/05/2021 04:19
Koide gets the distinct impression that she should have been paying more attention to the others. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 05/05/2021 04:32
Takumi catches a bit of Koide's writing, 'yeah it's still not very good...' "Uhhhh... Does the horse actually talk? Or understand? I only ask because a friend of mine used to talk to the rats and birds, he said it was more a feeling or simple stuff like food and shiny or hunter and prey. It used to help us pick easy targets. I only ask, because Tanpo is in my memory... Maybe not as a horse, but still... The horse does know what his mistress called him. Are horses smarter than birds and rats? What I'm actually asking is... Could Lady Koide actually be this Tanpo's mistress and the thing that messed with out memory have messed with us... and this horse... even more?" The half elf expresses concern and suddenly reverted to a slight expression of regret. "I'm sorry, just trying to help. Lady Koide, have you been practicing your words? I caught a 'who're' and a 'the' from you... you can't scold me if you can't talk and don't practice...." Takumi feigns escaping her reach, almost like a preemptive dodge, but stands fast almost expecting what may be coming.
TheOrsini 05/05/2021 04:37
True to form, Koide tries for a half-hearted punch from her sitting position at her friend for his comment. 'She hadn't said 'whore'....' but even as she purposefully misses, she gives a smile and checks her leg to make sure the inkwell was not tipped in the exchange.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 05/05/2021 21:02
Viraj nods. "It didn't say you were the same, just said something about the two of you being similar. Mike 06/05/2021 01:19

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 06/05/2021 01:45

TheOrsini 06/05/2021 04:18

Mike 06/05/2021 04:43
