TheOrsini 06/05/2021 04:51
With Sadao and Takumi now both retreating to their own corners, Koide nods to Viraj and tries to sign. 'I'm going to bed.' indicating her bedroll. She corks the inkwell, and gathers her supplies to move over to her little sleeping area. After settling in, she spends an hour reading on the history within the pages of Kojiki by candle light before resigning and finally drifting off to sleep.
Kyle [Arcadian] 06/05/2021 12:53
Clouds obscure the moon, bringing a night that is dark and quiet, but for the whistling of the wind through the bushes. Koide sleeps restlessly, plagued by dreams of a dark forest and a monstrous raven that seeks to steal her voice. The morning is grey and damp when light spills across the countryside once more.
TheOrsini 07/05/2021 07:18
It was dark, and not just the sky but the shadows of the dense trees. Koide found herself running, harder and faster than she thought possible, but it was not enough. It was never enough. Her katana laid broken in three pieces in the forest behind her, but she heard the caw of the giant creature behind her. She did not need to see the blue reflective plumage or its sapphire glowing eyes to know it still followed behind her. It crowed off in the distance, with uncanny laughing like that from a giggling child. 'Heha hehe....' came the horrifying call behind her. It was close, maybe only a few trees behind, but she dared not waste the time in the dense undergrowth. She pushed past the next group of bushes, but the ground dropped out from under her feet suddenly, and she found herself tumbling into the clearing. She hits the ground hard, knocking the breath from her lungs. She was in some sort of dirt pad that rested in a large pile of sticks and broken debris. Koide's eyes dance as the world spins around from the impact. The great raven spreads its wings, a gleeful giggle emerges before fading into a shrill caw. Beneath the gold adornments, and magical orbs, deep within its plumage, Koide sees part of her katana blade wedged near the creature's thigh, as it is plops into the pile of debris. The realization occurs to Koide, 'This is a nest.' There is an evil gleam in the bird's eye, and Koide screams as the bird inhales.... (edited)
07:18
(edited)
07:23
She awakened, with sweat and dew from the morning on her brow, and a few twigs stabbing at her side. 'They hadn't awakened her for a watch?' The sun was already in the sky. Koide didn't fell well-rested at all. And even now, the memory of the bird still had her senses dulled. She stretched, reaching out to seeing Shi No Kaze still resting in its sheath. 'Well at least that's something.' She wants to tell Lyrel about the dream, but maybe it was not a good idea to count on him for everything. 'It could be from being too close to a hedgeway,' she considered as well. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/05/2021 21:18
Ryuzuko wakes from his long sleep, stretching his arms. His large, clawed hand shoots out, narrowly missing Kinoh, tail still pinned to the earth with his back. He sits up and yawns, "Mmm... I needed that...maybe I'll let Tsuruki carry my pack." He looks around the camp, just to see Koide spring awake, with a muffled scream. The dragonborn immediately gets up to check on his friend, freeing the small tanuki of his weight. "Koide, are you okay?" he asks of the girl once he reaches her. (edited)
TheOrsini 08/05/2021 03:34
Koide has a disconcerted look upon her face. She points to her head, and gives it a slow shake. She closes her eyes to clear her thoughts, but the ghostly image of the raven floats before her again and she shutters from the fading memory.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/05/2021 03:59

TheOrsini 08/05/2021 04:00

TheOrsini 08/05/2021 04:13
Koide rolls her eyes at Ryuz's stumbling. 'They don't have to constant change what they want to say. It's not like I don't understand them.' She thinks to herself but gives him a knowing smirk and nods in appreciation. 'Dragonborn were quiet different, sort of like lizardfolk in her approximation...' She continued her thoughts, 'I wonder if they even dream.' His words made it seem a plausibility, especially by deflecting to the two other humans in the group. She had nightmares of her past before, shared them with Lyrel. But this was different.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 10/05/2021 20:34
Viraj slowly comes to life with the rousing from Ryuzko. He wanders about the campsite for a moment to stretch out his muscles after a tense evening sleep of resting next to the planar junction, eyeing the suspicious hedges as he gathers the torches. As the others go through their routine, the druid begins the process of breaking down the herb he found the previous day to turn it into some concoction. "So, have we decided if we're going to check things out in these shrubs?" he asks the group while separating the fibers of the purple, ropy ivy. While glancing around to the others for an answer he stops at Koide. "You feeling alright? I could almost carry my coin in the bags under your eyes," he says jovially. "Needing some healing hands?" (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 11/05/2021 14:05
Takumi is a little slow to get up, yawning profusely and stretching throughout the process. "Morning friends..." His eyes pop open and in sudden movements he looks back and forth, marveling at the world around him. "We only slept for the night right? It wasn't a hundred years right? I don't know, that tree looks bigger... Is that tree bigger? Was that shrub here before? That rock looks really old... Please tell me that we're still near the end of The Emperor's Dawn." The half-elf appears to be enjoying this display, more than actual fear of lost time.
Mike 11/05/2021 20:15

TheOrsini 12/05/2021 04:58
Koide packs up her kit and stores her affects on the wagon, but decides to take a moment to write out a few thoughts. Can you speak with the horse for me again, Viraj-san? We cannot follow to its master if it went through the hedge, she thinks for a moment realizing the animal may prefer a handler to fending for itself, would it prefer to be free or to accompany us? It may choose either. If the horse decides to come with us, does it prefer a different name? Tanpo brings sadness to our hearts for the one we lost, and it would remind him of his former master. With quill to paper, she stores the utensils, and hands the paper over to Viraj. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 12/05/2021 15:25

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 13/05/2021 04:45
Viraj glances around in confusion at Takumi's observations as he begins to saddle up Tanpo, then takes a moment himself to reexamine their surroundings. "Uhh..." The druid looks between the rock, back to Takumi, then the tree and back again. He finally gives a hearty laugh. "You're just messing with us... Right..?" "Thinks he's a funny-man, huh?" he says to Koide as she approaches with her questions. He mouths the words as he reads over the note, before giving the huntress a nod. "Sure thing," he replies before casing his spell to communicate with the horse as he continues to prepare the beast for their journey. "So, friend... Doesn't look like we can be going through that hedge to look for your mistress. Maybe she'll turn up in Tonghua - where we have some things to take care of. Do you want to come with us, or roam around here to see if she'll turn up?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/05/2021 14:32
At first, Tanpo shakes his head in distress, but the horse also seems reluctant to reenter the Hedge. "I stay with... new mistress. Maybe one day we find old mistress."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 13/05/2021 17:25
Viraj strokes the mane of the horse to comfort him. "Yes, one day we might," he replies with a a few frim pats to its shoulder. "So, since you're coming along and since your new mistress - Koide's her name, by the way - knew a Tanpo, who recently died... Would you like a new name? Like being born reborn." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/05/2021 17:27
The horse nods when Viraj mentions Koide by name. "Old mistress was Koide too. Humans like human names, like 'Tanpo'. Horse names different... like feeling. When I was a foal, other horses called me 'Swiftwind'."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 13/05/2021 17:39
"I like that better, too." He gives the horse a warm smile then finishes cinching up the saddle. "Well, I think we're just about ready to go, Swiftwind." "So," he begins as he walks over to Koide, "Tanpo... err, Swiftwind, here said he'll be joining us. However, he mentioned his last owner was named Koide also." He scratches his head as he tries to puzzle through the similarities, but then just shakes his head after a moment. "Will you be riding him today?" (edited)
TheOrsini 13/05/2021 23:32
Swiftwind's response was even more confusing than she had anticipated. Koide nods yes, and silently pushes aside some of the thoughts about the mysterious being from beyond the veil. 'There would be time for more questions later. For now, it was time to make up some of the lost time this distraction had cost.' Koide holds up her finger as if asking for a moment. She catches Lyrel's eyes, points to her eyes, and then to the ground. Making a circular motion. 'They needed to search the area for any tracks. Everyone needed to look. If a fairy had flown from the hedge there would of course be no sign, or the tracks could be washed out if too old, but they needed to look. Partially, in case, Swiftwind was wrong about Koide, and partially to be wary if something had come out of the hedge.' She catches Sadao's and Takumi's attention and makes the same gesture to scout, but she points to the others. 'They couldn't afford to miss something especially if it came out of the hedge.' Her nightmare only confirmed her concern from the night before. After any assemblence of understand appears on the men's expression, she begins conducting the search. 'She hoped they didn't find anything besides their own prints.'
Kyle [Arcadian] 14/05/2021 13:41
The flora surrounding the hedgeway is especially wild and verdant and any imprint in the earth is quickly consumed by new growth. Nevertheless, sequestered amongst the tufts of the thick, green carpet, Koide and Viraj find bare patches of blackened, dead grass that are only slowly recovering. Each is shaped in the form of a large clawed foot. The trail leads out of the clearing and west - towards Tonghua.
TheOrsini 14/05/2021 14:27
Koide stares at the tracks, 'Just had to be right.' She studies the tracks a for a few moments... Her first thought is a basilisk or some other reptile, but as she looks she notices the splay and thickness. And then some of the journals that Sensei Tsuneuji had made her read through. 'Garkain' She uses the palm of her hand to measure the track. 'Large for the species. Maybe an alpha.' Koide sighs, 'Damn, I hate vampires.' She waves to the others to gather around. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/05/2021 05:30
Viraj kneels down next to Koide and passes his hand slowly over the deadened patch of grass. "Doesn't look like anything too friendly, huh? I hope this is something that's long been on the loose and not something we cleared a path for..." He casts an eye towards Sadao.
TheOrsini 15/05/2021 08:54
Koide nods, but the print is definitely older than the night, if she had to guess. Koide waves the others over to the imprint. 'Perhaps Lyrel had another possibility for what this could be... else they were in for a world of hurt.'
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 15/05/2021 23:06
Lyrel joins the others in examining the prints that Koide discovered. "Damn." He looks at Koide and nods. "Garkain, definitely. Koide, how old are the tracks? It did not come through last night, otherwise we would have been fighting for our lives. I wonder if this was the darkness that took Tanpo's other mistress." He hadn't spoken aloud his concerns yet, but the similarities here with this horse sharing the name of Koide's dead porter and now they knew that his former mistress was also named Koide. Couple that with the fact that it seems the horse had come through a gateway that could have easily led to a gateway in which a parallel world could have... the implications were too much. 'Focus on the task at hand. Find the undead, kill it. Then worry about the horse.' "Do we go after it?" He looks to Koide for an answer.
TheOrsini 15/05/2021 23:23
'Too many words' and her paper was already packed away on the wagon. Koide tilts her head, raises her gaze to Lyrel, and just nods. She points toward Tonghua, still two days walk, and the vague direction of the tracks.
Mike 16/05/2021 20:17
Sadao withdraws slightly, looking away from Viraj. He mutters something about restoring balance to the world, before moving to follow the group and the tracks. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/05/2021 20:31
The Garkain tracks lead west for several hours, eventually listing north towards the road where a barricade has been cobbled together out of scrap wood. The stench of decay hangs in the air.
TheOrsini 17/05/2021 09:48
Koide raises her arm at a right angle above her head to signal the party to stop. Her nose crinkled at the smell, but it was not something she hadn't expected. She picks up a stick to draw in a bare patch of ground. She drew a curving line to represent the road, and an intersecting line for the barricade. She then added a small rectangle for their wagon and two lines to show them splitting up and going at the hold from two sides. She flicks her eyes to Lyrel trying to read him for understanding.
Dandiil {Takumi} 17/05/2021 10:31
Takumi gags at the smell multiple times, if he had more than trail rations over the last couple of days, it probably would have spewed out. After regaining his composure, the half-elf sees what Koide is drawing out and gestures out a slight apology, along with an affirmative nod. He knows this plan, they've done it before... Covering his nose with his collar, he collects his staff and peeks through the shrubbery. 'With all the death I've seen, I still can't get past that smell' He thinks to himself while seeking any movement at the barrier. (edited)
Mike 17/05/2021 19:51

With Kinoh by his side, they both stay alert.

Kyle [Arcadian] 17/05/2021 23:30

This was once a campsite of some kind, but supplies have been strewn all across the road and a cooking pot lies upturned amongst the ashes of the fire. The dead are everywhere. Mike 18/05/2021 21:20

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 18/05/2021 21:36

Mike 18/05/2021 22:21

TheOrsini 18/05/2021 23:57
It surprised Koide, how quick Lyrel was to judge the quality of a man. 'Banditry was the natural result of a few bad circumstances and the will to survive. Was it wrong? Trying to rationalize Lyrel's statement in her head, she thought about Takumi. 'He could have easily become a bandit with his life choices before I had met him. Of course, he had been smart about it, and could pull off any indiscretions that I asked of him.' Like any of her friend's, she took care of them; made sure they were safe. 'As much as the world allows.' She looks at the carnage among the slaughter. 'I would have done worse to these people had they turned on my friends.' Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 19/05/2021 04:41

TheOrsini 20/05/2021 01:31
Koide instinctively reacts to the call, the quill and ink spill on the page as the hunter rapids shifts her weight away from the makeshift table. Her bow is up in her hands and the arrow comes free of the quiver at her hip, knocked into position with honed precision. Not even for a moment is there hesitation. No thought to securing information from the man. The longbow's waxed string is drawn to her cheek and her eye follows the shaft to the target. 'Loose' There is a thwang as the string snaps back to the resting position. The arrow flies true spinning rapidly from the crow feathered fletchings until it makes a wet impact with the leather clad stranger. The man falls backwards, the shaft jutting from its right eye socket. 'Not getting that one back,' Koide considered. Adrenaline pumps at the side of her neck, but she doesn't surrender to the euphoria. She carefully reaches into the satchel and retrieves the bottle of acidic resin dipping another arrowhead into the bottle as she watches the piles of dead men about looking for further movement. Dandiil {Takumi} 24/05/2021 21:25

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 25/05/2021 21:51
Viraj's summons his healing flames atop the bleeding Ryuzoku. His ax then falls to the ground with a thud and the nails on his hands sprout into sharpened thorns. The tips gleam with acid. With the creature's attention on the dragonborn, the enraged druid swipes with one hand on the forearm grasping Ryuzuko. The caustic claw severs the limb from its owner. The second clawed hand of the druid swipes upward, underneath the jaw of the former bandit. The middle three thorns find purchase, then sprout upward into the diseased brain and through its skull. Viraj retracts the thorny nails and the lifeless body crumples to the ground.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/05/2021 23:24
The twisted form of what was once a man finally falls lifeless to the ground and silence reigns once more, broken only by the whistling of the wind.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/05/2021 02:57
Ryuzuko holds onto his neck, which profusely bleeding, as he slowly walks towards the spirits that begin to slowly heal his wounded body. "Atsukau..." he says in a quiet tone, ridding his body of the poison. "Viraj, if you wouldn't mind just, burning it all, that would be fannntastic. We can't have more of those, things, show up. Kuso...that hurt." The dragonborn clambers back onto his steed, making his way back to the cart, still holding the wound in his neck occasionally.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/05/2021 08:52
The wound in Ryuzuko's neck burns like holy fire as he clutches at it - a feeling that is gradually spreading throughout the dragonborn's entire body as the adrenaline leaves him. It's an excruciating, yet also reassuringly cleansing sensation that leaves the paladin light-headed and breathless.
TheOrsini 26/05/2021 09:09
Koide overhears the dragonborn's words but holds up a hand to Viraj asking him to wait. She understood his fervor, but the creature needed further examination. She tears fabric from her sleeve revealing her bare right arm. She opens the stopper on her waterskin and pours some of the fluid onto the sleeve before tying it around her nose and mouth. Before entering among the bodies, she grabs a long sturdy stick from the deadfall outside of the barricade. Armed for the task and her bow now stowed over her shoulder, Koide moves into the dangerous area around the bodies getting close enough to proud and inspect the creature's corpse. She lifts the chin for a better look. Besides the shifted arrow shaft from the first fatal blow, she notices the monster newly formed characteristics, 'Another Garkain...' The realization surprises her. She had not known much about the species, but the fact that the disease could potential spawn more was a worrying concept. She considered the rest of the diseased bodies. 'Why had they not turned? He had been human, which disproved her theory of a potential fey connection.' This information really supported her and her teacher's classification for the Garkain as solely undead. 'They functioned just like standard Vampires when it came to creating spawn.' She then realized she had an excellent opportunity here. She flipped the spawn on its back to show most of its features. Stood back from it and pulled paper and tools from her bag. She was going to take a minute to sketch and write her observations down on paper. As she began, she fantasized for a moment that maybe one day someone would read her entry in the bestiary. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 27/05/2021 15:33
Viraj gives a nod to the huntress. While she investigates and journals her findings of the creature they just slayed,Viraj returns to the work of piling up the bodies around the ruined barricade. He works quietly through the grim task. Saving the mutated bandit's body for last, the druid's vines wrap around its legs and it joins the others. He waits a moment to ensure no one else has any business they would like to conduct with the scene. "I suppose we should say a little something," he says to the group. He then begins a simple druidic rite. Turning to to each direction - first to the east, then south, west and north - he says, "Earth my body, Water my blood, Air my breath, Fire my spirit, Spirits of Arden we thank you." The druid holds out a hand and a fire springs to life in his palm. He holds it there as he continues. "Spirits of fire, Sun's fire, lightening, Flame on the hearth, Fire that cleanses and destroys, Fire that purifies, Now take our dead." The flame shoot from his hand into the debris, and another, until the barricade is lit aflame. "Let them become flame and ash. From their spirits a pure flame will rise. Go in peace." With a hand out before him, fingers splayed, Viraj drags his other hand across the first, causing the flames to spread through the other bodies. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/05/2021 23:35
Cleansing flame sweeps across the pile of fuel and the dead, consuming the tainted corpses and the former barricade until only ashes remains. The mood is quiet and subdued for the rest of the day, although little further of note transpires. It seems that Ryuzuko is still not entirely recovered and the unspoken question of disease hangs in the air over Lyrel.
TheOrsini 28/05/2021 13:01
They travel until near dark, with the huntswoman looking for a safe place to rest. As the dusk begins to encroach, Koide is forced to settle for the underside of a bridge. It won't be a comfortable night's rest, but she notes that it is fairly out of the way with only a couple of approaches. 'Should more Garkain spawn be nearby.' She directs the cart down a narrow path to pull it out of the way. Looking at the muddy puddles and grime about, she decides not to pull out her finer paper or scribble more notes. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/05/2021 13:12
Throughout the day's travels, the half-elf is uncharacteristically silent.... Tak is able to build a fort of ice with the water that flows under the bridge, "It's not much, but ... this is so much easier than tryin to keep a watch... I can get out of watch with this.... right?"
TheOrsini 28/05/2021 13:16
Koide rolls her eyes at Takumi before nodding with a heavy smile. 'That'll do nicely.' She pats him on the shoulder as he finishes his work. She motions to Takumi while the others are unpacking that she is going to scout. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/05/2021 13:34
Takumi looks around at the group.... "if everyone else is tired of nuts and berries, we could use a real meal.... Viraj, Lyrel, is there anything in the area worth eating?? I'll cook up whatever ya'll bring back." the half elf nods at lady koide....
TheOrsini 28/05/2021 13:43
Koide's worry is assuaged as she starts with a sweep of the area around the camp. Her stomach begins to growl slightly from the day's travel, and she puts thought into Takumi's request. 'Something fresh would be nice.' As she continues, she begins checking for signs of game and areas with natural herbs or berries.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 28/05/2021 15:29
After the battle, Lyrel distanced himself from the remainder of the group. Keeping a safe distance from the others to prevent spreading of the disease he had exposed himself to through his reckless actions. As they ride the remainder of the day, he keeps to himself on the massive, spectral deer-like mount he conjured. He sent his familiar up into the air far ahead of the group with directions to scout and report back with anything that felt unnatural. As they took shelter beneath the bridge and Takumi conjures his dome, Lyrel spends several minutes setting up his very own dome further away from the others in order to keep them safe from him. While Takumi cooks their meals, Lyrel unsheathes Dongfeng and spends sometime staring at the slightly glowing runes upon the immaculate, yet ancient steel as his thoughts wander. Thoughts of his own ignorance and the potential cost for his failure. Eventually, he lovingly wipes the blade with oil before placing it back into the scabbard and removing Star of the Lost Omens from his backpack and proceeds to quietly read for the next several hours while the others set up their own camp and acquire food. He did not like feeling so useless. Leaving the others to provide for him, but... he also did not want to expose the rest to the disease that was still stubbornly clinging to him. (edited)
15:34
Later when Koide returns from his foraging he calls to her from within his protective bubble. Koide? A moment of your time, please.â€
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 28/05/2021 22:49

Just as soon as they sit down to start, Ryuzuko's tired and battered body begins to fail him and he starts to nod off. The large dragonborn quickly falls forward, landing on one of Sadao's books, crushing it into the dirt and grass.
TheOrsini 28/05/2021 23:34
When Koide returns, she drops a trio of rabbits, some wild onions, and a few tubers next to Takumi, hoping to help him in his cooking. Before she could decide to do anything else, she hears Lyrel's voice. She inclines her head to listen, and then nods drawing closer to him, but not within arms width.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 28/05/2021 23:53

If this progresses beyond our ability to fix, I shall kill myself or... if Iâ€™m too far gone to do so, you must do it for me. Burn my body and everything on it except my sword. Dongfeng must be returned to my father should this come to pass. Can you agree to this?â€ It is clear to Koide that heâ€™d been thinking about this and what to say for some time as his voice was even and matter of fact. Lyrel had reached this decision the moment he had witnessed the awful transformation of the bandit back at the barricade.
Mike 29/05/2021 00:19
"...now, just repeat that back to me. 'Ni-hao...'" When Sadao hears Ryu's resounding thud, he brings his palm to his forehead. They'd have to try another time. Kinoh slinks by him, hopping on top of the dragonborn's form and curling up to go to sleep herself, clearly tired after hours of distracting the pair, resulting in what felt like very little progress to Sadao. With little else to do, the bard notices Koide and Lyrel talking, and can't help but be curious. He draws nearer under the guise of offering to help Takumi, while trying his best to subtly eavesdrop from a distance.
Dandiil {Takumi} 29/05/2021 01:29
Takumi tastes the rabbit stew, and then adds a few more peppers. "Soup's done!! It may not be the greatest, but it's better than nuts and berries." He announces it loudly, allowing Koide a way out of her current conversation. A knowing glance in Sadao's direction as the bard starts serving the freshly prepared stew.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 29/05/2021 03:41
Viraj returns with his own offerings for dinner: a half dozen or so quail looking half-burnt already, a handful each of carrot and fiddle-head ferns, along with some wild greens. "Maybe this'll get us through tomorrow as well. Also," he drops in a few of golden dragon tongue petals from his herb pouch. "This'll give whatever you make a real kick, but don't go using a whole lot. I don't think the others can take the heat.' The Rajani dishes up two bowls of the soup and walks to Sadao. "Here, see they if they aren't hungry," he says, nodding towards Lyrel's dome. He leans in close as he hands the bowls off. "Might be easier for you to listen in, too" He gives the man a wink.
TheOrsini 29/05/2021 04:59
Koide's faces drains of color and her demeaner goes grave. It was a hunter's oath, and she had sworn to carry out tasks on others before. 'Had fulfilled such oaths before.' But this was... different. She had worried about Lyrel off and on throughout the afternoon, but she had busied herself with other tasks. The blood pumps in her ear as Lyrel finishes. She clears her throat out of habit, trying to force the lump from forming. She finally takes a deep breath, trying to be strong for her companion, and nods sullenly. The oath was struck - not in word, but by bond. She would kill him, if the time came. And had she the capability to speak, at that moment she would have lacked the will. She felt numb... hollow. The warrior woman gave a bow of respect to Lyrel and silently slipped off into the woods to be alone.... and weep alone.
Mike 29/05/2021 16:25
"You guys are getting the wrong idea," protests Sadao, as he takes the two bowls of soup. "Just figured they uh, might be getting hungry." He takes the bowls over, but halts for a moment as he notices Koide slip away, seemingly upset. Though his first instinct was to follow her, a nagging sense at the back of his mind told him to drop it. He sighs and continues over to Lyrel's dome. He extends one bowl through the dome for him to take. "Here. You'll feel better if you eat. And this should be less spicy than last time." He pulls his hand back through the dome and sits down just outside of it, while Lyrel presumably ate. He looks about him and finds a sprig. Muttering a word in Primordial as he touches it, it magically matures into a decently-sized frond, which he plucks and skillfully wraps around the other bowl of soup to keep it warm. "I'm leaving some for Koide out here." he assures the bladesinger, setting it down. He doesn't leave, though, instead sitting and looking up at the night skyâ€”what was visible of it from under the bridge, anyway. "How... how did you meet, exactly?" He still knew little about Koide's life before he joined up with them. He wished he'd gotten the courage to ask her directly before she lost her voice.
Dandiil {Takumi} 01/06/2021 08:51
Takumi puts a hand to his mouth and starts to chuckle quietly in Viraj's direction as the bard walks away... "How can he think he's hiding it?" He whispers to the druid.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 01/06/2021 14:33
Lyrel nods at Koideâ€™s tacit response, knowing full well what he was asking of her. Each hunter knew that a mercy killing was likely the way they would leave this world and that it was best if it was a fellow hunter, but when it was someone with whom you had a shared past... a friend? A lover? What were they? It was all that much harder. He watches her leave, wondering what thoughts were coursing through her brain as Sadao brings Lyrel some food. He looks at the young man for a time, wondering if he knew just how complicated the question he just asked was. He takes a bite of the food, wincing slightly at the extreme heat of the spices, but chewing for a while as he ponders how to answer. He eventually swallows and looks at her bowl before looking back up to Sadao. â€That is a long story, but I am not a very good teller of tales, so I will keep is brief. Also, I do not wish to speak of Koideâ€™s past without her consent, but... our masters were companions of a sort. During our individual training, we were sent together of several joint tasks appointed to us by our masters to prove ourselves and to complete our training. During that time, we become close friends and have always helped each other in moments of need or duress.â€
Mike 01/06/2021 16:29
"I see." Sadao decidedly neglects to ask 'how close.' He only had his own guesses and observations to go on. From Sadao's side of the spell, he couldn't see Lyrel, though he was dimly aware of his eyes on him. As he looked back, seeing only the opaque sheen of the dome and hearing his clipped words, Lyrel proved equally unreadable. He had a sense of what he and Koide had been talking about, that made her leave like she did, though. After a few more moments of silence, he rises to leave, but looks back, his eyes shifting to focus on different parts of the dome, in hopes of making eye contact. "I'd never leave a friend looking like that." With a serious, if sincere look, he departs, leaving the bowl. When it came to not just their past together, but Koide herself, he felt, still, like he was on the outside looking in. The bard resolved to do something about it, besides asking someone closer to her. After Tonghua. He promised himself. He ventures off to the other side of the undercroft, taking time to practice with his sword before going to sleep.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/06/2021 16:56
"Beats me," Viraj replies, shaking his head. Grabbing a bowl of the stew for himself, he finds a place under the dome to enjoy the meal. "I'm sure glad we have you with us, Tak! These meals make the journey a little more bearable." He raises his empty bowl as a sign of approval. With his meal devoured, the druid then turns his attention to the crafting of the potion he began the night before. He snips portions of the stem and leaves of the drojo's ivy into his small stone bowl. After grinding it down into a paste he adds a bit more of the plant and continues to process it to aid in the extraction of beneficial elements. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/06/2021 22:21
Fortunately, Takumi's frozen fortifications prove unnecessary and the night passes quietly, but for the babbling of the brook beneath the bridge. The next morning is spent trudging steadily west along the road to Tonghua. It's close to an hour before noon when the silhouette of the village finally appears on the horizon. The number of farmers that can be seen working their fields grows steadily as the distant buildings draw nearer and the mismatched band of warriors attract the stares of most, be they curious or fearful. The sun would be high in the sky when Koide and her companions finally arrive on the outskirts, but for the overcast skies. Crows can be heard cawing from the rooftops and the density of villagers is sparse, though several can be seen milling about.
Mike 04/06/2021 02:52
Sadao turns to the others. "Finally, we made it. We should go talk to the shizhang now... oh." His eyes land on Lyrel as he remembers his condition. "Lyrel-san, I hate to say it, but you probably shouldn't come along." (edited)
TheOrsini 04/06/2021 03:02
Koide signs to Sadao, pointing to her self and then to Sadao, making a shape like a river flowing downstream. 'I must go with you.' She pulls the letter from her pack with the remnant of beige wax still clinging from the broken seal.
Mike 04/06/2021 23:46
After a moment, Sadao understands Koide's meaning, especially when she brings out the letter again. He nods in return. Again, some small part of him took smug satisfaction at this turn of eventsâ€”Lyrel having to stay back, and he and Koide going ahead together, her with the letter, and his presence necessary as a translator. Once more, he bites his tongue at the thoughts, disbelieving they were even his. Eager to put these notions behind him, he steps up, ready to head into town. Kinoh watches his expression a few paces away quietly, but appears ready to move as well.
Mike 05/06/2021 14:25
As they pass through the village's stone arches, Sadao looks for someone he could ask for directions, seeing no obvious place the Shizhang could be in.
Kyle [Arcadian] 05/06/2021 15:06
The first local to cross Sadao's path is a weathered looking woman with long, curled grey hair and a round figure. She's dressed typically for a farmer in these parts and is carrying a basket of apples. "The Shizhang is Shen Dingxiang," she explains. "His smithy is on the north side of the village."
Mike 07/06/2021 23:32
Sadao thanks the woman, and translates to Koide. "The Shizhang runs a smithy, we can find it this way." He begins to head north through the town, looking for any distinctive plumes of smoke to hint at the smithy's location.
TheOrsini 08/06/2021 02:01
Koide nods, but picks up on the name difference. She remains wary as she follows her bardic companion toward their destination.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 08/06/2021 04:12
As the two members of their group continue on into town to gather information, Viraj turns to the others that remain. "I guess we can all wait here. I'd just get in the way anyways.. since I can't speak the language." The druid then turns his attention to Lyrel. After a moment to attune his senses, allowing him to see the aura of the disease. "Hmmm...," he muses, stroking his bearded chin. "Whelp... Doesn't seem to have gotten worse from yesterday, so that's something." Chew it up and put it between your cheek and gum. It'll help keep you on your toes." He gives his patient a wink. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 08/06/2021 10:51

Kyle [Arcadian] 08/06/2021 20:54
It doesn't take Sadao and Koide long to find the smithy. The distinctive clang of metal on metal can be heard from down the street. The man working the forge is thick set with a bushy black beard. He pauses in his hammering at the anvil to look up at the strangers as they approach.
Mike 08/06/2021 21:23
As they walked, it began to dawn on Sadao that no one else was coming alongâ€”since no one needed to, reallyâ€”making it just them. He clams up for the rest of the brief journey through the streets. When they reached the smithy, he caught the eye of the heavyset mayor and blacksmith. It had been a while since he had had to make introductions to the elected official of a town; Dandong having only had a maddened shell of one itself, but nonetheless, he remembered how he was taught to make a good impression. With mindful posture, he bows before the man and purposely holds his gaze for a moment before speaking. "Good day to you, Shizhang. My name is Sadao Huiya, and this is Koide. We are here to answer your summons." He motions for Koide to show him the letter.
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/06/2021 21:36
The man sets his hammer aside and thrusts the metal that he has been working into a pail of water that hisses and steams as the iron is quenched. He places it on a nearby table and approaches Sadao, pulling off his gloves as he does so. "Good day, Huiya-zÅ«njià. I am Shen Dingxiang, Shizhang of Tonghua." The Shizhang watches his visitors carefully as he speaks. "By whom, exactly, were you summoned? I am afraid that I have sent no such message."
TheOrsini 08/06/2021 23:49
In answer, Koide produces the letter, and hesitantly passes it to the smith. Something felt off to her, but she was unsure if she was just being paranoid after the encounter with the Beast of Dandong.
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/06/2021 13:57
Dingxiang takes the parchment from Koide and examines it carefully. "This is the mark of our Shizhang," he explains, pointing to the seal on the letter, "but it was written by my predecessor, Jiang Kokwan." The name is signed clearly at the bottom of the missive. "He spoke the truth - an evil preys upon our village. It claimed his life, but a week ago. I am not familiar with this Raven Watch, nor do I know what Jiang-dàrén's connection to it was, but if you can help us, we will be forever in your debt." The words are spoken respectfully, but he watches Koide and Sadao with hard eyes, as though challenging them to prove that they can.
Mike 10/06/2021 17:16
At the mention of the Raven Watch, Sadao casts a curious glance at his mute friend as well, but returns his attention to the Shizhang to keep up professional appearances. "We can assure you, your people will not have to go on living in fear," he states solemnly. "But for now, we need to know more about the threat. When and how did these attacks start? Was there anything off beforehand?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/06/2021 16:13
Dingxiang shakes his head sadly. "The first that we knew of it was when a young woman disappeared. She was later found in pieces near the fields of her family's farm. The monster claimed more victims and eventually we began to travel in groups for safety. That was the first time that it was seen. A bestial horror that defies description. Even those that somehow escape its clutches always succumb to its foul touch, as was the case for Jiang Kokwan. We have come to know it as the Corpse Eater. It seems to love to feast upon what remains of the dead."
Mike 11/06/2021 16:45
Sadao lowers his head in respect for those lost as well. "On our way here, we came upon a disturbing sight. The creature had torn across a large group of men who had barricaded the road, no doubt planning banditry. One of them had less wounds, but quickly grew into a half-human monstrosity himself, and attacked us. I fear the same thing could happen again. Those that perished from its diseased touch, were they buried?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/06/2021 16:48
Dingxiang frowns in concern and nods hesitantly. "On the southern edge of the village."
Mike 11/06/2021 16:59
"Then, it pains me to say it, but we know what must be done. We'll need your permission, and access to shovels and oil." Sadao keeps his head lowered, letting a shadow fall over the upper half of his face, as he can't quite meet the Shizhang's eyes while he says this.
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/06/2021 22:03
Dingxiang hesitates, but nods in understanding. "I see. Well, we cannot risk the safety of the village." The Shizhang secures his forge and steps towards Koide and Sadao. "Please, follow me. We should speak with Lai Mingxia." Dingxiang leads the pair across the village to the local temple, inside of which they find a Honmin woman dressed in yellow robes. "Lai-shèng," the Shizhang addresses her with a bow. "These foreigners come bearing a letter from Jiang Kokwan." She turns to Koide and Sadao with a cool look, waiting for them to introduce themselves.
TheOrsini 12/06/2021 07:55
Koide performs a proper bow of respect to the priestess, remaining silent but trying to maintain her composure.
Mike 12/06/2021 14:31
Sadao bows as well. "I am Sadao Huiya, serving as a translator for Miss Koide here. We are part of a larger group that specializes in handling threats such as these, called here by the former Shizhang. Dingxiang-shizhang, shall we repeat our tale and concerns?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/06/2021 22:21
The Shizhang nods and the priestess watches Sadao with piercing eyes as he tells his tale. "You speak the truth," she asserts when the bard is finished, "but I cannot allow the graves of our honoured dead to be defiled by foreign hands. I shall purify their final resting places, in keeping with our rites and traditions."
Mike 14/06/2021 02:00
Sadao is a little taken aback at her stance, but not terribly surprised. He meets her gaze, and decides to push back. "Lai-shèng, I'm humbled by your resolve. I'd leave it entirely in your capable hands if I weren't certain we could be of aid to you. We have fought against this creature's spawn already; they're extremely dangerous and formidable. I believe we should be present at least to ensure no harm comes to the townspeople, should one arise." He takes a step forward, with a small but warm smile that seems to challenge her icy look. "Besides that, I believe we should cooperate in the ritual. I myself have some training in the performance of purification rites; my clan, the Huiyas, has strong roots in Hong, which is why I learned the tongues as well. I do not think I would be as a foreigner."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 14/06/2021 16:54
Lyrel quietly nods to Sadao's suggestion to remain outside the limits of the city. "I shall. I do not wish to bring this foulness to the innocent. My family is well known in these lands should you need the aid of their name." As he watches the others depart, he solemnly takes the root from Viraj. "Thank you for doing everything you can to keep this corruption at bay. I do not wish to succumb in the same way that man did back at the barricade, nor do I wish to see myself become a harbinger of disease. I just hope I have not exposed any others through my foolishness."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 14/06/2021 20:38
Viraj gives the elf a nod. "If that thing we fought back there is any what this creature can do... I'd not wish it on anyone. We'll get you fixed up," he declares confidently. "Well... Since they're off doing whatever in there," he waves toward the town, "I'm going to see if I can find anything useful for my potions in these fields. I think I saw a few promising spots not too far from here along the road." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 14/06/2021 22:03
"Very well," the priestess concedes in face of Sadao's diplomacy. "You may accompany me. For protection, of course." The corner of her mouth curls in the faintest hint of a smile.
Mike 15/06/2021 01:26

Kyle [Arcadian] 15/06/2021 09:00
"Right away," the priestess tells Sadao with a graceful nod, before rising and moving to gather some items from a cupboard. Incense, oil and water, among other things. "Shall we?" She asks waving a farewell to Dingxiang, who bows before departing.
Mike 15/06/2021 15:53
Sadao dips his head towards the Shizhang, and catches Koide up in Je'dahnian while they wait for Lai. "She insists on performing the rites to purify the bodies, and I kinda agree, since we no longer have a cleric. There's one issue: she's only letting me come along to perform these rites. I figure you and the others can stay nearby in case something goes wrong." The bard throws her a helpless sort of look before turning to reply to the priestess. "Yes, let's make haste." He moves to accompany her out of the temple. (edited)
TheOrsini 15/06/2021 22:59
Koide stops Sadao with a hand to his chest. She makes a praying gesture and pointing to the woman, and then points to her own throat. She looks him pleadingly in the eye.
Mike 15/06/2021 23:22
Sadao gasps as he realizes Koide's meaning. "Oh, of course!" Why the hell wouldn't I think to ask her that? He pushes aside his shame at getting distracted, and switches to Honmin to speak to Lai Mingxia. "Lai-shèng, a moment, please! Before we begin with that, we have our own request requiring your abilities as a priestess." He gestures to Koide. "During a battle against a different creature, Koide-san suffered a wound in her throat, leaving her unable to speak. Is it possible for you to heal her?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/06/2021 21:47
The priestess stops in her tracks, clearly caught off guard by the request. "Is it not more urgent that we protect ourselves from the monster? I assure you, I can inspect this wound later."
Mike 16/06/2021 22:03
Sadao translates simultaneously to Koide. "Willing to wait for just a little longer?" He says in Je'dahnian, with a sad look of his own in his eyes. (edited)
TheOrsini 17/06/2021 02:11
Koide nods in resignation.
Mike 17/06/2021 02:38
"Thanks." Hesitating slightly, Sadao places a reassuring hand on her shoulder, and flashes her a mischievous grin. "Between you and me, I can't wait to hear your voice again, either." Retracting his hand, he turns to the priestess. "Very well, Lai-shèng, lead the way."
TheOrsini 17/06/2021 03:36
Koide smiles coyly.
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/06/2021 11:45
"Come along then," Mingxia notes, beckoning to Sadao and Koide. She passes her bag to the bard to carry and steps out of the temple. Her steps are quick as she guides the pair across the village to an isolated field on the outskirts.
Mike 17/06/2021 19:45
Hefting her bag with the smallest of grunts, Sadao follows the priestess towards the southern edge of the village with Koide. As they near the city limits, he informs her that their companions were waiting nearby, and detours to find Ryu, Lyrel, and Takumi. "We're going to the village's graveyard to consecrate the dead, so they don't come back like that bandit. You can follow along if you want, but they're not keen on foreigners, well, like everywhere else." Seeing Viraj missing, he puts a hand to his mouth and whistles. In the blink of an eye, Kinoh appears next to him with a gust of wind, carrying a golden leaf among others. "I need you to find Viraj," he dictates to the stretching canine. "Mmm. And Viraj was... which one, again?" Sadao's unamused stare being her only response, she sets off at a trot to look for the druid.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/06/2021 21:59
Viraj is deep under some thorny shrubbery off the road about a mile outside of town. He's about to pluck the Ucre Bramble when he feels a paw at his back side. The sudden sensation causes the large man to jerk while in his prickly situation. "Huh! Wha-..! Ow! Damnit..! Son of a..!" The druid takes a calming breath before extracting himself from the shrub. He emerges - small rivulets of blood cover the backs of his hands and lower arms - and looks to find the cause of his troubles staring up at him, looking rather pleased with itself. "Why'd you have to go and startle me like that?!" He wipes away a streak of blood on his cheek. The familiar begins to chatter and growl, but the druid quickly holds up a hand. "Hang on, hang on. Give me a moment." Having taken the time to cast his spell to allow himself to understand animals, he begins again. "Okay. Let's start again." "I said the priest in town's about to cleanse their dead. You might want to get back there in case something goes wrong." "Well, let's get moving then." (edited)
Mike 18/06/2021 07:46
Kinoh spends the entire trip back jawing away at Viraj about all manner of topics, apparently quite glad to have someone else to talk to besides her bonded master. Tail wagging all the while, she gossips about Sadao's awkward attempts at courting "Raggedy Girl," passes along critiques on Takumi's cooking, and rants about the injustice she suffered the other night, when Ryuzuko rolled onto her in his sleep. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 18/06/2021 13:25

Kyle [Arcadian] 18/06/2021 21:23
The priestess guides Koide south to a field on the edge of the village carpeted in lush tufts of hardy grass. The earthen bald spots of graves, some freshly dug, line the area and trees rim the sides granting frequent spots of shade. Mingxia stops at the near edge, beckoning for her bag, before unpacking some of the supplies. "Wait here," she says quietly, "and I shall perform the rites." Sparks fly from a tinderbox, lighting a stick of incense that the priestess carries with her as she moves to the first grave, sprinkling holy water across its surface.
TheOrsini 19/06/2021 04:28
Following the priestess' instructions, Koide sits with her legs folded beneath her. She slings the bow off her shoulder and lays it within arms reach. Her hand grips the tsuba and draws the meticulously clean katana blade, placing Shi no kaze on her lap. The huntress breathes in deeply, opening her senses to the world around her. The words of the holy woman's prayers fall away and only the void remains. Here, she searches for the Garkain's taint upon the land, or any of its foul spawn. She appears tranquil to any outside observer. (edited)
TheOrsini 19/06/2021 05:08
...... She senses... shadows... and then.... close....coming now. Koide springs forward, her legs thrusting forward and up in a smooth transition, the katana's blade rotating in the area flying into her outstretched hand. She lands feet spread apart, transitioning into a dance-like combative guard. With great effort, the mute woman attempts to shout, making whatever noise as her throat would allow to draw any unwary to her as she points toward the direction of the encroaching beast.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 19/06/2021 05:10
Wating a ways off from the ritual, Ryuzuko hoists himself onto tsuruki's back as he notices Koide ready herself for combat. He begins scanning the area for signs of approach. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 19/06/2021 05:23
Takumi follows Sadao toward the ritual site, but not keen on entering the burial grounds, hides himself behind a nearby tree. He glances over to see Koide in meditation, and turns his attention to the ritual. These funeral rites are not like those of the streets. The care this woman seems to be taking is much more thought out and a lot longer than he was used to. The speed of Things here reminds him of the way the noble classes strut around the city... no rush, not a care in the world... If the half-elf moved that slow, he'd likely starve, be trampled, or worse... get caught in one of his fast paced schemes. Oblivious to the sudden reaction of Koide, and almost enthralled by the ritual that is being performed... Takumi stays still within the confines of the low branches.
Mike 19/06/2021 05:38
After arriving, Sadao waits patiently as the priestess performs the funeral rites. Despite himself, he does begin to grow bored, nearly drifting off to sleep... until Koide rises to her feet, letting out a guttural sort of noise and pointing towards something in the distance. He saw nothing, but he was beginning to trust her instincts over his own. Something must be out there. "Lai-shéng, get away from there! Something's coming!" He yells, running towards the priestess with a hand on his sword, but not drawing it yet.
Kyle [Arcadian] 19/06/2021 15:41
For a brief moment, the garkain's approach can be felt. A subtle rumble of the ground as the undead monstrosity pounds through the trees towards the graveyard. Abruptly the monster bursts into the open. It's twice the size of a man and the foul stench that surrounds it is sickening from across the field. It bellows a ferocious howl and shadowy tendrils seep from the garkain towards the surrounding graves. (edited)
TheOrsini 19/06/2021 18:36
Koide has a calm composure about her face. She pulls the last of her vial of Enhance Vampire Oil out and bites at the stopper. She had known the Garkain would attack once it had sensed their presence. With a quick pop, she pours the oil over the blade, and spits the cork away, the vial dropping to the ground. The intensity grows along her soft features until only the hardened warrior is all that remains. She adopts Quick Fox Still Lives and readies herself for the fight of her life. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 19/06/2021 18:38
The monster snarls and rushes towards the priestess with preternatural speed.
TheOrsini 19/06/2021 18:41

Dandiil {Takumi} 20/06/2021 06:28

The large creature comes pounding out of seemingly nowhere The kid knows what he must do, but he's not sure he can pull it off... 'can this work? Will it help?' He starts to draw the moisture from the air and the earth, gathering all of the water that he can find waiting for the right moment to release it.
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/06/2021 16:04
Water masses before Koide, bubbling up out of the ground in front of her before surging towards the garkain. The powerful beast leaps the wave as it moves and is only slightly buffeted by the passing flood, landing directly in front of the warrior woman who blocks its path towards the priestess.
Mike 20/06/2021 16:47

A serene, moth-like spirit manifests above the area, and scatters glowing dust all around the charging beast, causing it to be covered in glowing red. Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/06/2021 03:22

Kyle [Arcadian] 21/06/2021 08:14

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 23/06/2021 11:32
As the garkain rushes in and Koide begins to deliver orders to the group, Lyrel's hands draw his familial blade in a blink of a eye as he rolls his shoulders back as he allows the wordless tune of the Bladesong begins to take hold of his mind and body, calming his fears and concerns. He reaches his left hand down to the large blue gem attached to the pommel of his blade, twirling a finger around the end. "Honoured ancestors grant me the alacrity to face down this terrible foe." As his finger tip twirls around the gem, a silver mist begins to gather around it and he brings it up toward his face. He inhales the mist through his mouth and nostrils... just as time around him begins to slow. He finds himself moving at a normal speed, but everything around him seems sluggish, but to his companions Lyrel's movements are moving so rapidly that he seems to leave an echo trail behind all his gestures. He breaks quickly to defend the priestess against the garkain which is now looming over the slight woman. As he slides to a graceful stop, DÅngfÄ“ng slices through the chaotic battle, leaving behind a faint echo trail of blue glow in the air as it aims for a slice through the garkain's midsection. Just before the edge can connect, the garkain's wildly flailing claws turn the weapon aside and a potentially deadly strike is turned into a glancing blow to the beast's armored thigh! (edited)

Kyle [Arcadian] 23/06/2021 12:00

TheOrsini 23/06/2021 12:07

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 23/06/2021 15:27

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/06/2021 17:10
Ryuzuko shakes off the roar, but Tsuruki is not as lucky, standing dazed in the field. "Not again..." The dragonborn thinks too himself, being in the same situation he was the last time they fought one of these things. Ryuzuko hops off Tsuruki and walks towards the menacing creature. Tightening his grip on Rakurai, his spear, his hands begin to charge with sparks of electricity, arcing around his two weapons. "Todoroku...Rakurai..." he says quietly, staring at his spear. As the last word leaves his mouth, the weapon begins to crackle and arc even more streaks of lightning, until it flashes white. Once the flash disapates, those watching see a bright blue bolt of lightning, grasped in Ryuzuko's hand. "Your time of killing as at an end, abomination!" With a thunderous roar, almost loud enough to rival the garkain's, Ryuzuko pulls his arm back before shooting it forward, releasing the lightning bolt from his hand. "Inazuma no tsuiraku!!" He exclaims, causing the bolt to burst with more energy and streak ever faster to his target. Within mere fractions of a second the lightning infused spear launches from his hand and impacts the monsterous creature, exploding into a massive burst of energy, followed by a strike of lightning from the sky. The creature violently shakes as the electricity burns through it's body, leaving its skin smoking. As the light disperses, Rakurai, lodged into the back of the beast, glows fainter and fainter until shifting back into a spear. "Stings, doesn't it, monster?" He snarls as he grips his odachi, ready for retaliation. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/06/2021 17:20

TheOrsini 26/06/2021 10:28

Dandiil {Takumi} 27/06/2021 07:02

One shot wide and the other hit its mark cleanly. He then sees another claw coming out of the ground... "There's another one" the half-elf calls down to his companions. (edited)

TheOrsini 30/06/2021 06:35
'Kill them all, Ryuz-san.' Koide spares a moment to glance at the dragonborn's work, while she hastily anoints the graves with the sacred oil. She had no prayer to offer the body buried below her, but that custom was not required. A superstition to give power to religion. She understood that the gods were real; that they attended to some of their follower's needs, but the added ceremony was to the benefit of the lay folk who felt the need to appease the gods. Koide shook her head and continued, moving to the next grave. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 30/06/2021 21:51

Mike 01/07/2021 00:08
Sadao kicks the ground and gets himself airborne to survey the fight. "Yeah, I'm alright!" He calls back to Takumi. As he feels the wind surround him in his sudden ascension, a sense of exhilaration comes over him. The unparalleled freedom of flight quickly calls to mind the tale of a reckless fugitive, and he needs only lay a hand on his scroll to fix it in his mind. As he hovers above, he outstretches his other hand, pointing a finger at either garkain spawn in an odd gesture. Speaking a confusing word in Primordial, a purplish haze surrounds the aberrations for a moment, impeding their movements. Meanwhile, Kinoh uses Viraj as cover against the garkain he is locked in combat with. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/07/2021 02:03
Viraj grunts an acknowledgement to Lyrel. Taking the blade of his axe, the lumberjack hooks it behind an ankle of the garkain. With two hands on the handle, he then yanks the weapon back, upending the creature. Following through with his momentum, he spins and delivers an thorn-tipped elbow to the midsection of the falling creature. As it falls to it's back onto the ground, a bit of ichor begins to flow from the puncture wound that the druid delivered. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 04/07/2021 04:46
Lyrel looks to Viraj after the druid brings down the creature, wrapping his blade in the same thundering energy as he slashes twice in rapid succession with Dongfeng, but the garkain is able to bat away the first strike, but still suffering the cacophonous burst of sound. The second blade strike slashes into the forearm, but the undead nature of the garkain makes the wound less than it would on a living creature!
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/07/2021 23:15
The garkain rises amidst the cacophonous boom of thunder, once more going after Lyrel and this time the Elf's fate seems inevitable. However, yet again the monster is repelled by a shield of force at the last possible moment. Meanwhile, the other garkain pushes itself to its feet and leaps at Viraj, wrapping its clawed arms around the druid as it digs its fangs into his neck. However, they fail to pierce the thick bark of his transmuted skin. The priestess's summoned blade continues to slash at the creatures while she administers holy oil to the graves. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 05/07/2021 00:00
Once a good distance away, Tsuruki makes a hard turn, charging back around between the two garkain. "Teki o kÅgeki suru chikara o kudasai..." Ryuzuko chants as he grips his amulet, harnessing more divine power. The dragonborn holds Koide's sword at his left side, ready to strike once within range. As they approach, Ryuzuko swings the blade upward with a trail of static, slicing the creature being repelled by Lyrel, clean in half. With the momentum he swings the katana up and strikes downwards onto the other garkain with a small explosion of lightning, deeply injuring it. "Keep your eyes out for more!" he snarls aloud as Tsuruki flanks around the other side of the creature before pounding it with his hooves. (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 05/07/2021 20:01
Takumi keeps his wits about him as the smell of decayed flesh and rotting entrails reaches him. He spots the druid wrapped in the creatures embrace, 'Well, that's not normal' The angry bite at the druid, from the flesh made life dispels any thoughts that the half elf might've had. He summons his strength again, condensing a large ball of air into his palm. "Please, don't blow up, please don't blow up..." He mutters to himself as he splits the ball of air in two. The thought of pain worries him, when he has an additional thought. He throws the compressed air to the combat below, giving an additional little burst of wind to increase their speed. Takumi cheers when they don't explode in his hand. The two balls of force strike the monster at the same time, one of them slicing the jaw of the creature off, spraying congealed blood on poor Viraj. The other blasts through the top of the monsters head, slamming hard into the ground as it travels through its body. Dirt and coagulated blood erupt from the impact, creating a thin cloud of dust. Takumi calls down to Viraj playfully. "Sorry about your Girlfriend, Viraj!"
Kyle [Arcadian] 05/07/2021 21:01
"Quickly!" Mingxia calls to Koide and Sadao as she spreads the oil throughout the burial grounds. Dark tendrils of shadow still swirl amongst the graves. "Before this fell power raises more from their final rest." (edited)
Mike 05/07/2021 21:07
"Got it!" Sadao swoops down to take some oil, then flies over to another side of the grounds to begin working inward, performing each rite as properly as he can, given the rush.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 05/07/2021 21:08
Ryuzuko and Tsuruki ride over to the body of the prime garkain, where the dragonborn snatches up his odachi. With a hefty slash, he throws the blood off before sliding the blade back into it's scabbard, before retrieving Raikurai from the corpse of the monster, as he continues watch for more creatures to emerge. (edited)
TheOrsini 05/07/2021 22:45
Koide dashes to the final grave, dousing it with the sacred oil. She tosses the bottle aside and runs to clear the site.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 05/07/2021 22:55
Viraj lets out a hearty laugh as he wipes the gore from his face. "You're just jealous!" he replies to the airborne sorcerer. "What else is needed to cleanse these cursed graves?!" He shouts to Koide and Sadao as they run about performing the ritual.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 05/07/2021 22:56
Lyrel turns to watch after the final enemy is downed and tries to fully understand Koideâ€™s intentions...
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 05/07/2021 22:58
Ryuzuko rides over to Mingxia, ready to hoist her onto Tsuruki's back once she has finished the rites.
TheOrsini 06/07/2021 00:49
Koide motions to the druid, with a large explosion with her arms. Lyrel catches the meaning.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 06/07/2021 01:44
Viraj's eyes spark and the druid give the huntress a thumbs up. He hurries to the edge of the burial site and quickly begins his ritual as he did along the road. "Earth my body, Water my blood, Air my breath, Fire my spirit, Spirits of Arden we thank you. Goddess of fire, Sun's fire, lightening, Flame on the hearth, Fire that cleanses and destroys, Fire that purifies, Now take the dead." With one hand, he takes a pulls a piece of yellowish mineral from one pouch and a bit of bat droppings with the other. "Let them become flame and ash. From their spirits a pure flame will rise." Clasping his hands together, the reagents mix and soon a large orb of fire begins to grown between his hands. Having grown to the size of a large watermelon, the druid lifts his arms above his head and hurls the ball of fire into the middle of the grave site. "Go in peace." (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 06/07/2021 01:53
Takumi backs away from the blast and heat from the burning oil, and calls down... "Let me know when you want me to put it out!!" Flying around, he circles the graveyard to make sure that the entire area is covered with the flames, and to ensure that the flames don't spread too far beyond. (edited)
TheOrsini 06/07/2021 13:44
Koide lets the oil burn for a while, but when they begin to die down, she moves back in with the holy water, waving to the priestess and the others to remain vigilant. The final step of the ritual was all that remained.
Kyle [Arcadian] 06/07/2021 16:40
Grasping Ryuzuko's hand, Mingxia allows the mighty dragonborn to pull her up atop Tsuruki. Together, they race from the field of graves, clearing the area just moments before orange flames streak from Viraj to blossom into an enormous fireball behind them. The wave of heat is scorching against their backs as the celestial warhorse comes charging out with its two passengers. For a long moment, the flames linger, confined to the burial site by Takumi as he swoops over the treeline. Surgical gusts of wind, cold and water leave the scorched earth licked with rime, until the fire slowly fades to ash. The priestess slips from Tsuruki's back and cautiously follows Koide, aspergillum in hand. The blessed water makes the blackened tufts of grass glisten in the sunlight and as it touches the burned remains of the garkain, each one crumbles to dust. "It is done," she finally declares, once the last grave has been anointed. Mingxia turns to Koide, Sadao and their companions and bows in gratitude. "You have saved Tonghua today. I could not have done this alone. How can we ever repay you? Our village does not have much, but we would thank you in any way that we can."
Mike 06/07/2021 17:00
Sadao places his feet firmly on the ground, landing near Koide and the priestess. The struggle was finally over. He looks everyone over, finding those that had been wounded in safe condition, and lets out a sigh of relief. As Lai Mingxia expresses gratitude, he returns her bow. "Your help was instrumental, Lai-shéng." He returns to a standing position, his face starting to flush. "All I can ask for, though, is what we mentioned before. If it's within your power, please. Restore Koide's voice. That'd be... more than enough of a reward to me."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 06/07/2021 17:22
Ryuzuko holds Koide's katana im his hands, palms below it, handing it back to the girl. "Arigato, Koide-san. Your katana served me well and I return it to you." The dragonborn, now standing firm on the ground with Tsuruki at his side, watches as Lai Mingxia and Koide finish the ritual with the cleansing of the garkain.
Kyle [Arcadian] 06/07/2021 17:45
The priestess nods in sympathy and beckons to Koide to show the injury to her throat. "This is a grievous wound indeed," she confirms after several moments with a sigh of regret, "but do not despair. While it is beyond my power to heal such damage, it is not impossible. Travel to the Obsidian Maw and seek out the sea witch known as Kuma. She has rare skill in such matters. Her magic is the stuff of legend." (edited)
Mike 06/07/2021 18:09
Although the priestess's answer is obvious enough in her sigh, Sadao translates this to Koide and the others regardless. "Even so, we thank you for the information." He says with another short bow, before turning to Koide. "Seems it'll be longer still. I'm... really sorry."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 06/07/2021 18:12
Knowing they need to develop the cure for Lyrel's disease from the larger garkain, Viraj walks over to the charred remains of the creature and pulls out a couple of tools from his pack - a small hammer and chisel - to extract its fangs. "Hold on a moment there, miss," he says holding up his hands, hoping the priestess understands his meaning. "Needing to get something from this one first." He points the creature then his teeth. She gives the druid a nod and continues to cleanse the other bodies and graves with her holy water. Meanwhile, Viraj works on the extraction of the fangs. Fortunately, with much to the tissue burned away from his fire makes it a much easier task, but he takes his time as to not damage anything. After a moment, he is finally able to get the fang chiseled out. "Got it," he says triumphantly. He deposits the tooth into one of his bottles used for his potions. "We'll get you fixed up, Lyrel," he calls out, shaking the bottle, the tooth clinking within. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 06/07/2021 18:32
Lyrel continues to check all the area to ensure there are no more threats before assisting Viraj in any way he can with the extraction. Once that is done he looks to the druid with a thankful glance. "I very much appreciate that. Koide-san, if you must travel further to fix yourself I will accompany you on this journey to find Kuma."
TheOrsini 06/07/2021 23:52
Koide is simply satisfied. She feels a brief moment of joy in her reuniting with Shi no kaze. As the others consult with the priestess, she quickly opens herself to void to make sure no other Garkain spawn remain. 'But it was... just the void.' As Sadao and Lyrel and the others talk about her, passing thanks and gratitude, she is caught up by the overwhelming support. 'The Obsidian Maw, huh.' She smiles, but her look betrays some worried thought. For she remembers the light from that area of the sea, the one that came when they took passage to Dandong. 'What greater dangers await them?' Unlike this one, she would be ill prepared for it. 'Could she put them through such peril?' Her mind is pulled back when Sadao finally tells the rest of them the town doesn't have any money to pay them. Koide's brow furrows in growing frustration. She pulls out the letter that had started them on this journey. There was a promised price; her services were of value. She could force the town to produce compensation, or suffer under the law, but... The ice that had protected that burning fire; the one that kept her alone away from others unless she choose to have them. 'It was gone.' Had this been a few months ago, she would have sought recompense, but today Koide just sighs quietly. She walks a few step over to one of the few dying remnants of Viraj's fires, and let's the letter drift from her into the flame. For a moment, Koide considered retiring from adventuring, settling down, applying her trade as an Alchemist. She look towards both Lyrel and Sadao, 'Maybe both could sate her.' She laughs silently to herself, the mirth returning to her face for a moment. Her laughing reflex jostles the silver chain around her neck. She looks down at it, and lift the Raven symbol to her eyes. The mirth becomes resolution, 'No, her path still lay before her. She still had to protect others, or die trying. To keep tragedies like that had befallen the Yakuda clan, her family.' She lets the moment pass, and the medallion drop back around her neck and rejoins the others. Koide rejoins the others knowing that their paths would surely diverge here. She shakes the hand of the great Dragonborn warrior, bowing in great respect, meeting his gaze in the ritualism. And smiling as they release the bow. She would have offered him her thanks, or written it had her paper been at hand, but her expression exudes the gratitude. She moves to Viraj, offering him an appreciate hug, knowing that he had his own path to tread. Koide pats Takumi on the shoulder, and then catches him up in a hug. She strains to get a 'thank you" from her lips. But it doesn't come, instead she just mouths it, put her forehead against his in silent thanks. She catches Sadao as he speaks further with the priestess, and envelopes him in a sidelong hug, ignoring propriety. She plants a friendly kiss on the cheek for his dedication and concern, and support. She tightens the hug in gratitude, but leaves some ambiguity to his own imagination. And then she starts to approach Lyrel and get caught up in the moment, but simply smiles and holds her finger up to wait. 'Not gonna catch that shit from him over platitudes.' She mouths After the cure, and gives him a knowing, suggestive smile. And then bursts into a fit of silent laughter at the sour look on his face.
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/10/2021 16:36
Yingkou, One Week Later Lyrel looks from Ryuzuko to Sadao to Takumi to Viraj and then back to the ostentatious junk that bobs gently on the water besides them. The five companions are stood on a pier at the docks. That is, the end of the docks that wasn't trampled flat by the kaiju attack two weeks ago. The port side of Yingkou is still abuzz with construction crews and other workers going about rebuilding their town in the wake of the monster's destructive rampage. Three days ago, after returning to Dandong, Koide departed before dawn without a word. The Je'dahnian warrior woman had chosen to set out alone to seek the sea witch Kuma, who the priestess Lai Mingxia claimed had the power to heal Koide's throat and return her ability to speak. In the wake of this, Lyrel invited those left behind to accompany him north to investigate the recent kaiju attack on Yingkou. They were a capable bunch and he'd been impressed by both their skills and their ability to work together during the Garkain hunt. It hadn't taken long to learn that the monster never ventured far beyond the town, instead returning to the sea for reasons unknown a few miles north of Yingkou. Furthermore, a boat named the Baochuan is leaving tomorrow morning to sail out onto the Obsidian Maw and uncover where the colossal creature came from and why it attacked the town in the first place. The leader (and patron) of this expedition is one Zheng He, a self-made merchant and Renaissance man. Zheng is a natural showman and has half of Yingkou buying into his antics as a welcome distraction from the devastation that the kaiju has wrought on their homes. Rather than pay for the services of skilled sailors and warriors, Zheng has declared that only those that sufficiently impress him will 'make the cut' and 'be permitted to join' his expedition. By now, many are vying for a spot on the crew of such a 'prestigious expedition' and little time remains to impress Zheng sufficiently for an invitation.
Mike 25/10/2021 21:25
"It's a wonder it can sail," comments Sadao in Honmin, looking for a glimmer of understanding from Ryu, and snickering. Their recent lessons in the language had been proceeding remarkably well as of late, to the point where Ryu now knew enough for the two of them to exchange a casual joke or two, given enough context. He turns to Lyrel, who looked a sight better than a week prior. "I didn't think we'd have to prove ourselves just to get a chance at seeing that kaiju again. What do you suppose he'll have us do?"
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 27/10/2021 20:40
Lyrel still looked tired from his brush with undeath, dark circles beneath his eyes and a sallow color still among his cheeks. He looks at Sadao with a wry smile. "I do not know, but if we do, we shall not be denied. Of all those gathered, I see none that can match the prowess of those who stand with me." He shares a smile with his companions, though he still felt the sting of loss without Koide. He had never been a leader before, he worked better alone, but those assembled here made it easy.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 27/10/2021 20:48
Viraj's eyes scan the gaudy ship before them. "It sure looks fancy," he grumbles. "Doesn't mean it sails well." Back in Higashiko, the Rajani man and his father, Sujit, had always focused on producing quality vessels without the need for such ornamentation. He shakes his head and scoffs lightly before adding, "This is our only choice for going after this monster? Anyone trying to show off this much is likely lacking in something." (edited)
Dandiil {Takumi} 28/10/2021 01:36
Takumi, stands nearby watching the sea push the waves to the shore must have zoned out a moment. He turns to Viraj with a hurtful glance. "Am I really lacking in something?" His glittering blue cape flowing and fluttering from the half-elfs shoulders playing with the light breeze. "How do you think this Zheng guy wants to be impressed? Contest of skills? or something more elaborate... Maybe a performance."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 29/10/2021 05:22

Kyle [Arcadian] 31/10/2021 11:23

Mike 03/11/2021 05:58

Mike 05/11/2021 06:44

A pair of bare-chested and well-muscled guards stand at the top of the ramp. They scowl at Ryuzuko as he approaches, but do not challenge the dragonborn. Kyle [Arcadian] 17/11/2021 19:56

Kyle [Arcadian] 23/11/2021 20:25
The newly dubbed Ajentodon follow Chi-Fu inside and immediately they can hear bubble of conversation and music from below deck. Warm lantern light flickers in the belly of the Baochuan and the lively tune of an erhu keeps rhythm with the clapping of those gathered while an elven woman with pale skin and long, black hair dances with Zheng He. Chi-Fu stands waiting for a brief moment after entering and then coughs loudly to make his presence known. Slowly the music dies away and the dancing ceases. All eyes are on the new arrivals. "Zheng-daren, I present to you the Ajentodon," Chi-Fu introduces the party, bowing deeply to Zheng He and stepping aside.
Dandiil {Takumi} 25/11/2021 20:17

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 29/11/2021 23:14

Kyle [Arcadian] 03/12/2021 19:56

Kyle [Arcadian] 07/12/2021 19:49
