Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 08/12/2021 08:42
Ryuzuko looks down at Takumi, shaking his head. "We won't know until we ask them what they require of us." The dragonborn then moves aside for the rest of the group to enter, namely those who can speak Honmin.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/12/2021 05:46
Viraj stands and takes in the salty air from the sea, staring off towards Je'dahn for a moment and thinking on that day from the boat on their voyage over to Hong. "It's better then sitting around at home and letting one's inner monsters eat at you. Plus, I did not like what I heard and saw from the seas the day whatever-it-was that did all this." He waves toward the rebuilding efforts in the harbor. "As you said, it is unsettling to have something like this roaming the waters so close to my own home. Fortunately, my friends here seem to enjoy such challenges."
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/12/2021 20:17
Ishaan blinks in surprise. "You saw something at sea? What happened?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/12/2021 05:25
Viraj nods solemnly. "Yes. It was the day before with arrived in Dandong as we crossed from Je'dahn. A powerful wave struck our boat, and then a strange dark pillar of, uh... something rose through the sky that met with swirling clouds above. Haven't seen anything like it." He shakes his head, still trying to understand what they saw. "Though we didn't see any creature, I could still hear a roar in the distance. Something large and reptile-like by the sound of it." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 15/12/2021 15:00
Ishaan mirrors Viraj's nod. "They say that it had scales, claws and a tail. Reptile sounds about right. You're lucky that it didn't catch you at sea."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 15/12/2021 18:23
Lyrel looks at the man, then back to his group. "If they wish to see a show, perhaps we could give them a show of our martial prowess to a musical show." He cracks a smile as he looks to Sadoa and Takumi. "What do our resident performers think? Ryu and I can provide them with a show to go with your music?"
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 16/12/2021 20:08
One of the figures that are already in the chamber, sitting comfortably with his legs crossed says in Je'dahnian"We are define by our actions" when they turn to look at him they see a young man wearing a pale yellow gi, green obi and pale green hakama, weared by travels and use. He is wearing a piramidal straw hat so it's hard to see his face but the party would say he is young. A wide, circular walking staff is at his side and an another object is resting at his right side, carefully wrapped in silk. It's not clear but it could be a sword of some sort. At his feet there is a backpack. "He is looking for warriors. Your idea should work. If you are warriors of course."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 16/12/2021 23:06

Kyle [Arcadian] 16/12/2021 23:13
"He's hunting a monster at sea," Ishaan states simply. "A monster so vast that just walking through Yingkou crushed buildings. Show Zheng He what you can do that makes you valuable to him. Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/12/2021 04:59
Stepping inside, Viraj notices his companions quietly discussing some matter amongst themselves while Zeng He looks on expectantly. "Would you help me speak to the captain?" he says to Ishaan, who replies with a simple affirmative nod. The druid then looks to the captain and clears his throat. "Pardon me, sir, if my words aren't as impressive as some of my friends here - who seem intent on wanting to impress you with some grand performance, but I understand that you seek warriors for your quest here. "When we arrived in Dandong, we found that some many-head creature had burrowed it's way under the town. By the end of the day of our arrival, we had taken care to the creature though. We blew up the in its lair, making use of the powder used for fireworks." He smiles proudly at this point. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/12/2021 22:39
Zheng He takes a seat as he listens to Ishaan translate Viraj's story, reclining in it like a king holding court on his throne. Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/12/2021 05:18
Ryuzuko crosses his arms, arching his back straighter, showing off his full height as he looks at Zheng He. "More recently, we performed the rites required to cleanse a monstrous creature called a garkain from Tonghua. Including preventing it from spawning more of it's kind through the use of corpses of dead townspeople and travelers." The dragonborn pulls at the collar of his shitagi, revealing the large, almost burned, scar the lesser garkain left in his scales. "This is what just one of it's spawn could do..." pausing for a second as he eyes those present, "and we killed the alpha. Somehow felling the creature with little lasting injuries." he then fixes his shirt back up and eases himself more. "Some of us may be new to these lands. Kyle [Arcadian] 18/12/2021 21:16
"Impressive," Zheng He remarks, with a nod of respect. "Why? Why have you come here and helped the people of these towns?"
Mike 19/12/2021 00:08
Sadao slows his pace as he enters the junk with the group, trying to think of a way to leave a lasting impression on such a wealthy person. Takumi's watery serpent serves as a magical prelude however, as they pierce the crowd to stand before the illustrious Zheng He and his coterie. "No real time for preamble, right?" His eyes seem to say in response to Tak and Lyrel's propositions. The bard opts to join Viraj and Ryu in their introductions and accolades. He takes a deep breath before speaking, feeling a hint of pressure from the many curious gazes they drew. It'd been a while since he'd addressed an assembly of upper-class individuals. "There is a saying in my family. 'The covered flame is secure, but shares no warmth, and sheds no light.' I cannot speak for my friends' personal reasons, but it's the Huiya clan's duty to use our abilities to help those in need. And now more than ever, from what we've seen in just this past few weeks. The realms are out of balance, and sinister forces seem intent on keeping them that way. Every life we save brings us closer to discovering the truth." He lets his conviction carry his words, hoping that will leave the intended impression on the patron, and those gathered.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 19/12/2021 01:02
Ryuzuko glances at Sadao, nodding in respect to the bard before adding to the question. "I am of the Buzoku no Ryuginjin. We are taught to aid those in need with our strength and skills, wherever we go. Most of our group came here at the request of a friend, to aid her in a mission she had in Tonghua. She has since set out on her own path, as she always has." He adjusts his stance, resting his hands on his hips. "Once we rid the town of the garkain, we came here at the request of Lyrel here," Ryuz looks down at the elf. "To aid him in his search for the beast that attacked this town." He holds his palm out to Zheng He, motioning what he was about to say next was directed at him. "We heard that you were looking for men to join your expedition into the Maw. And so it would seem that our goals align, if but only at their source." The dragonborn then crosses his arms once again. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 19/12/2021 01:19

Kyle [Arcadian] 19/12/2021 20:53

Mike 20/12/2021 11:44

The young man leans back, putting a hand to the back of his head and scratching slightly out of habit, with a self-conscious smile on his face. His 'bold and cool' front hasn't crumpled entirely, but it's certainly been fractured.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 20/12/2021 18:07

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 21/12/2021 17:11
Lyrel turns towards Viraj. "Two weeks this evening. My friends reported that they saw a massive column of black energy rise into the sky on their journey from Je'dahn before this creature first arrived. Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 22/12/2021 00:03

Mike 22/12/2021 17:07

Kyle [Arcadian] 22/12/2021 23:11
Up on deck, there are already several scorch marks on the deck where burning torches have been hurled onto it. The air is full of clamour as sailors run about extinguishing torches and peering into the dark in search of their assailants.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/12/2021 05:51
Viraj rushes out with the rest. Using his druid magic, he begins to snuff out a few of the torches as he moves to the rail facing the docks. He peers out into the darkness, looking for any signs of the goons he saw in the alley.
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/12/2021 11:26
Viraj can see several signs of movement in the darkness. Fast shadows darting around the ship. Then one lights a bottle full of oil to hurl onto the ship and in the flickering light he can see that they could well be more of the same disgruntled townsfolk.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/12/2021 19:34

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/12/2021 19:46
Ryuzuko follows closely behind Viraj as they search for the commotion. Seeing men throwing objects onto the deck, the dragonborn strides down the ramp to the dock, swirling his hands around. "Henka no kaze," he says as a ball of harsh wind forms between his hands, catching random debris. Once the ronin is on the dock, positioned horizontally from the ship and facing the direction of the thugs, he shoots his hands forward. The ball of air between his claws rushes into a powerful gust of wind, sending loose objects and people flying a short distance as well as extinguishing any unprotected flame in it's path. (edited)
Mike 23/12/2021 21:25
Unable to see much beyond the briefly flickering light from one of the vandals, Sadao holds out his hand in front of his face, his thumb and forefinger pinched together. With an eldritch whisper of "Soi sáng," he blows hard between his fingers, and a swathe of ethereal, glowing petals issue forth. Carried by Ryu's gust of wind, they spread throughout the gang of thugs, clinging to those unable to avoid them. "Don't think the dark can hide you from retribution!" He yells to them in Honmin.

Kyle [Arcadian] 21/01/2022 21:12
The Changchun drinking house is a simple stone building on the north side of town near the water. It seems to have been fortunate enough to not lie in the path of the Kaiju's destruction. Inside the lights are low the several men sit at the tables talking quietly amongst themselves as they drink huangjiu. From their style of dress, most appear to be dock workers. They eye the ostentatious foreigners suspiciously as the Ajentodon enter.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 25/01/2022 20:48
Ignoring the suspicious staring, Tatsu calmly walks towards the bartender and bows respectfully to him. He then addresses him in his own language to be sure he is understood. â€Good evening. We have been told that we should ask hereâ€ He doesnâ€™t yell but he talks in clear voice so anyone close enough and paying attention can hear him
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/01/2022 21:14
The bartender stares at Tatsu for a long moment, before nodding and ducking through a curtain of beads into the back. After a few minutes, an orange robed man with dark hair emerges. "If you could spare some of them I would appreciate so I can learn about it. But I do have a particular question if you don't mind me asking. How its teachings could lead a group of people to attack the vessel of Zheng He when he is trying to stop the Kaiju that attacked the city not so long ago? I am curious"
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/01/2022 21:00
"Is he doing that?" Li asks Tatsu with interest.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 26/01/2022 23:00
"What do you think is he doing?" replies Tatsu "Please enlighten us"
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/01/2022 20:15
"Who knows," Li answers, raising up his hands on each side and taking a seat at a nearby table. "He has made a great show of sailing into this town and putting on a show. It's been a wonderful distraction for many. However, I'm not aware of him having yet done anything to investigate the Kaiju attack, or to prevent another."
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 27/01/2022 20:24
"But it is known that he has call for volunteers to track it and hunt it down. Even if he hasn't, that doesn't explain why his vessel has been attacked, and why those who made it claimed to be following your teachings...Don't you find it unsettling?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/01/2022 20:29
"Perhaps these discontent people seek only to tarnish my good reputation?" Li remarks in return.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 27/01/2022 23:31
â€The candor with he talks about the teachings cannot be faked. He wish no harm to you or your reputation. â€œ Tatsu cannot hide his disappointment â€Why do you cast this doubt upon them or their intentions? It is your way to talk poorly of your followers? Kyle [Arcadian] 28/01/2022 23:20

Kyle [Arcadian] 30/01/2022 14:07
The hostile and incomprehensible words from the enormous dragonborn warrior draw fearful glances from the drinking house's patrons and a stern look from the barkeep.

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 31/01/2022 06:41
Ryuzuko's disposition softens as he realizes he startled the patrons with his words. "I...uh..." he starts to mutter in very basic and broken Homin as he tries to find how to say he's sorry. He then bows before them in respect before giving an eye to his companions who could better translate his intentions. (edited)
Mike 02/02/2022 08:07
"You can find the words," Sadao says in a quiet but supportive tone. He passes his hand over the Dragonborn with an utterance in Primordial. Quickly, the gaps in Ryu's speech seem to fill in for those listening, even when he is forced to switch to Je'dahnian. Letting Ryu speak his piece properly, he chimes in with his own rejoinder. "We're leaving in good faith, Li-xiÄnshÄ“ng, to help the honored Zheng He with a serious threat to Yingkou. I hope you as well, have the people's best interests in mind." He bows, as courtesy dictates, but looks up with a scrutinizing eye, to see if Li has returned the gesture, from either him or Ryuzuko.
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/02/2022 22:37
Li Hongzhi stands to mirror the bows of his leaving guests, before returning to his drink.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/02/2022 02:07
Ryuzuko looks to his side at Sadao, giving him a nod. "Thank you friend." the Je'dahnian dragonborn composes himself before correcting his earlier muttering. The ronin makes a respectful bow to the barkeep before reiterating more clearly with the help of Sadao's magic. "I'm sorry to have startled you and your patrons. I was merely expressing my distaste of something and I mean none of you any harm." The dragonborn straightens his back and moves out of the bar, following the others back to the docks.
Mike 03/02/2022 06:34
Sadao exits the bar with the others, but lags behind a bit. He looks back at the building, in thought, before holding out a hand, palm downwards, and rubbing his thumb and pointer finger together. Ethereal golden leaves begin to appear from his hand, dropping one by one to the ground, and forming a small pile, from which a familiar gold-tailed tanuki springs forth. She paws at her face as if wiping off sleep. "Joy, I'd nearly thought you'd forgotten about me. What is it now?" "Kinoh, it's time you earned your keep. Since you love gossip so much, why don't you stay around here and listen to what Li Hongzhi has to say behind our backs?" "Hm. At least you know me well." With a derisive flick of her tail, she sets off to the bar and attempts to climb up the side of the building, looking for a stealthier way in than the front door.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/02/2022 20:56
The patrons seem not entirely happy with Ryu's 'distaste', but are nonetheless reassured that he poses no threat and return to their drinks. Outside the building, a mote of flame suddenly appears in the air in front of Lyrel, blossoming out into a piece of paper that he catches still warm from the air. The elven mage reads the fire message and falls quiet for a few moments, before turning back towards Ryuzuko and Viraj. "My friends, I am sorry, but I'm afraid that I have been summoned back to Dalian. I will not be able to join you on this hunt." Takumi glances sidelong between Lyrel and their other companions. "Never much was one for boats," he admits, "and I have always wanted to see Dalian." Lyrel nods stoically to the sorcerer in acceptance. Meanwhile, Kinoh vanishes quickly and silently up the side of the Changchun and into the dark. (edited)
Mike 03/02/2022 21:16
While surprised, Sadao realizes the gravity of Lyrel's duty, plain on his face. Whatever was written in that letter was clearly not to be challenged, even in the face of a kaiju. He nods, before stepping forward and giving the two of them a proper bow. "It... stings to see you both go, to be honest. But I can understand, and I'll get over it." He raises his head to regard them. The elf swordsman had taught him a valuable lesson in caution and humility. The half-elf had always brought levity to the harshest of times on their journey. He hadn't known them overlong, but he knew he'd miss their respective presences. Before he knows it, his eyes are watering, and he quickly wipes them with his sleeve. "Hah... what's with that? Not like I'll never see you again." He laughs sincerely, and gives them a big grin. "Farewell, and take care of each other!"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/02/2022 21:36
Ryuzuko puts a hand on each of their shoulders, giving them a nod of respect. "Safe travels my friends. And if you are ever in need of my blade, I will be there to wield it." His piercing gaze falls on Takumi. "Keep yourself out of trouble and continue to trust your instincts, they will serve you better than worrying about what you should do." The dragonborn then turns to Lyrel. "Keep an eye on our little entertainer." With another nod, Ryuzuko backs away before bowing to his departing companions.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 04/02/2022 20:41
Viraj looks to Lyrel and gives the him a respectful nod. "Be careful out there." Then, after giving the elf a more discerning look, he reaches into his bag and pulls out a small glass vial. "I look forward to the next meal you can cook up for me." He pulls out a stem of Dragontongue petals from his herb pouch. "Here. Remember just a little to give things a kick." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/02/2022 23:02
Lyrel and Takumi happily accept Viraj's gifts with thanks and wave farewell to their erstwhile companions as they depart. Ryuzuko, Sadao, Tatsu and Viraj are left stood outside the Changchun drinking house, while Kinoh makes herself comfortable amongst the rafters.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 05/02/2022 18:33

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 06/02/2022 22:56

Mike 08/02/2022 09:40
Sadao nods affirmatively, and heads for an alleyway just outside of the public house. Finding a place that hopefully wouldn't be too conspicuous, he unslings the case from his shoulder and retrieves the Huiya scroll from within, faintly glowing with magic. Squatting in the alley, he unfurls the scroll, and peers intently at what appears to others to be a blank sheet of paper. To the bard's eyes, it is the interior of the building they were just in, from Kinoh's perspective. As he absorbs himself in the scroll, the sounds begin to form in his mind as well, until it is as though he were inside once more. (edited)
Mike 08/02/2022 09:52

Mike 09/02/2022 07:24
Sadao wrests himself from the vision, with a word on his lips. "What...?" He certainly hadn't expected to hear that. He mentally contacts Kinoh one last time, having her linger for a few more minutes in case they said something else of note, after which he would recall her into the realm of spirits. He looks for Viraj, who'd taken up a position as lookout in the form of a cat. "Vir," he half-whispers, "listen to this." He tells the druid what he heard, to get his opinion.

Kyle [Arcadian] 11/02/2022 09:03

Kyle [Arcadian] 15/02/2022 22:27
Asking around amongst the crew reveals that, following the revelry seen earlier in the evening, Zheng He has retired to the captain's cabin to get some rest before the ship's departure early tomorrow morning. The door is closed with two men standing watching outside.
Mike 15/02/2022 23:56

Kyle [Arcadian] 16/02/2022 20:06

Mike 16/02/2022 20:09

Kyle [Arcadian] 16/02/2022 21:25

Mike 18/02/2022 09:37
Sadao steps inside, bowing before the heavyset trader. "He-xiÄnshÄ“ng, we have a request that you must hear. We know for a fact that Li Hongzhi's group, the Falun Gong, are planning to delay this boat further come tomorrow. Our advice is that we set sail immediately, to prevent any more bloodshed, and be on our way to stopping the true threat to this land: the kaiju."
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 18/02/2022 12:38

Kyle [Arcadian] 18/02/2022 21:39
Zheng He is wrapped up in a silk night gown with furs over the top and is clearly preparing to sleep. For a moment, he seems surprised to see Sadao and Tatsu so late, but that quickly changes when he hears what they have to say. "Li Hongzhi?" Zheng He repeats in surprise. "You're certain? Very well, we will make preparations to depart immediately." Crossing to the door, the merchant throws it open and begins giving instructions to his guards. "Rouse the crew and have the ship made ready to sail. We leave tonight!" As the word is spread, the peaceful hush of the night is transformed into a hive of activity as the oars are put out and the sail unfurled. Less than half an hour later, the Baochuan finally begins to glide out onto the open water.
Mike 19/02/2022 05:05
"While not as glamorous, wisdom has prevailed. Thank you for your swift response, He-xiÄnshÄ“ng." Sadao inclines his head out of gratitude. "We should discuss our plans for how to deal with the threat once we've had some rest." He bows a final time before leaving. For the rest of the night, the bard watches the shoreline disappear as they drift away, with conceptions of Hongzhi's treachery on his mind. Eventually, he retires to a cabin below decks for a good night's sleep. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 21/02/2022 20:53
Tatsu just bows in respect and heads out, leaving Zheng He alone. He finds himself a place in the deck where he doesnâ€™t bother the busy sailors, which happens to be atop of the the door that leads to the cabins, in a small, yet plain and surprisingly comfortable piece of wood. He sits there, legs crossed seeing the sailors do their job and enjoying the fresh breeze. When the sun starts to came up he meditates and then he goes to get some rest.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 22/02/2022 22:48
Viraj watches from the edge of the ship, keeping an eye out should any of Li's followers attack again. Once the boat lurches from the docks, the Rajani lets out sigh of relief before searching the decks from Ishaan and offers to help out with other preparations as the Baochuan begins it's journey.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/02/2022 02:29
Letting the others stress over the recent events, Ryuzuko spends are few hours tuning his shamisen, playing some simple tunes to help calm the crew as they make their journey across the sea. Around the time Sadao retires, the dragonborn joins him, giving a nod to Tatsu as he passes by.
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/02/2022 23:09
For the next few days, the Baochuan follows its course due west, headed for the deepest depths of the Obsidian Maw. On the third day, the sea grows increasingly choppy, as though some kind of current is drawing the ship north and causing great waves that regularly shower the deck in salt water. (edited)
TheOrsini 24/02/2022 16:30
Her path lie to the west, to the heart of the Maw... the abode of the sea witch Kuma... Her hours in the magistar's study had pointed the way, but they had revealed many dangers that were too great to put her friends at risk. She knew they would have come without hesitation, and that made it all the worse for her. She had grown attached to them. Even now, days into the voyage on the rough sea, she thought of them. Koide had missed Takumi's cooking, the coy smile of Sadao-san, the embrace of Lyrel even as brief as their reunion was - she missed these most, but even the dragonborn's decisive demeanor and the Viraj's voice echoed in the silence of the rocking ship timbers. To quiet the ghosts, she focused hard upon her studies reading a few of the books she had recovered from Dandong. The more she read and greater the boat rocked, the more the warrior was grateful that her friends were hundreds of miles away... (edited)
Mike 25/02/2022 20:11
On the journey, Sadao makes a point of engaging their host, He, in conversation wherever possible. The man was still a mystery to them, and the only way he could quiet the doubts Li Hongzhi had brought up was to get to know their patron better. At one point, however, he finds himself gazing out over the waters, imagining how Lyrel, Takumi, and even Aralynn-san were getting on. And of course, he hoped Koide had found some measure of success in her own quest. Maybe I should've convinced her to stay? I haven't cracked the secrets of my family's scroll, perhaps there's an incantation that could cure her... Just wistful thinking. He knew he had a lot to learn before making a feat like that, exclusive to those most pious of priests and witches with legendary talent, possible. He leans back against the ship's railing, only to be doused in cold water, making for an effective wakeup call. The bard dries himself off with a gust of wind, and looks to make himself useful to the crew.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/02/2022 22:22
As Sadao wanders the prow, he spots something cresting up out of the water ahead of the Baochuan. Something large and conspicuously red amidst the dark blue waves.
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/02/2022 21:25
The red object continues to rise up in front of the ship, revealing an enormous red crustacean! It has one pincer that is larger than the other, two antennae and a giant nose-like shell piece. Multiple legs flank the creature's segmented body, leading up to its tail. It has spikes on its back and a long scythe-like pointy crest.
Mike 28/02/2022 00:05
Stopping to eye the strange object, Sadao nearly falls back as the sea monster crests the waves! Thinking quickly, he runs up and balances on the railing, getting as close to the creature as possible. He holds up his hands, trying to get its attention. Speaking an incantation as he produces the golden scroll, he tries to make his words pierce the creature's mindâ€”provided it was indeed the simple-minded beast it appeared to be. "Great beast of the sea! We are not your enemy, nor your prey! Let us pass in peace."
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/02/2022 10:38
Cries of fear, horror and determination can be heard from all over the deck as the sailors hurry to trim the sails and turn the ship away from the gargantuan creature. "Could it be?" "Another kaiju?" The monster rears up, clacking its pincers and bellows at the Baochuan. The powerful gust of air stinks of rotten flesh and cuts all forward tension from the sails. Several sailors are sent flying and, although some manage to hold fast to ropes and lines, others are hurled into the sea and disappear beneath the tumultuous waves. Amidst the howling gale of the creature's roar, Sadao hears what sound like words, but the language is foul and harsh and like nothing that he knows or could possibly understand. "DÌµÌƒÌ‹tÌ´ÌÌ‰xÌ¶ÌÌ Ì¶Ì•ÌˆdÌ¶Ì„Ì§aÌ¶Ì‰ÍkÌµÌ›ÌŽxÌ¶Ì†Í Ì·Í‹Ì”iÌ·Í‹Ì—pÌ¸Ì‰Ì… ÌµÌƒÍ‡uÌ·ÌŠÌcÌµÍ‚Ì†xÌ¸ÌƒÌ› Ì´Í›Í„uÌ·Ì”Í€sÌ¶Ì•Í„wÌµÍ˜ÌŠ Ì·ÌÍ”zÌ·ÌˆÌ¥nÌ¶Ì…Í iÌµÍ ÌyÌ´ÍÌ¬wÌ¸ÌÍ„ Ì¸ÌÌ›aÌµÍ’ÌŒzÌµÌ…Í„ Ì´ÌŠÌ½sÌµÌ½Í›aÌ¶Í‚ÌfÌ·Ì‰Ì‹tÌµÌ¾Í—.ÌµÍŒÌ‚" However, somewhere in the distance and yet not so far away at all, Koide hears a voice boom across the dark water in the tongue of demons. Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 28/02/2022 13:12
Tatsu, who had been helping out the crew when he could and exercising at the deck every morning and dusk was in the middle of the routine when the great crustacean breaches the surface. He looks amazed at the seer size of the creature and approaches Sadao and starts to ask him â€Do you think fire willâ€¦ woahâ€and the bard goes flying. He gets ready to catch him
Mike 28/02/2022 16:22
Facing the creature head on, and so close to it, Sadao takes the full brunt of its mighty exhalation. Unable to understand what it was saying, the bard grows faint from the overpowering stench, finally passing out as he is blown upwards. What feels like minutes are actually moments. As Sadao comes to, he is greeted by a perplexing sightâ€”choppy waves up above him, and gray clouds below. As he regains consciousness, the strange sight finally makes more sense: Oh, right. I'm upside down. He closes his eyes again for a second, before jerking awake, nearly slipping out of the grasp Tatsu had on his leg. The two of them were up in the rigging after the monster's air blast, with Sadao dangling by the ankle. Sadao grabs onto the rigging and holds on, lessening Tatsu's burden. "Phew. Th-Thanks!" The bard manages, realizing he'd have been a goner without his help. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 28/02/2022 17:16
With one hand grabbing the ringing and the other Saadiâ€™s leg Tatsu just nods in response to the bardâ€™s words. He sighs in relieve when Sadao holds by himself. That was a close one. The huge creature were still there. After seeing what it was capable of with a single breath he highly doubted that his original plan would be useful at all.
17:17
â€We need to climb down Sadao-sanâ€ he says (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 28/02/2022 18:32
Viraj was keeping himself busy turning his herbs into useful concoctions when he hears the roar from outside and the ship suddenly slows, sending the Rajani tumbling into a wall. He mutters a curse as he quickly stows his tools and rushes to the main deck. "What was that?" Viraj looks around for a threat, but instead notices most of the crew trying to secure themselves from getting tossed overboard. He finds a rope and follows in kind. "You two alright?!" he calls to Sada and Tatsu. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 28/02/2022 20:11
Ryuzuko had been sharpening his wakizashi below deck, watching Viraj do his work. As the upper deck grows in the shouts of the crew the dragonborn sheathes his blade and stands to see what the commotion is. The sudden stop of the ship throws him off balance but he manages to grab and hold onto one of the upper deck support beams. The harsh and unknown words then ring through his ears "Nothing good..." He snarls back at Viraj as he grabs his helmet, slamming it onto his head, sets his sword in his sash, and grabbing his odachi before charging outside. Looking up in the direction of Sadao and Tatsu but for a moment, "We have more concerning matters to attend to, Viraj-san..." Small arcs of lightning start to crackle from his body and blade as he beholds the sight of gargantuan crustacean.
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/02/2022 20:39
The ship shudders and jolts as the monster's enormous bulk makes contact with the prow and it screams in fury.
TheOrsini 28/02/2022 21:40
Koide reads distractedly, keeping an eye on the Junk's ropes and the shift of the wind. A boom voice echoes in her head - demonic: 'The time of axe and sword is nigh.' Koide ran the words over in her head as she sat the book into the chest on the floor. 'Why did that sound so familiar, not the voice... but the words... it sounded like something would have come from her books.' It was ahead of her to the north. She holds her medallion, smelling a change on the sea breeze. There is a slap of something that echoes over the waves. And she stares intently ahead, letting a little more of the sail out to catch the wind.
Mike 28/02/2022 22:47
Sadao latches onto the ropes completely, and climbs back down with haste. "Okay, that sounded like a language, of some sort. I'll try again!" Once on the deck, he rushes back towards the prow, touching his neck and ears while speaking a more familiar incantation, which he'd used to aid Ryu's Honmin learning. As the effect of tongues takes hold, he yells to the sea monster once again. "Great spirit! We are at your mercy. What do you wish from us, to pass unharmed?"
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 01/03/2022 09:36
Climbing down behind Sadao, and seeing his determination to try again, Tatsu takes a rope and tie it around the bardâ€™s chest. He then walks back and holds it at the other side of the deck when Sadao tries once more to communicate with the beast
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/03/2022 21:42
Blood red pincers clack, whistling through the air with surprising speed and dexterity to pluck Sadao from the deck and lift him closer to the creature's face. Crab-like eyes narrow at the bard, examining him closely.
Mike 02/03/2022 02:42
Sadao struggles instinctively for a moment, but stops as he realizes the crustacean is not about to crush him. He lets the creatureâ€”surely a spirit of some kind, if it was speaking a languageâ€”bring him closer for scrutiny, holding him like a child would a doll. He remembers the ferocious dragon-like river spirit that he once similarly persuaded to be calm, and continues to address it. "As I said, we are at your mercy. We come here in search of the great disturbance that occurred some time ago, the giant creature that appeared in these waters with a flash of light. What, may I ask, do you know of it?"
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 02/03/2022 12:57

He keeps it in his hands in case the creature decide to drop Sadao into the water. "Please, tie a rope around my chest" he asks the nearby sailors. "If I have to jump over do not lose it"

The monster belches a deep rumble back at Sadao, which (besides the stench) almost sounds like it could be a laugh. "Should I take you to him... or to her?" It asks, although the bard can't be sure if it is merely musing to itself.
Mike 02/03/2022 22:31

Kyle [Arcadian] 02/03/2022 22:41
The giant crab throws its head back to the heavens and warbles hysterically. "IT HAS CHOSEN!!! KEKEKEKEKE!" It declares, before diving beneath the waves, taking Sadao along with it.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 02/03/2022 23:06
"Oh, no you don't!" Viraj throws off his rope as qucikly as he can when the creature disappears into the depths with Sadao. He takes off in a sprint, his heavy feet pounding the deck. He lets out a roar as he leaps over the rail. The Ranjani man is no more by the time he reaches the water. Much like the last time they were in the Maw he takes the form a creature of the sea. However, this time the form is less sleek; its head wider for the rows of teeth. A shark, with orange streaks along dorsal fin and back, hits the water in pursuit of their friend. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 02/03/2022 23:16
Tatsu sees the intentions of the inmense crab and he pulls trying to free Sadao but the sheer force of the creature doesn't even notice the pull of the monk. Instead he is dragged away the railring and hits the cold water. He is not dropping the rope and is dragged along. He makes a couple of pulls trying to catch Sadao's attention. He knows that he is not going to be able to hold his breath long enough to free him.
Mike 03/03/2022 00:31
"Whoa, wait, WAIT!" The bard is too busy yelling to remember to take a deep breath as the creature suddenly dives with him in tow. When he breathes back in however, he is surprised to fond himself breathing normally, despite the impossibility. Definitely a spirit. And probably a crazy one at that. Great... He feels a tug on his chest and does his best to look around the creature, barely making out Tatsu on the other end of the rope. The bard feels a swell of respect for the martial artist, seeing that he was willing to risk his life for him like this, when they'd only known each other a few short days. He motions for Tatsu to go back. He tries his best to demonstrate that he is not drowning, and definitely couldn't say as much for the others. At that point he notices Viraj's distinctive orange streaks on an approaching shark. At least the druid could breathe underwater as well. He doesn't wave him off, but gestures for him to keep his distance. The spirit could no doubt scissor either of them in twain with its huge claws. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/03/2022 20:29
Ryuzuko secures his odachi to his person as he charges towards Tatsu and the rope, grabbing it in his powerful claws. The dragonborn then wraps the rope around his forearm as he plants his feet into the deck, holding on without pulling for now. He gives a nod to Viraj as the man dives into the water and turns into a shark. At least one of us is able to give chase. He thinks before turning his attention back on the rope.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/03/2022 21:19
The rope is rapidly stretched to breaking point and Tatsu must choose which one to release or risk being torn in half.
TheOrsini 04/03/2022 13:26
The junk finally pulls into view, another vessel with men scrambling about. 'Pirates?!' Koide would have been better off leaving them alone. As she surveyed them, she noticed many were in the water trying to trend the watery depths. 'Maybe ... not pirates.' Even now, some had already failed with their bobbing form as the marker of their watery grave. She couldn't hail them, 'so what to do?' She pulled in the sail as she drew closer, using the till to swing the ship near some of the struggling men. She tied a rope off to mooring post, and tossed the other end into the water for any survivor to climb aboard. She could always deal with them if they were pirates. 'Someone had clearly attacked them.' She glanced about the waters for another ship. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 04/03/2022 13:32
Tatsu sees Sadao moving his arms and hands, but he is distracted by a big orange stripped shark going in his direction. Desperately he moves the rope up and down trying to free the bard from the pincer.Tatsu can feel the rope hurting the palm of his hand but he cannot let it go without trying. He only manages to scratch Sadao's body against the sharp ends of the pincer, but he is almost free. Suddenly the crab roars in his direction while using the other pincer to cut the rope that binds them. With a look that tries to say "I am sorry" Tatsu swims up trying to reach the surface and the safety of the ship before more sharks come to the scene.
Mike 04/03/2022 15:54
Sadao covers his wound, grateful that Tatsu wouldn't be in any further danger, at least. Realizing it would be foolish to struggle now, so deep below the surface, he settles for simply holding onto the monster's claw until they reached their destination; apparently the sea witch herself. Did Koide make it this far? He idly wonders.
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/03/2022 23:26
Moving with astounding speed, the crab dives until the light from above the waves has grown distant and dim. Then, with a splash and a thud they plop through a skin of water tension and Sadao finds himself being carried across a sea bed that is submerged and yet dry. Glowing algae light the way and the giant crab begins to sing in its strange and unpleasant tongue. "...ho ho ho and hee hee hee, break that lute across my knee... and if the bard, should choose to fight, why then I'll set his clothes alight..." Up ahead, a dark grotto of stone juts up out of the ocean floor like a jagged spike. The interior is shrouded and lightless. However, as the crab and Sadao draw nearer, it appears that somebody might be moving around inside. (edited)
TheOrsini 05/03/2022 21:25

Kyle [Arcadian] 06/03/2022 20:01

Mike 06/03/2022 20:08
As uncomfortable as the position is, Sadao holds off on his natural inclination to jostle around, grimacing as he hears the twisted lyrics the monstrous crab was singing, clearly targeted at him. But if this creature served the sea witch Kuma as its mistress, then they might really be in luck... so long as she could be reasoned with. He glances behind them to look for Viraj's marine form, realizing that he'd have to transform back to follow them in this air pocket. While unsure whether he intended to keep following in human form, he gives the druid a quick nod, to assure him he'd be fine, either way.

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 07/03/2022 03:43
The shark slows as they approach the odd bubble at the bottom of the sea. It circles the top air pocket, looking for a way to get closer to the sea floor. However, it finds no way around it. Eventually, the shark loops around and dives into the space and falls to the sea floor. As it impacts, the shark is no more and druid is sent rolling across the sand. Viraj lies there a moment - battered, bleeding and without breath - trying to regain his senses. He grunts in pain before he calls forth a spirit of flame which begins to mend his wounds. He pushes himself to his feet as the healing begins to take effect and strides toward the large crustacean and Sadao with the flames surrounding him to continue to repair his injuries. "What is this place?" Viraj asks once caught up with the pair, with little regard to the large monster. (edited)
Mike 07/03/2022 15:32

The young man shrugs, gesturing to the giant claw. Knowing him though, Viraj can likely guess another reason he'd want to see the sea witch. (edited)

Kyle [Arcadian] 07/03/2022 20:56
The crab continues to sing as Viraj hurries up behind it. "...and if I spy a singing bird, I'll snap its neck before it's heard..." However, the monstrous crustacean doesn't seem to pay much heed to the druid and he and Sadao are able to converse freely. When they finally reach the grotto, the creature comes to a halt and sets Sadao down on the sea floor in front of it. "*...oh if I chance to see a cat, I'll feed its corpse to my pet rat... *" The shadows within the grotto shift and writhe and a lithe cecaelian figure drifts forth from within. Her skin bears a deathly pallor and the sclerae of her eyes are jet black with glowing crimson irises. She has pale white hair worn in a large bun, dark purple veins that line her face and arms, and a black diamond-shaped marking in the centre of her forehead. Her many tentacles are of a similar deep purple, verging on black. "What tasty morsels have you brought me today, Ebirah?" She asks in abyssal with a husky voice worthy of a siren. "Humble Ebirah lives to serve, oh wise one," the crab replies, prostrating itself besides Sadao on the sea floor. "These humans seek the obsidian runestone." "Do they now?" The cecaelia remarks in amusement, eyeing her guests with interest. -------------------------------------------------- Up on the surface, Zheng He has emerged on deck and barks orders at various sailors to get the Baochuan under control. "Ahoy there!" He calls in Honmin over the edge of the ship towards Koide's junk. "My men and I thank you for your assistance. What brings you this far out on the Maw?" (edited)
TheOrsini 07/03/2022 21:12
Koide turns to the rescued sailor on her junk, and tries to make hand gestures indicating she can't speak even though she is unsure what the man aboard the other vessel is shouting. 'This is always awkward,' she thought. 'I wish Tak or Sadao were here.' She gives a slight sigh as she changes tactics; from a slit in her vestment, Koide slides her Stilleto dagger from its thigh sheath and scratches a Je'dahnian letter into the deck. 'Maybe I can at least get them to speak my language.' She watches the sailor and point to him with the three prong blade and then to the letter. She was only slightly worried about scaring the man. Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/03/2022 21:53

Mike 07/03/2022 22:29
Sadao feels his heartbeat grow a little faster as the witch of the sea revealed herself. Just from the aura of raw magical energy she exuded... and nothing more. Or so he told himself. Never mind how she looks or sounds, I have to make an impression. Knowing that even a dubious being commanded respect in both the physical and spiritual realms, he kneels on the ground before her, then kowtows, not unlike Ebirah next to him. "Greetings, exalted one. My name is Sadao, of the Huiya clan. This is Viraj Dhawan, a druid, and one of my traveling companions. The rest of our adventuring party await on our boat above." He raises his head and chest after making salutations, but stays kneeling until she bids him to rise. "As your emissary said, we are here seeking the immense creature that shook the earth and sea alike weeks ago. Such an event, of course, could never have escaped your notice. While safe passage would suffice, we would greatly appreciate any knowledge you could grant us involving it, and this runestone, which is foreign to us." He maintains a deferent lack of direct eye contact throughout his speech. At his earliest opportunity, he will reach to Viraj to cast tongues on him as well.
TheOrsini 07/03/2022 22:37

Mike 08/03/2022 22:59

Ignoring the cool feel of the tentacle, he gives his best look of humble sincerity.

Kyle [Arcadian] 10/03/2022 23:13

The inky substance seeps viscously, flowing upwards against the pull of gravity as it seeks Sadao's ears, eyes, mouth and nose. Anywhere that it can gain entrance to his body. As the last drops vanish inside him, the bard feels an icy cold burning sensation over his heart. "You will find that you have little trouble breathing beneath the waves." (edited)

Mike 11/03/2022 00:33

He breaks his polite social veneer for once, coughing up a storm. "What'd you do to me?" As he hears Viraj, he nods in agreement, feeling a tinge of shame for not pushing for it himself. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/03/2022 01:00
"Why, you gave me your word, Huiya Sadao," Kuma replies innocently in her sing-song siren tone, "I merely sealed the pact with a gift." A smile full of shark-like teeth spreads across the witch's mouth as she explains. "As for your friend... this is within my power, but that magic has its own price - I will require the voice of another to sacrifice."
Mike 11/03/2022 08:59
Sadao opens his mouth to come back with a retort, but her last sentence makes him pause. Someone would have to give up their voice? He hadn't even considered that as a possibility. Could I really? He lowers his head, his mind beginning to race. What kind of peacekeeper could he be without a voice? The proof was right in front of themâ€”they were only here right now because he'd been able to talk to Ebirah. If he were to give up his gift of speech, it'd be like turning his back on his family and their duty... But then he thought of the tears Koide had cried, when she first suffered the injury. And the anguish she clearly had felt not being able to articulate the pain. "Fine," the bard says at last. "We can talk about it when we return with her... and the runestone."
TheOrsini

Kyle [Arcadian] 11/03/2022 21:29
Zheng He leads Koide and Ryuzuko to the captain's quarters, where he produces ink, quill and parchment from a bureau, as the dragonborn had requested. "You must be tired. Make yourself comfortable and then we can talk," he tells her.
Mike 11/03/2022 21:44
Sadao moves to side with his friend. But before he can even vocalize his agreement, his words catch in his throat. In fact, just thinking about going against Kuma felt... exhausting, somehow. When he tries to come up with some form of alternate plan in earnest despite that feeling, the cold feeling in his heart suddenly intensifies. He clutches his chest in pain, which quickly turns to horror, as he realizes this was undoubtedly an effect of Kuma's 'gift.' Damn. Father warned me about making agreements with magical beings. Even verbal ones... He hesitates before returning Viraj's look. Despite himself, his eyes have fear in them. "I'm sorry, Viraj. We should... do what she asks." He swallows, and remembers why they came in the first place to gain a measure of his prior calmness. "Besides, what she knows could be the key to saving the realm. And we could help Koide, if we can pay that price." (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 11/03/2022 22:16
Viraj quickly moves to Sadao's side. "What have you done to him?!" he asks, scowling at the witch. But he doesn't wait for an answer. He places a hand on Sadao's chest and calls on his healing magics to hopefully rid Sadao of the inky substance that Kuma placed inside him. However, the effort is in useless. "No..! Damnit!" In frustration, he walks away from Sadao. Viraj continues to pace, eyes filled with the raging fire that lives inside him and fixed on Kuma. "RAAAWRRR!!!" This sound more primal and beastial. The druid's teeth and fingers elongate. However they soon revert to their natural state, as Viraj realizes there is little choice to be made here. "Damn you!" he spits out, teethed gnashed and huffing in rage. "I will do this, but not for you..! My pact is with him!" (edited)
TheOrsini 12/03/2022 00:08
Koide sits upon a floor cushion, tucking her legs beside her and accepts the ink and paper, and begins scribing on the low table: Well met, Captain, and thank you for your hospitality. If I may ask either of you, as I have many questions... She pauses for a moment considering all the different concerns about their situation, and decides upon the most pressing. What happened to the Baochuan before my arrival. You look like you were attacked. She finishes her writing and turns the page to the captain. (edited)
TheOrsini
Koide sits upon a floor cushion, tucking her legs beside her and accepts the ink and paper, and begins scribing on the low table: Well met, Captain, and thank you for your hospitality. If I may ask either of you, as I have many questions... She pauses for a moment considering all the different concerns about their situation, and decides upon the most pressing. What happened to the Baochuan before my arrival. You look like you were attacked. She finishes her writing and turns the page to the captain. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/03/2022 21:56
"Another kaiju emerged from the ocean and barred our path," Zheng He explains. "I'm sorry to say that it left with your comrade Sadao. If Viraj does not return soon, we will have to continue on towards the heart of the Maw without them. The waves will have already carried us away from our original position."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan]
Viraj quickly moves to Sadao's side. "What have you done to him?!" he asks, scowling at the witch. But he doesn't wait for an answer. He places a hand on Sadao's chest and calls on his healing magics to hopefully rid Sadao of the inky substance that Kuma placed inside him. However, the effort is in useless. "No..! Damnit!" In frustration, he walks away from Sadao. Viraj continues to pace, eyes filled with the raging fire that lives inside him and fixed on Kuma. "RAAAWRRR!!!" This sound more primal and beastial. Kyle [Arcadian] 12/03/2022 22:26
Kuma's lips twist into a smug and confident smile as she watches the exchange between Sadao and VIraj unfold. "We made a deal," she says in answer to the druid's question. "As a man of honour, Huiya-san is merely holding up his end of the bargain. Perhaps that is a concept foreign to one as uncivilised as yourself?" The witch drifts through the air towards Sadao as though underwater and gently caresses his jaw with one hand. The trees and flowers surrounding her grotto sway as she does so, their long and slimy branches reaching for anything passing by like grasping worms. "When you have the runestone, you can use this to return to me," she tells the bard, placing a pale, bleached bone in the palm of his hand. "Throw it into the sea and a polyp will appear to return you to me." (edited)
Mike 12/03/2022 23:25
Sadao twitches as she holds his cheek, however briefly. But he doesn't shy away from her touch. "Very well, Kuma-sama." He puts the bone in his pack. He steps away, and bows to her, albeit with less decorum than his earlier genuflection. "Let's go, Viraj. I imagine we'llâ€”I'll have a lot to explain to the others." Though no less disappointed in himself, he looks to the druid, hoping to encourage him to ignore her barbs. (edited)
TheOrsini 13/03/2022 15:28
Koide turned with a start after hearing the captain's words, forgoing the pen to hurriedly attempt to motion her question to Ryuzuko, "Where are the others?" Koide feels that tightness in her gut. She needed to rally Lyriel and the others. 'Why was Ryu just standing here with the others stolen away?' she puzzled. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 14/03/2022 05:40
"Lyrel was regretfully called back to Dalian in haste. Takumi followed him, said he wasn't much for boats. I'm more worried about Sadao and Viraj, but unfortunately we have no way to follow them under the ocean." Ryuzuko answers. (edited)
TheOrsini 14/03/2022 20:07
A perplexed look comes across Koide's face. She seems lost in thought, working out the problem in her head. She unconsciously tapped her finger on the table. She turns the paper and begins writing: Apologies, Captain. A lot apparently has transpired. So to the here and now. How soon do you plan to get underway? I understand your vessel may be at risk.... but I request time to try to recover my companions
Kyle [Arcadian] 14/03/2022 22:59
Zheng He frowns at the request, obviously keen to be underway, but he takes one look at Koide's look of determination and his expression softens. "You have one hour."
TheOrsini 15/03/2022 01:56
Koide nods, stands, and bows. Not lingering she taps Ryuz on the shoulder, and motions for him to come. She had bought a little time for them. 'Now what?' she questioned herself. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/03/2022 03:31

TheOrsini
Koide nods, stands, and bows. Not lingering she taps Ryuz on the shoulder, and motions for him to come. She had bought a little time for them. 'Now what?' she questioned herself. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 15/03/2022 03:32
Ryuzuko bows towards Zheng He before following behind Koide. "I assume you have a plan then?"
Mike 15/03/2022 16:57
Sadao looks up to the sea above them, and unslings his shamisen. As he plays a rising chord, wind gathers, despite being on the sea floor. The winds sweep up Viraj, granting him the power of flight. He takes the druid's arm, and with a reluctant glance over his shoulder at the witch of the sea, takes off with him.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/03/2022 17:30
Viraj gives Kuma one last heated look and then carries the two of them to the top of the air pocket. Once at the top, the Ranjani lifts Sadao to the barrier's edge. "I've got a good idea where our friends are. Grab on when I change and I'll swim us to the surface. Let's just hope that gift hers works out for you," he says before pushing the bard out into the ocean's depths and then pulling himself out. The druid immediately shifts into a shark again and begins the accent to the surface. Reverting back to his human form once they reach the surface near the boat, Viraj calls out, "Down here!" He also sends three small orbs of fire into the air along side the Baochaun to signal those on deck. (edited)
Mike 15/03/2022 17:53
As Viraj brings him to the barrier and voices his misgivings about the witch's endowment, Sadao breathes in before experimentally pushing his upper body into the water. He exhales bubbles, and inhales, finding that he can indeed still breathe underwater. However, even before latching onto Viaraj, the bard begins to float of his own accord. With a look of surprise, he finds moving to and fro extraordinarily easy, with the water simply flowing with him when in close proximity, creating an effect that makes it appear as though he was the one flying now. He notices, however, that the demonic-looking ink secretes from him as he swims and breathes with ease. He signs to Viraj that he's alright, and instead follows the shark to the surface, actually keeping pace with him. As they reach the surface, he emerges with a splash, calling out as well to get the attention of those on board. "Hey!" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 15/03/2022 23:12
Their attention drawn by Viraj's flames, a number of sailors hurry to the side and throw ropes over for the druid and Sadao. "I thought that that was the last I'd seen of you," the deep voice of Ishaan rumbles as he hauls Viraj up over the guard rail. "By Vishnu, how did you manage to free the bard from that kaiju?"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ]
Ryuzuko bows towards Zheng He before following behind Koide. "I assume you have a plan then?"
TheOrsini 16/03/2022 01:45
Koide had just begun to concentrate and try to feel the world through her connection with the natural world. She reasoned while she could detect undead through the wholly unnatural and twisted magics that animated them, she might be able to do something similar here. Perhaps through the beasts or the absence of beasts in an area. Her mind focus, pushing out the distractions, but the rocking of the ship gave her unease. She was just about to suggest to Ryuz to let her tie a rope about herself so she could drift in the water for a better conduit of her power, but Viraj's fireworks alerted her to their return. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/03/2022 01:46
Ryuzuko looks over to he commotion and the sound of Viraj and Sadao's voices. "Well nevermind then."
TheOrsini 16/03/2022 01:47
With Ryuz's help, Koide strains to pull up Sadao's soaked form with another of the ropes.
Mike 16/03/2022 17:43
Sadao grabs the rope and climbs up and over the railing of the boat. The bard's hair, being thoroughly wet, falls in a mop over his eyes. This, combined with the ink that coated him during the swim, makes him rather a sight. "Thanks, guys. Good news, we found Kuma. Bad news is, Koide wasn't there. I hope she didn't get lost at seaâ€”" He wipes his face clean of water and ink, and parts his sodden hair, only to find himself looking right at the swordswoman herself. Immediately, he lunges forward and wraps his arms around her in a chaste hug. "Koide! When did you get here- I mean, I thought-" while stumbling over his words, he has also unwittingly gotten water and ink all over her clothes. (edited)
TheOrsini 16/03/2022 19:38
Koide returns the embrace, giving the man a kiss on the cheek. Her eyes are as bright as her smile.
Mike 16/03/2022 20:33
Sadao lets her go, her warmth a pleasant contrast to Kuma's cold tentacles and hands alike. But the mental comparison brings him back down, as he remembers the task at hand. "But... like I was saying, there's worse news. We met with the sea witch Kuma. She knows the location of the kaiju, and possibly more, but she will only share her knowledge if we do something for herâ€”specifically, she wants an artifact of magical power known as Israphel's runestone." As he explains, he raises a hand and creates a spectral minor illusion to depict the object floating above his palm, as Kuma did herself. "I was... a bit too quick to reply, and agreed to doing this. She then laid a curse on me that binds me to her service until I bring it to her or else... I don't know what." He sighs, and dispels the illusion. "First, let me apologize for involving everyone in this without your knowledge. This curse is my fault, and only affects me. I can go myself to deliver it to her." He bows before the group. (edited)
TheOrsini 16/03/2022 21:26
The smile drops from Koide's face. She fights the urge to slap him. 'How could he be so stupid?' The fire burned in her eyes for several seconds as she let him explain. Her lips pursed in frustration, thinking of how similar the situation would have been had she been the one down there. 'Would I have been any different?' She had been looking for the sea witch for her own problems. She looks at the image of the runestone. 'Had she seen it her books...yes, masterwork... possibly dwarven... but that name had not meant anything.' (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 19/03/2022 09:09
Tatsu helps Viraj and Sadao to come up the ship, relieved that they are fine and quite surprised by it. He them keeps himself in a second plane while the friends reunite and listen to the bardâ€™s words. â€You are alive and you have given us a lead we didnâ€™t had. We must know more of this artifact. Perhaps it is not meant to be in human hands and itâ€™s better for it to be with the Sea Witch?â€ he interjects without not interrumpting anyone
TheOrsini 20/03/2022 13:29
Koide's brow rises in the musings of this stranger weighing in. The ship had no real privacy, but she found it concerning to disclose such information in this open forum. While the others had travelled the Baochuom before - so it was possible that they were comfortable speaking here - Koide found herself concerned about the allegiances of the crew. Unfounded superstition was rampant amongst the common folk, which put the swordswoman at further unease. Subtly she leans against the railing to shift her katana into a better position and tries to keep an eye open for any disgruntlement from the crew. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 20/03/2022 23:10

I could ask the crew if it is possible to have a cabin ready for you if not you can keep mine. It would be a honor.â€ he bows again.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/03/2022 16:55
Viraj grunts and gives Ishaan a nod of thanks. "It seems my help wasn't needed. Excuse me."He pushes past his fellow Rajani and marches over to Sadao. "I sure hope you know what you're doing." Though the fury within the druid has died down with the journey back to the boat, he clearly remains perturbed. "That witch's gifts seemed to come with some conditions. The most up worrisome is that she can easily cause you to act on her will. So keeping this runestone is something that's going to be tough to do." He pauses and rubs a hand along his beard, looking to the others. A slight smile cracks his face. "Well, look who you all found!" Viraj steps over and gives Koide a hug. (edited)
TheOrsini 21/03/2022 17:42
'So they have recruited others to the cause,' Koide pondered. She breaks her vigil to reciprocate the welcoming of Tatsu-san. She let herself dwell on the whether should would be rejoining them. She had not wanted to put them in danger, but it seems Sadao had somehow involved himself with the witch. 'I hope it was not on my account,' she guiltily thought. However, Viraj's hug breaks the worry and she returns the hug of her friend. It was this final reunion in which her mind was set. She would see this problem through, whatever may pass. Any apprehension Koide had about their situation just melted away with this new resolve. She ends the hug with a pat to Viraj's back.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/03/2022 18:15
With their missing friend back among them, Viraj calms further. "It's good to have you back with us." But his smile soon fades. "The witch also gave us her price to return your voice... Another must sacrifice their voice."
TheOrsini 21/03/2022 18:27
Koide recoiled with the words. 'Sacrifice another's voice?' She shakes her head vehemently, 'No... ... NO... NO!' She wasn't going to play games like this, not with some witch. Demons dealt with such magics and pacts, and Koide was not prepared to take any deal of the sort. She wags her finger in front of Viraj's face and locks eyes with him. 'No.' She lets out a frustrated breath. 'I'll have to find another way.' She looked to the others, forcing herself to relax. 'This was going to be a lot of writing....' (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/03/2022 18:36

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/03/2022 20:19
