We should save Sadao from his fate and find an alternative, if all she deals in is pacts of magic and equivalent exchanges." The dragonborn looks off out to sea, towards his idea of the direction of Je'dahn. "Maybe your answer lies at home, although I do not know that for certain." (edited)
Mike 21/03/2022 20:22
Sadao straightens up and nods as Viraj addresses him. "Even if Kuma wasn't involved in this though, I'm not sure if holding onto it would be a good idea, if we can reach it. I'm not sure what it's capable of. Giving it to Kuma might not be a good idea eitherâ€”" a stinging sensation, like a pinch, resounds in his heart, silencing the bard from continuing this thought. He folds his arms in frustration. He then gauges Koide's reaction to Viraj's explanation carefully. More than anything, he feels shameâ€”for he had been considering this further on the swim up. If he couldn't give up his voice for her, perhaps they could use someone else, perhaps one more deserving of such a fate... But as the swordswoman rebuffs the idea, he slightly shakes his own head. Such dark thoughts were what the witch sought. He couldn't make compromises in dealing with such creatures, if it could be avoided. He masks these unsavory notions as best as he can before the others.
Mike 21/03/2022 20:34
"Again, I thank you all for this. And I hate to ask you to hold on for a bit longer again, Koide. But the kaiju is still the prevailing threat on these waters." Sadao gives another bow of gratitude. "If we seek out the runestone to have her remove this 'gift' from me, and to learn what she knows, then know that she said it can be found in the deepest point of the Obsidian Maw, 'where not one ray of light touches the sea floor.' Besides the obvious dangers, there's probably something powerful guarding it, if she won't retrieve it herself. This'll take some planning."
TheOrsini 22/03/2022 22:38
Koide leaves her perch near the railing and pushes up to Sadao, the worry in her own eyes for his safety. She fights the urge to slap him, but instead rests her hand against his chest feeling the dampness of the sea and nods in acquiescence. It could have been her imagination, but she thought she felt a sickly oil upon his clothes - something imperceivable and nearly intangible. It had to be worry from Viraj's and his encounter with Kuma. She couldn't decide if she was just missing Lyrel or if in all of her flirting she had actually developed some affection for the man, but she didn't want to see harm come to him. (edited)
Mike 23/03/2022 14:54
Sadao at first wants to lean into the soft hand Koide places on him, but as she presses it against him, he feels the wetness of not only the seawater, but of sickeningly natural oilâ€”the remnant of the ichor that issued from him while swimming. It wouldn't clean away, not that easily. He shies away from her touch, from equal parts guilt at the predicament he'd put himself in, and disgust at what the witch's blessing was doing to his body. "I'm sorry..." is all he can say, quietly, before trying to change the subject. "Let's speak to Zheng He. We'll likely need to divert from the present course to get to the deepest point of the Maw. And we can see if he's even willing to put stock in the witch's knowledge." Sadao breathes a word in Primordial to dry himself with a small gust of wind, and give himself the more pleasant scent of freshly fallen autumn leaves before looking for He.
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/03/2022 22:19
Drawn out by the commotion on deck, Zheng He emerges from the shelter of the ship's interior, in search of Koide and Ryuzuko. "Well, well, well. I must admit, I certainly wasn't expecting to see you two again," he tells Sadao and Viraj, clearly impressed. "Tell me, what did you see in the kaiju's world beneath the waves," Zheng He asks them with twinkly-eyed fascination.
Mike 25/03/2022 06:52
He wouldn't be so envious if he'd been the one to get conned... Sadao slouches a bit as the ironic thought crossed his mind. "Well, we met with the sea witch Kuma on the ocean floor." He corrects his posture and pipes up. "Come to think of it, she found that name amusing, somehow. Anyway, she offered us information about the kaiju we've been seeking, but at a price. She wants an artifact called Israphel's runestone, which lies in the deepest part of these waters. Does any of that sound familiar to you?" "To my shame, I agreed to help her, and she's bound me to my word with a hex. I must humbly ask that we pursue this lead not just for her knowledge, but so that I don't succumb to the ill effects of her curse."
TheOrsini 25/03/2022 07:08
Koide held her breath as she waited for the man's reaction. Experience had taught her to keep such things close to the vest, but Sadao had chosen to be open and honest on this, and so she hoped his faith was well placed. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/03/2022 21:40
Zheng He shakes his head pensively. "No, I'm sorry to say that I'm unfamiliar with any Israphel. Since Yingkou our course has been set for progressively deeper waters. It seemed only logical that the kaiju could not have come from the shallows and must have risen from below." He fixes Sadao with a penetrating stare. "How does this witch's curse work? Can she control you? Huiya-san... if you become a danger to this ship and its crew, we will be forced to treat you as such."
Mike 25/03/2022 22:21
Sadao is taken aback. Koide's furtive glance had indicated he might have been oversharing, but it was too late for that. But lying had never come naturally to him, so he commits. "It causes me pain, when I try to ignore the task she set for me. I can only assume it will weaken me more and more, the longer I try to go against it." He places a hand over his heart, which grew chill at this line of thought. "But I am not compelled to do whatever she says. And I would sooner let this spell lay me to waste before I bring harm to anyone." He speaks with palpable conviction.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/03/2022 23:03
Zheng He continues to watch Sadao warily. "Remain in your quarters for the time being. It seems that our destinations are the same." As the sky overhead grows ever darker, the merchant begins to give orders to his crew in Honmin to set sail for the heart of the Obsidian Maw.
Mike 26/03/2022 03:12
Sadao bows in deference. It was his boat, after all. He waits by the door until the others are ready to leave, and exits with them.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/03/2022 21:40
The next morning, a booming, visceral roar peals out across the sea, rousing the sleeping from their beds and causing uproar on deck. High above, a sailor shouts from the crow's nest. "Kaiju!"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/03/2022 23:15
The roar and shouts of the sailor's has Ryuzuko quickly rising from his slumber. The dragonborn hastily straps his armor on, throws his pack over his shoulders, and grabs his sword before stomping out onto the top deck. "In what direction is the beast?!" he snarls loudly, although unsure if the crew can understand him, as he scans the horizon for the creature.
Mike 28/03/2022 20:08
Sadao spends the night in his cabin as directed, though he is restless. Throughout the night, he feels a peculiar urge to swim in the sea. Eventually he drifts off to sleep. As he is awoken by shouts as the others, he rushes to the door and hesitates, before throwing it open regardless, heading for the deck. Curse or not, he still couldn't sit idly by while something of this magnitude was going on. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/03/2022 21:39
The man in the crow's nest waves to the east and as if on cue, lightning strikes the ocean, illuminating the silhouette of something enormous emerging from the waves. It appears to be headed south.
TheOrsini 29/03/2022 21:06
Koide's mediation is interrupted by the commotion on deck. At the call of Kaiju, she uncrosses her legs and lifts Shi no kaze from her lap before standing. The warrior draws the 4 inches of the blade from the sheathe . Koide notices her reflection in the wavy folds in the steel, and her own grim expression starring back at her. 'What good would a blade be against something so great? Would arrows even pierce its flesh?' She hadn't even seen the thing and the doubt from the beast of Dandong still lingered in her mind somewhat. She had Lyriel and Takumi with her in Tonghua. She quickly slides the blade back into its scabbard, lacing the blade and belt around her waste. She recites the Watch's mantra in her head. 'By fate's hand, I go. By my hand, I serve. From this day until my last, I shall watch to understand that which is unknown and to beat back the darkness where it lurks. This so I vow.' She uses her foot to help string her bow and slides it and her quiver over her shoulder. She assumes the void, shunting doubt and fear into it, and takes a steady step out her door and onto the deck. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 29/03/2022 22:44
Recounting his encounter with the sea witch the day before, Viraj had been awake when the roar broke the silence of the morning. The familiar sound shakes the druid back to the present and he grabs his belongings before rushing to the deck. Viraj searches the sky for the column of light that appeared that day he last heard the familiar roar, but find none. Then turns his attention to the horizon, trying to catch a glimpse of the creature. The call from the crow's nest draws his attention to the east. Not much frightens the Ranjani man, but the sight to the huge creature emerging from the water is enough to send a chill up Viraj's spine. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 29/03/2022 23:00
"It seems that we have found him" says Tatsu looking to the silhouette over the railring
Mike 30/03/2022 20:41
Sadao considers their relative position, and comes to a grim conclusion. "It's headed for Je'dahn! We've got to do something before it gets there!" He looks to the other members of the party. "Maybe I could communicate with it like the crab, see what it wants?" This had come about sooner than he'd expected, and hadn't fully made a plan. Then again, he wasn't sure what Zheng He had in mind for this moment either.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 30/03/2022 20:55
â€Shouldnâ€™t we be closer to do that? I doubt that we should risk this boat and the lives of the sailors. Perhaps if we use Koide's-san to approach it?â€ (edited)
TheOrsini 01/04/2022 04:37
The warrior sees the swell of water as the thing moves ahead. Her new companion had a point, but she worried that the smaller vessel might be capsized in that beast's wake. 'Still...' Koide grabs ahold to one of the lines and ties it off, tossing it down for access to her junk. She motions for them to come on. 'Was this a bad idea? Was she compensating for her doubt with foolhardiness?' She didn't let these thought take root, instead burning them in the void and the flame as she started her climb to the smaller boat. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 01/04/2022 10:32
Tatsu bows his head to Koide in recognition of her bravery and descend to the junk. â€If this fails. Do you think we would be able reach that object the sea witch wanted before this Kaiju reach Jedahnâ€™s shores?â€
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/04/2022 20:36
Zheng He emerges from below deck and raises a telescope to one eye, inspecting the monster from afar. "Do you truly believe that it will heed you, Sadao-san?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/04/2022 20:55
"If this fails, we may be be lucky to reach anything" Viraj begins his descent to the junk. "If we're going to do this, we need to get going. It's going to take some time to catch the monster in this thing."
Mike 01/04/2022 21:19
Sadao thinks on Tatsu's suggestion. "If no one else, Viraj and I can get underwater fast, no problem. We'll have to be quick either way. If we could at least slow it down before we find the runestone, it could make a difference." Turning to the merchant, he responds with a steady voice. "There seems to be some purpose in its actions. And if it has purpose, then it has a mind, and some sense to it, unlike the aberration we faced when we first entered Hong. If it can hear and understand us, this won't have to end in bloodshed." He looks back toward the monster, and places one of his feet on the railing. "By my family's honor, I have to try." He takes a deep breath, more to assure himself than to actually draw in air, and dives off the side of the ship. Upon hitting the water, he doesn't actually sink, instead skimming the surface as he propels himself forward, riding the waves like a horse. (edited)
TheOrsini 06/04/2022 00:21
Koide move to the mast, untying the knots holding the furled sails. As the others board, she reaches a hand out to the other speeding form of Sadao dashing out into the waves. She frowns, but motions for the others to hurry as she shifts the fabric to catch the wind.
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/04/2022 23:15
Zheng He looks on in surprise as Sadao takes to the water with his new aquatic powers. Once Ryuzuko, Tatsu and Viraj are aboard Koide's junk, she releases the lines holding the smaller vessel in place and the waves take it with a jolt. The wind fills the sails and the ship begins to quickly accelerate away to the south-east.
TheOrsini 13/04/2022 15:33
Koide motions for Ryuzuko to take the tiller as she ties down a sail attempting to blow free in the wind. She had seen Sadao-san's magic before, but this new power seemed a bit different. She'd seen a lot of magics in the world, but she still wanted to worry on the looming threat from the sea witch. It threatened to burst free of the void, but she tied it down like the sail and the let the flames conflagrate upon it. She gave a determined smile to the others, trying to be stoic as they headed for a great beast that threatened to devastate her homeland. 'Where are you...' She thinking Lyrel, but she knew she was pining like one of the novices. Being around these people had changed her, and in the moment she didn't like it. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 19/04/2022 22:06
Thunder rumbles and booms overhead as the kaiju's silhouette on the horizon draws closer. At this distance it is no longer merely an ominous shadow rising and falling below the waves, but a colossal reptilian visage with a robust build, upright posture and rows of serrated plates along its back.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 20/04/2022 06:06
"We're going to need a bigger boat..." Ryuzuko says as he stares up in awe of the towering creature,
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 21/04/2022 01:35
Tatsu smiles back at Ryuzukoâ€™s comment. â€I wonder if this one would be willing to listen as the other. It seems moreâ€¦ determined. My sensei always told me that everyone has a weaknessâ€¦ but I honestly donâ€™t see one on that.â€
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/04/2022 20:33
As the junk sweeps in closer to intercept the titanic monster, it becomes clearer and clearer just how much faster than them it is moving. Waves roll off of the kaiju, making the ship rock and bump in the turbulent waters.
TheOrsini 24/04/2022 20:54
'This was foolish...' The thought stabbed at the void with murderous intent. No longer a stab of fear, but the rationale of self-preservation. And the bubble sundered like soap with that realization. Koide let out the rope, giving the junk a bit more sail to help turn them away. She motioned to Ryuzuko to shift the tiller to move them from the path. 'If Sadao meant to speak with it, they would be close to support them.' (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/04/2022 22:16
The junk shifts its course, putting it in significantly less danger. However, they now run the risk of losing the kaiju as it surges south far faster than the ship can keep pace with.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 26/04/2022 22:35
â€That creature will be in Jedah faster than we can catch it. I do hope that Sadao-san is successful in talking to it. Hopefully make it change its course. Why it would like to go there?â€
Mike 27/04/2022 09:55
As the bard crests a particularly harsh wave naturally, like a knife through butter, he glances back to see the others in the junk turning away. He hadn't realized just how rough the waters were getting, but it made sense. He comes to a stop and wades in the water, shouting to them. "I'll be back!" The bard felt more assured with his friends to back him up, but that wouldn't be happening here. He dives in and springs back out of the water to build up speed, and double-times it to the great beast. Talking things out with it might've been a long shot, but if nothing else, he'd be able to see it up close. And he was certain of his ability to swim away, with no risk of drowning.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 27/04/2022 18:31
As the group departed from the Baochuan, Viraj takes a seat upon the bow of the boat facing to the south and pulls a small piece of cork from his pouch. He begins a ritualistic prayer to the spirits of the waters in the strange language of the druids. After a few moments of chanting, Viraj crumbles a bit of the cork in his coarse fingers before sprinkling it upon himself. *Seas around me and in our blood, provide us a way to walk upon as the earth below. * He then stands and repeats the process over each of his companions in the boat, finishing with Ryuzuko. "We can afford a little danger. There is no fear of us going under the water should our vessel go down."
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 27/04/2022 18:45
"That's is really impressive Viraj-san. Domo Arigatô" It is obvious by the loong that the young monk gives to the water that he would like to test it but the common sense prevails.
Kyle [Arcadian] 29/04/2022 21:17
The wake coming off of the towering reptile is a challenge for even Sadao to navigate and the bard must fight against the currents of displaced water produced by the creature to stand any chance of getting near it.
Mike 03/05/2022 23:18
Sadao continues to skim the waves with supernatural agility, though an especially rough chop catches him off guard. He is able to stay on course, and tries to continue forward. The being's colossal size only becomes more apparent the closer he gets, but the bard focuses on his duty. As odd a time as it was, he began to think of what Takumi would do in his magical performances, to draw the eye. As soon as he is close, he begins casting a minor illusion, which serves to bolster his voice with that of others'â€”his ancestors' voices, at least, as he imagined them. He then conjures up four dancing lights to orbit around him, all in an attempt to get the creature's attention. "Great One! I ask you to cease your stride!" He calls out with a sonorous, multi-layered voice.
Kyle [Arcadian] 20/05/2022 20:03
Perhaps the kaiju cannot hear or understand Sadao, or perhaps he is simply so small to the colossal creature that it does not notice him, but the monster continues inexorably onwards. It appears to ignore the bard entirely and he soon finds another vast wave headed straight for him.
Mike 20/05/2022 20:45
Sadao tries to maneuver out of the way, but is knocked back regardless by the sheer force behind the wave. He reemerges on the surface, watching the beast continue on its path. Damn, the bard thinks to himself. If it just can't hear me, I can't possibly be any louder... wait. He didn't have to be loud. Even a deaf man could hear words carried to him by the spirits, as they'd seen once before. He pushes through the waters towards the kaiju one last time. Laying a hand on the scroll, Sadao calls the tongues of the ancients to mind, and gets within range to send a message to the kaiju. He points his middle and forefinger at the monster, and speaks. "If you understand, then please, listen, great one!"
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/05/2022 21:32
This time, the kaiju reacts. It pauses in its stride, and the mass of moving water is churned by the sudden inertia as its turns to seek the source of the words at its ear. Sadao is about to swept away by the rapidly forming whirlpool, but instead slams into the scales of what passes for the creature's arm. It's as though the full length of his body has been hurled into a wall of solid bone. Cold yellow eyes stare down at the bard, as though he's an insect on the monster's skin. Mike 24/05/2022 03:01
Sadao clasps his hands over his bleeding ears, as the monster's 'voice' boomed throughout him. Whatever the bard had been expecting, it certainly hadn't been a response like that. He thinks back to the false hydra. Perhaps this creature was akin to itâ€”an aberration of some sort. He didn't know much about them in particular, except that they were inscrutable, alien and hostile to both the spirit and mortal realms. There was no peace or understanding to be had here. Knowing this, the young man lets go of the creature's massive scaled arm, and dives, heading back towards his comrades while staying under the surface.
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/05/2022 14:56
The kaiju turns and continues on its way south, creating another surge of turbulence that begins to rapidly expand towards Koide's junk.
TheOrsini 26/05/2022 21:44

Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 26/05/2022 23:03
Seeing that the sails are left unattended, Tatsu runs towards the rope that fix them and grabs it just in time. He feels the tension as the wind tries to turn them and flap them around but he somehow manages to keep them steady. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/05/2022 23:32
Beneath Viraj's experienced hand, the tiller swings to the side, bringing the ship about so that the bow takes the enormous wave head on. The prow soars into the air and for a moment it seems like their efforts are for naught. The angle on the deck is so sharp that it is tipped almost vertically, sending those aboard tumbling towards the stern, until they catch hold of something with a painful jerk to the arm. However, moments later they crest the wave and the boat comes crashing down on the other side, showering everybody in brine.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/05/2022 23:48

Mike 28/05/2022 15:30
Though he felt faint, Sadao pushed himself to swim back towards the party's junk. As Tatsu voices his question, the bard suddenly appears, clinging to the side of the boat with a splash and accompanying groan. He struggles to climb fully aboard, with bruises showing on his arms and legs, and blood strangely issuing from his ears and nose, besides the octopus-like ink. "That... that thing, it's no spirit," He wheezes. "It's an aberration."
Mike 07/06/2022 19:09
Taking a moment to clean himself off, Sadao watches the monster's receding form. He reconsiders their estimated location, using the sun as a guide. He suddenly goes deathly still as he comes to a horrifying conclusion: if the monster was headed south from here, it wouldn't just make landfall in Je'dahn, it'd reach Kitajima first. His family's home. He jolts up from his seated position, and looks to Koide. "Koide-san, I need your scroll!" He points at the kaiju. "It's headed for my home, I have to warn my father!"
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 07/06/2022 20:07
Tatsu lools at Sadao and says "How can I help?"
TheOrsini 07/06/2022 21:55
Koide hurries to a side wall and unlashes her storage chest. She pulls out the key to the padlock, lifting the lid. She digs past empty bottles and retrieves the magic telescription scroll. She holds it up fro Sadao to take.
Mike 08/06/2022 08:24

"Thank you." The bard takes the scroll, and tears off a suitable portion. He sets to work. Father, a giant kaiju is approaching Kitajima. Cannot be reasoned with. Warn all who will listen and get away now. He pauses for a moment, counting the characters he's used with a pensive look. He then quickly adds one last line. Have not found Mother yet. He deftly folds the paper into halves, and then quarters. He holds the paper up, picturing his father's face in his mind's eye.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 08/06/2022 08:30

Mike 08/06/2022 15:33

We just need to get there ourselves, and we'll find him, and eventually the stone." He glances about the group's luggage. "One thing thoughâ€”leaves don't get hungry. TheOrsini 18/06/2022 01:22

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/06/2022 01:37

The dragonborn returns his rations to their pouch before taking off his pack and rummaging through it. After a short while he produces a folded bambo rod and a small bag with various objects suitable for fishing. "If there are fish in these waters, we can catch some with this if need be." He then returns the items and re-secures his pack over his shoulders.
Mike 18/06/2022 01:53

"My things are still on the Baochan," he explains, before gratefully accepting a ration from Koide. He'd only just realized how hungry he actually was, and starts eating a portion now, nodding assent to Ryu's plan. (edited)
TheOrsini 18/06/2022 03:56

Kyle [Arcadian] 20/06/2022 10:59
Night falls, revealing stars by which Koide and Tatsu determine the junk's course north towards the heart of the Obsidian Maw. True to his word, Ryuzuko settles down to fish for their breakfast the next morning and, with a little patience finds that he has a bite... and whatever it is, it's big. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 22/06/2022 02:58
The dragonborn quickly gives his fishing rod a strong pull, firmly locking the hook into it. "Viraj! I'm going to need... some help getting this one on board!" he yells out to the Rajani as he struggles, even with his incredible strength, to reel the creature in without snapping the line. Ryuzuko fights the thing for a good minute before the line suddenly goes slack. A few moments later the surface of the water explodes as a large swordfish soars into the air, hanging there for a few seconds, before crashing back down into the ocean depths. "Mekajiki!" the dragonborn exclaims as he continues the battle with the powerful sea creature. A few more moments go by with the swordfish speeding to the right while Ryuzuko pulls to the left, then away from the small boat and Ryuzuko tugs on his pole harder, being careful as to not break the line. After a few minutes of fighting, the swordfish is just about within reach of the boat. "Get ready Viraj!" Ryuzuko calls before giving one last powerful heave, forcing the fish out of the water and towards the group. Viraj deftly grabs it by the tail, struggling to hold on to himself. Once the Rajani has a grip, Ryuzuko grips his pole with one hand and reaches out to grab the creature by the mouth, being careful as to not get sliced or stabbed by the sword-like nose of the fish. He manages to grip it by the mouth without injury, his still armored gauntlet blocking the fishes attempts, and with the help of Viraj hoists it onto the ship. Once it's on board, Ryuzuko drops his pole on the deck to pull his wakizashi from it's sheath. While he holds it's head down and Viraj it's body and tail, the ronin stabs the fish straight through the heart, ending it's mad flailing. "Yatta! Meals will be the least of our issues for awhile!" Ryuzuko exclaims to his companions, cleaning his blade and sitting back to rest from his battle. (edited)
TheOrsini 23/06/2022 22:23
Koide looks at the giant fish, wishing for her friend to be there. 'He would have been able to make this delicious.' She looks to see if anyone else had a better idea, maybe their new companion had some skill with a spoon.

Mike 27/06/2022 16:56

Kyle [Arcadian] 29/06/2022 19:32
The sword fish is enormous, with more then fifty pounds of meat on it. However, with the limited space and suboptimal conditions aboard the junk, Koide and Tatsu are only able to harvest about half in an edible fashion. An auspicious tailwind sends Koide's ship rushing north at speed. The best part of the day is spent sailing into the ever deeper waters of the Obsidian Maw, until the ocean waves grow as dark and glossy as their namesake. Black clouds swell overhead and it slowly becomes apparent that it's not merely the wind lending its breath to the sails. No, some kind of current is drawing the ship inexorably towards its destination. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/07/2022 11:01
Night falls once more as Unus rises in the sky to blot out the sun. The water glistens with the reflection of the vast silver orb suspended in the heavens, but all that can be seen up ahead in the distance is a dark void on the ocean's surface.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 01/07/2022 11:18
Tatsu pulls the rope with the bucket with clean water for the last time and offers it to the others so they can clean themselves after the mess prepping the fish. He knows that if they would have been a little more skilled more could have been salvaged. As he uses the water himself he contemplates the calm waters that seem to extend with no limits and remembers how tumultuous and fierce were at the proximity of the kaiju. Even now, the occasional shark breaks the surface of the pristine waters in search of more discarded swordfish meat. He cannot help but make a parallel with their own souls and how they can change when they face combat or danger.
TheOrsini 03/07/2022 14:40
Tired from the day of fish butchering, Koide dozes quietly against Sadao's shoulder, unintentional falling asleep on him to the sound of the waves.
Mike 03/07/2022 16:20
Sadao comes to a rest as the night's eclipse after washing his hands, slouching against a railing. The icy sensation in his core continued to seethe, reminding him of his 'duty.' He'd noticed too, that a strange sort of current had begun to ferry them along towards their destination. Could that have been Kuma's influence, too? Surely, not much happened in these waters without her knowing... at least, that's what she'd have you believe. Some things had to be beyond her power, as her decision to use them to reach the Runestone evidenced. By bringing it to her, would they be making her far more powerful? Plagued by these thoughts, he seems unable to find rest. At first he began to want to go for a nighttime swim, an urge which first came upon him when confined to his cabin aboard the Baochan. But now... Just as he planned to get up, he feels a weight shift onto him. His eyes dart over to see Koide's sleeping form next to his. Just as suddenly, he feels there's no place else he'd rather be, and he can barely notice the curse's cool grip. He adjusts himself to better support her, and falls asleep as well in no time. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/07/2022 21:30
The junk glides onwards through the inky black waters of the deepest reaches of the Obsidian Maw. In the distance, just a few degrees to the east, the fluttering sails of another vessel can just about be made out, occasionally illuminated by flashes of light in various colours.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 05/07/2022 23:37
As some of the others rest, Viraj sits at the tiller, though not really steering since the odd wind that's been carrying their boat toward the depths of the Obsidian Maw that past two days. His eyes continue to scan the horizon as the night passes. "Stay alert, friends!" The Raijani's voice booms so as to wake those who have dozed off. "By the waters grace, we just may have found The Baochuan!" (edited)
Mike 06/07/2022 07:50
Sadao jolts awake, upsetting Koide at his shoulder. Too embarrassed to acknowledge their position, he mumbles an "Excuse me..." and rises to look in the direction Viraj indicated, hoping the dark hid the blush in his cheeks. "That might be it, but it's hard to tell. What about those lights the sails are catching? They remind me of the lantern spirits I can conjure. Could there have been a mage on board?"
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 06/07/2022 08:02
"Zheng He used magic when the rioter spat at him. It could possibly be his own but we won't know unless we can make contact with that ship." Ryuzuko replies, having been awake already and assisting Viraj in watching the horizon.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 06/07/2022 13:26
"If a branch falls in the middle of the forest. Does it makes sound?" simply says the monk staring at the lights.
TheOrsini 06/07/2022 14:14
Koide makes a startled gargle as she shifts of Sadao's shoulder as he bolts upright. Half-asleep, but still aware of those about her, she stares daggers at him for the interruption, slowly confirming her bearings as the others speak. Her eyes unglaze as she stares at the fireworks over the ship in the distance. She closers her eyes and centers her mind, forcing herself to full wakefulness. 'Had she fallen asleep on Sadao-san?' She smiles for a moment, but ignores the other questions pushing behind that one. And tries to compare the ship illumined by the lights ahead to the one they had encountered during the daylight before. 'Possibly.'
Mike 06/07/2022 15:42
"We can signal them much the same way, then." Sadao summons a lantern between them to demonstrate. "Does everyone agree, or should we hold off?" He looks to Koide, knowing by now her more cautious nature often trumped his more blythe one.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 07/07/2022 01:40
"Well, let's hope not, but they could be fighting something, too. If they are, maybe we hold off on signaling them so we don't let anything else know that we're coming?" (edited)
Mike 09/07/2022 19:17
Sadao nods, dispelling the light. "Let's try and get closer, then."
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/07/2022 22:23
The junk adjusts course to head for the other ship and another flash of light illuminates an enormous scaled monster clinging to the prow. The men on deck are locked in mortal combat with several reptilian heads. (edited)
TheOrsini 09/07/2022 22:52
Koide points at the creature in the darkness, but at this distance and with light faded, she has a hard time making it out. She reaches down and strings her bow, preparing for battle.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 12/07/2022 04:29
"Hmm... I don't like being right about this one. Regardless if it's The Baochuan, it looks like someone needs some help." Viraj stands and pulls a piece of cork from his pouch. "Someone take over for me here. I'm going to make it so we can walk on the water's surface." He begins his ritual as he did on the day they encountered the kaiju making it's way toward Je'dahn. Seas around us and in our blood, give us the way to walk upon you as ground we have trod. (edited)
TheOrsini 12/07/2022 15:46
As the junk draws closer, Koide sits in the center of the boat feeling the sway of the waves and the energy from the sea. She closes her eyes in meditation, preparing herself, making the complex set of gestures and ending with drawing both of her hands across her face. Her eyes open, and the chocolate irises are replaced with the glowing yellow of moonlight reflecting of a wolf's gaze. Her vision improves significantly. She stands now seeing the creature a little better, well enough to shoot at it. She readies her bow and knocks an arrow, fletchings out over the bow in her opposite hand to allow for faster draws.
Mike 12/07/2022 16:44
Sadao draws his own bow, and follows suit. He eyes the creature as they approach, considering what advantages they could gain. Defense, he thinks, and before he knows it, he's reaching a hand out over the waters, sweeping it over the dark tides. It reacts to his touch, as he speaks the word in Primordial, and animates, gradually covering his upper body. As it does, his skin also grew slick with unearthly black ink once again, and the water blends with it, before freezing into the shape of armor. This bond isn't without its benefits, he thought, though he certainly wasn't ready to thank Kuma sincerely. He then clasps his frost-covered hands together in prayer, whispering Kinoh's name. "Return to me, oath-sworn guide!" With a gust carrying spectral golden leaves, the slender tanuki appears with a bark. "Oh, I see how it is. You'll call for my help against the giant monster, but not ask for my wisdom when it comes to bargaining with tentacled witches. Your funeral." She lets out a whimper, seeing the ferocious kaiju get closer. "Or ours."
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/07/2022 21:41
As the beleaguered ship grows larger in the distance, it becomes clear that it is in fact the Baochuan. Zheng He's band of warriors is arrayed upon the deck battling the monster's many heads.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 12/07/2022 22:05
Ryuzuko snarls as he pulls out his odachi, his body and sword arcing with lightning as he prepares for battle.
TheOrsini 13/07/2022 16:41
Koide draws at roughly 250 paces, as the junk moves in closer. She sights down the shaft, judging the angle, and draws in a breath. Loose. The arrow flies free of the bow arcing toward the creature in the distance. She habitually knocks a second arrow still watching the first as it sails past the heads. 'Misjudged the distance.' she notes as she adjusts her aim. Another breath, waiting for the boat to crest another wave, and loose. This one flies true hitting one of the creatures necks. It does seem to be sunk in deep though from her vantage point. 'Must have a thick hide.' She sets a bodkin arrow from her quiver and knocks the bow as the move closer to the creature. Her mind thinks to her toxins in her bag, but the watchman waits considering if it would be needed for her blade. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 14/07/2022 08:02
"Time is of the essence if we are to save as many men as possible!" The towering dragonborn treads to the back of the junk, behind the sails, and plants his feet into the ground. "Kaze no kamigami yo, kono fune o mokutekichi ni subayaku tsureteitte kudasai!" Ryuzuko recites loudly above the sound of the ocean waves, waving his free hand around in the shape of a ball. He then thrusts his hand into the sail, unleashing a gust of wind, causing the junk to lurch as it builds up speed towards the Baochan.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 14/07/2022 16:38
Viraj stoops to pick up a bit of sand and dirt from the deck of the boat. "I can help you out if you're in such a hurry, friend." The druid steps over to the dragonborn, rubbing the dirt between his hands and slaps him firmly upon the back. "Co-hooill dy tappee!! Your legs will carry you a bit farther now," he says with a nod and returns to the tiller to guide the junk toward the fight. With a roll of his neck and a shrug of his shoulders, the protective vines and thorns sprout from Viraj's form. "Lets hope this many-headed beast doesn't like to play tricks with our minds." (edited)
TheOrsini 14/07/2022 17:04

In answer, a faint spectral figure emerges from the wavesâ€”a jellyfish, unnaturally large, and floating through the air as if still underwater. It bounces pleasantly to Koide's side, instilling a sense of calm focus, despite the circumstances. "It does seem to favor a more hands-on approach!" He commented. "Let's be careful." (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 15/07/2022 16:59

TheOrsini 16/07/2022 03:14
Koide feels an uncontrollable joy surge through her. The jellyfish seems play while floating in the air reaching out in its watery pool to touch her. Instead of a sting, it calms her, and the void forms about her, allowing her to focus. She draws and the arrow flies true into the thing's hide. Reflexively, her bow draws back for a second shot, but she feels her pacing and the shot is rushed. As the arrow flies, she loses sight of it... Unsure if it hit the mark in the gloom, she sets up for another round of arrows as the junk continues toward the heaving monstrosity.

é€ƒã‚Œã‚‹ "Escape"
Immediately, the tale of an elusive rogue that outwitted a boorish shogun reaches his mind. Keeping the story in his memory, he then takes up position near Koide and looses an arrow at the kaiju, but it falls short, swallowed by the ocean. (edited)
TheOrsini 21/07/2022 00:15
Koide continues to loose arrow after arrow in rapid succession. Though the darkness hid how effective her shots were, she could feel the fluidity in her form, knowing if a short were true. Koide almost imagines the glow of the floating jellyfish along the monsters neck, designating her shot. The fletching catches on the bow, but the arrow flies cleanly toward her target and out of sight. She steadies, push the doubt and concern outside of the void, and loose. 'That one hit,' she smiles in confidence drawing another shaft to the bow.

Kyle [Arcadian] 25/07/2022 22:49

TheOrsini 25/07/2022 23:07
As the boat impacts into the rushing monster, Koide uses the momentum of the junk to roll to her feet, leaving the bow to whichever corner it fell. She rushes for the beast running up the destroyed boat like a ramp jumping between plates on the creature's necks, and landing on its back. 'Insanity,' came the thought outside the void, but it had worked somehow. Her hand on Shi no kaze, she draws in one fluid motion and cuts at the back of one of the necks, spinning on the wet back, stabbing downward at a tear between its scales. She draws the blade back into a guard watching for the kaiju's vengeance. She couldn't clearly see her friends anymore, but she hoped they made it clear of the wrecked vessel, and hope this had bought them time to recover. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/07/2022 20:56
Ryuzuko barely manages to roll himself off the junk and onto the surface of the rolling waves. The dragonborn snarls as he watches his odachi sink below the sea, still lodged into the boat's deck as he was unable to grab it in time. "Kuso, that's going to make this fight difficult." he curses. His gaze then switches to one of the many snapping heads of the monster as his body, Rakurai, and the water around him, charge with arcs of lightning. The warrior of lightning stands to his full height, bringing the weapon above his shoulder, aimed at the creature. "Feel the wrath of the gods of lightning, beast!" he roars of the waves before taking a few fast and powerful steps forward, launching Rakurai towards the beast. "Todoroku Rakurai!" the ronin roars, this time followed by the cracks of lightning and thunder as the weapon turns into a blue streak and accelerates instantly to it's target. Rakurai finds it's mark, lodging itself into the skull of one of the beast's heads. "Inazuma no tsuiraku!!" Ryuzuko roars again, calling down a bolt of lightning from high in the sky that strikes Rakurai, discharging massive amounts of power into the head. A few moments later it explodes, sending brains, hunks of bones, and blood in every direction. Ryuzuko then hastily charges towards his weapon, aided by Viraj's magic, and rips it out of the creature's broken skull before it sinks into the ocean as well.
TheOrsini 26/07/2022 20:59
Koide grabs ahold to one of the necks as she notices Ryuz javelin flying toward the creature. She braces as the creature recoils from the brilliant blow, the cascade of lightning stabbing at her eyes for a moment. As the neck slumps below she regains her stance. A silent cheer in her head for the fell stroke.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 26/07/2022 21:43
Viraj tumbles deftly for one his size after being thrown from the boat. He finds his feet on the waves and reaches into a pouch, pulling forth a few dried sumac blooms, and crushes them between his hands. As he pulls his hands apart an arc of fire springs to life in the shape of scimitar. He pulls his shield from his back and bangs his weapon upon it. The druid gives his own battle cry, and charges the beast with weapon drawn back. With one of the heads coming near, he swipes at it. A shower of sparks is kicked up as the flaming sword strikes the hard scales of the creature. (edited)
Mike 27/07/2022 02:19
Sadao sees the kaiju dive, and clings to the junk's rigging instinctively. But as the creature fractures the boat and sends everyone flying anyway, he lands hard on his front. The icy armor that covered him shatters into a frosty mist as he collides with the water, now like a solid wall thanks to Viraj's spell. Though he is too dazed to raise a cheer for Ryu's commendable strike, he does notice the dragonborn's odachi sink into the seawater. Thinking quickly, he picks himself up, suppresses the effects of the water walk spell as best he can, and dives into the water after it. Spearing through the water, he catches it quickly, and turns back for the surface. Remembering the tale he'd been granted, he closes his eyes and clasps his hands together, vanishing in a burst of golden light. That same light traces a path, shimmering all the way, from underwater, to another location above the water, where he reappears a bit further away from the monster. Ryuzuko and Kinoh similarly find themselves spirited away to new locations near him. The bard offers the blade to the paladin. "Drop something?" With his load lightened, Sadao focuses on the monster once more. In an instant, his hand is coursing with a brackish aura once more, and he makes a gathering motion. Simultaneously, a black and purple spectral tentacle, which looks familiar to Viraj, manifests above, lashing out at the monster and attempting to restrict one of its heads, but to no avail. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 27/07/2022 10:02
When the big Kaiju dives below the waves Tatsu peeks over the board trying to see it, probing once more that he has none experience with boats at all. He then adopts a defensive stance, ready to the retaliation of the creature
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/07/2022 16:19
Acidic blood spurts from the wounds inflicted by Koide and Ryuzuko, showering both them and Viraj in the caustic fluid. The stump of the kaiju's ruined fifth neck swells and bulges, until two fresh heads burst forth in another spray of viscera. Six pairs of jaws gape open to reveal row upon row of razor sharp teeth and then necks swoop through the air as the monster's jaws dive down to snap at its attackers. Up on the kaiju's back, Koide dances back and forth between the clumsy strikes, while the discipline and training embodied in Tatsu's defensive stance just barely allows him to evade the snapping teeth. Viraj is less lucky and curved fangs clamp down on the mass of roots that coats him like armour, causing the druid's flaming blade to flicker out as he struggles to maintain concentration. A second head dives in to take advantage of the beleaguered warrior, but he grabs it by the lips, muscles rippling as he tosses the head aside.
TheOrsini 27/07/2022 16:44

Mike
Sadao sees the kaiju dive, and clings to the junk's rigging instinctively. But as the creature fractures the boat and sends everyone flying anyway, he lands hard on his front. The icy armor that covered him shatters into a frosty mist as he collides with the water, now like a solid wall thanks to Viraj's spell. Though he is too dazed to raise a cheer for Ryu's commendable strike, he does notice the dragonborn's odachi sink into the seawater. Thinking quickly, he picks himself up, suppresses the effects of the water walk spell as best he can, and dives into the water after it. Spearing through the water, he catches it quickly, and turns back for the surface. Remembering the tale he'd been granted, he closes his eyes and clasps his hands together, vanishing in a burst of golden light. That same light traces a path, shimmering all the way, from underwater, to another location above the water, where he reappears a bit further away from the monster. Ryuzuko and Kinoh similarly find themselves spirited away to new locations near him. The bard offers the blade to the paladin. "Drop something?" With his load lightened, Sadao focuses on the monster once more. In an instant, his hand is coursing with a brackish aura once more, and he makes a gathering motion. Simultaneously, a black and purple spectral tentacle, which looks familiar to Viraj, manifests above, lashing out at the monster and attempting to restrict one of its heads, but to no avail. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 27/07/2022 19:57
"DÅmo arigatÅgozaimasu, Sadao-san. Fortunately it looks like I won't be needing it for this monster." The dragonborn takes his weapon from the Bard, bowing his head in respect and thanks. Hearing Tatsu's suggestion, Ryuzuko breaks into a dead sprint towards the beast, tightly grasping his odachi and Rakurai. His enormous form charges with lightning once again, channeling from his eyes down to his legs. "Brace yourself Koide-san!" He yells loudly enough for the hunter to hear. As he reaches the creature he springs his right foot forward, slamming his heavy booted heel into its side. A loud CLASH, like thunder, rings from the impact, as the monster is sent hurtling into the waves. He follows up with another inhumanly powerful kick to one of the creature's many heads, this time setting it aflame in a holy blue fire for an instant, singeing it's scales and throwing the head into the rest of the toppled body. "Strike now with everything you've got!" (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 27/07/2022 21:13

TheOrsini 29/07/2022 21:46

Kyle [Arcadian] 29/07/2022 22:02

Mike 29/07/2022 22:15

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/08/2022 16:44
