Kyle [Arcadian] 01/08/2022 20:40
More coughing follows and Ishaan offers Viraj a wan smile. "It's beautiful; on the western coast. I have a son there. His name is Ravi. I wasn't always the best father, Viraj, but he should have this," he explains, gripping the druid's hand with his failing strength for emphasis. "He should know that his father died fighting to put an end to this before it comes for Madras. Finish this for me, Viraj. Finish it and tell my son that his father loved him. That he will always love him; in this life and the next."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/08/2022 21:46
Viraj nods solemnly. "I don't know where our journey will take us, but when I find my way to my grandfather's homeland, I will do this for you." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/08/2022 21:56
Ishaan nods, holding Viraj's gaze for a few more moments, until his eyes finally glaze over and his arm goes limp. In the meantime, the rest of Viraj's companions have saved no small number of sailors and Zheng He's other warriors with their skills and magic. Behind the druid stands the man himself, sadly approaching following Ishaan's final moments. "He faced the kaiju head on," Zheng He tells Tatsu and Viraj softly. "The ship would not have lasted as long as it did without him."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 01/08/2022 23:42
Viraj places the man's arm to his side and draws his eyelids closed. The Rajani rises and looks to He. "I will let his son know that he died bravely, trying to protect his crewmates - and family back home - from these monsters." He looks down at the necklace, places it around his neck, then his eyes turn towards Je'dahn with it's own monster barreling towards its shores.
Mike 03/08/2022 06:31
With triage care behind them, Sadao respectfully approaches Zheng He again. The bard speaks in Je'dahnian, to keep their conversation somewhat private from the Honmin-speaking crew. "It's a grim reunion, He-xiÄnsheng, but a reunion nonetheless. As you'd thought, attempts to establish contact with the beast were fruitless; but we know one thing now at leastâ€”it is not bestial in mind. It spoke to me using telepathy, talking of a higher plane of knowledge we could never comprehend." "I must ask, do you still intend to continue the journey? It believe it is more important than ever to investigate the heart of the Maw, though there could be more creatures lurking." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 05/08/2022 11:36
As though in answer, Zheng He gestures forwards over Sadao's shoulder, towards the bow of the Baochuan. Beyond where the many-headed kaiju is slowly sinking beneath the waves, the water grows ever more turbulent. On closer inspection, the sea appears to be swirling perpendicular to the ship's path slowly drawing the vessel in towards a vast maelstrom of dark water. "We have arrived."
Mike 06/08/2022 16:13
Sadao gazes at the churning waters ahead of them. He looks back to each of the party in turn, his question written on his face. Are we ready?
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 08/08/2022 17:54
Viraj shakes his head. "I'm needing some time to recover my magical energy before going down there," he replies to Sadao. Then turning to Zeng He, "Should we take care of those that have fallen? I don't think it would be wise to just let them rest below if there's some unknown power at work in the depths of these waters." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/08/2022 09:15
Zheng He stares at Viraj in confusion. "Where else would you have them go?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 10/08/2022 16:58
"We give them up to the flames of rebirth." Viraj looks down reverently to the bodies that the able-bodied crewmembers have begun to arrange on the deck. (edited)
TheOrsini 11/08/2022 18:21
Koide listens to her companions, while continuing to treat the wounded sailor.
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/08/2022 23:27
Zheng He sighs sadly, glancing over the side of the ship at Koide's slowly sinking junk. "There, perhaps?" He carefully asks. "Would that be appropriate for your funeral pyre?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 12/08/2022 17:02
Viraj nods at the proposal then looks to Koide. "I don't know that we would be able to make your boat seaworthy again."
TheOrsini 12/08/2022 17:06
Koide's face gains a small frown in the corner of her mouth, but her eyes keep attention on the work in front of her. She glances back to Viraj and gives a quick nod in acquiescence and a wave of her blood-coated hand.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 12/08/2022 19:22
Ryuzuko nods in agreement with the others. "They fought bravely and died with honor, including the vessel that brought us here. Honoring their sacrifice is the least we can do." The dragonborn then begins to help carry the fallen to the small boat, saying his own prayers to the kami.
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/08/2022 20:27
Several of the other men aboard the Baochuan follow suit, assisting Ryuzuko in solemnly moving their dead aboard the floundering junk. Zheng He remains by the guard rail, looking on with hard eyes and a deep frown. Once the smaller boat is ready, the crew look to their patron and he gives Viraj a sharp nod.
Mike 12/08/2022 21:20
"Cáº£m Æ¡n báº¡n Ä‘ã sa..." Sadao speaks a few words in Primordial over the junk, as the proceedings are carried out. Four lantern spirits, dimly lit, appear at the prow of the junk, to its port and starboard, and aft respectively to guide it to the spirit realm. "An Nghi." He and Kinoh look on in respectful silence.
TheOrsini 12/08/2022 21:26
Koide stands quietly by Sadao watching the proceedings, wiping her hands clean on a discarded rag. She looks on in anticipation. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 12/08/2022 22:06
Viraj kneels at the prow of the junk and looks over the bodies. His shoulders heave as he bows his head. So much death in our journey. He wipes his brow and then stands to perform his druidic rite of passing. The druid slowly turns toward each direction, invoking the spirts of Arden, before saying his prayer. "Let their bodies become earth and ash. Let these powerful waters offer their spirts to the skies. Let the winds fuel the flames so their spirits my rise again." From a pouch, Viraj removes a pinch of seeds from a weeping willow. "Go in peace," he adds, scattering the seeds across the bodies. After a final bow of respect to the fallen, he takes to one knee and reaches to the deck with a hand. A flame springs to life where he touches wood, which soon grows. Viraj's hand goes to the necklace, pausing a moment to bathe in the warmth of the flame, then climbs back aboard the Boachuan.
TheOrsini 12/08/2022 22:20
Koide makes the igni sign in respect, even with no power or words behind it. 'May the light bear their souls to the next realm.'
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 13/08/2022 17:33
Tatsu cleans his hands after helping Koide with the wounded and nods in respect when the junk departs with the fallen and erupts in flames
Kyle [Arcadian] 14/08/2022 21:54
As the junk burns, it slowly spirals ever faster away from the Baochuan and into the gaping mouth of the Obsidian Maw. In the distance, the flicking light of the flames can be seen to tip over some kind of edge and vanish from sight.
Mike 15/08/2022 07:59
As the moment of silence lifts, Sadao watches the light be swallowed by the ocean, quite suddenly. "Our group could use some time to rest and recuperate, as does your crew. Can we resist the current long enough to do so?" The young man asks of Zheng He.
Kyle [Arcadian] 15/08/2022 10:22
Already the deck is a hive of activity with sailors reefing the sails to tack against the prevailing wind that blows north from the Je'dahnian straight. "I do not know," Zheng He admits with a glum shake of his head. "I fear for our lives if the maelstrom drags the ship to the depths. We will fight to break free of this accursed current. However, if it continues to draw us in, then at this rate in an hour or so we will have no choice but to press on and hope that salvation is to be found at the Maw's heart." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/08/2022 21:16
An hour later, the crew's fears appear to be realised as the Baochuan still struggles in the clutches of the maelstrom's current. If anything, the ship has drifted slightly closer to the sea's gaping maw.
Mike 17/08/2022 22:56
Sadao sits, strumming the last few notes of a calming song, in an attempt to keep the crew from losing heart in the face of the ravenous Maw. He looks to Kinoh, communicating to her with a look. "I had better send you away," he thought with a sad smile. "Whatever happens next might be too dangerous for you, small as you are." "Hmph. I'm supposed to be the mentor here, last I checked. And this body would not have been my choice." The tanuki licks her side with a bit of disdain, where she'd gotten a splinter from the battle aboard the junk. She turns to face him with an unusually serene look. "In all seriousness, let me give you some advice before I go, then. It's not too late, Sadao." He gives her a puzzled, but hushed look. "Not too late... for what?" She rears up on her hind legs, baring her teeth in a twisted canine grin. "You can still confess to Raggedy Girl! Love confessions are only more romantic near the end, perhaps she won't mind if your heart belongs to another!" She collapses to the deck, rolling and wheezing with an animal approximation of uproarious laughter. Blushing furiously, Sadao makes a sign of dismissal with his hands, vanishing his familiar with a gust of golden wind. He massages the spot over his heart anew, feeling it thrum with cold, which eases ever so slightly the closer they get to the Mawâ€”to the object of his pact. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/08/2022 10:39
Caught in the inexorable pull of the Obsidian Maw, the weary crew of the Baochuan find themselves with no other option but to cease their fight against the current and allow it to carry the galleon north. The mood onboard is bleak and subdued. The desperate hope that somehow something can save them from the crushing black pressure of the depths seems ever more distant in the face of the black clouds that swell and billow overhead.
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/08/2022 13:12
Tatsu hangs in the rigging near the crow's nest as naturally as an ape lazing in the branches of a tree. As lightning strikes the ocean on the horizon, he spots what looks like a dark tower reaching up out of the sea like a vast stalagmite. The Baochuan is headed straight for it.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 21/08/2022 13:14
Tatsu screams on the top of his lungs trying to get heard over the raging wind and swirling water. He points to the tower barely keeping his balance but holding his grip to the rope. "A Tower!!! A Tower !! We are heading to it!
Mike 21/08/2022 14:49
Sadao runs to see as well, waiting for a lightning strike to get a glimpse of the structure. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/08/2022 18:21
In the distance, Sadao can make out a huge spire of natural stone stretching up out of the water to the heavens. Zheng He soon joins the bard along the bow. "Incredible..." he whispers, before turning and shouting to the rest of the crew. "Prepare to make anchor!" (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 22/08/2022 16:30
Finishing his preparation for an underwater journey, Viraj stands from the deck and walks to the railing to see what the commotion is about. "Hm... That's a small blessing - better than being pulled beneath the waves, I think. " He shrugs and watches as the strange island comes into view. (edited)
TheOrsini 22/08/2022 16:31
Koide was intrigued by the spectacle before her. An unusual sight in the middle of the sea, not the horrible void that stories had portrayed the Maw.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/08/2022 16:39
Urgent voices call out new insights, coordinating efforts across the ship as the sailors desperately work to halt the Baochuan before it suffers the same fate as Koide's junk. "Three points to port!" "Anchor's still too deep!" "Steady, don't run her aground!" The helmsman leans heavy on the rudder as the ship arcs towards the tower, searching for purchase that they can anchor to. Finally, the whole deck shakes and jolts. Wood creaks and metal screeches from the strain as the anchor at last catches on something solid. The Baochuan turns and lists dauntingly to the side for one moment, before finally coming to a halt mere feet from the rocks. The anchor's line is stretched taut against a current that is stronger than ever. A short distance to starboard, the ocean can be seen to drop away at the edge of a vast vortex of dark water that falls impossibly deep.
TheOrsini 22/08/2022 16:45
'So there was a void.' Koide corrects as she picks herself up off the deck. She looks at it before the inconceivable height and motion begins to tug at her stomach. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/08/2022 22:11
With several long poles the crew begin to maneuver the ship around the rocky shoals at the foot of the spire. Others gather by the anchor's heavy chain to haul the vessel into gentler waters and slowly the Baochuan drifts into a shallow bay, encompassed by a small beach. Beyond the sands a thick forest has sprung up around the base of the enormous stone spire. Zheng He takes out his spyglass and peers up at the distant top. "That's a long climb," he muses.
Mike 22/08/2022 22:24
"I could use the winds to fly up..." Sadao considers. "But it would just be for me, or one other person. And we don't know what's up there." He places a hand on the ship's railing, ready to leap off into the water at a moment's notice. "Guess we'd better get a closer look on foot?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/08/2022 22:40
The ship's row boat is lowered to carry Sadao and his companions through the shallows to the shore. It's the first time in days that many have had dry land beneath their feet. The pale sand crunches underfoot as they clamber out of the little boat and drag it up onto the beach.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 24/08/2022 03:42
Ryuzuko's heavy feet squishes into the watery sand as he exits the boat, sinking noticeably more than the others. "Keep your wits about you, there could be more monstrous sea creatures waiting for us here." The dragonborn yells loud enough for the landing party to hear. He then gives a nod to Sadao and the rest of his companions, agreeing with the bard's suggestion.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 24/08/2022 12:12
Tatsu lands at Ryuzuko's side and for amoment thinks that, if they weren't set for a trek, he will unite his sandals and feel the sand. Perhaps when they come back. The dragon-kin words bring him back to reality and focus looking at the trees in front of them looking for a suitable place to start their exploration.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 24/08/2022 21:23
Viraj slowly paces along the beach as he gets used to being on firm ground again. "Up may not be the only way to go," he says coming along side the others. "Doesn't like we're too far from the base. Well, shall we." The druid removes his axe off his back and steps toward the edge of the trees.
Kyle [Arcadian] 24/08/2022 22:20
Barely visible behind the cloud cover, the moon hangs low in the sky. The first rays of sunlight are just barely beginning to blossom out from behind the vast silver orb like little beads of golden light. Up ahead, the woodland canopy is thick and dense, such that little to no light reaches the forest floor.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 24/08/2022 22:35
"I agree Viraj." The dragonborn then removes his pack to untie his lantern, lighting it before hoisting the large bag back onto him. He holds the light high, illuminating the surrounding area as they enter the forest. (edited)
Mike 24/08/2022 22:48
Sadao strides through the shallow waters, already barefoot himself, and seeming content, despite the circumstances. As they reach the land, however, and espy the darkened wood, tension reclaims his features. Ever since he made that pact, he'd felt more comfortable in or surrounded by the sea. He frowned at the realization. She's toying with me, without even being here. He gives the waters a parting glance, and puts on his sandals to proceed, returning Ryu's nod. His blade rests on his hip, but his shamisen and scroll are kept just as close at hand, slung across his back for easy access.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/08/2022 00:06
The shadows amongst the trees are pitch black, but for Ryuzuko's lantern cutting through the darkness. The tree trunks grow close to one another, with tangled branches hanging low and winding roots sticking up to trip the unwary.
Mike 26/08/2022 00:31
As the way forward grows darker and denser still, Sadao withdraws his gilded shamisen, and begins to play an adventurous tune to keep their spirits up. If there had been words to it, they were long forgotten, but it evoked courage all the same.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 26/08/2022 23:14
Guided by Ryuzoko's light and inspired by Sadao's tune, Viraj pushes into the dense forest and begins to carve a path with his axe for the group to follow behind. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 27/08/2022 00:49
"Do we open the path" says Tatsu to no one in particular as Viraj cuts down the dense vegetation "Or does the path opens for us to follow?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 27/08/2022 03:40
"I just hope this it the right path." Viraj wipes his brow and tries to peer through the thick canopy, but to no avail. "It seems like that tower is this way."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 28/08/2022 21:46
"It also seems like we're being watched." Ryuzuko says as he pulls out Raikurai, his eyes locked onto the various shadows moving to their left, in what little light shines through the forest canopy. (edited)
TheOrsini 29/08/2022 03:20
Koide points ahead, trying to determine the way for the others. 'Whatever this tower held must be crucial to their journey and possible the source of the Kaiju monstrosities.' She peered through the forest looking for snares or deceiving paths in the openings ahead. Many had died to get them this far, and it would not do to turn back now.
Kyle [Arcadian] 29/08/2022 20:50
As Ryuzuko gestures to the shadows moving amongst the tree, four pairs of red lights bear down on the group. Out of the darkness steps a quartet of pale, nearly skeletal humanoids dressed in rotted, hooded robes and burial wraps. Their eyes glow a deep scarlet and each bears a long pole of obsidian.
TheOrsini 09/09/2022 21:33
Koide reacts instinctively grabbing a vial of fiend toxins and dousing her quiver so the arrow heads are covered, reflexively reading, knocking, and drawing as she sights in the approaching ferrymen. In her haste, the void and her focus had not become as one and the first arrow flies harmlessly past the demon into the void beyond. The second flies true and even as it is loosed, she sighs knowing the shot to be true. She taps Ryuz on the shoulder to point at the creature she just hit, and prepares to knock another.
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/09/2022 22:32
The daemons advance slowly but steadily through the trees and then in a flash of darkness they are upon the interlopers. Blood red eyes blaze in their skulls, striking fear into the hearts of Ryuzuko, Sadao and Tatsu. Only Koide and Viraj can steel their hearts against the gaze of death. As fast as they appeared, the daemons strike with their staffs, but Koide dances aside, evading the strike completely. Viraj blocks one, before being struck from behind, while the last rebounds off of Ryuz's armour with a loud clunk.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 09/09/2022 23:45
Tatsu sees one of the staffs coming towards him and he spins, getting close to the demon as he raises his arms, grappling the creature's wrist at the same time, then he pulls down and make the demon's elbow make leverage aginst his shoulder. With a pop the elbow jumps from its socket and the creature drops the staff. Without stoping, Tatsu keeps moving the arm in a circular pattern, and he changes his own weight so the demon loses its balance and it's thrown over Tatsu's shoulder. The monk finds the creature heavier than he intially thought so he aids it with puliing with his arm on the demon's rear leg. With a thud the demon hits the ground on his back and Tatsu uses that momentum and his own body to put a kneel on the demon's neck, still controlling the arm. He changed his grip to the beast's lower jaw and back of the head, and twisted, but the alien anatomy didn't respond as he expected so he had to force more the movement until the neck broke with a loud crack. The demon disolved behind him into black smoke that was carried away into the night.
Mike 10/09/2022 03:51
Stricken with fear by the creatures suddenly surrounding the group, Sadao reflexively reaches for his family scroll. His hands unsteady, instead of unfurling it with his usual flourish, he jerks it out wildly, and calls out words of power. "Ancestors, preserve us!" with a flash of golden light, the opened scroll animates, and extends from the bard in a spiraling pattern. It glows brightly, before seeming expelling a series of shades. Humanoid figures appear, enveloped in that same golden light, each bearing weapons or casting implements of their own. Floating around him, the spirits begin to assault the demons.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 10/09/2022 18:41
Seeing the daemons suddenly upon them, Viraj gives a primal grunt and flexes his arms in a circular motion in front of himself. As the muscles bulge, the protective thorns and vines sprout from his skin. The druid reaches out with a thorn hand and grasps onto the nearby creature that Koide shot. The thorns dig into the creature, but Viraj senses some bit of resistance as they piece it's skin. He then pulls with his might to get the creature away from Koide to allow her another shot without being harried. (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 11/09/2022 08:09
The flash of demonic power emanating from the creatures causes Ryuzuko to jerk away from them. In his distress, the lantern that was held firmly in his grasp clashes onto the forest floor. "Chikara o ataeru kami!" He lets out a hasty prayer to the kami before pulling out his shield and making two swift strikes against the daemon between Viraj and Tatsu. With the momentary distraction created by Viraj, both powerful thrusts of Rakurai meet their mark, each followed by a burst of radiant light that burns the creatures upon contact. The dragonborn stands his ground, the daemon's power still firmly putting fear into his mind. (edited)
TheOrsini 11/09/2022 17:15
Seeing the opportunity that Viraj allowed, Koide takes a breath to aim with each arrow she drew, feeling them true to form even through the void, and let fly. The points stab the fell flesh and the coated toxins seem to do their work. Only seconds after the last arrow struck home, the fiend apperates into fine smoke before vanishing. It looked like they were winning. She heard movement behind her, and as she turned, she noticed the one in their midst. 'They must have teleportation magics'. Koide had not noticed before, too focused in the void. Tossing the bow over her shoulder, she manages to draw Shinokaze from its sheath, ready to defend against this new foe. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/09/2022 19:39
The spirits of golden light that surround Sadao lash out at the two remaining daemons, until a third can no longer hold its corporeal form and dissolves into smoke on the wind. The final fiend utters a fell incantation and a wave of impenetrable darkness billows out between the trees. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 11/09/2022 19:40
The darkness surrounded them taking out more than just the sight from the monk, but also the hearing. He couldn't hear or sense were his companions were, less the demon remaining. Tatsu decided to wait, and after a couple of deep breaths to calm himself down and adopted a defensive position, ready to react in case anything attacks him. (edited)
TheOrsini 12/09/2022 19:54
The fear of losing her eyes in addition to her voice was like a needle that burst the void in her head like a soap bubble. Koide wanted to scream, and the incoherent moans and rasps were all that came out. She reached for her face - touching her healed skin to make sure this was real. The blindness hid her hands only a breadth from her face, but she could feel that callused tips along her cheek. Closing her eyes, she centered herself, not pulling for the void, but just trying to curb the fear. She listened for the others, and reached out with planted feet for those that should be nearby. (edited)
Mike 13/09/2022 07:03
Still gripped by terror, Sadao staggers forward blindly through the brush. One of the demons had fallen, but one still remained, giving him no cause to celebrate, and only adding to his tension. He halts before getting too far from his comrades, and listens carefully for the sounds of one of these creatures, with even the ancestral spirits growing still. But he hears nothing. "Th-There was one left. Can anyone see it?" His voice breaks for an instant.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 13/09/2022 20:26
Viraj dashes through the heavy foliage looking for a sign of fleeing creature, or to rid himself of the void of light that it left behind. After a few steps he notices the slight difference in his surrounds, the faintest bit of natural light. Feeling he is clear of the darkness, the druid summons a blade of pure flame to light his surroundings. "I don't see the creature, but I'm out of the darkness! Follow my voice!" (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 13/09/2022 21:17
As the smoke dissipates from the destroyed source of fear and pitch darkness comes over the dragonborn, Ryuzuko steels his mind and silently prays to the kami, holding onto his amulet. The amulet begins to pulse and move within his hand, inching towards his north-east. "It's in the opposite direction from you Viraj!" He shouts while carefully stepping through the dense foliage in the direction of the creature. (edited)
TheOrsini 16/09/2022 01:12
Despite Ryuz-san's words, Koide desperately seeks Viraj's voice in the darkness. She make its step count, finally emerging from the shroud of darkness. Tears welling up from the gift of light. She place a hand of her medallion, grateful to still have her sight. Mindful, she looks into the hazy gloom afar for the fiends.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/09/2022 15:22
Between the tangled branches Koide can make out the fiend's red eyes suspended in the gloom of the canopy. It disappears for a brief moment, before reappearing once more further away. The daemon seems to be moving towards the enormous stone spire. Clouds swell overhead and rain can be heard falling upon the tree tops. Though little water reaches the forest floor, the air is thick and humid.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/09/2022 03:08
"It makes for the spire!" Ryuzuko shouts to the group as he watches the creature disappear into the night. The dragonborn then turns his gaze from there, sheathing his shield and retrieving his lantern, checking it for damage. "Is everyone good to continue?" He asks his companions, lifting his light high to better illuminate thier surroundings. (edited)
Mike 18/09/2022 06:12
Sadao stills his rapid breathing as he emerges from the magical darkness. As he regains his composure, the golden warriors surrounding him gradually fade from sight, leaving only faint trails leading back to the sealed scroll. "I'm alright," he says, glancing around at the others to see if they were any worse for wear themselves. "Those creatures could play tricks on the mind. And they were kin to the dark. What were they, and what kind of place is this, really?" He straightens his garb as Koide draws near, trying not to appear as shaken as he'd been, moments ago. It hadn't seemed to impact her nearly as much, mentally or physically. I should be more like her.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 19/09/2022 18:20
Flaming sword in hand, Viraj circles around to the others along the now visible edge of the half orb of blackness that covered them. "I"m fine here." He glances off in the direction where the deamon disappeared. "With that one getting away we should be careful. Who knows what will be alerted to our presence." (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 20/09/2022 10:29
Tatsu emerges from the dome of darkness. "I am fine and ready to contine mina-san"
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/09/2022 14:07
Close to the towering spire, the hike up through the woods grows ever steeper. Koide guides her companions unerringly towards their destination, until they break through the treeline onto a rocky outcrop of hexagonal columns at the foot of the colossal stalagmite. The columns form steps up the side of the spire, although most are three to six feet high.
Mike 28/09/2022 21:38
As the group begins the arduous climb, a shadow of tension still remains in Sadao's mind. From the appearance of the demons, to the mystery of this island right next to the Maw, to the 'oath' that still held sway over him and his close encounter with the kaiju itself, he feels smaller and smaller. So trapped in his own mind, he doesn't notice the handhold he's reaching for as he mounts the next column is fragile, until it's too late. "Whoa!" He blurts as he sinks. He struggles to get a firm grip on the edge to haul himself up.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 04/10/2022 19:01
Focused on the climbing and wondering who or what could have carved such gargantuan steps, Tatsu notices Sadao's predicament. He takes a step to the side and extends his arm, grabing Sadao's arm by the shoulder and pullimg him towards him, to a more secure area with less humidity and moss so he can get a firm grip again. "Sumimasen Sadao-san" he apologies "But I do think that you don't want to go that way"
Mike 04/10/2022 22:07
With Tatsu's help, Sadao gets a good hold on the ledge and climbs up. "Arigatou, Tatsu-san." He looks up at the length of the climb ahead of them, and sighs. "Truth be told, this place is getting to me. I hope we can find answers up there, or at least respite." He sets back to climbing, more carefully this time.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 04/10/2022 22:51
Tatsu just nods to Sadaoâ€™s words and keep himself below him and the rest, more focused now not o Lu on the climb but ready to assist any companion who may need his assistance. He notices, however, than the rock formation they are climbing is natural, not made as he initially thought.
Kyle [Arcadian] 05/10/2022 16:39
The climb to the top of the spire is long and hard. When Viraj finally makes it to the plateau at the peak, he immediately notices two things. First, a large circular pattern is etched into the the centre of the rocky surface. Second, in the distance he can make out six similar stone spires spaced evenly around a vast maelstrom of dark water - the Obsidian Maw.
TheOrsini 06/10/2022 07:39
Koide struggles up the stone ledges. The exertion wasn't anything she hadn't done before, but the roar of the sea wall off in the distance caused a bit of worry that it may just crash upon them at its whim. Without the embrace of the void in battle, she didn't benefit from the centering calm. But with Sadao's near fall and that calm nearly tuning the event out, she chose to be here in the present as the others talked nervously. In the back of her mind, she considered the fiends from the circle below, and the reason for their presence. 'Was it religious? Ritualistic? Were they guarding something, or guarding for another?' She caressed the medallion at neck, frowning as she slowly caught up with Viraj at the precipice.
Mike 06/10/2022 20:55
Sadao takes stock of their surroundings at the peak, steadying his breath. "This isn't good," he says, as he steps closer to the side that faces the massive expanse of the Maw. "Kuma said Israphel's Runestone was at the deepest point of the Maw. But if there's no safe way down there..." He trails off, looking again. He counts six other spires, seven, including the one they were on now. From a glance, they looked to be equidistant. Was there some significance to the number? He examines the pattern on the ground as well, trying to make some sense of it. "What is this, anyway?"
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 06/10/2022 22:36
Once on the top of plateau, Viraj takes a breath after the exhausting climb before turning and kneeling to assist the rest of the group with the climb to the final ledge. Extra effort is needed to assist the heavily armored dragonborn. He stands and clasps Ryuzuko on the back to help steady him after the arduous climb. The druid then approaches the edge of the circle carved in the ground and scans the horizon, noting the six similar spires. He takes a moment to focus in on the two nearest spires, looking for any signs of movement. "I'm not sure," Viraj answers Sadao. "But that last demon had to have run off somewhere."
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 06/10/2022 22:54
When Tatsu reaches the top of the plateau in the last place he let his gaze wander around, taking in the impressive yet intimidating landscape. Then he tries to focus on what the rest of his companions are talking about. "Maybe there is a secret entrance that we missed? hidden in between the natural pillars we've used to climb here?" (edited)
TheOrsini 10/10/2022 13:33
'Surely the fiends could leap or teleport between the fingers of the maelstrom,' Koide pondered. When she had began her training years ago, she had tried to focus on fiends in her own pursuit of vengeance, but The Watch had said more practical studies were required: things that the huntress would encounter in the field like undead. The masters had been right, though, she had fought many undead over the years, with the Garkain being the most recent benefit. But now she wished she understood the creature they pursued just a bit more...
Mike 10/10/2022 20:38
Sadao cups his stubbly chin in thought, then lays a hand on his scroll. A strand of golden light emanates from it, remaining on his hand. He then holds out his hand in front of him before quickly drawing it right up to his face, his eyes peering through the wisps of magical energy webbing his fingers. "Linh há»“n!" With a blink as he speaks the incantation, the aura vanishes, but his eyes now glow the same yellow hue. He looks again at the scene with spiritual sight, and can discern the presence of transmutation magic, as well as abjuration. "Well, I can at least say it's not a gateway of some kind. The magic here is transmutative, and there's some kind of ward too." He kneels to examine the pattern in closer detail, even running a finger along the outer edge. A few minutes of study don't yield aught, however, even with spirit vision. "It's no use. I can't make heads or tails of it. This is just a guess, but I think this location is important to the demons, somehow. Perhaps they guard this place, or are trying to get in. Maybe should stay the night up here, just to see what happens." (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 11/10/2022 06:18
Viraj nears the edge of the spire and glances between the circle and swirling maelstrom below. "What if this transforms and protects those that need to travel to the depths of The Maw?" He steps back to the edge of the circle and kneels next to Sadao. "If we're going to be waiting around until night maybe we can test this?"
TheOrsini 12/10/2022 18:26
Koide puts her hand up to get attention of those around her. She motions at the circle, drawing her hand in an elliptical shape, and then mocks the fiend's appearance before miming walking into a solid wall. She looks to the others to see if they understand.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 16/10/2022 02:26
Ryuzuko studies the circle himself while the others are discussing its possible intent. While kneeling down to one side, his eyes tracking the shapes and patterns, he notices Koide's miming. "I believe the fiends cannot cross this circle, like some kind of seal. At least that's what Koide is trying to tell us." He then stands, more keenly watching Koide's movements now. "Is it safe for us to cross then?" The dragonborn says before giving Sadao a glance. Maybe not Sadao anymore, because of what that witch did to him.
Mike 16/10/2022 03:51

"Well, all the more reason for us to stay inside it for the night." To emphasize the point, he steps insideâ€”while instinctively holding his breath.
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/10/2022 15:32
Sadao steps inside the circle and the lines and sigils begin to emanate a black glow.
Mike 17/10/2022 15:49

TheOrsini 17/10/2022 15:54
Koide takes the opportunity to draw her stilleto and draws a gentle slice across her hand, wincing with the cut but trying not to bury too deeply. She flicks the blood into the circle to wait for it to activate.
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/10/2022 16:01
Where Koide's blood touches the circle, the black turns to red, slowly spreading until the new colour overtakes the entire sigil. A deep rumble emanates from below, causing the spire to shake and tremor, and then a line of darkness opens across the diameter of the circle as its two halves slowly move away from each other, retracting into the rim of the plateau. A cavernous opening reveals the drop into darkness below, with a narrow, stone staircase spiralling around the inside edge of the spire's hollow core.
Mike 18/10/2022 15:27
Sadao blinks. "Oh. That's what the magic is for." He steps back and lets everyone else enter, before stepping inside himself, worried it might close on him. He conjures up more dancing lights to spiral down alongside the stairs in a row.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/10/2022 18:18

Kyle [Arcadian] 18/10/2022 23:03
The descent is long and dark, quickly swallowing up the meagre light of Ryuzuko's lantern. Before long, the rough basalt walls grow smooth and slick, as though polished to a mirror finish. Infinite reflections shimmer all around in the dancing lights of Sadao's floating spirits. Most are no more than echoes of the here and now, but those who look harder find the impossible reflected in the spire's glossy walls. A silver dragonborn ronin hiking across snowy hills, his wide-brimmed hat pulled low as he leans into the wind. A middle-aged Je'dahnian woman practices kata in a gi beneath tree branches laden with cherry blossoms. An aging druid walks the forests at the foot Jedahn's mountains. A woman dressed in dark leathers, who at a glance could almost have been Sadao, walks the streets of a busy city. Lyrel sits at an ornate wooden table, leaning over sheaves of parchment and stacks of ancient books.
Mike 19/10/2022 06:47
At the sight, Sadao stops in place, staring. Something catches in his throat and refuses to budge as he watches the shimmering mirage of the woman in a crowd. I nearly forgot her face. He wipes his eyes with his sleeve before they begin to water, and looks again at the vision, doing his best to ingrain every detailâ€”from her vaguely busy urban surroundings, to her older face, to her strange new garbâ€”in his memory before it faded. He hastens to catch up with the group before falling too far behind.
TheOrsini 19/10/2022 07:27

Kyle [Arcadian] 19/10/2022 10:25
Lyrel is sat in the library of the Tylnier family estate, poring over a set of ancient scrolls and cross-referencing them with an only slightly less ancient tome. As he works, the wizard feels a strange ripple pass through the air around him. The effect is almost imperceptible, but just enough to draw Lyrel's attention to a large mirror with a gilded frame that hangs on the wall a few feet to his left. The reflection within has turned almost pitch black and but for the image of Koide standing in darkness.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 19/10/2022 15:55

Conjuration though... could this be some sort of teleportation effect?' "Koide, can you hear me?" He calls out loud enough for anyone within vocal range in the room to hear him. (edited)

He had a feeling he knew what might happen if he touches the magic and so he holds up a finger. He heads back over to this table where he had been studying and scribbles out a lengthy note to his father indicating what had occurred here and that if Lyrel was no longer on the grounds, that he had gone to assist his companion. Kyle [Arcadian] 25/10/2022 21:58

As quickly as he was engulfed by the surface of the mirror, Lyrel is ejected on the far side and finds himself standing on a narrow precipice in the dark amidst Koide, Sadao and Viraj.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 25/10/2022 22:03

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 27/10/2022 15:33

I was in my family's study when I noticed one of the nearby mirrors reflecting an image of Koide with a shadowy background. I could see nothing else. He examines the darkened surface as he speaks to look for any reflections of his own. "How did you activate this magic? Kyle [Arcadian] 14/11/2022 17:13
Sadao works his divination and, although the inscription remains unchanged, it as though as veil inside his mind has been lifted, giving way to understanding. The script reads: One door leads to destiny and the other to certain death. One always lies and the other always tells the truth. You have one question. When Tatsu addresses the first door, it replies in the same language that he addressed it in. "Greetings, Tatsu-san..." The voice is deep and rich and as it speaks a carving of a weathered, bearded face forms around the most. (edited)
Mike 14/11/2022 19:31

He begins subtly working his fingers as he asks this, causing a ripple of barely visible spirits to be stirred up. Soft, comforting whispers are carried to the wizard's ears, granting him guidance. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 14/11/2022 19:53
Lyrel grins as Sadao translates. "Ah yes, this is a classic riddle. It is a simple one dressed in layers of misdirection. You simply ask which door the other door would tell you to enter and then choose the opposite door it tells you or in this case, which door will kill you. That is assuming both doors can speak..." He approaches the other door that Tatsu does not stand in front of to see if a mouth appears on the second door. As the second mouth appears he leans towards the mouth. "Tell me, which door would the other door tell me leads to certain death?" (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 14/11/2022 22:28

Mike 15/11/2022 15:42

"That means... this door is the one to certain death," he says, indicating the door next to him and Tatsu. "And that door is the door to destiny. Right?" He backs away from the door he was closest to.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 15/11/2022 23:08

Mike 16/11/2022 20:41

And he might've heard this riddle in some old text years ago himself, but if so, he'd forgotten the solution. Besides, his life was already in someone else's hands, whether he liked that or not. He stands with everyone else at the threshold of the door, and steps through when they're ready.

Kyle [Arcadian] 16/11/2022 21:37
Lyrel steps through the void and finds himself in an underwater seascape much like that which Sadao experienced with Kuma. The ground is dry, but far above the ocean is suspended like an undulating ceiling of water. The ocean floor is littered with plant-life that glows in a broad spectrum of fluorescent colours and in the distance Lyrel can make out the shadows of hulking, monstrous creatures moving about.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 16/11/2022 21:42
Lyrel immediately looks around to see if he spots the avenue from which he appeared on this side of the portal.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/11/2022 21:54
Behind Lyrel stands a vast surface of natural rock that looks like it might be supporting the island that his friends told him lies above.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 16/11/2022 22:19
Lyrel stares at it for a moment, feeling around the edges and the solid face. After a moment he steps back and simply waits, while keeping an eye on the large shapes moving in the waters nearby.
Mike 16/11/2022 22:33
Sadao stands watching the unchanging blackness for an uncomfortably long time. Having noticed Koide moving to stop him as he left, he can only guess at what's in her head right now, much less the others'. "He's not dead." He suddenly says, with an amount of conviction. "No way. He's right about this." Unsure if he's doing it because he trusts Lyrel's intelligence, wants to outdo him, or simply because he's being pulled to the runestone by Kuma's invisible puppet strings, he takes a deep breath, and takes several striding steps through.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/11/2022 22:36
Lyrel sees impossibly fine seams appear in the rock face as the door is opened. He's read of such achievements before. Dwarven craft that is indistinguishable from the natural stone that surrounds it. Sadao steps through and the rocks close behind him. (edited)
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 17/11/2022 18:03
As the cracks appear, Lyrel quickly tosses a section of his hemp rope through, just as the cracks appear before it closes. "Ah, Sadao, welcome! Are the others coming?"
Mike 17/11/2022 18:14
Sadao exhales as he takes in the familiar surroundings, his eyes settling on Lyrel as he greets him. "We hesitated, but they should be along shortly. I guess the rope will tell them it's safe." He looks at the large shapes moving in the distance. "Kuma had a sanctum like this. Must be powerful magic keeping it here. Can't be much further now." (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/11/2022 02:06
Viraj is about to follow behind Sadao, but stops as the rope suddenly appears after the bard. "Wha- ?! Damnit! They must be in trouble and want us to pull them back through!" The Rajani grasps the rope and begins to pull his companions to safety. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 18/11/2022 11:54
Lyrel and Sadao watch the door close on the rope, which is pinched in the gap. On the other side, Viraj feels resistance as he begins to pull.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 18/11/2022 23:55

Mike 21/11/2022 06:31
Sadao looks back at the rope curiously. "It is taking them a bit, eh? Maybe if we just..." he approaches, and takes hold of the rope with Lyrel. "...give it a good tug, they'll come through?" He remembers Ryu is surely on the other side, holding onto it. "Maybe gently. I don't think we'll win a tug-of-war." He shrugs to the elf.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 21/11/2022 12:45
At the mention that the others maybe in danger, Tatsu jumps into the same door trying to reach his new friends.
Kyle [Arcadian] 21/11/2022 12:46

Mike 21/11/2022 16:37

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 25/11/2022 19:24

Mike 28/11/2022 20:56

A giant curve is the watery atrium above them apparently funneling into a point on the ground is all that stands out to him, so he points it out to the group. TheOrsini 28/11/2022 23:32

She steps through the door as the others had done before, wishing she was back at home for the first time in many years. Something was creeping in her heart, and the seeds of doubt had taken root now.
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/11/2022 20:41
The group sets off along the path that Sadao has pointed out, heading towards the very heart of the Obsidian Maw. Their route winds between some gentle hills, but is overall fairly flat. The darkness above is heavy and oppressive, alleviated only slightly by the multicoloured fluorescent flora that litters the ocean floor, providing some dim light. In the shadows, just on the edge of perception, something (some things?) is moving in the dark.

Mike 05/12/2022 18:00

Kyle [Arcadian] 06/12/2022 15:48

Mike 06/12/2022 21:43

But the creature doesn't hesitate or show any glimmer of understanding. Not a beast, then?! How'd a fiend get all the way here?! is all the bard has time to think, getting into a defensive stance before it rushed them. (edited)

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 12/12/2022 16:50

What better way to handle it, than to simply make it slower? He draws DÅngfÄ“ng from its sheath, the beautifully glowing blade shimmers in the strange light of this watery abyss as Lyrel's stance shifts into the graceful, lithe Bladesong. His off hand reaches up to the sapphire pommel as he draws some sort of wispy, cloying energy out of the gem while he pulls his hand away before abruptly flinging the substance out towards the daemon! As it arcs over the heads of his companions, it spreads out into a cloud before settling over the daemon. Almost immediately the creature's movements seem slower and sluggish as the energy saps its energy. "I do not know how long this will last against such a foe, but let us make quick work of this foul minion!" (edited)

TheOrsini 14/12/2022 08:34
Satisfied with Ryuz's handiwork, Koide decides to join the fray lending her compatriots the time needed to defeat this creature. She knew Shi no kaze would not draw blood from the oni's hide, but that didn't mean that it knew that. Had her voice had strength she would have shouted out in a battle cry to render the demon's blood in cold iron shivers. Yet, even that was beyond her grasp. Pushing the fears from her mind, she embraces the void, feeding the emotions and worries and doubts into the fires surrounding the nothingness. The warrior dashes forward lightning fast, the katana drawn effortlessly from the saya. The blade flies as Hummingbird Kisses the Honeyrose shifts into Parting the Silk. Each sword form making false blade cuts, so quick and deliberate to force the Oni to the defensive, to follow her with its gaze and goad it into making her its focus. 'A fool's plan...' echoes on the bubble outside the void. 'It was necessary.' She tumbles through its legs to the far side of the great ape-like fiend with The Swallow Takes Flight, landing at rest on her heels, one hand braced against the ground as her blade is outstretched above her to the rear. She straightens into Feathers in the Wind awkwardly as the creature draws nearer. If she had but a few more moments, she could have shifted to Cat Dances on the Wall to improve her defensive posture. As she looked through the creature's thick legs, Koide sees the worry on Lyrel and Sadao's faces. 'This has to work.' was her last thought before the blow. (edited)

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 21/12/2022 19:48

The dragonborn's full might comes crashing down, powerful enough to shove the hilt of his blade into its skull. "Akuma ni nare!!" Ryuzuko's shout rings through the landscape, followed by a CRASH, and a bright flash of blue light as the creature's skull bursts, showering the sea floor with its blood and brains. The gozu is flung from the blast and thrown to the ground, freeing the dragonborn from its maw. The light, what little it had, of its dark eyes then fades, its arms and legs go limp, and its last breath leaves its twisted form. The dragonborn stumbles back to his feet, holding his side on the wounds the beast gave him. "Hopefully more creatures like this... Aren't nearby..." He slowly says as he catches his breath.

Soon, the group is in a thick jungle again as the plants have grown at least as thick they were on the island above where the group encountered the smaller daemons. TheOrsini 15/01/2023 23:15

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 15/01/2023 23:21

Mike 16/01/2023 15:17

Without a moment to lose, he takes out his shamisen and plays an ascendant chord once again, causing strong winds to surround and lift him up into the air. "They can't reach me up here. I'll guide from above, draw them off if we need it!" He calls down to the party. He darts his tired eyes around, looking for the giant curve again and flying towards it. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 18/01/2023 20:53

They rip and tear at the vegetation, wading through the ruined tangle towards the Ajentodon, but only making meagre progress. Mike 23/01/2023 17:10
Feeling another light pulse from his core, Sadao is drawn closer to their apparent goal. He floats toward the rocky mass, keeping within sight of the group, while trying to get a better look at it, and what could be inside.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/01/2023 21:28
Lyrel finds that he is a touch slower than his companions and lags behind the rest of the Ajentodon as they flee from the gozu daemons. The elf can hear the oni snarling behind him as they smash their way through the fibrous terrain that has sprung up in their path. He knows that they are faster than him. Running will not be possible for much longer. Far ahead of the pack, Sadao alights a few steps before a pedestal of dark, natural rock that stands within a cylindrical wall of water at the foot of the maelstrom. In the water above the pedestal spins an octahedron of black glass lined with runes.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 25/01/2023 21:41
Hearing the oni rapidly closing the distance between them Lyrel glances around and with an utter certainty that he would not outpace them; he rapidly casts a spell and begins running even faster as his long legs begin pumping even faster, quickly closing the distance to Ryuz who had been running ahead of even Lyrel. "Quickly! They are closing on us!"
Mike 25/01/2023 21:46
Sadao lands, and takes a tentative step forward. There it is. It's right here... He reaches his hand out unconsciously, but stops just inches from touching the water, as he hears a loud snarl, and Lyrel's shout. What... what am I doing? My friends are in danger, I don't have time for this! He retracts his hand immediately, and turns to take off and rejoin the group.
Kyle [Arcadian] 25/01/2023 21:48
Sadao's foot twists on the spot to face away from the runestone and he finds that he cannot take another step away from the object of Her desire. His legs simply will not cooperate.
Mike 25/01/2023 21:55
The bard breaks into a cold sweat as he realizes his predicament. His mind felt at war with the rest of his body, as he tried in vain to turn one way, then another, and eventually struggles to even move his head away from the runestone in front of him. "Come... on! Dammit!" It was clear now that it would take more time not to take it, and more willpower than he had. He lets out a pained sigh, and reaches into the vortex of water to grasp the runestone.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/01/2023 20:21
Sadao's fingertips graze the surface and the water is ice cold. His hand pushes inside and the texture is thick and viscous like reaching through syrup. Dark veins of Kuma's ink trail up and down the length of his forearm, but recoil and recede as Sadao reaches into the swirling water, never passing the surface themselves. The runestone shimmers distortedly in the refracted light of the lantern spirits that dance around the bard. The warped image makes the glistening obsidian gem appear both toweringly massive and yet small enough to fit in the palm of one's hand.
Mike 26/01/2023 20:53
Sadao looks at his arm in fear, seeing the ink coursing through his veins in response to the runestone's power. Whatever this is, it's here for a reason. Away from her, for a reason. Tears start to stream from his face as he pushes himself to seize the stone and pull it free from the water, despite knowing this.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/01/2023 21:19
Sadao's fingers brush the surface of the runestone and it is smooth to the touch, like glass. For a split second, he sees the sigils that run around the faces begin to light up, then the bard's vision fills with white and he finds himself standing on an infinite, empty plane. Behind Sadao, a short distance away, stands a venerable male dwarf in cream-coloured robes, with a pure white beard that trails on the ground behind him.
Mike 26/01/2023 21:38
With a blink, Sadao scans his surroundingsâ€”or lack thereofâ€”before his eyes fall on the dwarf behind him. It takes him a moment to realize what this must mean, and he immediately bows deeply as he makes the connection in his head. "Israphel-sama, I presume? I am so sorry."
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/01/2023 22:55
"You presume, do you?" The dwarf asks with a kindly chuckle. "Perhaps I was Israphel..." he muses to himself, "for a time." Slowly, Sadao's conversation partner circles the bard, his beard dragging along the floor behind him. "...and who are you, he who is so sorry? Introduce yourself."
Mike 26/01/2023 23:41
Sadao lifts his head, to regard the patient dwarf. "My name is Sadao, of the Huiya clan. I'm apologizing because I... made a huge mistake. My friends and I came here to seek out your runestone. But they only did it because of me. I fell under the enchantment of the sea witch, called Kuma. She tasked me with retrieving the runestone and bringing it to her, and I can't disobey. I don't even know what it's fully capable of, but I can tell it's incredibly powerful, and all of the wards and defenses we passed through were no doubt meant to keep someone like her from getting to it. And now I have it in my hand." He lowers his head, despair weighing on him. "At this rate, I won't be able to keep myself from delivering it right to her. I'd be letting down my friends and my ancestral line. We're sworn to prevent exactly this, powerful beings throwing the world out of balance." He feels for and instinctively clutches his gilded family scroll. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/01/2023 20:52
The dwarf nods in understanding. "Well met, Sadao of the Huiya clan. You may call me Arken. Now, I know a little something of ancestral duty. So, tell me: this 'Kuma', her influence and her power over you, do you feel it here and now?" It is not until Arken asks this question that Sadao realises that for the first time in hours, he does not feel the itch of Kuma's curse in the back of his mind, driving him towards the object of her desire. (edited)
Mike 27/01/2023 21:07
Sadao lifts his head and stares back at Arken. "I don't. But how? Are you doing this? Can you free me?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/01/2023 21:43
"Perhaps I could," Arken admits, "for a time... but to do so would bring the ocean down on your friends. Have you considered how you might free yourself?"
Mike 27/01/2023 22:33
While disappointed, Sadao puts his mind to work without Kuma's obsession to interfere. "I'm sure it would require a sufficiently powerful mageâ€”or more likely, priestâ€”who can break curses. Problem is, we went to Kuma because she was the most powerful mage we'd heard of. Aside from you, Arken-sama, I don't know where to begin finding someone who supersedes her... but that reminds me." "There is more to the story. We sought her out to find out what she knew about the leviathan that has begun emerging from these waters and destroying coastal towns. I encountered the beast myself, and it spoke to me through my mind. It was unlike any I'd ever seen, though I'd long studied accounts of such strange entities in our family's most apocryphal tomes. Do you know anything about it?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/01/2023 22:29
Arken points up and above Sadao their blank, white surroundings blur and swim until an image forms. It is the mouth of the Obsidian Maw lost in the oppressive darkness of the waters directly above the runestone. A black disc with a faint white rim crackles with sparks of magical energy. Tentacles, scaled limbs and feathered tails are all desperately trying to pull themselves through from somewhere else, but all but the largest are kept at bay by the crushing water pressure. "It is not of your world," Arken confirms simply.
Mike 30/01/2023 09:04
Sadao watches with awe and a touch of fascination. Seeing the bizarre creatures only described in the texts he'd taken a liking to in the flesh, like the leviathan earlier, was incredible. But this did have new dangers. After all, they couldn't be plied by favors or logic, like other magical beings. "So the runestone itself is keeping them sealed? But the Leviathan got through, and... maybe that false hydra, too?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/01/2023 09:58
Arken shakes his head. "They are drawn to my power," he explains, "and I have lain here so long that the wall between our worlds has weakened to the extent until, finally, some could break through."
Mike 30/01/2023 20:01
Sadao's eyes widen. "Then, what can be done? Does removing the runestone even matter at this point?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/01/2023 20:49
"Oh, yes," Arken assures Sadao with an affirmative nod. "In time, the wound will heal fully, but my absence will already allow it to close significantly."
Mike 30/01/2023 21:12
"Well, that's a silver lining, I suppose. That still leaves the issue I mentioned: once I leave this place, I'll be compelled to bring it to Kuma. Although..." The bard pauses. "It might be safe with her there, if it can't stay here." He looks back at Arken, and jumps to add, "Just a thought. I still don't know what she wants with it!"
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/01/2023 21:32
"I am not your master, Sadao of the Huiya clan," Arken laughs with a friendly shake of his head. "You must follow your own heart, even if it takes you where this Kuma cannot go. I must admit that I have never been wielded by human hands before. It will be a new and interesting experience - the first in more than a millennia! I look forward to seeing what you will build." The empty, white surroundings fade from sight and Sadao once more finds himself poised with his arm stretching into the water. High above, the black portal from the bard's vision with Arken swirls and broils; a living engine driving the Obsidian Maw itself. In the distance behind him, Sadao can hear the oni rapidly gaining on his friends. The more he stretches into the frigid water to grasp the runestone, the more his shoulder pulses as Kuma's ink shrinks away from the runestone's protective bubble.
Mike 30/01/2023 22:07
Sadao's eyes refocus as he returns to his present surroundings, the sounds of struggle not far away. With no more time for doubt, he presses onward into the water, diving in headfirst. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/01/2023 22:56
As Sadao's head passes the surface of the water, the black veins climbing up his neck slither down and away into his torso. Once more, the bard finds his mind clear of Kuma's influence, but, as he grasps the runestone, it also becomes clear that he has other problems to worry about. Although the witch's grip on Sadao fades, so too do her powers, including his ability to breathe like a creature of the ocean. (edited)
Mike 30/01/2023 23:34
Sadao expels a burst of bubbles as he realizes he can't breathe underwater for the first time in days. He tugs himself free with the runestone in his hands, spitting out seawater and shaking his head and hair dry. He gazes on the obsidian gemstone for a moment, before safely storing it in his bag, and taking to the air once more to find the others. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 31/01/2023 13:13
As soon as Sadao returns to the bubble of air beneath the ocean, he can feel Kuma's influence slowly creep back over him as the ink in his veins returns to his head.
Mike 31/01/2023 18:12
Sadao halts as he feels the black ink come over him again. There wasn't much time for experimenting, but the water had worked... He pulls out a waterskin and empties it. Returning to the vortex, he fills the waterskin to the brim with the seawater, and tries a sip, watching the ink in his arms for a reaction.
Kyle [Arcadian] 31/01/2023 19:14
Sadao gags and retches upon drinking pure sea water, but it seems to have no effect on Kuma's mark on him.
Mike 31/01/2023 19:30
Sadao promptly dumps the contents of his waterskin out, thankful no one had seen him do that. Knowing what would happen if he left without purging the mark somehow, he mutters a word of prayer and takes a deep breath, before stepping into the vortex one last time to immerse himself fully in its waters.
Kyle [Arcadian] 31/01/2023 20:52
This far beneath the surface, the pressure of the ocean above Sadao coming down on him should be utterly crushing in the most literal of senses. However, the bard is in far too much pain to notice. Thick, black ink rushes from one side of his body to the other, in an attempt to escape passing the surface of the aquatic barrier that held the obsidian runestone. Blood vessels burst from the sudden change in conditions both within and without. Then, finally, as Sadao pulls his second leg through, the congealed mass of the oil slick that the witch has placed upon his mind explodes out through the end of his foot. Submerged within the column of water, the bard barely hears the wet splat as the black mass hits the ground in a spray of his own blood. It seizes, writhes and raises pseudopods that make it look strangely alive. Some distance away, the oni are finally gaining on Ryuz and the others... (edited)
TheOrsini 01/02/2023 00:53
Koide seeing this oozing form emerge from Sadao. Is this a manifestation of Kuma's power? The warrior doesn't hesitate, if this will free Sadao, she would have to take it. She forgoes the void and charges in to carving at the oily jelly. She opens her mouth to give a bestial yell, but her mind is the only one to hear it. 'I should have never left you, but I will save you.' (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 01/02/2023 12:47
Seeing his friend in danger, Tatsu launches himself forward, pushing the limits of his body to reach Sadao and the strange creature that is threating him. On the last steps he jumps and launches a flying lateral kick to the weird, black slug, hitting it in the center of its form. He isn't sure if that thing was hurt at all but some of it sticks on his foot, like tar. Trying to hold his breakfast the monk stomp a couple of times trying to get it off his foot.
Kyle [Arcadian] 01/02/2023 12:53
The foul slime creature clings to Tatsu's leg, slithering up his body until it finds the mouth and pushes its way inside. The unpleasant sensation makes the monk heave and retch.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 01/02/2023 15:26
Lyrel glances back to Ryuz a short distance behind as all the others begin running up towards Sadao and calls out. "Quickly, Ryuz, perhaps Sadao has discovered a path for us out of this place!" He spots the oni rapidly gaining and slows his breathing as he shifts his stance in that of the Bladesong, the ancient form of his people. With a rapid flourish of DÅngfÄ“ng, the blade begins to crackle with electricity before Lyrel slashes the blade through the air, sending the energy streaking through the air, past Ryuz, and towards the oni. Unfortunately, the alacrity of Lyrel's attack causes the crescent shaped lightning to hit the ground! He then turns and begins running towards the others.
Mike 01/02/2023 17:28
From within the cylinder of water, Sadao lets out a gurgling scream as his foot expels the creature. By the time he finishes reeling, he sees the thing starting to attach itself to Tatsu. he reaches his hand out of the water and grabs the monk's arm, pulling him in with a sharp tug. Sadao paddles out of the water, landing on his hands and knees. He tries to stand, but has a more difficult time than expected on his injured foot. His left hand seems to explode as the creature leave his body and Tatsu screams and coughs , but despite his pain he puts his left hand inside too to make sure nothing of the creature remains He is amazed by the wisdom and bravery of Sadao-san
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 02/02/2023 18:30
Viraj follows the energy Lyrel sends flying through the air behind them toward the oni, then back to where Sadao flew off to. The rajani man pauses his gait, glancing bout unsure what to do. Kyle [Arcadian] 03/02/2023 19:45
The two gozu roar and snarl as they gallop across the ocean floor towards the Ajentodon, undeterred by the eruption of Viraj's carpet of chitinous spikes. However, the pair make little progress and eventually stop to fight amongst themselves. The enormous monsters bellow, roar and wrestle, until one lifts the other clear off the ground and hurls it at the dragonborn! The rapidly incoming gozu catches the paladin off guard, smashing into Ryuz with an almighty crash that drives him back several feet. The dragonborn tastes iron on his tongue as a rib cracks from the impact, but manages to avoid being knocked off of his feet.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 03/02/2023 21:12

TheOrsini 06/02/2023 17:26

She outstretches her left moving her forefinger and thumb in a specific rotation, aligning the angle of her eyes to the creature, and make the motion of her lips. Igni.
TheOrsini 06/02/2023 18:20
Her irises redden and glow with the embers of the magic dormant within her. Sparks surge forward giving way to red and then white hot flames erupting from the palm of her hand. The warmth caresses Koide's face and exposed arm, but broils the oily magical residue. The ooze writhes in pain with the flames licking across its amorphous surface. Shrieks escape from the hissing form as pressure forces the entity to expand from rising pressure. It reaches futilely with a fiery tendril toward Sadao before losing its composure and collapsing into a dried black stain on the ground. Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 08/02/2023 14:35

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 08/02/2023 17:30
As Lyrel closes the distance from the oni, he hears a commotion behind and turns to see Ryuz engaged with one of the creatures and the other rapidly gaining on the dragonborn warrior. He curses, realizing that Ryuz had not continued along with him, and stops; he could not leave Ryuz to face the oni alone. He then things the energy into the air as it coalesces into a mist that soars across the distance and settles itself over the two oni. Mike 09/02/2023 05:05

TheOrsini 13/02/2023 19:05

Mike 16/02/2023 05:49

Kyle [Arcadian] 17/02/2023 16:13

Mike 17/02/2023 16:44

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/02/2023 20:18

Kyle [Arcadian] 21/02/2023 22:22
Lyrel leans over the edge of the platform to hurl a parting arc of electricity at the gozu as it tumbles back down the rapidly growing spire of stone that the Ajentodon are riding upon. However, the creature's motion is too chaotic and the bolt finds only more rock. The spire continues to rise up from the ocean floor. It even seems to be accelerating. From this high up, one can see how drops of water are beginning to drip through what was previous a perfect torus of surface tension. Then, just as the spire is about to pierce the top, whatever magic had still been holding the sea at bay finally dissipates and the bubble bursts. An ocean of water comes crashing down on the strange landscape below, but the Ajentodon are spared by an invisible sphere of force encompassing the plateau upon which they stand. Water rushes past until finally they break the surface and are lifted into the sky. All around stand the seven other island spires that surround the Obsidian Maw. They appear to be crumbling into the ocean and the maelstrom has shrunk significantly. Down at sea level, the Baochuan can be seen casting off in order to avoid falling chunks of rock from the island at which it had been moored. It appears to be making for the new spire that has emerged from the deep.
Mike 22/02/2023 18:19
"That... worked. Not quite the way I expected, but... it worked! Yeah!" Sadao breaks the tension with an exultant cheer. "And I'm freed!" He breaks off to look at the others, particularly the battered Ryuzuko. "Oh, I nearly forgot. Let me help, Ryu-kun." He limps over on his injured foot and speaks a word of power in ancient Xingongese, conjuring a healing spirit. This time it takes the form of a lily-white snake, which slithers up onto the dragonborn and gently coils around his midsection. It sinks its fangs into him, but instead of additional pain, he feels relief. Sadao examines his wound as it does so, ensuring they heal properly. "You withstood a great deal from those things. I'm shocked you can even stan-" (edited)
TheOrsini 22/02/2023 18:23
Koide release the void and drops her katana to enwrap Sadao in a fierce hug.
Mike 22/02/2023 19:37
Sadao is cut off by Koide's sudden embrace. Blushing hard, he starts to ask what the matter was, but stops. He remembers the look she'd had when facing down the ooze that represented Kuma's hold over him, before destroying it with extreme prejudice. That had infuriated her. He felt dense for not picking up on it sooner. Wordlessly, he shifts to put his arms around her in return. After a few more moments, he extends one arm to bring Ryu in as well, and casts a teary-eyed glance at Viraj, Tatsu, and Lyrel, welcoming them.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 22/02/2023 22:11
Tatsu was speechless. Not even in his wildest dream he would had imagine something like what he and the others had experienced. He looks to his left hand, Still painful he bandage it with some silk warps of his forearms as he nods in acknowledgment of Sadaoâ€™s words to Ryuzuko. Then Sadao and Koide hugh and he locks his eyes in the ocean below, trying to give them some kind of privacy. Thatâ€™s why he doesnâ€™t notice Sadaoâ€™s invitation in the first place, but when he does he join then letting all the stress and fear dissolve with the want of the friendship.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 23/02/2023 17:10
Lyrel lets out a sigh of relief as their escape, but stares in curious awe as the rest of the islands begin to crumble and fall. 'This will reshape these waters for years to come. Hopefully for the better.' When he turns to look at the curious artifact held by Sadao-san, he notices the teary-eyed look from Sadao as he embraces Koide. For a moments he eyes the public display of affection and vulnerability with a dubious gaze before a wry smile crosses his lips and he joins the others. 'Humans and their emotions...' "You did very well, Sadao-san. Whatever you did, it was likely the main source of our survival."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 23/02/2023 17:38
Viraj smiles at the bard and shuffles into the group. Stooping slightly, he wraps his large frame around his friends. He offers Sadao a comforting pat upon the back and reassuring nod. "I think we're going to be okay."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 23/02/2023 17:51
"Thank you Sadao-san..." Ryuzuko lets out as the adrenaline subsides. "I do not think I could have held out any longer..." He turns to watch the scene before them, allowing himself a moment of respite as he and his allies grow closer to their goal. The towering dragonborn also joins the group, placing his hands on Viraj and Lyrel. "I would not survived without either of your magic. Arigatou gozaimasu."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 23/02/2023 18:11
Lyrel looks up at Ryuz with a dismissive gesture. "It was nothing compared to the might of Ryuzuko-sama, standing before the might of two oni! We all do our part together. I am just one of many. You and Sadao-san deserve the praise for this day."
Mike 25/02/2023 23:23
As the group hug dissolves, Sadao takes to watching the Baochuan gradually approach their spire, figuring they can descend down the side of it when it was near. Though this particular adventure had been a success, there were still loose threads that lingered in the bard's mind. Chief of which, was what to do about Kuma. While he thought, his mind returned to the original reason they had sought her out in the first placeâ€”to restore Koide's voice. He withdrew the runestone again and stared at it. It held up an ocean. Surely it could have this power as well? More than ready to try, Sadao closes his eyes and focuses on the runestone again, willing himself back into its confines, where Arken waited in the endless void. "Arken-sama! Please don't think less of me for calling on you again already. I have another request for you, and it's very important to me." "Someone... dear to me, has been grievously injured, and lost the use of her voice. She longs to have it back, and I long to hear it again. Can your power mend her body in that way?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/02/2023 12:31
Arken sits cross-legged in the void, sipping from a porcelain teacup. A steaming pot stands on the floor in front of him. "Greetings Sadao, of the Huiya clan. Would you care for some tea?"
Mike 26/02/2023 17:31
Sadao gapes, baffled. Not only had he effortlessly parried his plea, but he had an entire teaset somehow. "Tea? Where did you get that?" He shakes his head to regain his composure. "Uh... alright then." It wasn't as though time was an issue. However long he seemed to spend here, only a brief moment passed outside. The bard sits down across from the dwarf and waits for him to pour him a cup. "By the way, it's more common to just say Huiya Sadao. I was just being especially formal when we first met. And since we're familiar, my given name, Sadao, will do fine."
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/02/2023 18:48
"Here, reality can be whatever you want it to be," Arken tells Sadao cryptically, offering him a second cup that wasn't there a moment ago. "Very well, Sadao. Come. Sit with me a moment."
Mike 26/02/2023 19:19
Sadao accepts the offered cup, with a blink. "Whatever you want it to be, huh?" Wondering if he could influence things the same way, he looks at the tea in his hand. Focusing hard, he recalls the taste of a tea his mother made, on rare occasions when the mood struck her. Comforting and nostalgic, rather unlike the brewer. He takes a sip.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/02/2023 19:21
The fragrant aroma of the steaming tea is exactly as Sadao recalls it.
Mike 26/02/2023 19:39
"...Wow." is all the bard can say, taking another sip and beginning to truly relax. "This place really is amazing. You must love it here."
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/02/2023 20:12
"I must?" Arken echoes. "Perhaps. Of course, neither of us is really here. Now, Sadao, tell me about the one who is dear to you."
Mike 27/02/2023 06:33
"Well, her name is Koide. She is... a bold, beautiful warrior, who saved my life more times than I can count. Just now, she destroyed the remnants of my curse before they could do me any more harm. I think I love her. But..." He puts his half-finished tea down, covering it with one hand. "...I also think she has feelings for another. An elf named Lyrel. They've known each other for longer. He left the group some time ago, but he quite suddenly reappeared, seemingly called to us because she missed him so. I can't just ignore that, even though it hurts." "So, I want to restore her voice. I want to hear it, from her, in her own words. Even if her answer is 'No.'" He stares off into the void as he finishes this thought, then heaves a sigh, almost relieved. "It feels nice to get that off my chest." He chuckles, though it rings hollow.
Kyle [Arcadian] 27/02/2023 21:15
"Healing a loved one is a noble cause, Sadao," Arken agrees as he drinks his tea, "but first you must learn to harness the runestone's full potential. This spire is merely temporary and will crumble as soon as some other thing is asked of me. Permanency can only be achieved once the runestone has accepted you as its master, which can be a lengthy process."
Mike 28/02/2023 08:57
"I understand. In that case, I'd better get to it. I suppose we'll be meeting again soon enough, if I'm to learn more... Arken-sensei." He takes one last deep drink of tea, and sets the cup aside, before closing his eyes one more and willing himself back to the present.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 01/03/2023 21:39
Ryuzuko takes the rope from his pack and begins to tie it around the severed gozu limb. Once he's satisfied he makes his way to edge, peering down the towering spire. "Alright, who's first?"
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 02/03/2023 09:44

Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 02/03/2023 18:15
