Kyle [Arcadian] 03/03/2023 20:53
The height and exposure of pushing out over the edge of the spire's flat top provokes a sense of vertigo and a small spike of adrenaline. The basalt columns are rough, abrasive and incredibly steep, while their hexagonal shape makes for a unique climbing experience. Although the descent is physically demanding, the steps in the columns provide foot- and handholds, making for a challenging, but surmountable task. By the time Koide reaches the bottom, the Baochuan is drawing close to the island, with some of the sailors on the prow waving to the Ajentodon.
TheOrsini 03/03/2023 21:02
Koide took the physical exertion to work through some of her thoughts from the past few days. By the time she was at the bottom, she was resolved within herself, even having a relieved smile on her face as she waves to the crew. (edited)
Mike 03/03/2023 21:09
Sadao, for his part, seems deep in thought as he climbs down as well. This time, however, he remains attentive enough not to lose his footing, like on their earlier ascent.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 04/03/2023 21:11
Ryuzuko, as the last to descend the tower, follows close behind the group with his prize dragging it along the stone and sand behind him. The dragonborn looks towards the Baochuan, then to the sea around it. "Looks like Zheng He-san and his men managed to stay out of trouble. I don't believe I have the strength to fight another creature from this place..." He says before letting out a sigh of relief and then hoisting the rope above his shoulder and toiling towards the beach. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/03/2023 21:44

Kyle [Arcadian] 05/03/2023 15:13

Mike 05/03/2023 16:53

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 05/03/2023 17:00
"What exactly is it?" The dragonborn asks, currently splashing sand and sea water on the gozu hand in an attempt to clean what blood is still seeping from it.
Mike 05/03/2023 17:23
"Well," Sadao starts counting with his fingers as he begins to list what they knew. "It's known to the world as Israphel's runestone. I can say from experience when I use it, that there is some kind of spirit inside who can get in your head and help you channel its power: Arken, the name I said earlier. Kuma wanted it rather badly, which is what concerns me now. And, last but not least, it wasn't just holding up that undersea sanctum, but it also maintained the barrier that's supposed to keep our world and another separate, and, apparently, the entire Obsidian Maw." He grows more visibly stressed with each item he enumerated, until he is practically shaking his whole hand stating the last point. He blinks, and goes back to smiling and waving at the approaching boat, trying to maintain appearances that nothing was amiss. "For all I know, it probably brought Lyrel to us too." This makes him pause again. They'd have to explain that, too. (edited)
TheOrsini 08/03/2023 14:35
Koide couldn't say much of her thoughts on the runestone, or how she hoped Sadao had been freed of the sea witch's curse. Instead she puts a comradely arm around the dragonborn's tall shoulder in support of his efforts below.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 08/03/2023 15:15

Mike 08/03/2023 15:36

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 08/03/2023 16:29

Mike 08/03/2023 17:23

Kyle [Arcadian] 09/03/2023 21:56
The row boat comes to a halt alongside the towering pillar of stone and the sailors help the Ajentodon down from the rocks and into the small vessel. Mike 10/03/2023 16:58
As Sadao lays eyes on Zheng He, he prepares a cordial bow and greeting like normal, but a sudden memory brings a chill over him.
"...be done to prevent Baochuan's departure. We can only hope that Zheng He does not find what he is looking for out on the Obsidian Maw. Perhaps the gods will smile upon us and the kaiju will swallow the ship whole. Its power cannot be allowed to fall into their hands."
"...and if he does find it?" One of the other men ventures.
"Then we can only pray that those adventurers come to see the kind of man that they work for before it is too late."
Sadao still was not sure if he truly trusted Zheng He. He been friendly and accommodating enough, helping them hold their brief memorial service for Viraj's friend, and he'd been considerate enough to wait here for their arrival, never giving up. But he could've had his own reasons for waiting so long. Regardless, the fewer people that knew about the runestone, the better. "Zheng He-xiÄnsheng, hisashi buri, desu ne?" He gives him the traditional Jedahnian greeting with a smile. "Thank you for waiting. We would have been doomed if you had given hope and left without us." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/03/2023 21:23

"It seems that you have done the impossible and even found a solution to this. Tell me; what did you find on that island and how did it bring you here?"
Mike 12/03/2023 02:48

Mike 21/03/2023 16:43

Sadao launches into a vivid account of their journey through the island, and the demonic forces that hounded them from the moment they entered the thicket. He tells the taleâ€”this leg of it, anywayâ€”faithfully, leaving nothing out, up until he reached the part where they began to see visions in the abnormally smooth basalt cavern. "Koide-san saw, and could actually touch Lyrel-san! She pulled him through, which must have teleported him an incredible distance from his home." He motions to the high elf.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 23/03/2023 20:15

Kyle [Arcadian] 24/03/2023 19:49

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 03/04/2023 15:07

Mike 12/04/2023 17:08

He continues to summarize their experience, up until the point where they reached the runestone. The bard is careful not to mention them acquiring or even seeing the runestone. "So we came upon a strange well, with water flowing upwards! When I touched it, it relieved me of my curse binding me to the sea witch. But before we could investigate further, we were set upon by great four armed daemons. Ryu still has the remnant of one. When they were slain, the magic supporting the underwater realm began to collapse. I can only assume they were magical guardians, linked to it somehow." His mixture of truths and half truths is clearly pushing it for the party, that had been there, but he hopes that this would serve for someone uninitiated.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 12/04/2023 21:44

Kyle [Arcadian] 15/04/2023 21:34

Mike 15/04/2023 21:53

It kept extending upwards out of sight, presumably meeting the bottom of the Obsidian Maw somewhere." Sadao sits back, as if reminiscing. "Never seen anything quite like it. We didn't have time to take it in, though, because the guardians attacked." "After we managed a victory, the place began to crumble, as I said, and fill with water. We had nowhere left to go except the spire we were already on. We thought we were doomed, but inexplicably, the spire rose, and carried us above the waves. And of course, you know the rest." Kyle [Arcadian] 16/04/2023 17:09

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 16/04/2023 17:41

After a moment, he interjects politely. â€Honorable Zheng He, we have fought a terrible battle and one of our members was grievously wounded. Mike 16/04/2023 18:21

Sadao rises from his seat, finding his rhythm again. "I'll be more than happy to go into greater detail then, Zheng-xíansheng! Kyle [Arcadian] 16/04/2023 20:57

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 17/04/2023 17:42
"It would probably be best to return there as soon as possible. That reptile-like monster was heading in that direction." Viraj's head drops. "Though I don't know what we would be able to do. It is almost two days ahead of us." (edited)
TheOrsini 17/04/2023 19:56
Koide stands against the railing on deck watching the sea, feeling the rock of the waves. She briefly considers the conversation below. But her companions were quite capable of handling that. She had come along way from that mission against the Garakin in such a short period of time, 'Losing your voice would do that.' she thinks smirking to herself. She had lost the revulsion of having to rely on others, eventually even growing to enjoy it, much to her own chagrin. But she no longer felt embarrassed or weakened by it; it was just a burden of the journey. Something that would like be part of her for many years to come. 'I wonder what comes next?' she ponders, though the thought crossed her mind. 'Definitely off the water.' Koide had a growing concern that Kuma might come for the stone now that is free of the maelstrom. And they were vulnerable while at sea. She starts to move to her chest, realizing it was left aboard the other vessel. She sighs. 'I'll tell them after the meeting.' she makes a mental note for herself. (edited)
Mike 17/04/2023 20:17
"Even so, that may be for the best. At the very least, we can lend some aid to those who survived the attack." Sadao's fist clenches as he thinks of his father at home, and family estate. I hope he made the most of my warning. "Besides, we still need to find more clues as to this monster's nature, and why it's targeting the towns it does." He looks back to Zheng He. "One last question, if you'll hear it, honorable Zheng-xíansheng. It seems the kaiju we're tracking came first to Yingkou, and now Kitajima. Do you think there's an emergent pattern here, or any links?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/04/2023 21:20
"What makes you think that they are one and the same?" Zheng He challenges. "The kaiju in Yingkou was reportedly a quadruped. It seems that several emerged from the Maw before you could close it. Do you have any insight into their origin?"
Mike 17/04/2023 21:34
Sadao blinks at that news, not recalling that detail. "We have our work cut out for us, then. As for their origin, it remains unclear, from what we saw. If you'll excuse us..." He bows once more, and goes to the door.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 18/04/2023 16:31
Lyrel wished he could have had more time to examine the strange magics beneath the sea before it was collapsed, but it was either that or possibly face death against more of the oni. Who knew how many more had lingered in the darkness. He follows Sadao out, waiting until they were far from earshot and leans in to whisper. "Is there anywhere private on this vessel that we could speak?"
Mike 18/04/2023 17:06
Sadao glances up and down the hall, before responding to Lyrel with a gesture, and another whisperâ€”one carried by spirits as a messageâ€”"I've been trying to think of one since we set foot on this vessel. Our quarters will have to do." He motions to Viraj, Ryuzuko, and Tatsu as well. First, they ought to find Koide.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 18/04/2023 20:44
Tatsu bows politely to Zheng He and follow the others, starting to feel the long day in his body.
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/04/2023 20:33
Sadao and his companions find Koide on deck, more or less where they left her.
TheOrsini 22/04/2023 21:03
Sitting crosslegged against the bulwark, Koide smiles as she sees the others finally free of their discussions with the Baochaun's captain. She lets the meditative breath escape before beckoning them over.
Mike 24/04/2023 19:29

TheOrsini 29/04/2023 17:48
Koide seems confused by Sadao's apology, but she takes his hand to stand up and join him. She just smiles and motions for him to lead onward. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/05/2023 12:23
Sadao leads the Ajentodon below deck to the modest cabin, but private cabin that he has spent the last day confined to.
Mike 04/05/2023 15:04
Once they enter and get settled down, Sadao double checks for any eavesdropping before starting. "Alright, so I've been thinking. Remember that idea I mentioned earlier?" He outlines a plan to attune to the runestone, then allow Kuma to do the same, effectively splitting its power between them. To bind this deal, a new pact of non-aggression could be formed, one more mutually beneficial than his earlier curse. "...And that's it. We could get Kuma's information and cooperation this way, and without risking the destruction of this boat, and the bloodshed that might entail. What do you all think?" The bard completes his concerning explanation, seemingly oblivious to his comrades' stares. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 05/05/2023 22:11
â€Trying to beat the devil with his game turns you into a devilâ€ quotes the monk. â€I think itâ€™s too risky and now that you are rid of her influence I do not understand why you must risk to be attacked to her again. You are the master of the Runestone now. Itâ€™s more likely that she will look for your demise nowâ€
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/05/2023 23:22
"I agree with Tatsu on this. Making deals with beings such as this Kuma, who only seek to further themselves, will only end in our own suffering." Ryuzuko adds in, standing tall by the entrance with his arms crossed. "She cannot be the only source of knowledge as to why the kaiju attack the shores of Je'dahn and Honmin. That stone held up the ocean and lifted the earth beneath us, surely it can help us find a more reasonable solution."
TheOrsini 08/05/2023 00:17
Koide nods aggressively in support of Tatsu and Ryuz's words. She had no intention of losing him again. (edited)
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 08/05/2023 06:25

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 08/05/2023 14:47
Lyrel sat quietly, digesting the information presented by Sadoa and thinking over his knowledge and experience with magical items, while the others dissuaded the young bard from his idea. "Not only that, Sadao, but I have never heard of any magical items sharing their powers between two different people. It is likely it would become a battle of wills and the greater would claim the prize."
Mike 08/05/2023 16:59
With each additional point, Sadao's expression grows a shade more guilt-ridden. After Lyrel, he holds his hands up with a sort of halting gesture. "Okay, okay, you're all right, of course. Kind of a... stupid idea." Inwardly, he had to wonder if there wasn't still some shred of her left in him that would make him want that. But there wasn't any time for introspection. "Forget it. We should get ready for a visit from Ebirah though, and that means I need to continue my meditations with the runestone, if we want to really use it. Do you think we can warn Zheng He and the crew without letting them know what else transpired?"
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 08/05/2023 17:03
Lyrel smiles and places a hand upon Sadao's shoulder. "No stupid ideas, Sadao-san, only stupid people who refuse to ponder such things. One cannot know the limitations of themselves until the test them. Now... as for Zheng... the less we tell him, the safer we will be. I do not have any evidence other than my instincts, but I believe he is a part of a shadowy cult." He looks directly at Koide with his next words. "One of the Black Hand. Like the ones who tried to murder my father, and that the Magistrate was seemingly part of. We must be very careful here, never go anywhere alone while on the ship."
Mike 10/05/2023 00:04
Sadao nods. "Given what Li Hongzhi had to say about him back at the docks, I believe he is hiding his true nature from us as well. He's pretty good at it though, if so." Sadao sighs, and looks around the room, now growing worried they might be being monitored here, too. "I'm going to stay here for a while and finish communing with Arken. As for you all, I'd like you to stay too, but it might look strange if no one comes out to eat when dinner is served. It's up to you guys. Either way... please be careful." His gaze sweeps among all his friends, but lingers on Koide the longest. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 10/05/2023 19:45
The monk puts a hand on Sadao's shoulder. "You were wise not wanting to antagonize her. We must thread those waters with caution" Tatsu then stands and says "You have not to worry my friends. Only the water and the wind can wander free around a mountain. I will go outside and meditate at the door. No sailor could enter and interrupt your meditations while I am... " he smirks "just in the way" He then bows and goes outside and closes the door. He then sits, legcrossed with his back at the door and closes his eyes and begin to meditate. If any of his friends whishes to come out or go back in he will move of course but to any other he will be just there, cross-leged, eyes closed, breathing calmly.
Mike 12/05/2023 20:32
Sadao sees Tatsu off with a grateful look. As he sits down to resume communing, however, he still doesn't feel at ease. He decides to take at least a little time to more carefully investigate this room beforehand. Starting with the walls, he works his way checking the back- and undersides of the various furnishings of the room, before finally coming to the large rug in the center. When he peels it up, he is shocked to discover a familiar-looking arcane circle. "Guys..." He calls their attention to it, as he removes the rug entirely, revealing the inscription.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 12/05/2023 20:34
Lyrel frowns before silently removing a spellbook from a pouch on his belt and begins to ritually cast a spell to detect the magical properties of the symbol...
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 13/05/2023 06:39
"That looks familiar." Viraj says from nearby the door as he glances over to Sadao's findings. "That scorpion looks like what was carved on top of that pillar we climbed to the top of... Except that it doesn't have the all the other stuff surrounding it.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 22/05/2023 16:10
Lyrel's eyes glow briefly as he finishes the ritual and he spends several moments examining the auras of the magical properties of the symbol upon the floor that become visible to his enchanted vision. "This is a warding spell. You say that you saw a similar symbol in the Obsidian Maw? Did you happen to examine the magical properties of those symbols as well?"
Mike 22/05/2023 16:49
"Koide-san examined it, as I recall. That one prevented fiends from entering the depths of the Maw." Sadao responds, examining the circle from a few feet away. "I wonder if it was meant to contain me in case things got too bad with Kuma?" (edited)
TheOrsini 22/05/2023 17:20
Koide thinks on it, and then nods.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 22/05/2023 17:42
Lyrel ponders this for a moment. "That is possible, I suppose. Did he know you were being sent into the Maw by Kuma for...?" he gestures towards Sadao's pack, intentionally not saying the word 'Runestone' aloud in the event someone was eavesdropping on them. "There is a good chance this is also an inwardly warding symbol, by that I mean... a ward used to trap an infernal presence inside the symbol."
Mike 22/05/2023 20:25
"So this one works in reverse, huh?" The bard kneels and looks it over one more time, before nodding, and turning to Lyrel. "Oh yeah, he knew all about it. I kinda... told him everything when we got back to the boat after meeting Kuma." He grins sheepishly, motioning to Koide, who'd been too late to stop him. "Though I have some reservations about He, and I think you do too, but I can't really fault him for a measure like this after knowing I might be possessed by a sea witch." Once the group was satisfied with their investigation, Sadao reaches for the rug, and pulls it back over the circle. "Well, if that's all it is, it's definitely not a problem now." He kneels (this time away from the rug, just in case), and pulls out the runestone to resume his meditation. "No time to waste. I'll try to gain control over it as quickly as possible." He extends a hand, and gestures, causing a small breeze to issue forth, with a gold-tinged leaf appearing from nowhere. Just as quickly, a familiar tanuki apparates underneath the leaf, wearing it like a crown before it fades away. The raccoon dog stretches and yawns, baring sharp teeth. "Knew you couldn't get by without me. That was quite the show!" Sadao raises an eyebrow, thinking back. "You could see us that whole time?" Kinoh sits back on her hind legs, with a vulpine sort of smile. "Mainly you, and your surroundings. My favorite part was when you drank seawater." Frowning, and with a slight blush in his cheeks, Sadao speaks aloud. "Kinoh, go stand watch outside with Tatsu." The tanuki slinks over to the door, and waits for someone to exit or open it for her, to go about her task.
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/05/2023 16:57
The moon hangs high in the inky sky, casting a gentle silver glow upon the vast expanse of the open sea. The Baochuan sails gracefully on the tranquil waters, its sails billowing in the night breeze. Shimmering lanterns cast ethereal light upon the intricately carved wooden planks of the deck and the scent of incense wafts through the air. Overhead, the stars shimmer like diamonds, creating a celestial canopy that stretches as far as the eye can see. At the helm, a seasoned seafarer with a weathered face and eyes full of wisdom, stands tall, steering the ship with expert precision, his eyes fixed on the distant horizon, where the sea melds seamlessly with the sky. As twilight deepens, the ship's crew, dressed in vibrant silk robes, go about their duties, diligently trimming the sails in perfect harmony, their movements synchronized with the rhythm of the sea. In his cabin, Sadao can feel the gentle sway of the ship beneath him, lulled by the soothing melody of the waves. The creaking of the timbers whispers secrets of forgotten eras, as if the ship itself holds the weight of history.
Mike 26/05/2023 19:20
The bard sits cross-legged, eyes closed, with the runestone in hand. He pictures the item in his mind's eye, and makes a concerted effort to will himself back into its vast, ethereal confines. "Oshiete kudasai, Arken-sama. I must know all there is to know about you, and this runestone. I have to master it before Kuma or Zheng He, if he is what I think he is, interfere."
TheOrsini 26/05/2023 19:28
Koide rests against Sadao's cabin door. Her katana in her lap, feeling the back... and ... forth of the waves against the ship. She nods off, taking a momentary power nap, but attempts to be an additional barrier to any who would disturb the stonekeeper. (edited)
Mike 26/05/2023 19:42
Kinoh stares at Koide all the while, after Tatsu leaves to go above deck. She occasionally brushed her tail or yipped at him for attention during his watch, but she doesn't try the same with the sober, younger warrior. The raccoon dog's eyes are curious, yet also judgmental, betraying some spark of intelligence. She almost seems to be sizing her up.
Mike
The bard sits cross-legged, eyes closed, with the runestone in hand. He pictures the item in his mind's eye, and makes a concerted effort to will himself back into its vast, ethereal confines. "Oshiete kudasai, Arken-sama. I must know all there is to know about you, and this runestone. I have to master it before Kuma or Zheng He, if he is what I think he is, interfere."
Kyle [Arcadian] 26/05/2023 20:42
"Very well, Sadao-san. Let us begin." With that, Arken begins to instruct Sadao in the use of the runestone, which he explains will take several days to complete. The dwarf explains that the obsidian runestone holds the power of creation. It can produce almost anything that its wielder desires, but one must be thorough and detailed, since the creation will be exactly as specified. However, the runestone cannot bring back the dead and it cannot be used to destroy anything.
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/06/2023 21:51
The next morning the skies are dark and stormy. The wind howls across the open sea, cutting through clothes to the bone, and huge grey waves surge and crash, making the great galleon rock and lurch unpleasantly.
TheOrsini 05/06/2023 16:54
Koide is rattled awake by the crashing of waves. She knocks twice on the cabin door before slipping inside to check on Sadao.
Mike 06/06/2023 15:57
At the knock, Sadao's eyes go from a milky white to their normal cobalt blue. "Come in..." He yawns, noticing Koide. "Ohayou gozaimasu, Koide-san." He rises and stretches out, seeming rather tired despite the night of rest. He goes over to his pack and fishes out a couple of rations: wrapped onigiri (but a bit stale). "It's not much, but care for breakfast?" He smiles as he offers her one.
TheOrsini 06/06/2023 16:30
The huntress glances about the room for any signs of intrusion or danger. But brightens as she turns her attention to the man stretching from the bed. She nods in response to his greeting, and gratefully takes the offer food. She remembers the Sadao's pet from last night, and how it glared at her. As she tries the first bite, she realizes it was probably hungry was why. She point to Sadao and then makes a petting motion before pointing outside and then mocks eating her food.
Mike 06/06/2023 17:13
Sadao raises an eyebrow before understanding. "Oh, right, Kinoh. I hope she didn't bother you too much. She likes to beg for more food than she ever really needs, technically being a spirit and all..." He looks to the door in thought. "But she does need breakfast too, and she deserves a treat for managing to stand guard all night. Excuse me." He reaches back into his bag, and pulls out some more onigiri, with salted salmon filling, and a handful of daigaku imo before heading for the door. Opening it, he sees Kinoh curled up in the corner. He kneels and gently sets the bundled food down next to her, but as he does so, the tanuki's head immediately raises, looking right at him. It seems she was already awake. "Sadao." She "sounds" much more serious than usual. "I hope you know what you're getting into. With her." He fixes her with an equally serious, but questioning look. "What's that supposed to mean?" "That means, you've been burned before. Kuma, your mother. And this girl... I spent all night trying to get a read on her, and came up with nothing. She could be dangerous. Humans are not all good Sadao. You need to be certain before you let her in." The bard frowns, and shakes his head before standing. "Enjoy." He says, though it's not very earnest. He closes the door and crosses back over to Koide to finish sharing the meal. Any traces of the 'conversation' he just had are wiped from his face by the time he sits down with her again. He simply savors the food, and the moment.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 09/06/2023 17:49

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 20/06/2023 23:26

"I never thought I'd tire of being on a boat, but these monsters are starting to test my resolve!" Viraj says with a shake of his head. Mike 21/06/2023 00:02

The tanuki whimpers from behind him. "Oh, you can't be serious!" The bard palms the runestone, and looks down at it. I'm not ready... Heedless of this, he runs forward anyway, toward the prow, and thrusts it in the direction of the incoming creature. Calling on his previous connection and lessons from Arken, he tries to channel its power. Create a barrier, protect the ship from harm!
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/06/2023 21:02
Shadows swirl around the runestone and the smell of brine on the air grows hard and acrid. On the port side of the ship, the water between Sadao and the oncoming whale churns and froths, growing ever more white and solid, until colossal pillars of salt erupt from the depths! The Baochuan lurches and jolts from the impact as the whale collides with the vast barrier, sending the vessel surging forwards and away from its pursuer. The creature's bulk shatters the first of the glistening columns, filling the air with an almighty crack and sending great chunks of salt plummeting into the surrounding waters. The impact produces huge, rolling waves that rock the Baochuan yet again and the whale cries out in a bellowing moan.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 30/06/2023 21:51

TheOrsini 03/07/2023 18:02
Koide scrambles across the deck searching for a harpoon or similar weapon.
Mike 04/07/2023 23:33
Sadao watches the pillars of salt spring forth with a mixture of triumph, and awe. He'd only begun to scratch the surface of this artifact, and it could do that in his hands? All the more reason not to let Kuma have it. He grabs the railing as the boat rocks in the resulting waves, and tries to think. So it has the power to create, though it can't destroy anything. What I didn't know is that it seems to only make things out of what's at hand, like how it made a spire by elevating the ground we were on before, and just now, it made those pillars out of salt from the seawater. Arken said I'd have to be specific and detailed, because it will be exactly as I describe it. Upon hearing Tatsu call for a harpoon, Sadao turns. "I could make one. Actually... let's think bigger!" He lifts the runestone and focuses on shaping some of the hardened salt leftover from the broken column into a series of aerodynamic, throwable harpoons, with hooked tips, like ones he'd seen before.
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/07/2023 12:10
Sadao wields the runestone and it pulses with the same black 'light' that the Ajentodon saw emanating from across the sea almost a month a go now. The pillars holding the whale at bay begin to crumble and disintegrate into thousands of crystalline shards. Several ark through the air towards the bard, before landing with a clatter on the deck of the Baochuan. Each is shaped in the form of a long shaft tipped with a jagged harpoon.
Mike 18/07/2023 06:23

Whoever can throw the farthest, come take oneâ€”" He is cut off by the clatter of yet more harpoons, dozens of them, falling behind him onto the deck in a heap. His eyes widen, then he adds: "Scratch that, anyone with an arm, grab as many as you can carry!" "They might not look like much, but they're made of salt. If they pierce its hide, they're gonna hurt. Kyle [Arcadian] 21/07/2023 22:20

TheOrsini 21/07/2023 22:24

Mike 21/07/2023 22:45

Kyle [Arcadian] 03/08/2023 20:37

Kyle [Arcadian] 10/08/2023 20:51

Mike 10/08/2023 22:57
The bard's mood quickly reverts back to a guarded one, as Zheng draws near. Kinoh senses this too, and leaps from his arms and stands in front of him defensively, letting out a low growl with her fangs bared. "I think you are already well aware how, Zheng-xiÄnsheng." While he is still facing away from the merchant prince, he tries to slip the dormant runestone back into his bag, before too many lay eyes upon it. He speaks in Je'dahnian and keeps his own voice low as well, to avoid drawing suspicion from the crew. "I suppose the only question now is, what of it?" Every muscle in his body is tensed as he turns to look the older man in the face, waiting for a response. His eyes dart over to Koide, to the group. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 15/08/2023 21:16

Mike 15/08/2023 22:20

He wanted to know He's motives, and they were beyond deception at this point, so displaying the item, at the very most, would be fine, right? Sadao slowly, carefully, withdraws the runestone from his bag and shows it to Zheng He, keeping a bit of distanceâ€”and an upset tanukiâ€”between them. He watches the other man like a hawk.
TheOrsini 15/08/2023 22:25
Koide sets the spear down slowly, as if no longer worried about the whale creature. She doesn't like where this conversation could be going. Her hand is free to draw the katana, dash forward, and clear the captain's smirk face from his body if needed.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/08/2023 21:46
Twin reflections of the many faceted orb glisten and sparkle in Zheng He's eyes as Sadao produces the stone and the man takes an involuntary step forwards. "Remarkable. This held up the seas and summoned daemons?"
Mike 17/08/2023 00:38
As Zheng takes a step forward, the bard takes a half-step back, only to bump into the ship's railing. But Sadao can't hide his surprise at the man's words. "Yes. How do you know all of that?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/08/2023 12:36
"Your story," Zheng He points out, as though it were obvious. "The well beneath the Maw. I can only assume that this is the source of its power. Magic strong enough to break the curse of the Sea Witch. What will you do with it?"
Mike 17/08/2023 18:07
Sadao sweeps a hand over his face, remembering the description he'd given him. Of course he'd put one and two together. "All I really want is to keep it out of Kuma's tentacles. I'm not sure how yet, but given what we saw with the frequent kaiju attacks, this could be either the key to saving the worldâ€”or ensuring its ruin. And try as I might, I just can't see the Sea Witch using it with all of our benefits in mind." He gives Zheng He an appraising look, watching for his reaction as he starts to put the runestone away. "That makes anyone that holds it her target. Which brings me to you. It seems you organized this entire expedition looking for a find like this. Now that you've seen it, and know what it's capable of, and what its pursuer is capable of, do you still intend to take it for yourself?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/08/2023 20:01
An amiable grin blooms upon Zheng He's chiselled features. "Sadao-san... after all our time together on this voyage, do you really think so little of me? The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. If you would keep this artifact safe, then we must take it beyond the reach of your Sea Witch â€” to the great desert of the Ardathian badlands."
Mike 17/08/2023 21:31
Sadao thinks back to Li Hongzhi's words, said in private. That Zheng He was not to be trusted. They truly seemed to clash with the Zheng He they had gotten to know so far. Could he have been mistaken? It was still yet to be proven one way or the other, but Sadao has some hope. "You're right. A desert would be the best place. I'd been hoping to return to Je'dahn, but every hour we spend on these seas is a risk while we carry this runestone. By your leave, we should set a course at once." As he places the runestone back in his bag, he bows to Zheng He. "And, my apologies for hiding this from you and suspecting you. This voyage wouldn't have happened without you, and you've been gracious all this time."
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/08/2023 23:08
Zheng He offers Sadao a dignified bow of gratitude. "Ardath lies far to the north, beyond the Obsidian mountains. If you wish to return to dry land with haste, then we should continue south to Je'dahn for now. We have a fair wind and Kitajima is but a few days away. There, we can resupply, make repairs and plan your journey. Not to mention that the kaiju are still at large. Perhaps this gem can do some good along the way."
Mike 18/08/2023 00:41
Sadao nods with a smile. "Very well. To Kitajima, then!" He turns to Koide, standing closest by during this exchange. "We're going home. Home for most of us, anyway. I can't wait for you to see my family's estate, it's a wonderâ€”" he cuts himself off, remembering the kaiju attack. "â€”if it's... still standing."
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 22/08/2023 19:25
Viraj's nose wrinkles being reminded of the danger that was heading towards the town. "It will still be good to be home." The Rajani lets out a long, drawn-out sigh then turns to address Zheng He. "Excuse me... But have you had problems with demons or creatures of that nature?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/08/2023 21:12
"I know a little of many things, but not first hand," Zheng He tells Viraj with a shake of his head. Hearing Sadao speak of his fears for Kitajima, the man turns to the bard with an idea. "If you fear that we will arrive too late... perhaps your 'runestone' could get us there faster?"
Mike 22/08/2023 21:21
"Israphel's Runestone, technically," the bard corrects him. "And... possibly. It holds the power of 'creation.' What you saw me do earlier, creating pillars, then weapons out of salt from the sea, that was all I could think of at the time. I don't know if, say, whipping up a tailwind to fill our sails falls under that umbrella, but it's worth a try." He steps up to the prow again, and raises the runestone. Hear me. Create a southward wind! (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/08/2023 20:54
The runestone pulses with black energy and the Baochuan begins to rattle and shake. Loose crates, timber and other objects slide towards stern as though the ship were tilting upwards congolomerating into a kind of propeller atop the poop deck. Slowly at first and then faster and faster, the contraption begins to turn, driving air into the sails of the ship. Meanwhile, the salty harpoons disintegrate into powder.
Mike 23/08/2023 21:02
"Well, that's one way to make wind. This should speed us on our way, wouldn't you agree, Zheng-xiÄnsheng?" Sadao grins at the trader. At his feet, Kinoh eyes the obsidian runestone with curiosity, and faint concern.
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/08/2023 22:05
The Baochuan lurches forwards as the wind catches the sails, rapidly picking up speed. "It is indeed, Sadao-san," Zheng He adds with a crooked smile. "It is indeed..."
Kyle [Arcadian] 23/08/2023 22:21
For the next two days, the Baochuan glides across the sea at tremendous speed on its way south to Kitajima. It's early the next morning when Je'dahn's northernmost island finally comes into view, but it takes another full day to round the cape to the port's eastern facing bay. Even before the town comes into view, smoke can be seen rising from beyond the cliffs.
Mike 24/08/2023 15:43
Sadao is visibly anxious for the rest of the journey that day. On the next morning, he rises early to see the island emerge from the horizon, and is pleasedâ€”until he sees the telltale signs of smoke. He stays out for the whole morning as the sun rises, with a white-knuckle grip on the railing.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 01/09/2023 20:56
The monk is at Sadao's side, but instead of anxiou he sits at the railring, his leg crossed and his arm resting on his knees. **"Whatever had happened has already happened Sadao-san. It will not prevent it or help anyone to be anxious about it. Let's see what we can do once we are there."^^
Kyle [Arcadian] 04/09/2023 21:11
The air is thick with tension and the heavy scent of smouldering ruins as the Baochuan comes around the rocky cape and into view of Kitajima. An eerie silence hangs over the harbour. The usual sounds of a bustling port have been replaced by a haunting stillness and a pall of smoke hangs in the air, the acrid stench of burnt wood and scorched earth seeping into one's lungs. Gazing upon the shoreline, the skeletal remains of buildings can be seen, their charred frames jutting out like broken bones. The bay itself is littered with the wreckage of ships, their masts snapped and their hulls crushed. Massive footprints mar the mudflats along the shore, each one a grim reminder of the creature's colossal size. The whole area is a morass of churned earth and debris, the sea reclaiming what the monster has torn asunder. Further inland, townspeople can be seen moving about, their faces drawn with exhaustion as they clear rubble and salvage what they can from the wreckage. The occasional clang of metal on metal echoes across the bay as survivors try to rebuild their lives. Nevertheless, amidst the destruction, there are also signs of resilience and hope. Colourful banners flutter in the breeze, hung by the locals as symbols of their determination to rebuild. A group of children plays near the water's edge, their laughter a stark contrast to the grim backdrop. The crew of the Baochuan watch in sombre silence as they drop anchor in the bay. The magnitude of the devastation is overwhelming.
Mike 05/09/2023 21:13
Sadao hears Tatsu's words, but doesn't respond. When they finally draw near enough to make out details, he lets out a sigh from deep within, as though he'd been holding his breath this whole time. He lets go of the railing, finally, and immediately crosses to the side of the boat facing the docks. "My father... I have to make sure he made it out alright." He seems almost ready to leap off of the ship before the gangplank has even been lowered. Kinoh stands quietly beside him.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 07/09/2023 02:22
With a low and angered snarl, Ryuzuko clutches his fists at the devastation laid before the Ajentodon. 'If only we had enough overwhelming power to prevent this needless destruction.' His gaze falls on the bard, Sadao. 'Maybe Sadao-san can be that power, or at least his use of the stone can find us someone who can.' "Yes, lead the way." Ryuzuko rests his hand on the eager man before striding down the gangplank himself, mostly to get his companion off his feet, but also in search of survivors in need of help along the way.
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/09/2023 22:21
The air on Kitajima's battered docks is heavy with the scent of saltwater, mingling with the pervasive odour of scorched wood and debris. The tang of brine from the sea mixed with something acrid creates a unique and unsettling aroma that clings to the senses. All around, the sounds of recovery are ever-present. The rhythmic thud of hammers striking nails punctuates the air as makeshift shelters are constructed from salvaged materials. A group of women works together, their voices raised in a mournful yet defiant song as they clear away rubble. Children play in the midst of the chaos, their laughter a poignant reminder that life carries on, even in the face of devastation. The docks themselves bear the scars of the attack, with shattered pilings and twisted metal. Dockworkers toil to repair the damage, determined to restore a sense of normalcy to their once-thriving port. Fishermen mend their nets, their boats tied up alongside the Baochuan, eager to return to the sea and provide sustenance for their community. Amidst the destruction, there are glimpses of hope. A small market has sprung up on a cleared section of the dock, where vendors offer what little produce they can scavenge or trade for. The bright colours of fresh vegetables and fruits provide a stark contrast to the sombre surroundings, and the grateful smiles of the townsfolk can be seen as they make their purchases.
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 09/09/2023 01:47
Laurel takes in the destruction with a stoic presence. â€Such was the destruction I witnessed on my journey to reach you all when Koide called for my aid. Whatever these creatures are, we must find a way to stop them before they destroy everything.â€
Mike 09/09/2023 08:16
Sadao leads the group through the broken remains of his home away from home. He tries not to look at the sheer amount of ruined familiar buildings, but it's in vain, especially as Lyrel calls attention to them. He shifts his pack to one side, feeling the weight of the runestone inside. If I could unravel its secrets faster... this wouldn't have happened. Here or elsewhere. He looks about as they enter the makeshift marketplace, trying to focus more on the familiar, friendly faces than the ruined locale. His eyes land on the Resting Shamisen, and he beckons the others toward it. "My family has history with this place. I'm sure my dad would've come here to warn them, as long as there was time." (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/09/2023 21:21
In the aftermath of the kaiju attack, the Resting Shamisen appear to be providing shelter for many of the displaced folk with nowhere else to go. Most of the tables and chairs in the common room have been pushed to the side to make room for bedrolls and stretchers.
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/09/2023 20:51
The atmosphere in the Resting Shamisen is sombre. A general air of disquiet and gloom hangs over the sunken banisters and cracked walls that only recently bore the mirth of music in their frames. Nevertheless, like the docks outside, an unmistakable quality of resilience fills the faces of those within. Families sit huddled together over hotpots of dashi to enjoy boiled meats and vegetables. Volunteers briskly pace the floor providing blankets and supplies as needed. A man bandaged widely across his torso and one arm grins from his stretcher before an assembled handful of kids, each eagerly watching as he shuffles a ball beneath a series of cups. As the party enters behind Sadao, a single young woman can be seen making her way up through the common room, her face awash with increasing desperation, despite the polite smile forced upon it. Of all the folks of varied backgrounds and cultures that make up the gathered townsfolk, none are so quick to standout, for no other bears the high-eared, bushy-tailed likeness of a fox, as she does. Moving from one person to the next, she can be seen asking some manner of question â€” occasionally holding up a hand as a spectral image of a man and a woman appear within it â€” and receiving only sympathetic shakes of the head in response. As she gets closer, the conversation becomes clearer and clearer, repeating again and again with only minor variations: "Have you seen my parents? Please, I lost them in the chaos... they look like this... no? Could you help me search for them thenâ€” ah, of course, sorry for bothering you."
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 11/09/2023 19:20
Ryuzuko veers off from the party and approaches the woman. "Hajimemashite, may I see what your parents look like?" The towering dragonborn kneels down before the woman, with as kind a smile as his scaly snout can express. "Perhaps my friends and I could be of assistance."
Kyle [Arcadian] 11/09/2023 22:28
"R-really?" From beneath the black rim of the wide conical hat she wore, the young woman â€” easily at least a head and a half shorter than the dragonborn â€” stares in awe through glassy eyes nearly as red with tears as the irises at their centres, then turns to examine the rest of the group. "Sugoi... I've never met a dragon before. You all look super strong..." She wipes a tear from the corner of her eye, then raises one palm up flat and with the other hand signs a series of fluid motions. Once more, the visage of two figures form within her palm. The first is a man, human with greying features complimenting a wizened face. "My father's name is Hiroshi..." The second, like the young woman herself, bears fur-lined ears that point upwards from the top of her head and a large bushy series of tails at her back. "And my mother's is Sora." "We... we got separated during the chaos. I've tried looking around a bit but with all the wreckage and mess and stuff I... I haven't had any luck." Her shoulders slump forward, but within a moment she stands back up straight, an eager expression replacing the worry. "I can't offer much, but I truly would be in your debt if you helped me."
Mike 12/09/2023 04:14
Sadao paces the room, looking for a familiar face in the concert hall. He is so concentrated, that he barely registers the fox-eared maiden asking for help from anyone who will listen. When he does notice though, he hesitates. He had his own family to look for, after all. He considers how best to phrase this, while Ryu steps forward to offer their aid nonetheless. The young man shakes his head with a bit of shame. That's no excuse not to help someone so desperate. Dad can wait a little longer. He approaches, and hears her out. "Hiroshi, and Sora. Got it. Yeah, of course we can help. My name's Sadao, by the way, and this is Ryu. May I ask your name as well, good miss?"
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/09/2023 16:40
"Ayana," she says with a bow. "Yoroshiku onegaiitashimasu." "We were in the town square for the festival. We're not from here so I was really excited to see the pretty lanterns! But suddenly the ground shook like heavy thunder and people started running and shoving. I tried to hold their hands tightly but the crowd surged and we were separated. I got swept away..." Her tails seem to almost deflate with her energy as she recalls the scene. "I saw it though â€” the creature â€” it was heading right for the square and... and..." Her lower lips quivers as more tears rush to her eyes. "...they got away, right?"
Mike 12/09/2023 19:57
"Yes. I believe they did, and we'll reunite you with them." Sadao doesn't hesitate to affirm the girl's hope. It mirrored his own. "So, there's no need to cry. How about this? While we're searching, why don't you keep busy around here? There are others here who could use help that you could provide."
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/09/2023 20:18
Ayana dabs at her tears and nods along with with the bard's words at first, but then stops. "Wait, could you take me with you? This place is no home and... and I don't want to be alone. I want to be there when you find them... even if... if..." She shakes her head, clearly trying her hardest to keep Sadao's affirmation in mind. "I won't get in the way, I swear! I follow directions well and my mother has taught me some spells, including how to mend wounds and stuff..." Her eyes look almost impossibly big as she looks between Ryuzuko and Sadao with a pleading smile.
Mike 12/09/2023 21:21
Sadao raises his eyebrows at the request, and looks back at the rest of the party with a questioning glance.
TheOrsini 13/09/2023 18:12
Sadao notices that Koide has disappeared again. Koide had been quiet the whole trip home, numb to what loomed ahead, worried about the dangers from the sea. It seemed as if all were keeping thier spirits up, but the husk of Kitajima ashen ruins captured Koide's attention when they arrived. She had been here before. 'There was a bakery right here that sold the best honeycakes. They had a hint of cinnamon in the glaze. Her name was... that was it... Narita... she reminded me of what I imagined a grandmother would be like.' It had been over a year since she had been back. Caught up in thought she drifted from the others. 'It was here.' She stood at a destroyed building, the stone-framed oven charred in the rubble. Her chest heaves with a deep breath of frustration, and a frown creeps across her face. (edited)

Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 14/09/2023 19:27

Mike 14/09/2023 20:39

As the group makes their way through the ravaged town, the scene is sobering, and Viraj canâ€™t help but quietly wonder how it compares to that of what his grandfather Brijesh experienced when his town was wrecked by the Empire â€“ Surely a monster of this would be no match for an army? Kyle [Arcadian] 22/09/2023 21:50
As Sadao glances about the Resting Shamisen for anybody who he recognises, he spots Nakamura Haruki, a musician who Sadao's father once hired as a tutor for his son. He's just come through the doors from the music hall's kitchens, wearing an apron of all things.

Mike 05/10/2023 22:59

His healing magic wasn't all that strong, but perhaps with the runestone... He crosses to the door, with Kinoh having stirred, and following right at his heels. He shows little sign of slowing down. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 06/10/2023 14:00

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 07/10/2023 21:26

Mike 07/10/2023 23:00
"Sadao, before you go running off, listen to me. Your father... may not make it. If that's the case, you'll have to accept that. Just don't try to use the ru-" With a wave of his hand, Sadao banishes the tanuki in a gust of golden wind. He calls to the others over his shoulder. "Thanks, guys. I'm going to ride the wind there. If you lose me, just keep following the trail!" He bursts outside, instantly pulls out his shamisen, and plays a chord. As before, winds whip around him causing his clothes to ripple as he rises into the air. He jets towards his family's estate, just up the coast. As he flies, he spares a thought of Koide. We'll have to catch up with her later.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 08/10/2023 00:07
Tatsu runs as fast as he can to follow Sadao.
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/10/2023 22:26
As Sadao takes to the skies, he can see Kitajima sprawled along the rugged coastline beneath him. The port's buildings are a picturesque blend of traditional Je'dahnian architecture and thatched roofs, their intricate, sloping designs adorned with curved eaves that give them a graceful, sweeping appearance. From above, the town resembles a labyrinth of narrow streets and alleys, winding their way between the tightly packed buildings. Small courtyards and gardens can be glimpsed from the air. The lush greenery of these hidden oases amidst the urban sprawl makes for a stark contrast with the earthy tones surrounding them. The hum of activity from below floats up to Sadao's ears, mingling with footfalls on cobblestone streets and the soothing rush of ocean waves to create a gentle symphony of muted sounds. The bard soars upwards, leaving the bustling town behind him and ascending towards his family's clifftop estate. Nestled amongst terraced rice paddies, this residence is a testament to the opulence and refinement of the Huiya clan. The steeply sloping, tiled roof of the grand manor house is adorned with intricate carvings and vibrant crimson accents. Meticulously landscaped gardens surround the building. The ponds here teem with koi fish and the fragrant blossoms of cherry and plum trees fill the air. Leaves rustle gently in the breeze, water trickles softly from ornate fountains and the occasional songbird perched in the lush foliage calls melodically. However, amongst all of this beauty, what stands out to Sadao is the damage wrought by the kaiju upon his home - a perfectly circular hole through the southern wing, Numerous sections of bamboo scaffolding have been erected in order to prevent this part of the house from collapsing in on itself.
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 10/10/2023 08:55
Ayana blinks as the group dashes away as soon as theyâ€™d agreed to help her, a momentary wave of fear flooding her senses that sheâ€™d be left alone here. â€W-wait!â€ The kitsune dashes after them, the wind from Sadaoâ€™s jetstream nearly blowing her hat from her head as she makes it outside. â€I can help too!â€ Biting her bottom lip as she sees them take off after him, she bounds forward, her run quickly taking her to all fours as her form shrinks and merges down into that of a small white-furred fox, its set of triple tails twirling about behind her as her increased speed pulls her back in pace with the group. Her small form scurries up besides Viraj and gives him a wide-eyed look as she continues ahead. (edited)
Mike 10/10/2023 09:20

When he gets to it, he takes hold of one of its aged Honmin-style knockers and slams it twice. "It's me, Sadao! I'm home! Please, let me in!"

Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 16/10/2023 17:14

Suddenly afraid she was failing step one of his request for discretion, she furiously waves her hand dismissively. "You don't need to answer that of course," she insists, "but if it is magic, it'd have to be super strong to work. Whatever's affecting your papa isn't like the other people who got hurt. "And yet he's clearly still alive..." (edited)
Mike 17/10/2023 05:34
"Well, let's just say this thing is definitely powerful enough. The only question is if can I guide that power." He looks at the runestone in his grasp, and back down at his father, a mixture of emotions plain on his face. "...I'm going to finish my lessons. Right here, right now." He shifts his seated posture into a meditative seiza stance, and holds the runestone in his lap. "Tell the others when they get here, normal healing magic is not enough. I'm going to sit here as long as it takes, until I comprehend the runestone. Then I'll use it to save my father. But until then, I need to focus." He gives her one last boyish smile. "Arigatou, Ayana-chan." He then faces forward, and shuts his eyes, willing himself back into the realm of the runestone. (edited)

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 18/10/2023 17:00

Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 18/10/2023 19:02
Ayana shakes her head. "You didn't fail if you learned something," she steps up closer to the body and reaches within her yukata, pulling forth an ashen porcelain mask lined in gold around its one eye and in crescent like wings across its top. A band of gold arches across the forehead and curls around a missing right half, as if half the mask had simply fallen off. In the center sits a luminous, milky white stone ensconced within a silver star. "My... my mother always says that." Placing the mask over her face, she closes her eyes, lets out a long-held breath, and begins concentrating. A silent call for aid accompanies the motion, and within seconds she feels a soothing chill surge out from the mask and through her. The solemn eye begins to glow, and the dark grays of the folded face begin to lighten, emanating a pale white glow that grows and grows until the missing half itself seems to form in ethereal white; solid luminescence that channels down through the young girls arms and out through her hands. The body of Houjo Huiya shines, magic far more formiddable than Ayana could have even expected rebuffing her, but she doesn't back down. No, she scowls unseen. Not with all of them watching, no doubt in her mind examining her every move here. Said aloud or not, this was a test, and whether for their benefit or hers, she would not fail. Grunting as she wills some of her own mana into the spell, she feels herself being pushed back. Her heels dig into the floor and her tails billow behind her as, with a final forceful shove and a twinkle of light from the stone in the porcelain, the illusion around Houjo shatters with the crack of a thousand mirrors. There, where previously had lain the still-breathing body of Sadao's father, an answer remained in its wake: Snow, unmelted and whole, perfectly preserved and immaculately shaped in the form of a man now assuredly and quite disturbingly, missing.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 18/10/2023 19:13
Ryuzuko looks on in disbelief for a long moment until he remembers Sadao, who has been silently meditating over the runestone. Ryuzuko says, pointing at the mound of snow in the shape of Huojo. (edited)
Mike 18/10/2023 19:58
Sadao opens his eyes in the now familiar white void. Before he can even look around for Arken, however, he feels a distant sort of call, and a faint, familiar weight on his shoulder. Someone must have been trying to pull him back into the world outside. Reluctantly, he follows this feeling, and withdraws from the runestone. He now awakens in his father's bedroom, with what he recognizes as Ryuzuko's hand on his shoulder. He rises with a start. "Wha, what is it? I haven't even gotten started yetâ€”" He cuts off his complaint when he sees his father's body, revealed to be a large, human-shaped lump of snow. "Wait..." His mind racing, he connects that this must have been a double of some sort. He vaguely remembered a tale where a trickster spirit shaped itself as a duplicate of a human, using snow. A brilliant flush takes over his face, as he realizes he'd been fooled, and was about to waste so much time on this trick. "Dammit." He mutters to himself. "Er, thank you all for... scrutinizing this. Did you find anything else out?" The humbled bard looks around more cautiously, keeping his voice low. "I think I should talk to Ichiro-san about this. Could it have escaped his notice, or perhaps..." He hated to imply his family's most loyal retainer was deceiving them intentionally, but for all he knew now, the man downstairs might not even be Yamamoto Ichiro. (edited)

A simulacrum is a nearly identical version of the original target and can follow instructions in an almost intelligent manner. Come, let us speak with Ichiro."

"Then, I thank you." He repeats his bow to Ichiro, then addresses the others. "We should start our search of the house regardless. Maybe we can find out how to get underground." He stands by the door, and leads them out when they're ready. (edited)
Mike
"Then, I thank you." He repeats his bow to Ichiro, then addresses the others. "We should start our search of the house regardless. Maybe we can find out how to get underground." He stands by the door, and leads them out when they're ready. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/11/2023 20:25
Sadao moves cautiously through the dimly lit cellar of his family's ancestral manor. The air is heavy with the musty scent of aging wood and earth. The flickering flame of a single oil lamp casts dancing shadows on the rough-hewn stone walls as he surveys the shelves laden with jars of pickled vegetables, barrels of rice and other supplies stored for harsh winters. His fingers trace the rough, cold surface of the stone walls, seeking any irregularities, his curiosity and determination fuelled by the suspicion of a hidden door, yet another family secret passed down through generations. Sadao's eyes scan the ground for telltale signs, such as a faint outline, or a subtle change in texture. He taps the walls, listening for the hollow echo that might reveal the concealed entrance. The soft glow of the lamp barely reaches the corners of the cellar and Sadao's steps echo in the silence. The air is thick with anticipation as he approaches the far end of the room. Drawing on the wisdom of his ancestors, Sadao presses against the seemingly seamless wall, his heart pounding in his chest. He closes his eyes, focusing on the sensations beneath his fingertips. A subtle, nearly imperceptible seam yields to his touch and a thrill of triumph surges through him. His keen fingers seek the contours of the hidden door, discovering a discreet latch. With a careful, deliberate motion, he pushes the latch, and the door yields, swinging open on well-oiled hinges. A rush of cool, stale air fills his nostrils as the hidden chamber beyond beckons him forth. (edited)
Mike 13/11/2023 21:22
His heart still beating, Sadao takes a long, deep breath. Father's last secret to share with me about our legacy. And Mother couldn't have known... aside from what I told her. The stagnant air suggested that very few, if anyone, had been down here. Mentally prepared, he steps into the chamber first, illuminating the surroundings with a whispered word conjuring dancing lights.
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/11/2023 21:35
A stone spiral staircase leads down beneath the cellar, where the flickering lights of Sadao's conjured illumination reveal a space frozen in time. The air is thick with the musty scent of parchment and the coolness hints at the subterranean nature of the chamber. The room is spacious, its stone walls adorned with faded murals that depict scenes of a bygone era. In the centre of the chamber, a low table holds a collection of meticulously arranged artefacts. A suit of armour, polished to a dull gleam, stands as a silent guardian, bearing the insignia of the Huiya clan. Next to it, a ceremonial sword with an intricately crafted hilt rests in a scabbard of aged leather. To one side, a series of shelves houses scrolls and manuscripts, their once vibrant ink now faded with time. The titles and symbols hint at the wealth of knowledge contained within, each document a testament to the intellectual pursuits of Sadao's forebears. In a far corner, a chest catches Sadao's eye. Its ornate design suggests that it holds treasures of great significance. The dancing lights reflect off of the polished surface, adding a shimmering allure to the mysteries contained within. As Sadao explores further, he also discovers a series of alcoves containing other items â€” a family crest, delicate silk garments and a collection of intricately carved masks. Each item seems to whisper tales of a time long past, providing a glimpse into the rich tapestry of the Huiya clan's history. (edited)
Mike 16/11/2023 00:15
Sadao paces the hidden chamber in rapt wonderment, realizing this was his clan's repository of wealth and knowledge. As he walks, a new artifact calls to him from everywhere in the room, he can almost hear them, like the lantern spirits at his side, like Kinoh's voice in his mind, and, perhaps disturbingly, like Kuma's whispers across the waves. Stories to tell, stories yet untold. They surrounded him like a chorus. He wrests himself from the hypnotic melody long enough to remember there was still work to do. He starts by closing his eyes and drawing on the spiritual presences around him, manipulating them to reveal the secrets of the sanctum itself. He whispers a request to the lantern spirits around him, and they fade from sight for others. But to him, their light instead reveals magical auras present in the room, as he casts detect magic.
Kyle [Arcadian] 17/11/2023 15:02
Brilliant lights dazzle Sadao with a rainbow of colours from numerous items throughout the room. The sword and armour glow red and blue respectively, while the chest shines with a shifting mixture of both.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 21/11/2023 23:29
Viraj enters the hidden room with his own flame flickering in his bare hand, axe held in the other. He approaches the table in the middle of the room. "I wonder what stories this could tell of your family..?" he says, breaking the silence as he examines the armor, though not really expecting an answer to his question. He wanders slowly around the room, looking over the heirlooms as he goes. "Is this where you felt the evil presence, Ryu?" (edited)
Mike 22/11/2023 06:53
"So many, Viraj. I can almost hear them." With the silence broken, Sadao releases the tension in his shoulders. Having noticed the unlit torches as the light waned, he raises his hand with an incantation. "Cháy." One by one, the torches around the room catch flame and shed proper light. He approaches the suit of armor and finely made blade, keeping his hand just away from them. "There are enchantments on a lot of things here... especially these. Lyrel, Ryukkun, they may be suited for you. In my father and our ancestors' stead, you have my blessing." He smiles warmly. He then turns to the chest and warily approaches it, keeping several feet away for now. "This chest, though, it seems to have a protection spell woven into it. It... might explode, if the wrong person opens it." He explains, with a wince.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 22/11/2023 15:33

Mike 05/12/2023 07:05

Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 07/12/2023 01:39
Viraj slowly walks the perimeter of the room, stopping at a shelf with various containers. A jar with bright green mud catches his eye. He picks it up and tilts it to the side. The substance within creeps along the side of the container. "Hmm... Goblin mud. This stuff is very corrosive," he observes aloud. The druid picks up another item from the shelf - a pouch of yellow leaves. He reaches in a rubs it between his fingers, finding it soft to the touch. Thunderleaf... His next find is a small, wooden box containing flowers with red and orange florets arranged in a cone-shaped head, he immediately recognizes as tempest flowers. "Sadao, do you mind? There are some things here that I could probably make use of in my potions," he says over his shoulder. The last item he grabs is a a glass vial containing a single dark pink flower with a thorny stem. "Not sure what this is though." (edited)
Mike 07/12/2023 05:57
"Sure, go ahead." Sadao says, glancing at the ingredients. He trusted the druid's character, and his skills thus far. Meanwhile, the bard crosses the room to examine the various scrolls and manuscripts for anything of interest.
Kyle [Arcadian] 08/12/2023 21:12
Sadao finds intricately detailed scrolls tracing the genealogy of the Huiya clan, dating back several centuries. These documents contain the names and achievements of Sadao's ancestors, as well as notable events in their lives. There are also ancient maps and celestial navigation charts detailing the positions of stars, a weathered manuscript containing battle tactics employed by the Huiya clan in ancient conflicts, a beautifully illustrated scroll showcasing the intricate rituals of the Huiya clan's traditional tea ceremonies and a carefully preserved anthology of poems composed by renowned poets of the Huiya clan. Additionally, some more esoteric writings include a delicate parchment adorned with alchemical symbols and diagrams, outlining the creation of mystical elixirs believed to enhance one's physical and mental prowess, a series of manuscripts delving into the mystical connection between the Huiya clan and the natural elements, and a collection of prophetic writings and interpretations of omens that were consulted by the Huiya clan's seers.
Mike 08/12/2023 22:27
Sadao scans the scrolls for a description matching the ancestor he saw in the reflection of the blade, if any were provided. Should that be fruitless, he looks through more recent records to see his father's, Huiya HÅjo, achievements and events. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/12/2023 13:42
Huiya Tenzen, Sadao's great great uncle and bearer of the ancestral blade Suzaku, is described as a master swordsmen, who earned the title of kensei. HÅjo is present, but his role is recorded in a more modest fashion, as a protector and preserver of the Huiya clan's legacy.
Mike 12/12/2023 00:58
Sadao eyes Tenzen's achievements with awe. Kensei. No small feat indeed. If even a shred of his wisdom and techniques still lingered on that sword, it could go a long way towards helping him learn the martial art. There didn't seem to be anything to divine from the simple listings under his father's name, so he furls the scroll with a sigh. He puts that back, but removes the writings on alchemical mixtures, connections between the Huiya clan and the elements, battle tactics, and prophetic writings. Out of sheer curiosity, he takes the anthology of poems as well. "While we're here, we may want to look at some of these," he says. "Viraj, these might pertain to the ingredients you see there." He shows the druid the alchemical manuscripts. "Ryuzuko, you and Lyrel might find these interesting," he hands the dragonborn the parchment on ancient battle tactics. "Ayana-chan, I'm not certain where you draw your magical ability from, but maybe we can both benefit from these." He shows the kitsune the elemental writings. He nods as he's finished handing them out. "Let's return them before we leave the estate though. Wouldn't do for them to get dirty, with all the scrapes we get into."

Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 14/12/2023 18:42

Kyle [Arcadian] 14/12/2023 18:42
Deep within the recesses of the hidden chamber, concealed behind a cunningly crafted panel, Ayana discovers a forgotten enclave. The concealed space reveals a set of ancient, ornate ceremonial robes and an intricately carved ceremonial mask, distinct from the others in the collection. Carved from a single piece of aged cherry wood, the mask possesses a smooth, polished surface that retains a warm, reddish-brown hue. Its overall shape is symmetrical, featuring gracefully arched eyebrows and almond-shaped eyes that are lined with delicate grooves. Beneath the eyes, a finely chiselled nose curves gently and the cheeks are adorned with intricate patterns of swirling motifs reminiscent of delicate tendrils. These patterns cascade down to the mask's jawline, framing the lips, which are carved into a soft smile. The entire surface is adorned with subtle engravings, each telling a story through symbolic representations. The mask is embellished with accents of shimmering gold leaf, meticulously applied to highlight key features and intricate details, as well as a delicate filigree that adorns the edges.
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 14/12/2023 19:09
Simply shocked at first to actually successfully stumble upon anything herself, it's a moment longer before the nature of precisely what she was holding dawns on Ayana. When it does though, her eyes widen and dilate like twin new moons seeing stars. She glances back a second, hesitating with what exactly she should say. Instead, her focus was instead primarily on Sadao. Just who is it I've met that has such a strange father... who has this of all things here... For not the first time this day, Ayana couldn't help but feel that fate really was pulling at strings just beyond the edge of her vision. "Sadao-san I... I found something. It's... they're... these robes. This mask." She beams up at him. "They're really pretty, ne!" She considers for a moment leaving it at that, but she recalls how the man had himself just moments ago offered her knowledge of his own, and something gives within her. "Actually, these designs. I think I recognize some of them. A book I read once had drawings like this. It's... an old ritual thingy. The details were lost to time as I recall but, well, still pretty interesting!" She pauses, her ears drooping a bit as she casts her gaze downwards. "Nanka... I know what I was just saying about leaving, and I know these must be your papa's but, at least until I leave, could I hold onto these myself? Maybe I can learn more..." Ayana glances back up to him wistfully. "And they are super pretty, after all..."
Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 15/12/2023 15:10
As the others converse about the findings of the room, Lyrel sets the armor in the ground before him as he kneels comfortably before the armor. After a moment, he turns towards Sadao once there is a lull in the conversation to address the properties of the armor. "This is a beautiful piece of armor, Sadao-san. It has an enchanted upon it to protect it from the ravages of time; dirt and rust have no effect on it. It also has an enchantment that will allow you to disguise this armor as something else should you have the need to do so."
Mike 15/12/2023 20:28

Kyle [Arcadian] 15/12/2023 20:32
The armour is comfortable and flexible. It fits Sadao like it was made for him.
Mike 15/12/2023 20:52
"I guess I should've known," the bard muses, feeling the perfect fit. "My dad once told me that as peacekeepers, we need to be prepared for the worst conflicts, but without appearing as such. 'Silk hides steel,' my great grandmother loved to say. I think I'm starting to catch their meaning." Once everyone is ready to move on, he lingers a little longer. "We humbly borrow these, honored forebears." He bows to the center of the sanctum, and closes the hidden door once again.
Mike 08/01/2024 20:59
Sadao leads the way up the stairs into his father's private study. The air was always a little warmer here, and carried a faint odor of cherry blossoms, a favorite of his father's. The last time he'd been allowed in here, it was to educate him on his family's history, when he first showed magical talent that fateful day years ago. It marked the start of his training as a Huiya peacekeeper. But the room feels a bit more stagnant now. Not so much as the secret chamber they'd found, but the contrast between its appearance now and how it was in his memories is upsetting nonetheless. "Let's look carefully, everyone." For his part, he approaches the desk, and examines the calligraphy set for any signs of recent use, then picks up the puzzle box and turns it over in his hands.
Kyle [Arcadian] 09/01/2024 12:28
Houjo's calligraphy set is ornate and finely crafted. The implements are neatly packed away, but this is not unusual for Sadao's father. The study is a room that tells a wordless story of the man who has lived and worked in it. The south wall is decorated with a woven tapestry bearing the Huiya family crest and, upon searching the room, Sadao finds a collection of weathered maps, detailing the lands owned by the Huiya clan and trade routes that they have stakes in. Some of these maps hint at hidden paths and forgotten landmarks. Another of the finely carved wooden cabinets in the study is secured with an intricate lock and in the corner of the room there stands a small shrine to Izanagi, with an amulet carefully hung upon it. From the shelves, Sadao picks out a leather-bound book filled with detailed illustrations and descriptions of medicinal herbs.

Matt [Val|Nik|Frida|Touji] 20/03/2024 20:26
As the group reaches the outskirts of the city the group spots Koide waiting for them nearly the gates. She approaches Lyrel and passes him a scroll with a stern countenance. His eyes scan the words quickly, exchanging a look with her and a curt nod. "Sadao-san! It seems that Koide and I are needed immediately elsewhere. We cannot say more, but... we will try to find you all once our business has been tended. We will send word to you via a scroll of telescription. I will sign it with the name of your family's servant, so that you know it is me and not an imposter. Be safe all of you, these lands have become dangerous as of late." He spends a moment saying his goodbyes to his companions before removing his spellbook and casting a ritual spell to summon a spectral steed to carry both he and Koide while she also says her own goodbyes. Once the steed comes into form, Lyrel places his spellbook upon a small wooden stand near the front of the saddle and climbs onto the mounts it. He offers a hand to Koide to assist her into a position behind him. "Be well, my friends. We will see you soon, I hope!" He gives the reins a sharp snap and the spectral steed bursts into a full gallop!
Mike 20/03/2024 22:03

Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 12/04/2024 02:40
