Mike 12/04/2024 18:15
At first, Kinoh points her nose up and away from the kitsune, showing her the same derision she did Sadao. "Hmph. Let's not get too friendly, rookie." But that aloofness melts instantly as Ayana crouches and pets her. The tanuki leans into her hand, scratching contentedly. "Oh! Not one of these brutes ever pets me like that. Especially not him, or the scaly one." She throws another look at Sadao, who ignores it, and one more to Ryu, as though eyeing her nemesis. "Now then, let's be underway!" Though her "words" come out as little more than yowls, Kinoh gives Ayana an appreciative lick, and sniffs the amulet to memorize the scent before setting off.
Kyle [Arcadian] 12/04/2024 18:45
Ayana and Kinoh guide their companions down the narrow streets and between tightly packed buildings to a collapsed inn that leans precariously to one side. The building's once sturdy beams and roof lie in ruin, a jagged mass of splintered wood and shattered tiles, with walls reduced to a tangle of rubble and debris. Piles of charred timbers and twisted metal protrude from the wreckage, and the air is heavy with the scent of smoke and dust. The inn's sign, which proudly reads "The Two Sparrows" in elegant calligraphy, lies shattered on the ground. Broken furniture and pottery litter the area, silent witnesses to the chaos that ensued when the kaiju attacked, and fragments of colourful fabric flutter in the breeze. In the distance, the sun is dipping behind the moon, casting shadow over the ruined building. However, in the fading light a tuft of vibrant orange hair caught on the jagged end of a piece of broken wood catches Ayana's eye. (edited)
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 16/04/2024 02:49
The whole while that they walked, Ayana's heart was aflutter. With each step, she was surer this whole incident would soon be behind her. She could already feel the crunch of gravel under their feet as she and her parents made their way out of Kitajima and back to the road once more â€” to their travels. As the scent grew stronger, so too did her pace quicken, until she instinctively found herself shifted back to a fox racing down the street, hopping from stone to wrecked wood and back as she bobbed and weaved along the twisted timbers of the ruins. It was only as the hair came into view that a different kind of anticipation for the first time crossed her heart and mind; one she'd refused to let enter her thoughts the whole of the time they'd been separated: dread. Shifting back once more, she kneels down by the broken wood and lays a hand upon it. "This... this is my mother's," she turns back to the others as they arrive. "Wh-where is she?"
Mike 16/04/2024 06:48
Sadao jogs to keep up with the shifting kitsune and tanuki as they darted off. As they came to a halt in front of the ruined inn, he slows and quickly catches his breath, in time to see Ayana holding the clutch of hair. He holds in a breath, this time not out of exertion. Realizing the implications, Sadao exhales, steadying himself. This was a very delicate moment, and as she was still only an acquaintance to him, he couldn't be sure whether Ayana was prepared to see this, if the worst had come to pass. "Let's look a little further. There might be more traces she left behind here." He says, balancing empathy and hope in his tone. He nods to Kinoh, who begins circling the building, trying to pinpoint the exact origin of the scent. For his part, he begins to clamber around the ruins carefully to investigate the scene.
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 16/04/2024 15:33
â€œR-right,â€ The kitsuneâ€™s voice catches herself by surprise as Sadaoâ€™s words tug the hope back into her heart. â€They might b-be trapped or somethingâ€¦ or they got away after losing just this,â€ she looks to the tufts of hair and fabric. Hopping up onto the rubble, she too begins pulling bits of rock and wood free and tossing them behind her.
Trent [Astrid|Berg|Declan] 20/04/2024 07:09
"Hang on, my friend." Viraj lays a large hand on the shoulder of Ayana. "I understand your haste, but you must be careful in how you remove the debris so we don't collapse what remains. Let me go in there first to make sure such efforts are even needed." He gives her a reassuring nod. "Don't worry. We will find them." The Rajani steps back and clutches a totem hanging from his neck adorned with various scales, claws and other parts of differnt types of creatures. His eyes bulge and go pitch black, but six more bubble to the surface of his face - two smaller orbs just below each original eye and a pair of half-moons at his temples. He sprouts coarse hair all over his body and two new appendages from each side of his abdomen. However his form also begins to shrink and is squeezed into two bulbous segments. The tarantula with fiery hairs along the back half of its body skitters up to the tuft of orange hair caught on the board. It reaches out with one of its forelegs to get the scent of the creature that left it behind. It then continues into the wreckage. (edited)
Kyle [Arcadian] 30/04/2024 22:44
Beneath the twisted beams and shattered tiles, Viraj finds a beautiful and ethereal creature lying trapped â€” a kitsune. Her once-lustrous fur is marred by dirt and ash. Her tails, usually a sight to behold are tangled and weighed down by debris. Her eyes hold a dull, pained glaze as she struggles to breathe and a pool of blood stains the ground beneath where she is impaled on a jagged length of wood.

Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 25/06/2024 21:30

Mike 31/07/2024 19:41

As Izanagi cleansed himself, his children came into being...
He struggled to remember who had taught him this, as he had been very young. But the story was rooted in his mind. He was unsure what it had to do with a "darkness that shines like light," but he held his tongue. Such a prophecy, from the lips of a dying mystic, was worth more than gold. He wouldn't interrupt. He kneels opposite of Tatsu, keeping respectful distance, but listening carefully. (edited)

Kyle [Arcadian] 01/11/2024 22:55
With quiet reverence, the Ajentodon kneel besides the fallen kitsune, brushing debris gently from her fur. Now free from the heavy weight of the rubble, Sora's many tails lie still and an air of quiet dignity somehow remains in her serene expression. With great care, Ayana's new companions prepare to lift the body. Sturdy planks are slid beneath Sora, creating a makeshift stretcher, while the blanket draped over her by Viraj preserves the kitsuneâ€™s dignity. With careful coordination, the group lift and walk in silence, each step in harmony as they carry Sora away from the ruins of the inn. The Ajentodon move through Kitajima's rubble-strewn streets, watched by townsfolk who pause to bow their heads in silent tribute. Past the northern edge of town, Sadao leads the way to a secluded path up a gentle slope, bordered by tall, wispy stalks of bamboo. This grove is a sacred place, untouched by the destruction that has ravaged the town. The air is thick with the scent of fresh earth and the soft rustling of bamboo leaves. A quiet haven from the scars of Kitajima. A short distance from the well-trodden paths, the Ajentodon stop in a small clearing, where pale moonlight filters softly through the canopy, casting dappled shadows on the ground. The grove is hushed and peaceful, with only the occasional call of a distant bird to break the silence. Her bearers kneel once more and Sora's body is gently lowered onto a bed of bamboo leaves, arranging her with care, her tails fanned out. (edited)
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 09/11/2024 12:53
Ayana nods in appreciation as the others lower Sora to the ground. The walk here was outwardly silent, but inside the young girl's thoughts whirred with conflicting grief, guilt, and apprehension. She knew she had to focus on the now, but the 'next' gnawed impatiently towards the front of her mind. So for now, she kneels, crouching low to carefully weave the bamboo leaves around the body. Gently, as one would tuck a child into their bed, she forms a cocoon around Sora, until only her face remains visible at the top. With a motion to the others for help, she sets about returning her to the sea nearby, wherein she lets the gentle waves begin to carry her away. Ayana stands silent, fidgeting uncomfortably as words failed to reach her lips, despite her better efforts. It is all she can do to stifle back a fresh set of tears that tumble out with the crack of her voice. "Kaa-san. You... you are free now. Please. Feel no more pain. Fear no more monsters. Worry no more about... a-about me." She clenches her eyes shut, holding back the river a moment longer. Lonely water, for a lonely soul. She speaks again, but the words that come out are foreign to the ears of those present. She motions to herself. To the world around her. Eyes flit up to the heavens; to the moonlit sky. Hands press in on each other. The girl clasps them tight, then releases them to her sides and bows, deeply. Her left hand rises as she does, and from it the twilight trickling through the trees behind them coalesces, enveloping her flesh in a radiant white glow. Twin flames, licking the air with radiant light, meet as her hands come together. Carefully, she sets the twilit flame upon the edges of the bamboo, where quickly it grows bright, spreading to surround Sora's body, offering one final look at the woman haloed out in light before she, too, is embraced. The current at last pulls her away. "Carried by current. Lifted by light. Twilight take you..."
Kyle [Arcadian] 22/11/2024 16:54
The journey back to Sadao's estate is a silent one, marked by the sound of boots and sandals on the winding path and the occasional rustling of leaves in the cooling breeze. The solemnity of putting Sora to rest weighs heavy upon the shoulders of the Ajentodon and, high above, the moon baths the landscape in hues of silver, glistening on the calm sea below. As they climb higher, the estate comes into view, perched atop the cliffs like a watchful guardian. Lanterns hang from the eaves, their soft glow illuminating the intricate woodwork and casting warm light over the surrounding gardens, where the scent of night-blooming jasmine mingles with the salty tang of the sea breeze. Upon reaching the main gate, the Ajentodon are met by Ichiro-san, who bows deeply and ushers them inside. The sounds of trickling water from a nearby fountain and the rustling of bamboo in the courtyard fill the air as they enter. Once inside, Ichiro-san leads them to a low table where a simple yet elegant meal had been prepared. (edited)
Mike 22/11/2024 22:14
"Thank you, Ichiro-san. Itadakimasu." Sadao clasps his hands in the traditional manner before repast. He has conspicuously chosen to sit beside the head of the table, where his father had previously sat. Taking the place now didn't feel right to him. Making relatively quick work of his meal (he'd been on his feet for so long, he hadn't realized he'd worked up quite an appetite), he sets aside his chopsticks, and begins idly toying with the small puzzle box he found on his father's desk. Something about the thing intrigued him, which he couldn't place. Meanwhile, Kinoh paces the perimeter of the table, eyeing the group's scraps greedily.
Kyle [Arcadian] 28/11/2024 21:54
As the night deepens, the Ajentodon retire to the guest bedrooms, the estateâ€™s walls shielding them from the outside world. The tatami mats are soft, yet firm, and the scent of fresh rice straw is a calming balm to the wearied senses. Each room is sparsely furnished, allowing the mind to focus and the body to unwind. The lanterns in the courtyard flicker softly, their light casting delicate shadows on the carefully raked gravel of the garden, and a gentle breeze whispers through the bamboo groves, carrying with it the faint sound of waves crashing against the cliffs far below. Above, the sky is a vast expanse of stars, unmarred by clouds, their light shimmering like a celestial tapestry. As dawn approaches, the first hints of light flare around the edge of the moon, painting the sea with strokes of lavender and rose. Crickets fade into silence, replaced by the melodious calls of songbirds greeting the day, and the scent of the earth, refreshed by dew, mingles with the faint aroma of incense wafting from the shrine.
Kyle [Arcadian] 03/12/2024 18:30
Sadao is lying in his bed, toying absent-mindedly with the puzzle box, when it yields with a soft click and unfurls in his fingers. The compartment inside contains a small vial of aromatic incense.
Mike 05/12/2024 19:17
With surprise, the bard nearly drops the box and vial. Recovering quickly, he gingerly takes the vial out, and holds it close to smell it. The aroma calls his mother to mind, one of her preferred varieties. He clutches it tenderly. Dad... His father surely felt her disappearance as strongly as he did. Looking inside the opened box, he notices a small slip of paper, with an odd poem and sketch of a mountain crowned with a crescent moon inside. Beneath it, a river is depicted, winding through a forest.
Beneath the mountain's shadowed crest, Where the river slows to rest, Find the shrine of autumnâ€™s flame, And speak aloud our family name.
His eyes widen. Finally, a clue! He lies back down to rest, but his excitement keeps sleep at bay for a while longer. When the sun begins to rise, Sadao rises with it, and presents the group with his findings when they are awake and assembled. "I'm not sure if it's where he was headed, but it's got to be important, right?" (edited)

Kyle [Arcadian] 20/02/2025 19:54
The road from the Huiya estate winds down from the cliffs, carrying the Ajentodon through rolling hills and into the lowlands, where the scent of salt grows stronger with every step. The sun casts long shadows across the landscape and a warm breeze tugs at their clothing, carrying the distant cries of gulls and the rhythmic crash of waves against unseen shores. Their path is well-trodden, but solitude surrounds them. No other travellers walk this way and the only company is the occasional fox darting through the underbrush or the rustle of unseen creatures moving beneath the trees. As the Ajentodon crest the final ridge, the coastline stretches out before them â€”an endless expanse of deep blue. The waves surge and break against the rugged cliffs far below. The wind here is stronger, tugging at their cloaks and carrying the scent of salt and seaweed. White gulls wheel overhead, their cries lost in the crashing surf. The cliffs themselves are jagged and worn, carved by centuries of relentless tides. Below, the water churns around sharp rocks, sending up bursts of white foam. To the north, the coastline curves inward, forming a hidden cove where the waves lap more gently against the shore. Near the edge of the cliff, where the grass grows sparse and the earth looks unstable, stands an ancient torii gate. Weathered by time and the elements, its once-vibrant red paint has faded to a muted rust, and patches of lichen cling to the wooden beams. Beyond the torii, half-buried in the earth, are remnants of an old shrine. The wooden beams have collapsed, leaving only a few upright posts jutting toward the sky like skeletal fingers. Among the ruins, stone lanterns lie toppled, their inscriptions worn smooth by the wind. A broken statue of a fox, its face eerily intact despite its fractured body, watches them with empty eyes.
Mike 20/02/2025 20:10
As they approach the torii, Sadao slows his pace, and begins to look for signs of other humanoids passing this way recently. Without prompting, Kinoh joins him in his search, sniffing here and there.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 20/02/2025 20:28
Ryuzuko, with Tsuruki by his side, deviates from the path towards the shrine and starts to lift up the toppled lanterns to place them back into place as best he can. "It has been a long time since anyone has been here." The ronin remarks while tidying up the shrine itself from leaves and twigs. Once done with his work he clasps his hands together in front of the shrine and bows before reconvening with the group.
Kyle [Arcadian] 16/03/2025 19:46
As Ryuz carefully restores what little he can of the forgotten shrine, Sadao and Kinoh move with slow deliberation, scanning the earth for any signs of recent passage. The grass is wild and windblown, bent by the elements rather than by feet, but Sadao's sharp eyes pick out disturbances â€” faint impressions in the dirt, where someone has stood too long, a rock that has been moved unnaturally and, deeper in the grass, a place where the earth has been disturbed. Kinoh lets out a quiet chuff, her nose wrinkling as she sniffs at one such spot. Her ears twitch and she pads a few steps forward before circling back, uncertain. Someone has been here, but not long and not recently enough for a strong scent to linger.
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 19/03/2025 19:04
Tatsu silently helps Ryuz with the shrine but it seems that there is little that can be really done
Mike 19/03/2025 20:14
"There looks to be something over here..." Sadao carefully follows the footmarks to a patch of upturned earth, indicating it to the group. He turns to his bemused familiar. "Kinoh, care to do the honors here?" With another sniff, the tanuki pads over and starts digging into the dirt, looking for a buried object.
Kyle [Arcadian] 19/03/2025 20:20
Kinoh's small paws rapidly fling clumps of damp earth aside. The scent of disturbed soil and old roots fills the air, mingling with the ever-present salt breeze from the sea. The earth here is softer than the surrounding ground, as though it has been recently moved, though not so fresh that the scent is strong enough for the tanuki to immediately pinpoint what lies beneath. The deeper she digs, the more the soil darkens, until at last her claws scrape against something solid. Kinoh pauses, snuffling at the dirt-covered object, before giving Sadao an expectant look.
Mike 19/03/2025 20:27
Sadao squats down, and brushes some dirt from the top of the object to look it over briefly. He slips his hands around the sides and tries to haul it out, with a mind to call Ryuzuko over if it should prove too difficult alone.
Kyle [Arcadian] 19/03/2025 20:28
Slowly, the shape beneath the soil becomes clear â€” a small wooden box, its lacquer worn and chipped from exposure and time. The edges are reinforced with tarnished brass and an old cord wrapped is around it, tied in a knot that has been partially loosened by moisture and decay.
Mike 19/03/2025 20:35
"Huh." Sadao pries the box free, and emerges from the brush with it in hand, bringing it over to the front of the shrine to show to the group. "Someone went to a bit of effort to hide this here, it seems." He places the box down on the altar and shakes off his soiled, scarred hands. "So... shall we?" He looks around to the others with a mischievous smile. (edited)
Frandal [Thurston|Kenji] 06/04/2025 18:25
Tatsu looks over Sadao's shoulder. "Looking at the closed box is like looking at the future. One can not know what it is inside until one open it. And then it is too late"
Mike 10/04/2025 20:34
Sadao shrugs off the chill that began to creep over him at Tatsu's words, and undoes the knot before opening the box in front of the party.
Kyle [Arcadian] 10/04/2025 21:07
The cord, frayed and stiff with age, comes undone with a soft whisper of protest. Sadao lifts the lid carefully, the hinges creaking with the weary voice of old wood. The faint scent of parchment, pine resin and something faintly metallic, like dried blood or tarnished silver, rises from within. Inside, nestled within the folds of a faded cloth, lies a scroll bound in lacquered wood and sealed with an unfamiliar wax sigil that is shaped like a foxâ€™s tail coiled around a crescent moon. Alongside it, tucked in the corner of the box, is a small carved talisman: a figure of a reclining fox with six tails, its eyes inlaid with tiny chips of jade.
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 01/05/2025 06:05
Ayana watches with increasing interest as each cord of the box is undone and opened, and when at last the contents are revealed to the group, her eyes widen. The sight of the scroll and talisman within cause her own tails to stand on end. â€œThatâ€™sâ€”!â€ She pauses. â€œThat is to say, those areâ€¦ I think I know. Sadao-san, may Iâ€¦?â€ Her hand unfurls into an open palm before him as wide scarlet eyes blink at his own.
Mike 06/05/2025 20:58
"Of course," he replied, handing the contents to the kitsune gingerly. "What do you make of them?"
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 07/05/2025 08:16
Ayana bows her head as she accepts the items with both hands. She remains quiet in the face of his question, however, focusing instead on carefully unsealing the scroll.
Kyle [Arcadian] 07/05/2025 08:22
The seal cracks like brittle bark beneath Ayana's thumb and, as she unfurls the parchment, the ink seems to shimmer faintly in the morning light. The writing is a mix of classical kanbun and draconic script, twining together like vines. However, with Ryuzuko and Tatsu's help, it can be understood.
The silver-blooded gate lies where stone meets sky, Its jaws sealed by the song that was never sung. Beneath the moonless tide and shattered bell, Those who bear the mark may pass unscathed.
The final line is in a shakier hand, added later:
Forgive me, sister. I could not stay. The tide was calling.
Mike 18/05/2025 17:13
Sadao's eyes pass over the obscure text as it is translated, then to Ayana. Perhaps... her mother had something to do with this? He didn't dare break in on her concentration with another dark reminder, however.
Vesh [Aubrey|Nessa|Zaps|Zee] 20/05/2025 15:51
Ayana's eyes remain transfixed for a time on the words, glossed over as they move from the words to the space between them, where sea and sky bled together through a pale silver light. All at once the words became real. Not these ones, per se, but ones she'd heard before, a dozen times over, all throughout her youth. Myths and legends and prophecies of things yet to come. She is silent an uncomfortably long time, long enough to draw concern perhaps from her companions before at once snapping back to the present. "It's... A riddle. Or, a ritual. Both, really. And, I think I can understand it. She stares resolute through eyes that burn suddenly bright and intense, yet linger beneath a sullen brow. "The first line â€” a 'silver-blooded gate where stone meets sky' â€” a place where the spiritual meets the physical. Someone high, a mountaintop, most likely." "A song never sung and a shattered bell. Rites and rituals, callings to the beyond that were left undone or incomplete. But still, it could be completed." "And the final line..." The final line tugged at a different part of her brain. Something far more tangible and raw. A pang of worry; of fear. "Who... whoever this was, they failed to complete the rite."
Mike 20/05/2025 16:40
Sadao swallows before speaking. "That last part, though..." The reference to the calling of the tide unsettled him. Come to think of it, they hadn't shared that part of their story with Ayana yet, had they? Should we? She'd already been through enough, why tell her a story to further unsettle her? But another look at the kitsune's face, concerned, but with a determination he hadn't registered previously, dispels that doubt. She's one of us now. Not someone we're just here to protect. "Ayana, have you heard tell of the sea witch, Kuma? We've met her..." He proceeds to summarize the adventure that led to their meeting, of seeking her out in the hopes of restoring Koide's voice, her attendant, the monstrous Ebirah, and of their flight, which led to an encounter with the Kaiju that leveled Kitajima. "When I hear of a 'tide's call,' I think of her. It may only be coincidence." (edited)
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 20/05/2025 20:35
"The witch seems to deal in coincidences, so it would not surprise me if they were connected to this ritual as well." Ryuzuko adds as he looks up at the landscape surrounding them. "Especially here where cliffs meet the sea." (edited)
Mike 21/05/2025 22:56
An involuntary shudder runs down Sadao's back as he remembers the cold, clammy touch of Kuma's tentacles. "Well, I'm just going to leave that as a possibility for now." "More presently though, this is another riddle atop the one we found in my father's room. Remember how it wentâ€”"
Beneath the mountain's shadowed crest, Where the river slows to rest, Find the shrine of autumnâ€™s flame, And speak aloud our family name.
"Isn't this the 'shrine of autumn's flame?' I'm not sure if there are any other shrines around here." He walks over to the broken fox statue and stone lanterns, looking among the inscriptions for any that still bore a trace of something legible.
Drake [ Shadow | Juke | Magnir ] 26/05/2025 18:05
"I don't see a river nor are we beneath a mountain's crest." Ryuzuko adds as he contemplates the riddle. "Are we sure we're at the correct location indicated on the map?"
Mike 26/05/2025 18:18
"Yeah, I guess not." Sadao murmurs sheepishly. He consults the map they've used so far and tries to figure their current location.
Kyle [Arcadian] 02/06/2025 21:17
As Sadao unfurls the creased parchment, the corners flapping in the sea breeze, the faint inked contours of hills and coastline reassert themselves. The weatherworn and lichen-cloaked shrine that the Ajentodon stand near is marked, but not with any sigil or name. Just a small red dot among many others sketched along the coast. The map shows more prominent relief not far inland, where there's a series of ridges that climbs into craggy hills.
Mike 02/06/2025 21:30
"...Hm." Sadao had never much been one for maps, simply marking his excursions as a child by memory. "This barely features on the map. We might want to search further for the landmarks the poem mentions, then." Kinoh rolls her eyes behind him and pads off in another direction.
Kyle [Arcadian] 13/08/2025 21:39
Ayana steps closer to peer at the map, her eyes narrowing. A serpentine blue line winds down the slope of one of the hills on the map. Besides it is a symbol shaped like a maple leaf carefully drawn in faded ochre. The kitsune frowns, then turns the map to reorient it to the cliffs behind them. "We're here," she says, pointing to the shrine, "but this," she continues, tapping the maple leaf, "this is further inland. Maybe half a dayâ€™s walk upriver. The 'shrine of autumnâ€™s flame' could refer to that leaf symbol. Shrines to seasonal kami are usually inland. This one might be built beneath trees that turn crimson in the autumn, like a sacred maple grove. If thatâ€™s the place mentioned in your father's riddle, then weâ€™ve only just begun." Ryuzuko straightens and shades his eyes as he looks inland, trying to gauge the distance through the haze. "The trailhead might start beyond the torii. That slope there could lead us down into the river valley." Viraj, who has remained silent through the earlier discussion, finally speaks, crouching by a patch of wildflowers. "The land remembers," he says softly, brushing his fingers along a bloom. "We may find more than a shrine. If somebody buried a truth there long ago, then the forest may still whisper it." Sadao folds the map and tucks it away. His voice is quiet, but firm. "Then thatâ€™s our next destination. Letâ€™s get moving." Kinoh gives a soft grunt of agreement and scampers ahead, nose to the wind. The torii behind them stands silent and weathered, casting a long shadow that reaches toward the sea. As they depart, Ayana lingers just a moment, resting a hand against the broken fox statue. "This shrine may be forgotten," she whispers, "but we haven't forgotten you." Then, she turns, robes fluttering, and follows her companions inland. Towards the river, towards the flame, towards whatever secret the Huiya familyâ€™s past has buried beneath mountain stone and autumn leaves.
